209 Jove (78)/the Gods (8)/Gods (6)/almighty Jove (2)/great Jove (2)/Immortal Gods (1)/the Ruler of Olympian Gods , who hurls fierce lightnings with his great right hand , may never dare to drive this chariot , and what art thou to equal mighty Jove (1)/mighty Jove (1)/Jove omnipotent (1)/The Gods (1)/O Gods (1)/Great Jove (1)

PER

103 Jove/the Gods/Gods/almighty Jove/great Jove/Immortal Gods/the Ruler of Olympian Gods , who hurls fierce lightnings with his great right hand , may never dare to drive this chariot , and what art thou to equal mighty Jove/mighty Jove/Jove omnipotent/The Gods/O Gods/Great Jove

Text

[My]0-i soul is wrought to sing of forms transformed to bodies new and strange ! [Immortal Gods]456-jove inspire [my]0-i heart , for [ye]1286-ye have changed [yourselves]1286-ye and all things [you]1286-ye have changed ! Oh lead [my]0-i song in smooth and measured strains , from olden days when [earth]1287-earth began to this completed time ! Before [the ocean]1288-the ocean and [the earth]1289-the earth appeared — before the skies had overspread them all — the face of Nature in [a vast expanse]1290-a vast expanse was naught but Chaos uniformly waste . It was a rude and undeveloped mass , that nothing made except a ponderous weight ; and all discordant elements confused , were there congested in a shapeless heap . As yet the sun afforded earth no light , nor did the moon renew [her]1291-her crescent horns ; [the earth]1289-the earth was not suspended in the air exactly balanced by [her]1291-her heavy weight . Not far along [the margin of [the shores]1294-the shores]1293-the margin of the shores had Amphitrite stretched [her]1291-her lengthened arms , — for all [the land]1295-the land was mixed with [sea]1296-sea and air . [The land]1295-the land was soft , [the sea]1298-the sea unfit to sail , the atmosphere opaque , to naught was given a proper form , in everything was strife , and all was mingled in a seething mass — with hot the cold parts strove , and wet with dry and soft with hard , and weight with empty void . But [God]457-the calydonian river - god , or kindly Nature , ended strife — [he]457-the calydonian river - god cut [the land]1295-the land from skies , [the sea]1298-the sea from [land]1301-land , the heavens ethereal from material air ; and when were all evolved from that dark mass [he]457-the calydonian river - god bound the fractious parts in tranquil peace . [The fiery element of [convex heaven]1303-convex heaven]1302-the fiery element of convex heaven leaped from the mass devoid of dragging weight , and chose the summit arch to which the air as next in quality was next in place . [The earth]1289-the earth more dense attracted grosser parts and moved by gravity sank underneath ; and last of all the wide surrounding waves in [deeper channels]1305-deeper channels rolled around the globe . And when [this God — which one is yet unknown]1306-this god — which one is yet unknown — had carved asunder that discordant mass , had thus reduced it to its elements , that every part should equally combine , when time began [He]457-the calydonian river - god rounded out [the earth]1289-the earth and moulded it to form a mighty globe . Then poured [He]457-the calydonian river - god forth [the deeps]1308-the deeps and gave command that they should billow in the rapid winds , that [they]1308-the deeps should compass [every shore of earth]1309-every shore of earth . [he]457-the calydonian river - god also added fountains , pools and [lakes]1310-lakes , and bound with shelving banks [the slanting streams]1311-the slanting streams , which partly are absorbed and partly join [the boundless ocean]1312-the boundless ocean . Thus received amid [the wide expanse of uncontrolled waves]1313-the wide expanse of uncontrolled waves , they beat [the shores]1294-the shores instead of crooked banks . At [His]457-the calydonian river - god command [the boundless plains]1315-the boundless plains extend , [the valleys]1316-the valleys are depressed , [the woods]1317-the woods are clothed in green , [the stony mountains]1318-the stony mountains rise . And as the heavens are intersected on the right by two broad zones , by two that cut the left , and by a fifth consumed with ardent heat , with such a number did [the careful God]1319-the careful god mark off the compassed weight , and thus [the earth]1289-the earth received as many climes . — Such heat consumes the middle zone that none may dwell therein ; and two extremes are covered with deep snow ; and two are placed betwixt the hot and cold , which mixed together give a temperate clime ; and over all the atmosphere suspends with weight proportioned to the fiery sky , exactly as the weight of earth compares with weight of water . And [He]457-the calydonian river - god ordered mist to gather in the air and spread the clouds . [He]457-the calydonian river - god fixed the thunders that disturb [our]1321-our souls , and brought the lightning on destructive winds that also waft the cold . Nor did [the great Artificer]1322-the great artificer permit these mighty winds to blow unbounded in the pathless skies , but each discordant brother fixed in space , although [His]457-the calydonian river - god power can scarce restrain their rage to rend [the universe]1323-the universe . At [His]457-the calydonian river - god command to [far Aurora]512-aurora , [Eurus]458-eurus took [his]457-the calydonian river - god way , to [Nabath]2-nabath , [Persia]3-persia , and [that mountain range]1324-that mountain range first gilded by the dawn ; and [Zephyr]459-zephyr 's flight was towards the evening star and peaceful shores , warm with the setting sun ; and [Boreas]460-boreas invaded [Scythia]4-scythia and [the northern snows]1325-the northern snows ; and Auster wafted to [the distant south where clouds and rain]1326-the distant south where clouds and rain encompass [his]457-the calydonian river - god abode . — and over these [He]457-the calydonian river - god fixed the liquid sky , devoid of weight and free from earthly dross . And scarcely had [He]457-the calydonian river - god separated these and fixed their certain bounds , when all the stars , which long were pressed and hidden in the mass , began to gleam out from [the plains of heaven]1327-the plains of heaven , and traversed , with the Gods , bright ether fields : and lest some part might be bereft of life the gleaming waves were filled with twinkling fish ; [the earth]1289-the earth was covered with wild animals ; the agitated air was filled with birds . But [one more perfect and more sanctified , a being capable of lofty thought , intelligent to rule]1329-one more perfect and more sanctified , a being capable of lofty thought , intelligent to rule , was wanting still [man]1330-man was created ! Did [the Unknown God]1331-the unknown god designing then [a better world]1332-a better world make [man of seed divine]1333-man of seed divine ? or did [Prometheus]461-prometheus take [the new soil of earth]1334-the new soil of earth ( that still contained some godly element of [Heaven]5-heaven 's Life ) and use it to create the race of [man]1330-man ; first mingling it with water of [new streams]1336-new streams ; so that [his]461-prometheus new creation , upright man , was made in image of commanding [Gods]456-jove ? On [earth]1287-earth [the brute creation]1338-the brute creation bends [its]1338-the brute creation gaze , but [man]1330-man was given a lofty countenance and was commanded to behold [the skies]1340-the skies ; and with an upright face may view the stars : — and so it was that shapeless clay put on the form of [man]1330-man till then unknown to [earth]1287-earth . First was the Golden Age . Then rectitude spontaneous in the heart prevailed , and faith . [Avengers]462-avengers were not seen , for laws unframed were all unknown and needless . Punishment and fear of penalties existed not . No harsh decrees were fixed on brazen plates . [No suppliant multitude the countenance of Justice]1343-no suppliant multitude the countenance of justice feared , averting , for [they]1343-no suppliant multitude the countenance of justice dwelt without [a judge]1344-a judge in peace . Descended not the steeps , shorn from [its]1345-its height , the lofty pine , cleaving the trackless waves of [alien shores]1346-alien shores , nor [distant realms]1347-distant realms were known to [wandering men]1348-wandering men . [The towns]1349-the towns were not entrenched for time of war ; [they]1349-the towns had no brazen trumpets , straight , nor horns of curving brass , nor helmets , shields nor swords . There was no thought of martial pomp — secure [a happy multitude]1350-a happy multitude enjoyed repose . Then of [her]1351-her own accord [the earth]1289-the earth produced a store of every fruit . The harrow touched [her]1351-her not , nor did the plowshare wound [[her]1351-her fields]1353-her fields . And [man]1330-man content with given food , and none compelling , gathered arbute fruits and wild strawberries on [the mountain sides]1355-the mountain sides , and ripe blackberries clinging to the bush , and corners and sweet acorns on the ground , down fallen from [the spreading tree of [Jove]456-jove]1356-the spreading tree of jove . Eternal Spring ! [Soft breathing zephyrs]1357-soft breathing zephyrs soothed and warmly cherished buds and blooms , produced without a seed . [The valleys]1316-the valleys though unplowed gave many fruits ; [the fields though not renewed]1359-the fields though not renewed white glistened with the heavy bearded wheat : rivers flowed milk and nectar , and the trees , the very oak trees , then gave honey of themselves . When [Saturn]463-saturn had been banished into night and all [the world]1360-the world was ruled by [Jove]456-jove supreme , the Silver Age , though not so good as gold but still surpassing yellow brass , prevailed . [Jove]456-jove first reduced to years the Primal Spring , by [him]456-jove divided into periods four , unequal , — summer , autumn , winter , spring . — then glowed with tawny heat the parched air , or pendent icicles in winter froze and [man]1330-man stopped crouching in [crude caverns]1362-crude caverns , while [he]1330-man built [[his]1330-man homes]1363-his homes of tree rods , bark entwined . Then were the cereals planted in long rows , and bullocks groaned beneath the heavy yoke . The third Age followed , called The Age of Bronze , when [cruel people]1364-cruel people were inclined to arms but not to impious crimes . And last of all the ruthless and hard Age of Iron prevailed , from which malignant vein great evil sprung ; and modesty and faith and truth took flight , and in [their]1365-their stead deceits and snares and frauds and violence and wicked love of gain , succeeded . — Then [the sailor]1366-the sailor spread [his]1366-the sailor sails to winds unknown , and keels that long had stood on [lofty mountains]1367-lofty mountains pierced uncharted waves . [Surveyors]1368-surveyors anxious marked with metes and bounds [the lands]1369-the lands , created free as light and air : nor need [the rich ground]1370-the rich ground furnish only crops , and give due nourishment by right required , — [they]1368-surveyors penetrated to the bowels of earth and dug up wealth , bad cause of all [our]1371-our ills , — rich ores which long ago [the earth]1289-the earth had hid and deep removed to [gloomy Stygian caves]1373-gloomy stygian caves : and soon destructive iron and harmful gold were brought to light ; and War , which uses both , came forth and shook with sanguinary grip [his]456-jove clashing arms . Rapacity broke forth — [the guest]1374-the guest was not protected from [[his]1374-the guest host]1375-his host , [the father in law]1376-the father in law from [[his]1376-the father in law own son]1377-his own son in law ; even [brothers]1378-brothers seldom could abide in peace . [The husband]1379-the husband threatened to destroy [[his]1379-the husband wife]1380-his wife , and [she]1380-his wife [[her]1380-his wife husband]1381-her husband : [horrid step dames mixed the deadly henbane]1382-horrid step dames mixed the deadly henbane : [eager sons]1383-eager sons inquired [[their]1383-eager sons fathers]1384-their fathers , ages . Piety was slain : and last of [all the virgin deity]1385-all the virgin deity , [Astraea]464-astraea vanished from the blood - stained earth . And lest [ethereal heights]1386-ethereal heights should long remain less troubled than [the earth]1289-the earth , [the throne of [Heaven]5-heaven]1388-the throne of heaven was threatened by [the Giants]465-the giants ; and [they]465-the giants piled mountain on mountain to the lofty stars . But [Jove]456-jove , omnipotent , shot thunderbolts through [Mount Olympus]8-mount olympus , and [he]456-jove overturned from [Ossa]9-ossa huge , enormous Pelion . And while these dreadful bodies lay overwhelmed in [their]1389-their tremendous bulk , ( so fame reports ) [the Earth]1289-the earth was reeking with the copious blood of [[her]1380-his wife gigantic sons]1391-her gigantic sons ; and thus replete with moisture [she]1380-his wife infused the steaming gore with life renewed . So that a monument of such ferocious stock should be retained , [she]1380-his wife made [that offspring]1392-that offspring in the shape of [man]1330-man ; but [this new race]1394-this new race alike despised [the Gods]1395-the gods , and by the greed of savage slaughter proved a sanguinary birth . When , from [his]456-jove throne supreme , [the Son of Saturn]1396-the son of saturn viewed [their]1397-their deeds , [he]456-jove deeply groaned : and calling to [his]456-jove mind the loathsome feast [Lycaon]466-lycaon had prepared , a recent deed not common to report , [his]456-jove soul conceived great anger — worthy [Jove]456-jove — and [he]456-jove convened a council . No delay detained [the chosen Gods]1398-the chosen gods . When skies are clear a path is well defined on high , which [men]1399-men , because so white , have named the Milky Way . It makes a passage for [the deities]1400-the deities and leads to [mansions of [the Thunder God]1402-the thunder god]1401-mansions of the thunder god , to [[Jove]456-jove 's imperial home]1403-jove 's imperial home . On either side of [its]1404-its wide way [the noble Gods]1405-the noble gods are seen , inferior Gods in other parts abide , but there [the potent and renowned of Heaven]1406-the potent and renowned of heaven have fixed [[their]1406-the potent and renowned of heaven homes]1407-their homes . — It is [a glorious place]1408-a glorious place , [our]1409-our most audacious verse might designate [the “ Palace of [High Heaven]10-high heaven]4875-the “ palace of high heaven . ”[1411-the king of all above the throng] When [the Gods]456-jove were seated , therefore , in [[its]1404-its marble halls [the King of all above the throng]1411-the king of all above the throng]1410-its marble halls the king of all above the throng sat high , and leaning on [his]1411-the king of all above the throng ivory scepter , thrice , and once again [he]1411-the king of all above the throng shook [his]1411-the king of all above the throng awful locks , wherewith [he]1411-the king of all above the throng moved [the earth]1289-the earth , and [seas]1413-seas and stars , — and thus indignantly began to speak ; “ The time when [serpent footed giants]4876-serpent footed giants strove to fix [their]4876-serpent footed giants hundred arms on [captive Heaven]4877-captive heaven , not more than this event could cause alarm for [[my]1411-the king of all above the throng dominion of [the universe]1323-the universe]4878-my dominion of the universe . Although it was [a savage enemy]4880-a savage enemy , yet warred [we]4881-we with a single source derived of one . Now must [I]1411-the king of all above the throng utterly destroy [this mortal race]4882-this mortal race wherever [Nereus]467-nereus roars around [the world]1360-the world . Yea , by the Infernal Streams that glide through [Stygian groves beneath [the world]1360-the world]4884-stygian groves beneath the world , [I]1411-the king of all above the throng swear it . Every method has been tried . The knife must cut immedicable wounds , lest maladies infect untainted parts . “[1411-the king of all above the throng] Beneath [my]0-i sway are [demi gods]1414-demi gods and fauns , [nymphs]1415-nymphs , rustic deities , sylvans of [the hills]1416-the hills , [satyrs]1417-satyrs ; — all these , unworthy [Heaven]5-heaven 's abodes , [we]1418-we should at least permit to dwell on earth which [we]1418-we to [them]5-heaven bequeathed . What think [ye]1419-your , [Gods]456-jove , is safety [theirs]1420-theirs when [I]0-i , [[your]1419-your sovereign lord]1421-your sovereign lord , [the Thunder - bolt Controller]1422-the thunder - bolt controller , am ensnared by [fierce Lycaon]466-lycaon ? ” Ardent in [their]1420-theirs wrath , [the astonished Gods]4886-the astonished gods demand revenge overtake [this miscreant]4887-this miscreant ; [he]4887-this miscreant who dared commit such crimes . ' Twas even thus when raged [that impious band]4888-that impious band to blot the Roman name in sacred blood of [Caesar]468-caesar , sudden apprehensive fears of [ruin absolute astonished man]4889-ruin absolute astonished man , and all [the world]1360-the world convulsed . Nor is the love [[thy]1419-your people]4891-thy people bear to [thee]1419-your , [Augustus]469-augustus , less than these displayed to [Jupiter whose voice and gesture all the murmuring host]4892-jupiter whose voice and gesture all the murmuring host restrained : and as indignant clamour ceased , suppressed by regnant majesty , [Jove]456-jove once again broke the deep silence with imperial words ; “[0-i] Dismiss [your]1419-your cares ; [he]0-i paid the penalty however all the crime and punishment now learn from this : — An infamous report of this unholy age had reached [my]0-i ears , and wishing it were false , [I]0-i sloped [my]0-i course from [high Olympus]11-olympus , and — although [a God — disguised in human form]1423-a god — disguised in human form [I]0-i viewed [the world]1360-the world . It would delay [us]1425-us to recount the crimes unnumbered , for reports were less than truth . “ [I]1426-not one house traversed [Maenalus]537-maenalus where fearful dens abound , over [Lycaeus]13-lycaeus , [wintry slopes of pine tree groves]4893-wintry slopes of pine tree groves , across [Cyllene steep]14-cyllene steep ; and as the twilight warned of night 's approach , [I]1426-not one house stopped in [[that Arcadian tyrant]4894-that arcadian tyrant 's realms]4895-that arcadian tyrant 's realms and entered [[his]4894-that arcadian tyrant inhospitable home]4896-his inhospitable home : — and when [I]1426-not one house showed [[his]4894-that arcadian tyrant people]4897-his people that [a God]4898-a god had come , [the lowly]4899-the lowly prayed and worshiped [me]1426-not one house , but [this Lycaon]4900-this lycaon mocked [their]4897-his people pious vows and scoffing said ; ‘ A fair experiment will prove the truth if this be god or [man]1330-man . ’ and [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant prepared to slay [me]1426-not one house in the night , — to end [my]1426-not one house slumbers in the sleep of death . So made [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant merry with [his]4894-that arcadian tyrant impious proof ; but not content with this [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant cut the throat of [a Molossian hostage sent to [him]4894-that arcadian tyrant]4902-a molossian hostage sent to him , and partly softened [his]4894-that arcadian tyrant still quivering limbs in boiling water , partly roasted them on fires that burned beneath . And when this flesh was served to [me]1426-not one house on tables , [I]1426-not one house destroyed [[his]4894-that arcadian tyrant dwelling]4903-his dwelling and [his]4894-that arcadian tyrant worthless Household Gods , with thunder bolts avenging . Terror struck [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant took to flight , and on [the silent plains]4904-the silent plains is howling in [his]4894-that arcadian tyrant vain attempts to speak ; [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant raves and rages and [his]4894-that arcadian tyrant greedy jaws , desiring [their]1428-all men accustomed slaughter , turn against the sheep — still eager for [their]1428-all men blood . [His]4894-that arcadian tyrant vesture separates in shaggy hair , [his]4894-that arcadian tyrant arms are changed to legs ; and as a wolf [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant has the same grey locks , the same hard face , the same bright eyes , the same ferocious look . “[1426-not one house] Thus fell one house , but [not one house]1426-not one house alone deserved to perish ; over [all the earth]1427-all the earth ferocious deeds prevail , — [all men]1428-all men conspire in evil . Let [them]1428-all men therefore feel the weight of dreadful penalties so justly earned , for such hath [my]0-i unchanging will ordained . ” with exclamations [some]4905-some approved the words of [Jove]456-jove and added fuel to [his]456-jove wrath , while [others]4906-others gave assent : but all deplored and questioned [the estate of earth deprived of [mortals]4908-mortals]4907-the estate of earth deprived of mortals . Who could offer frankincense upon the altars ? Would [he]4894-that arcadian tyrant suffer [earth]1287-earth to be despoiled by hungry beasts of prey ? Such idle questions of the state of [man]1330-man [the King of Gods]4911-the king of gods forbade , but granted soon to people earth with race miraculous , unlike the first . And now [his]456-jove thunder bolts would [Jove]456-jove wide scatter , but [he]456-jove feared the flames , unnumbered , sacred ether might ignite and burn [the axle of [the universe]1323-the universe]4912-the axle of the universe : and [he]456-jove remembered in the scroll of fate , there is a time appointed when [the sea]1298-the sea and [earth and Heavens]4915-earth and heavens shall melt , and fire destroy the universe of mighty labour wrought . Such weapons by the skill of [Cyclops]470-the cyclops forged , for different punishment [he]456-jove laid aside — for straightway [he]456-jove preferred to overwhelm [the mortal race]4916-the mortal race beneath deep waves and storms from every raining sky . And instantly [he]456-jove shut the Northwind in Aeolian caves , and every other wind that might dispel the gathering clouds . [He]456-jove bade [the Southwind]15-the southwind blow : — [the Southwind]15-the southwind flies abroad with dripping wings , concealing in the gloom [his]15-the southwind awful face : the drenching rain descends from [his]15-the southwind wet beard and hoary locks ; dark clouds are on [his]15-the southwind brows and from [his]15-the southwind wings and garments drip the dews : [his]15-the southwind great hands press the overhanging clouds ; loudly the thunders roll ; the torrents pour ; [Iris]471-iris , [the messenger of Juno]4917-the messenger of juno , clad in many coloured raiment , upward draws the steaming moisture to renew the clouds . The standing grain is beaten to the ground , [the rustic]4918-the rustic 's crops are scattered in [the mire]4919-the mire , and [he]456-jove bewails the long year 's fruitless toil . The wrath of [Jove]456-jove was not content with powers that emanate from [Heaven]5-heaven ; [he]456-jove brought to aid [[his]456-jove azure brother]4920-his azure brother , lord of flowing waves , who called upon [the Rivers]16-the rivers and [the Streams]17-the streams : and when [they]4921-their entered [[his]15-the southwind impearled abode]4922-his impearled abode , [Neptune]472-neptune , [[their]4921-their ancient ruler]4923-their ancient ruler , thus began ; “[1430-sister] A long appeal is needless ; pour [ye]1429-ye forth in rage of power ; open up [your]1429-ye fountains ; rush over obstacles ; let every stream pour forth in boundless floods . ” Thus [he]472-neptune commands , and [none dissenting all the River Gods]4924-none dissenting all the river gods return , and opening up [their]4921-their fountains roll tumultuous to [the deep unfruitful sea]4925-the deep unfruitful sea . And [Neptune]472-neptune with [his]472-neptune trident smote [the Earth]22-earth , which trembling with unwonted throes heaved up the sources of [[her]22-earth waters]4926-her waters bare ; and through [[her]22-earth open plains]4927-her open plains the rapid rivers rushed resistless , onward bearing the waving grain , the budding groves , [the houses]4928-the houses , [sheep]4929-sheep and [men]1399-men , — and [holy temples]4931-holy temples , and [their]4921-their sacred urns . [The mansions that remained]4932-the mansions that remained , resisting vast and total ruin , deepening waves concealed and whelmed [their]4921-their tottering turrets in [the flood and whirling gulf]4933-the flood and whirling gulf . And now one vast expanse , [the land and sea]4934-the land and sea were mingled in the waste of endless waves — [a sea without [a shore]4936-a shore]4935-a sea without a shore . [One desperate man]4937-one desperate man seized on [the nearest hill]4938-the nearest hill ; another sitting in [[his]4937-one desperate man curved boat]4939-his curved boat , plied the long oar where [he]4937-one desperate man was wo nt to plow ; another sailed above [his]4937-one desperate man grain , above [[his]4937-one desperate man hidden dwelling]4940-his hidden dwelling ; and another hooked a fish that sported in a leafy elm . Perchance an anchor dropped in [verdant fields]4941-verdant fields , or curving keels were pushed through tangled vines ; and where [the gracile goat enjoyed the green , unsightly seals reposed]4942-the gracile goat enjoyed the green , unsightly seals reposed . Beneath the waves were wondering Nereids , viewing [cities]4943-cities , [groves]4944-groves and [houses]4945-houses . Dolphins darting mid the trees , meshed in the twisted branches , beat against the shaken oak trees . There the sheep , affrayed , swim with the frightened wolf , the surging waves float tigers and lions : availeth naught [his]4937-one desperate man lightning shock the wild boar , nor avails [the stag]4946-the stag 's fleet footed speed . The wandering bird , seeking [umbrageous groves]4947-umbrageous groves and [hidden vales]4948-hidden vales , with wearied pinion droops into [the sea]1298-the sea . The waves increasing surge above [the hills]1416-the hills , and rising waters dash on [mountain tops]4951-mountain tops . Myriads by the waves are swept away , and those the waters spare , for lack of food , starvation slowly overcomes at last . [A fruitful land]4952-a fruitful land and fair but now submerged beneath [a wilderness of rising waves]4953-a wilderness of rising waves , ' Twixt [Oeta]19-oeta and [Aonia]20-aonia , [Phocis]86-phocis lies , where through the clouds [Parnassus]473-parnassus ' summits twain point upward to the stars , unmeasured height , save which the rolling billows covered all : there in [a small and fragile boat]4954-a small and fragile boat , arrived , [Deucalion]474-deucalion and [the consort of [[his]474-deucalion couch]4956-his couch]4955-the consort of his couch , prepared to worship [the Corycian Nymphs]4957-the corycian nymphs , [the mountain deities]4958-the mountain deities , and [Themis]4959-themis kind , who in that age revealed in oracles the voice of fate . As [he]474-deucalion no other lived so good and just , as [she]4960-she no other feared [the Gods]1395-the gods . When [Jupiter]475-jupiter beheld the globe in ruin covered , swept with wasting waves , and when [he]475-jupiter saw [one man of myriads]4962-one man of myriads left , [one helpless woman left of myriads lone]4963-one helpless woman left of myriads lone , both innocent and worshiping [the Gods]1395-the gods , [he]475-jupiter scattered all the clouds ; [he]475-jupiter blew away the great storms by the cold northwind . Once more [the earth]1289-the earth appeared to heaven and the skies appeared to [earth]1287-earth . The fury of the main abated , for [the Ocean ruler]4967-the ocean ruler laid [his]4967-the ocean ruler trident down and pacified the waves , and called on [azure Triton]476-triton . — [Triton]476-triton arose above the waving seas , [his]476-triton shoulders mailed in purple shells . — [He]476-triton bade [the Triton]476-triton blow , blow in [his]476-triton sounding shell , [the wandering streams]4968-the wandering streams and rivers to recall with signal known : a hollow wreathed trumpet , tapering wide and slender stemmed , the Triton took amain and wound the pearly shell at midmost sea . Betwixt the rising and the setting suns the wildered notes resounded [shore]4969-shore to shore , and as it touched [his]476-triton lips , wet with the brine beneath [his]476-triton dripping beard , sounded retreat : and [all the waters of [the land]1295-the land and [sea]1296-sea]4970-all the waters of the land and sea obeyed . [Their]4970-all the waters of the land and sea fountains heard and ceased to flow ; their waves subsided ; hidden [hills uprose]4973-hills uprose ; emerged [the shores of ocean]4974-the shores of ocean ; [channels filled with flowing streams]4975-channels filled with flowing streams ; the soil appeared ; [the land]1295-the land increased its surface as the waves decreased : and after length of days the trees put forth , with ooze on bending boughs , their naked tops . And [all the wasted globe]4977-all the wasted globe was now restored , but as [he]476-triton viewed [the vast and silent world]4978-the vast and silent world [Deucalion]474-deucalion wept and thus to [Pyrrha]477-pyrrha spoke ; “[1431-wife] O [sister]1430-sister ! [wife]1431-wife ! alone of [woman]1432-woman left ! [My]0-i kindred in descent and origin ! [Dearest companion of [my]0-i marriage bed]1433-dearest companion of my marriage bed , doubly endeared by deepening dangers borne , — of all the dawn and eve behold of [earth]1287-earth , but [you]1435-you and [I]0-i are left — for [the deep sea]1436-the deep sea has kept the rest ! And what prevents the tide from overwhelming [us]1437-they ? Remaining clouds affright [us]1437-they . How could [you]1435-you endure [your]1435-you fears if [you]1435-you alone were rescued by this fate , and who would then console [your]1435-you bitter grief ? Oh be assured , if [you]1435-you were buried in the waves , that [I]0-i would follow [you]1435-you and be with [you]1435-you ! Oh would that by [[my]0-i father]1438-my father 's art [I]0-i might restore [the people]1439-the people , and inspire this clay to take the form of [man]1330-man . Alas , [the Gods]1395-the gods decreed and only [we]1437-they are living ! ” , Thus [Deucalion]474-deucalion 's plaint to [Pyrrha]477-pyrrha ; — and [they]1437-they wept . And after [he]474-deucalion had spoken , [they]1437-they resolved to ask the aid of sacred oracles , — and so [they]1437-they hastened to Cephissian waves which rolled a turbid flood in channels known . Thence when [their]1437-they robes and brows were sprinkled well , [they]1437-they turned [their]1437-they footsteps to [the goddess]4979-the goddess ' fane : its gables were befouled with reeking moss and on its altars every fire was cold . But when [the twain]4980-the twain had reached [the temple steps]4981-the temple steps [they]1437-they fell upon [the earth]1289-the earth , inspired with awe , and kissed the cold stone with [their]1437-they trembling lips , and said ; “[1395-the gods] If righteous prayers appease [the Gods]1395-the gods , and if the wrath of [high celestial powers]1443-high celestial powers may thus be turned , declare , O Themis ! whence and what the art may raise humanity ? [O gentle goddess]1444-o gentle goddess help [the dying world]1445-the dying world ! ” Moved by [their]1437-they supplications , [she]4979-the goddess replied ; “[1444-o gentle goddess] Depart from [me]0-i and veil [your]1446-your brows ; ungird [your]1446-your robes , and cast behind [you]1446-your as [you]1446-your go , the bones of [[your]1446-your great mother]1447-your great mother . ” Long [they]1437-they stood in dumb amazement : [Pyrrha]477-pyrrha , first of voice , refused the mandate and with trembling lips implored [the goddess]4979-the goddess to forgive — [she]4979-the goddess feared to violate [[her]477-pyrrha mother]4984-her mother 's bones and vex [her]4979-the goddess sacred spirit . Often pondered [they]1437-they the words involved in such obscurity , repeating oft : and thus [Deucalion]474-deucalion to [[Epimetheus]478-epimetheus ' daughter]4985-epimetheus ' daughter uttered speech of soothing import ; “[1448-oracles] [Oracles]1448-oracles are just and urge not evil deeds , or naught avails the skill of thought . [[Our]1449-we mother]1450-our mother is [the Earth]1289-the earth , and [I]0-i may judge the stones of earth are bones that [we]1449-we should cast behind [us]1449-we as [we]1449-we go . ” And although [Pyrrha]477-pyrrha by [his]0-i words was moved [she]477-pyrrha hesitated to comply ; and [both amazed]4986-both amazed doubted the purpose of [the oracle]4987-the oracle , but deemed no harm to come of trial . [They]4986-both amazed , descending from [the temple]4988-the temple , veiled [their]4986-both amazed heads and loosed [their]4986-both amazed robes and threw some stones behind [them]4986-both amazed . It is much beyond belief , were not receding ages witness , hard and rigid stones assumed a softer form , enlarging as [their]4986-both amazed brittle nature changed to milder substance , — till the shape of [man]1330-man appeared , imperfect , faintly outlined first , as marble statue chiseled in the rough . The soft moist parts were changed to softer flesh , the hard and brittle substance into bones , the veins retained [their]4986-both amazed ancient name . And now [the Gods]1395-the gods supreme ordained that every stone [Deucalion]474-deucalion threw should take the form of [man]1330-man , and those by [Pyrrha]477-pyrrha cast should [woman]1432-woman 's form assume : so are [we]1449-we hardy to endure and prove by toil and deeds from what [we]1449-we sprung . And after this the Earth spontaneous produced the world of animals , when all remaining moistures of the mirey fens fermented in the sun , and fruitful seeds in soils nutritious grew to shapes ordained . So when the seven streamed Nile from [oozy fields]4993-oozy fields returneth duly to [her]477-pyrrha ancient bed , the sun 's ethereal rays impregn the slime , that haply as [the peasants]4994-the peasants turn [the soil]4995-the soil [they]4994-the peasants find strange animals unknown before : some in the moment of [their]4994-the peasants birth , and [some deprived of limbs]4996-some deprived of limbs , imperfect ; often part alive and part of slime inanimate are fashioned in one body . Heat combined with moisture so conceives and life results from these two things . For though the flames may be [the foes of water]4997-the foes of water , everything that lives begins in humid vapour , and it seems discordant concord is the means of life . When [Earth]22-earth , spread over with diluvian ooze , felt heat ethereal from the glowing sun , unnumbered species to the light [she]477-pyrrha gave , and gave to being [many an ancient form]4998-many an ancient form , or monster new created . Unwilling [she]477-pyrrha created thus enormous [Python]479-python . — [Thou]4999-thou unheard of serpent spread so far athwart [the side of [a vast mountain]5001-a vast mountain]5000-the side of a vast mountain , didst fill with fear the race of [new created man]5002-new created man . [The God that bears the bow ( a weapon used till then only to hunt the deer and agile goat]5003-the god that bears the bow ( a weapon used till then only to hunt the deer and agile goat ) destroyed [the monster]5004-the monster with a myriad darts , and almost emptied all [his]5004-the monster quiver , till envenomed gore oozed forth from livid wounds . Lest in a dark oblivion time should hide the fame of this achievement , sacred sports [he]5004-the monster instituted , from the Python called “[1448-oracles] The Pythian Games . ” In these [the happy youth who proved victorious in the chariot race , running and boxing , with an honoured crown of oak leaves]5005-the happy youth who proved victorious in the chariot race , running and boxing , with an honoured crown of oak leaves was enwreathed . The laurel then was not created , wherefore [Phoebus]549-phoebus , bright and godlike , beauteous with [his]549-phoebus flowing hair , was wo nt to wreathe [his]549-phoebus brows with various leaves . [Daphne]481-daphne , [the daughter of [a River God]5007-a river god]5006-the daughter of a river god was first beloved by [Phoebus]549-phoebus , [the great God of glorious light]5008-the great god of glorious light . ' Twas not a cause of chance but out of [Cupid]482-cupid 's vengeful spite that [she]481-daphne was fated to torment [the lord of light]5009-the lord of light . For [Phoebus]549-phoebus , proud of [Python]479-python 's death , beheld [that impish god of Love]5010-that impish god of love upon a time when [he]549-phoebus was bending [his]549-phoebus diminished bow , and voicing [his]549-phoebus contempt in anger said ; “[1448-oracles] What , [wanton boy]1452-wanton boy , are mighty arms to [thee]1453-thy , great weapons suited to the needs of war ? The bow is only for the use of those large deities of [heaven]1454-heaven [whose strength may deal wounds , mortal]1455-whose strength may deal wounds , mortal , to the savage beasts of prey ; and who courageous overcome [their]1455-whose strength may deal wounds , mortal foes . — it is a proper weapon to the use of such as slew with arrows [Python]479-python , huge , whose pestilential carcase vast extent covered . Content [thee]1453-thy with the flames [thy]1453-thy torch enkindles ( fires too subtle for [my]0-i thought ) and leave to [me]0-i the glory that is [mine]0-i . ” to [him]549-phoebus , undaunted , [Venus]996-venus , [son]5011-son replied ; “[549-phoebus] O [Phoebus]549-phoebus , [thou]1453-thy canst conquer all [the world]1360-the world with [thy]1453-thy strong bow and arrows , but with this small arrow [I]0-i shall pierce [thy]1453-thy vaunting breast ! And by the measure that [thy]1453-thy might exceeds the broken powers of [[thy]1453-thy defeated foes]1457-thy defeated foes , so is [thy]1453-thy glory less than [mine]0-i . ” No more [he]549-phoebus said , but with [his]549-phoebus wings expanded thence flew lightly to [Parnassus]473-parnassus , lofty peak . There , from [his]549-phoebus quiver [he]549-phoebus plucked arrows twain , most curiously wrought of different art ; one love exciting , one repelling love . The dart of love was glittering , gold and sharp , the other had a blunted tip of lead ; and with that dull lead dart [he]549-phoebus shot [the Nymph]5012-the nymph , but with the keen point of the golden dart [he]549-phoebus pierced the bone and marrow of [the God]5013-the god . Immediately [the one with love]5014-the one with love was filled , [the other , scouting at the thought of love]5015-the other , scouting at the thought of love , rejoiced in the deep shadow of [the woods]1317-the woods , and as [the virgin Phoebe]5017-the virgin phoebe ( who denies the joys of love and loves the joys of chase ) [a maiden]5018-a maiden 's fillet bound [her]5017-the virgin phoebe flowing hair , — and [her]5017-the virgin phoebe pure mind denied the love of [man]1330-man . Beloved and wooed [she]5017-the virgin phoebe wandered silent paths , for never could [her]5017-the virgin phoebe modesty endure the glance of [man]1330-man or listen to [his]1330-man love . [[Her]5017-the virgin phoebe grieving father]5021-her grieving father spoke to [her]5017-the virgin phoebe , “[1453-thy] Alas , [[my]0-i daughter]1458-my daughter , [I]0-i have wished [a son in law]1459-a son in law , and now [you]1458-my daughter owe [a grandchild]1460-a grandchild to the joy of [my]0-i old age . ” But [Daphne]481-daphne only hung [her]481-daphne head to hide [her]481-daphne shame . The nuptial torch seemed criminal to [her]481-daphne . [She]481-daphne even clung , caressing , with [her]481-daphne arms around [his]0-i neck , and pled , “[1460-a grandchild] [[My]0-i dearest father]1461-my dearest father let [me]0-i live [a virgin]1462-a virgin always , for remember [Jove]456-jove did grant it to [Diana]484-diana at [her]484-diana birth . ” But though [[her]481-daphne father]5022-her father promised [her]481-daphne desire , [her]481-daphne loveliness prevailed against [their]5023-their will ; for , [Phoebus]549-phoebus when [he]549-phoebus saw [her]481-daphne waxed distraught , and filled with wonder [his]549-phoebus sick fancy raised delusive hopes , and [his]549-phoebus own oracles deceived [him]549-phoebus . — As the stubble in [the field]5024-the field flares up , or as the stacked wheat is consumed by flames , enkindled from a spark or torch the chance pedestrian may neglect at dawn ; so was the bosom of [the god consumed]5025-the god consumed , and so desire flamed in [his]549-phoebus stricken heart . [He]549-phoebus saw [her]481-daphne bright hair waving on [her]481-daphne neck ; — “[456-jove] How beautiful if properly arranged ! ” [He]549-phoebus saw [her]481-daphne eyes like stars of sparkling fire , [her]481-daphne lips for kissing sweetest , and [her]481-daphne hands and fingers and [her]481-daphne arms ; [her]481-daphne shoulders white as ivory ; — and whatever was not seen more beautiful must be . Swift as the wind from [his]549-phoebus pursuing feet [the virgin]5026-the virgin fled , and neither stopped nor heeded as [he]549-phoebus called ; “[456-jove] O Nymph ! O [Daphne]481-daphne ! [I]0-i entreat [thee]481-daphne stay , it is no enemy that follows [thee]481-daphne — why , so the lamb leaps from the raging wolf , and from the lion runs the timid faun , and from the eagle flies the trembling dove , all hasten from [their]1463-their natural enemy but [I]0-i alone pursue for [my]0-i dear love . Alas , if [thou]1464-thou shouldst fall and mar [thy]1464-thou face , or tear upon the bramble [thy]1464-thou soft thighs , or should [I]0-i prove unwilling cause of pain ! “ [The wilderness]5027-the wilderness is rough and dangerous , and [I]0-i beseech [thee]481-daphne be more careful — [I]0-i will follow slowly . — Ask of whom [thou]1464-thou wilt , and [thou]1464-thou shalt learn that [I]0-i am not [a churl]5028-a churl — [I]0-i am [no mountain dweller of rude caves]5029-no mountain dweller of rude caves , nor clown compelled to watch the sheep and goats ; and neither canst [thou]1464-thou know from whom [thy]1464-thou feet fly fearful , or [thou]1464-thou wouldst not leave [me]0-i thus . “[0-i] [The Delphic Land]24-the delphic land , [the Pataraean Realm]25-the pataraean realm , [Claros]26-claros and Tenedos revere [my]0-i name , and [[my]0-i immortal sire]1465-my immortal sire is [Jupiter]475-jupiter . The present , past and future are through [me]0-i in sacred oracles revealed to [man]1330-man , and from [my]0-i harp the harmonies of sound are borrowed by [[their]1467-their bards]1468-their bards to praise [the Gods]1395-the gods . [My]0-i bow is certain , but a flaming shaft surpassing [mine]0-i has pierced [my]0-i heart — untouched before . The art of medicine is [my]0-i invention , and the power of herbs ; but though [the world]1360-the world declare [my]0-i useful works there is no herb to medicate [my]0-i wound , and all the arts that save have failed [[their]1467-their lord]1471-their lord . , ” But even as [he]0-i made [his]0-i plaint , [the Nymph with timid footsteps]5030-the nymph with timid footsteps fled from [his]0-i approach , and left [him]0-i to [his]0-i murmurs and [his]0-i pain . Lovely [the virgin]5026-the virgin seemed as the soft wind exposed [her]5026-the virgin limbs , and as [the zephyrs]5032-the zephyrs fond fluttered amid [her]5026-the virgin garments , and the breeze fanned lightly in [her]5026-the virgin flowing hair . [She]5026-the virgin seemed most lovely to [his]0-i fancy in [her]5026-the virgin flight ; and mad with love [he]0-i followed in [her]5026-the virgin steps , and silent hastened [his]0-i increasing speed . As when the greyhound sees the frightened hare flit over [the plain]5033-the plain : — With eager nose outstretched , impetuous , [he]0-i rushes on [his]0-i prey , and gains upon [her]5026-the virgin till [he]0-i treads [her]5026-the virgin feet , and almost fastens in [her]5026-the virgin side [his]0-i fangs ; but [she]5026-the virgin , whilst dreading that [her]5026-the virgin end is near , is suddenly delivered from [her]5026-the virgin fright ; so was it with [the god and virgin]5034-the god and virgin : [one with hope]5035-one with hope pursued , [the other]5036-the other fled in fear ; and [he]0-i who followed , borne on wings of love , permitted [her]5026-the virgin no rest and gained on [her]5026-the virgin , until [his]0-i warm breath mingled in [her]5026-the virgin hair . [Her]5026-the virgin strength spent , pale and faint , with pleading eyes [she]5026-the virgin gazed upon [[her]5026-the virgin father]5022-her father 's waves and prayed , “[1438-my father] Help [me]0-i [[my]0-i father]1438-my father , if [thy]1438-my father flowing streams have virtue ! Cover [me]0-i , O mother Earth ! Destroy the beauty that has injured [me]0-i , or change the body that destroys [my]0-i life . ” Before [her]5026-the virgin prayer was ended , torpor seized on all [her]5026-the virgin body , and a thin bark closed around [her]5026-the virgin gentle bosom , and [her]5026-the virgin hair became as moving leaves ; [her]5026-the virgin arms were changed to waving branches , and [her]5026-the virgin active feet as clinging roots were fastened to the ground — [her]5026-the virgin face was hidden with encircling leaves . — [Phoebus]549-phoebus admired and loved the graceful tree , ( For still , though changed , [her]5026-the virgin slender form remained ) and with [his]549-phoebus right hand lingering on the trunk [he]549-phoebus felt [her]5026-the virgin bosom throbbing in the bark . [He]549-phoebus clung to trunk and branch as though to twine . [His]549-phoebus form with [hers]5026-the virgin , and fondly kissed the wood that shrank from every kiss . And thus [the God]5013-the god ; “[1473-thou] Although [thou]1473-thou canst not be [[my]0-i bride]1474-my bride , [thou]1473-thou shalt be called [my]0-i chosen tree , and [thy]1473-thou green leaves , O Laurel ! shall forever crown [my]0-i brows , be wreathed around [my]0-i quiver and [my]0-i lyre ; [the Roman heroes]1475-the roman heroes shall be crowned with [thee]1473-thou , as long processions climb the Capitol and chanting throngs proclaim [their]1475-the roman heroes victories ; and as [a faithful warden]1476-a faithful warden [thou]1473-thou shalt guard the civic crown of oak leaves fixed between [thy]1473-thou branches , and before Augustan gates . And as [my]0-i youthful head is never shorn , so , also , shalt [thou]1473-thou ever bear [thy]1473-thou leaves unchanging to [thy]1473-thou glory . , ” Here [the God]5013-the god , [Phoebus Apollo]549-phoebus , ended [his]0-i lament , and unto [him]0-i the Laurel bent [her]1473-thou boughs , so lately fashioned ; and it seemed to [him]0-i [her]1473-thou graceful nod gave answer to [his]0-i love . There is [a grove in [Thessaly]27-thessaly]5040-a grove in thessaly , enclosed on every side with crags , precipitous , — on which [a forest]5041-a forest grows — and this is called [the Vale of Tempe]28-the vale of tempe — through [this valley]5042-this valley flows [the River Peneus]29-the river peneus , white with foaming waves , that issue from [the foot of [Pindus]30-pindus]5043-the foot of pindus , whence with sudden fall up gather steamy clouds that sprinkle mist upon the circling trees , and [far away with mighty roar resound]5044-far away with mighty roar resound . It is the abode , [the solitary home]5045-the solitary home , that mighty River loves , where deep in [gloom of rocky cavern]5046-gloom of rocky cavern , [he]0-i resides and rules the flowing waters and the water nymphs abiding there . [All rivers of [that land]5048-that land]5047-all rivers of that land now hasten thither , doubtful to console or flatter [Daphne]481-daphne 's parent : poplar crowned Sperchios , swift Enipeus and [the wild Amphrysos]5049-the wild amphrysos , [old Apidanus]485-old apidanus and [Aeas]31-aeas , with all [[their]5047-all rivers of that land kindred streams that wandering maze and wearied seek [the ocean]1288-the ocean]5050-their kindred streams that wandering maze and wearied seek the ocean . [Inachus]486-inachus alone is absent , hidden in [[his]486-inachus cave obscure]5052-his cave obscure , deepening [[his]486-inachus waters]5053-his waters with [his]486-inachus tears — most wretchedly bewailing , for [he]486-inachus deems [[his]486-inachus daughter]5054-his daughter Io lost . If [she]5054-his daughter may live or roam a spirit in [the nether shades]5055-the nether shades [he]486-inachus dares not even guess but dreads for [Jove]456-jove not long before had seen [her]5054-his daughter while returning from [[[her]5054-his daughter father]5022-her father 's stream]5057-her father 's stream , and said ; “[1473-thou] [O virgin]1477-o virgin , worthy of immortal [Jove]456-jove , although [some happy mortal 's chosen bride]1478-some happy mortal 's chosen bride , — behold these shades of overhanging trees , and seek their cool recesses while the sun is glowing in the height of middle skies — ” and as [he]486-inachus spoke [he]486-inachus pointed out [the groves]5058-the groves — “[1473-thou] But should the dens of wild beasts frighten [you]1479-you , with safety [you]1479-you may enter [the deep woods]1480-the deep woods , conducted by [a God]4898-a god — not with [a God of small repute , but in the care of [him]4898-a god who holds the heavenly scepter in [his]4898-a god hand and fulminates the trackless thunder bolts]1482-a god of small repute , but in the care of him who holds the heavenly scepter in his hand and fulminates the trackless thunder bolts . — forsake [me]0-i not ! ” For while [he]486-inachus spoke [she]5054-his daughter fled , and swiftly left behind [the pasture fields of Lerna]5059-the pasture fields of lerna , and [[Lyrcea]487-lyrcea 's arbours]5060-lyrcea 's arbours , where the trees are planted thickly . But [the God]5013-the god called forth a heavy shadow which involved [the wide extended earth]5062-the wide extended earth , and stopped [her]5054-his daughter flight and ravished in that cloud [her]5054-his daughter chastity . Meanwhile , [the goddess]4979-the goddess [Juno]488-juno gazing down on [[earth]1287-earth 's expanse]5065-earth 's expanse , with wonder saw the clouds as dark as night enfold [those middle fields]5066-those middle fields while day was bright above . [She]488-juno was convinced the clouds were none composed of river mist nor raised from [marshy fens]5067-marshy fens . Suspicious now , from oft detected amours of [[her]488-juno spouse]5068-her spouse , [she]488-juno glanced around to find [[her]488-juno absent lord]5069-her absent lord , and quite convinced that [he]5069-her absent lord was far from [heaven]1454-heaven , [she]488-juno thus exclaimed ; “[4898-a god] This cloud deceives [my]0-i mind , or [Jove]456-jove has wronged [me]0-i . ” From [the dome of [heaven]1454-heaven]5071-the dome of heaven [she]488-juno glided down and stood upon [the earth]1289-the earth , and bade the clouds recede . But [Jove]456-jove had known the coming of [[his]456-jove queen]5074-his queen . [He]456-jove had transformed the lovely [Io]489-io , so that [she]489-io appeared a milk white heifer — formed so beautiful and fair that envious [Juno]488-juno gazed on [her]489-io . [She]488-juno queried : “[456-jove] Whose ? what herd ? what [pasture fields]1483-pasture fields ? ” As if [she]488-juno guessed no knowledge of the truth . And [Jupiter]475-jupiter , [false hearted]5075-false hearted , said the cow was earth begotten , for [he]475-jupiter feared [[his]475-jupiter queen]5074-his queen might make inquiry of [the owner]5077-the owner 's name . [Juno]488-juno implored the heifer as a gift . — what then was left [the Father of [the Gods]1395-the gods]5078-the father of the gods ? ' Twould be a cruel thing to sacrifice [[his]456-jove own beloved]5080-his own beloved to [a rival]5081-a rival 's wrath . Although refusal must imply [his]456-jove guilt the shame and love of [her]5080-his own beloved almost prevailed ; but if a present of such little worth were now denied [the sharer of [his]456-jove couch]5082-the sharer of his couch , [the partner of [his]456-jove birth]5083-the partner of his birth , ' twould prove indeed the earth born heifer other than [she]5080-his own beloved seemed — and so [he]456-jove gave [[his]456-jove mistress]5084-his mistress up to [her]5080-his own beloved . [Juno]488-juno regardful of [Jove]456-jove 's cunning art , lest [he]456-jove might change [her]5080-his own beloved to [her]5080-his own beloved human form , gave the unhappy heifer to the charge of [Argus]490-argus , [Aristorides , whose head was circled with a hundred glowing eyes]5085-aristorides , whose head was circled with a hundred glowing eyes ; of which but two did slumber in [their]5086-their turn whilst [all the others kept on watch and guard]5087-all the others kept on watch and guard . Whichever way [he]456-jove stood [his]456-jove gaze was fixed on [Io]489-io — even if [he]456-jove turned away [his]456-jove watchful eyes on [Io]489-io still remained . [He]456-jove let [her]5080-his own beloved feed by day ; but when the sun was under [the deep world]5088-the deep world [he]456-jove shut [her]5080-his own beloved up , and tied a rope around [her]5080-his own beloved tender neck . [She]5080-his own beloved fed upon green leaves and bitter herbs and on the cold ground slept — too often bare , [she]5080-his own beloved could not rest upon a cushioned couch . [She]5080-his own beloved drank the troubled waters . Hoping aid [she]5080-his own beloved tried to stretch imploring arms to [Argus]490-argus , but all in vain for now no arms remained ; the sound of bellowing was all [she]5080-his own beloved heard , and [she]5080-his own beloved was frightened with [her]5080-his own beloved proper voice . Where former days [she]5080-his own beloved loved to roam and sport , [she]5080-his own beloved wandered by [the banks of [Inachus]486-inachus]5089-the banks of inachus : there imaged in [the stream]5090-the stream [she]5080-his own beloved saw [her]5080-his own beloved horns and , startled , turned and fled . And [Inachus]486-inachus and [all [her]5080-his own beloved sister]5091-all her sister Naiads knew [her]5080-his own beloved not , although [she]5080-his own beloved followed [them]5092-them , [they]5092-them knew [her]5080-his own beloved not , although [she]5080-his own beloved suffered [them]5092-them to touch [her]5080-his own beloved sides and praise [her]5080-his own beloved . When [the ancient Inachus]486-inachus gathered sweet herbs and offered them to [her]5080-his own beloved , [she]5080-his own beloved licked [his]486-inachus hands , kissing [[her]5080-his own beloved father]5022-her father 's palms , nor could [she]5080-his own beloved more restrain [her]5080-his own beloved falling tears . If only words as well as tears would flow , [she]5080-his own beloved might implore [his]486-inachus aid and tell [her]5080-his own beloved name and all [her]5080-his own beloved sad misfortune ; but , instead , [she]5080-his own beloved traced in dust the letters of [her]5080-his own beloved name with cloven hoof ; and thus [her]5080-his own beloved sad estate was known . “[1484-ah] [Ah]1484-ah wretched [me]0-i ! ” [[her]5080-his own beloved father]5022-her father cried ; and as [he]486-inachus clung around [her]5080-his own beloved horns and neck repeated while [she]5080-his own beloved groaned , “[1484-ah] Ah wretched [me]0-i ! Art [thou]1485-thy [[my]0-i daughter]1458-my daughter sought in every clime ? When lost [I]0-i could not grieve for [thee]1485-thy as now that [thou]1485-thy art found ; [thy]1485-thy sighs instead of words heave up from [thy]1485-thy deep breast , [thy]1485-thy longings give [me]0-i answer . [I]0-i prepared the nuptial torch and bridal chamber , in [my]0-i ignorance , since [my]0-i first hope was for [a son in law]1459-a son in law ; and then [I]0-i dreamed of [children from the match]1488-children from the match : but now the herd may furnish [thee]1485-thy [a mate]1489-a mate , and all [thy]1485-thy issue of the herd must be . Oh that a righteous death would end [my]0-i grief ! — it is a dreadful thing to be [a God]4898-a god ! Behold the lethal gate of death is shut against [me]0-i , and [my]0-i growing grief must last throughout eternity . ” While thus [he]0-i moaned came [starry Argus]490-argus there , and [Io]489-io bore from [[her]489-io lamenting father]5095-her lamenting father . Thence [he]0-i led [his]0-i charge to [other pastures]5096-other pastures ; and removed from [her]489-io , upon [a lofty mountain sat]5097-a lofty mountain sat , whence [he]0-i could always watch [her]489-io , undisturbed . [The sovereign god]5098-the sovereign god no longer could endure to witness [Io]489-io 's woes . [He]5098-the sovereign god called [[his]5098-the sovereign god son]5099-his son , whom [Maia]491-maia brightest of the Pleiades brought forth , and bade [him]5099-his son slay [the star eyed guard]5100-the star eyed guard , [argus]5101-argus . [He]0-i seized [his]0-i sleep compelling wand and fastened waving wings on [his]0-i swift feet , and deftly fixed [his]0-i brimmed hat on [his]0-i head : — lo , [Mercury]492-mercury , [the favoured son of Jove]5102-the favoured son of jove , descending to [the earth]1289-the earth from [heaven 's plains]5104-heaven 's plains , put off [his]492-mercury cap and wings , — though still retained [his]492-mercury wand with which [he]492-mercury drove through pathless wilds some stray [she]5105-she goats , and as [a shepherd]5106-a shepherd fared , piping on oaten reeds melodious tunes . [Argus , delighted with the charming sound of this new art]5107-argus , delighted with the charming sound of this new art began ; “[1491-thou] Whoever [thou]1491-thou art , sit with [me]0-i on this stone beneath the trees in cooling shade , whilst browse the tended flock abundant herbs ; for [thou]1491-thou canst see the shade is fit for [shepherds]1492-shepherds . ” Wherefore , [Mercury]492-mercury sat down beside [the keeper]5108-the keeper and conversed of various things — passing the laggard hours . — then soothly piped [he]492-mercury on the joined reeds to lull those ever watchful eyes asleep ; but [Argus]490-argus strove [his]490-argus languor to subdue , and though some drowsy eyes might slumber , still were some that vigil kept . Again [he]0-i spoke , ( for the pipes were yet a recent art ) “[0-i] [I]0-i pray [thee]1491-thou tell what chance discovered these . ” To [him]0-i [the God]5013-the god , “[1493-a famous naiad] [A famous Naiad]1493-a famous naiad dwelt among [the Hamadryads]493-the hamadryads , on [the cold Arcadian summit]1494-the cold arcadian summit [Nonacris]494-nonacris , whose name was [Syrinx]495-syrinx . Often [she]1493-a famous naiad escaped [the Gods]1395-the gods , that wandered in [the groves of sylvan shades]1496-the groves of sylvan shades , and often fled from Satyrs that pursued . Vowing virginity , in all pursuits [she]1493-a famous naiad strove to emulate [Diana]484-diana 's ways : and as [that graceful goddess]1497-that graceful goddess wears [her]1497-that graceful goddess robe , so [Syrinx]495-syrinx girded [hers]1497-that graceful goddess that one might well believe [Diana]484-diana there . Even though [her]1497-that graceful goddess bow were made of horn , [Diana]484-diana 's wrought of gold , vet might [she]1493-a famous naiad well deceive . “ Now chanced it [Pan]496-pan . Whose head was girt with prickly pines , espied [the Nymph returning from [the Lycian Hill]32-the lycian hill]5110-the nymph returning from the lycian hill , and these words uttered [he]496-pan : ”[1493-a famous naiad] — But [Mercury]492-mercury refrained from further speech , and [Pan]496-pan 's appeal remains untold . If [he]496-pan had told it all , the tale of [Syrinx]495-syrinx would have followed thus : — but [she]1493-a famous naiad despised the prayers of [Pan]496-pan , and fled through [pathless wilds]1498-pathless wilds until [she]1493-a famous naiad had arrived [the placid [Ladon]497-ladon 's sandy stream]1499-the placid ladon 's sandy stream , whose waves prevented [her]1493-a famous naiad escape . [There]1500-there [she]1493-a famous naiad implored [[her]1493-a famous naiad sister]1501-her sister Nymphs to change [her]1493-a famous naiad form : and [Pan]496-pan , believing [he]496-pan had caught [her]1493-a famous naiad , held instead some marsh reeds for the body of [the Nymph]5012-the nymph ; and while [he]496-pan sighed the moving winds began to utter plaintive music in the reeds , so sweet and voice like that [poor Pan]496-pan exclaimed ; “ Forever this discovery shall remain a sweet communion binding [thee]1493-a famous naiad to [me]496-pan . ”[496-pan] — and this explains why reeds of different length , when joined together by cementing wax , derive the name of [Syrinx]495-syrinx from [the maid]1503-the maid . Such words [the bright god Mercury]1504-the bright god mercury would say ; but now perceiving [Argus]490-argus ' eyes were dimmed in languorous doze , [he]1504-the bright god mercury hushed [his]1504-the bright god mercury voice and touched the drooping eyelids with [his]1504-the bright god mercury magic wand , compelling slumber . Then without delay [he]1504-the bright god mercury struck [the sleeper]1505-the sleeper with [his]1504-the bright god mercury crescent sword , where neck and head unite , and hurled [his]1504-the bright god mercury head , blood dripping , down [the rocks and rugged cliff]1506-the rocks and rugged cliff . Low lies [Argus]490-argus : dark is the light of all [his]490-argus hundred eyes , [his]490-argus many orbed lights extinguished in the universal gloom that night surrounds ; but [[Saturn]463-saturn 's daughter]1507-saturn 's daughter spread [their]1508-their glister on the feathers of [her]1507-saturn 's daughter bird , emblazoning its tail with starry gems . [Juno]488-juno made haste , inflamed with towering rage , to vent [her]488-juno wrath on [Io]489-io ; and [she]488-juno raised in thought and vision of [the Grecian girl]1509-the grecian girl a dreadful Fury . Stings invisible , and pitiless , [she]488-juno planted in [her]488-juno breast , and drove [her]488-juno wandering throughout [the globe]1510-the globe . The utmost limit of [her]488-juno laboured way , [O Nile]527-o nile , [thou]488-juno didst remain . Which , having reached , and placed [her]488-juno tired knees on [that river]1511-that river 's edge , [she]488-juno laid [her]488-juno there , and as [she]488-juno raised [her]488-juno neck looked upward to the stars , and groaned and wept and mournfully bellowed : trying thus to plead , by all the means [she]488-juno had , that [Jupiter]475-jupiter might end [her]488-juno miseries . [Repentant Jove]498-repentant jove embraced [[his]498-repentant jove consort]1512-his consort , and entreated [her]1512-his consort to end the punishment : “ Fear not , ”[498-repentant jove] [he]498-repentant jove said , “ For [she]1512-his consort shall trouble [thee]1512-his consort no more . ”[498-repentant jove] [He]498-repentant jove spoke , and called on bitter [Styx]278-the styx to hear [his]498-repentant jove oath . And now [imperial Juno]488-juno , pacified , permitted [Io]489-io to resume [her]489-io form , — at once the hair fell from [her]489-io snowy sides ; the horns absorbed , [her]489-io dilate orbs decreased ; the opening of [her]489-io jaws contracted ; hands appeared and shoulders ; and each transformed hoof became five nails . And every mark or form that gave the semblance of [a heifer]1513-a heifer changed , except [her]489-io fair white skin ; and [the glad Nymph]1514-the glad nymph was raised erect and stood upon [her]1514-the glad nymph feet . But long the very thought of speech , that [she]489-io might bellow as [a heifer]1513-a heifer , filled [her]489-io mind with terror , till the words so long forgot for some sufficient cause were tried once more . and since that time , [the linen wearing throng of Egypt]1516-the linen wearing throng of egypt have adored [her]489-io as [a God]4898-a god ; for [they]1516-the linen wearing throng of egypt believe the seed of [Jove]498-repentant jove prevailed ; and when [her]489-io time was due [she]489-io bore to [him]1513-a heifer [a son called [Epaphus]500-epaphus ; who also dwells in [temples]1519-temples with [[his]500-epaphus mother]1520-his mother in [that land]5048-that land . Now [Phaethon]501-phaethon , whose father was [the Sun]1522-the sun , was equal to [[his]501-phaethon rival]1523-his rival , [Epaphus]500-epaphus , in mind and years]1518-a son called epaphus ; who also dwells in temples with his mother in that land . now phaethon , whose father was the sun , was equal to his rival , epaphus , in mind and years ; and [he]501-phaethon was glad to boast of wonders , nor would yield to [Epaphus]500-epaphus for pride of [Phoebus]549-phoebus , [[his]501-phaethon reputed sire]1524-his reputed sire . Unable to endure it , [[Io]489-io 's son]1525-io 's son thus mocked [him]1513-a heifer ; “ [Poor , demented fellow]5111-poor , demented fellow , what will [you]1513-a heifer not credit if [[your]1513-a heifer mother]5112-your mother speaks , [you]1513-a heifer are so puffed up with the fond conceit of [[your]1513-a heifer imagined sire]5113-your imagined sire , [the Lord of Day]5114-the lord of day . ”[489-io] shame crimsoned in [his]1513-a heifer cheeks , but [Phaethon]501-phaethon withholding rage , reported all the taunts of [Epaphus]500-epaphus to [Clymene]502-clymene [[his]1513-a heifer mother]1520-his mother : “ ' Twill grieve [you]1520-his mother , [mother]5115-mother , [I]501-phaethon , the bold and free , was silent ; and it shames [me]501-phaethon to report this dark reproach remains unchallenged . Oh , if [I]501-phaethon am born of [race divine]5116-race divine , give proof of that illustrious descent and claim [my]501-phaethon right to [Heaven]1454-heaven . ”[501-phaethon] Around [[his]1513-a heifer mother]1520-his mother 's neck [he]1513-a heifer drew [his]1513-a heifer arms , and by the head of [Merops]503-merops , and by [his]1513-a heifer own , and by the nuptial torch of [[his]1513-a heifer beloved sisters]1528-his beloved sisters , [he]1513-a heifer implored for some true token of [his]1513-a heifer origin . Or moved by [Phaethon]501-phaethon 's importuned words , or by the grievous charge , who might declare ? [She]1520-his mother raised [her]1520-his mother arms to Heaven , and gazing full upon the broad sun said ; “ [I]1520-his mother swear to [you]1513-a heifer by yonder orb , so radiant and bright , which both beholds and hears [us]5118-us while [we]5118-us speak , that [you]1513-a heifer are [[his]501-phaethon begotten son]5119-his begotten son . — [You]1513-a heifer are [the child of that great light which sways]5120-the child of that great light which sways [the world]1360-the world : and if [I]1520-his mother have not spoken what is true , let not [mine]1520-his mother eyes behold [his]501-phaethon countenance , and let this fatal moment be the last that [I]1520-his mother shall look upon the light of day ! Nor will it weary [you]1513-a heifer , [[my]1520-his mother son]5122-my son , to reach [[[your]1513-a heifer father]5123-your father 's dwelling]5124-your father 's dwelling ; for the very place where [he]5123-your father appears at dawn is near [[our]5125-our land]5126-our land . Go , if it please [you]1513-a heifer , and the very truth learn from [[your]1513-a heifer father]5123-your father . ”[1520-his mother] Instantly sprang forth [exultant Phaethon]501-phaethon . Overjoyed with words so welcome , [he]501-phaethon imagined [he]501-phaethon could leap and touch the skies . And so [he]501-phaethon passed [[his]501-phaethon land of [Ethiopia]34-ethiopia]1529-his land of ethiopia , and [the Indies]35-the indies , hot beneath the tawny sun , and there [he]501-phaethon turned [his]501-phaethon footsteps to [[his]501-phaethon father]1530-his father ['s Land of Dawn]36-'s land of dawn . Glowing with gold , flaming with carbuncles on stately columns raised , refulgent shone [the palace of the Sun]1531-the palace of the sun , with polished dome of ivory gleaming , and with portals twain of burnished silver . And the workmanship exceeded all the wealth of gems and gold ; for there had [Mulciber]504-mulciber engraved [the seas encircling [middle earth]1533-middle earth]1532-the seas encircling middle earth ; [the round of earth]1534-the round of earth , and heaven impending over [the land]1295-the land . And there amid the waves were [azure deities]1536-azure deities : [melodious Triton]476-triton and [elusive Proteus]1537-elusive proteus ; there [Aegeaan]505-aegeaan pressing with [his]501-phaethon arms the backs . Of monstrous whales ; and [Doris]506-doris in [the sea]1298-the sea and [all [her]506-doris daughters]1539-all her daughters ; some amid the waves and [others]4906-others sitting on the bank to dry [their]4906-others sea - green hair , and others borne about by fishes . Each was made to show a fair resemblance to [[her]506-doris sisters]1541-her sisters — yet not one appearance was assigned to all — [they]1542-they seemed as near alike as [sisters]1543-sisters should in truth . And [men]1399-men and [cities]4943-cities , [woods and savage beasts]1546-woods and savage beasts , and streams and nymphs , and [sylvan deities]1547-sylvan deities were carved upon [the land]1295-the land ; and over these an image of the glittering sky was fixed ; — six signs were on the right , six on the left . Here when audacious [Phaethon]501-phaethon arrived by [steep ascending paths]1549-steep ascending paths , without delay [he]501-phaethon entered in [the shining palace - gates of [[his]501-phaethon reputed parent]1551-his reputed parent]1550-the shining palace - gates of his reputed parent , making haste to stand in [his]501-phaethon paternal presence . There , unable to endure the dazzling light , [he]501-phaethon waited at a distance . [Phoebus]549-phoebus sat , arrayed in royal purple , on a throne that glittered with the purest emeralds . — there to the left and right , Day , Month and Year , time and the Hours , at equal distance stood ; and vernal Spring stood crowned with wreathed flowers ; and naked Summer stood with sheaves of wheat ; and Autumn stood besmeared with trodden grapes ; and icy Winter rough with hoary hair . And from the midst , with orbs that view [the world]1360-the world , [Phoebus]549-phoebus beheld [the trembling youth]1553-the trembling youth , fear - struck , in mute amazement , and [he]549-phoebus said ; “ Declare the reason of [thy]1553-the trembling youth journey . What wilt [thou]1553-the trembling youth in [this [my]549-phoebus palace]5128-this my palace , [Phaethon]501-phaethon [[my]549-phoebus child beloved]5129-my child beloved ? ”[549-phoebus] And to [him]549-phoebus replied [the youth]1554-the youth ; “ O universal light of all [the world]1360-the world , [[my]1554-the youth father]1438-my father [Phoebus]549-phoebus , if [thy]1553-the trembling youth name be [mine]1554-the youth , if [Clymene]502-clymene has not concealed [her]502-clymene sin beneath some pretext , give to [me]1554-the youth , [[my]1554-the youth sire]5132-my sire , a token to declare [thy]1553-the trembling youth fatherhood which may establish [my]1554-the youth assured descent , and leave no dark suspicions in [our]5133-our minds . ”[1554-the youth] — then [Phoebus]549-phoebus from [his]549-phoebus shining brows cast down [his]549-phoebus circling rays ; called [Phaethon]501-phaethon to [him]549-phoebus , and as [he]549-phoebus held [him]549-phoebus to [his]549-phoebus breast replied ; “ [O child most worthy of [[thy]549-phoebus sire]5135-thy sire]5134-o child most worthy of thy sire , the truth was told [thee]549-phoebus by [[thy]549-phoebus mother]5136-thy mother ; wherefore doubts to dissipate , consider [thy]549-phoebus desire , and ask of [me]549-phoebus that [I]549-phoebus may freely give : yea , let the [Nether Lake]37-nether lake , beyond [our]5137-our view , ( which is the oath of [Gods inviolate]5138-gods inviolate ) be witness to [my]549-phoebus word . ”[549-phoebus] When this was said [the happy youth]1555-the happy youth at once began to plead command and guidance of [[his]1555-the happy youth father]1530-his father 's steeds , wing - footed , and [his]1530-his father chariot for a day . But [Phoebus]549-phoebus much repented that [he]549-phoebus sware , and thrice and four times shook [his]549-phoebus radiant head ; “ Ah , would [I]549-phoebus might refuse [my]549-phoebus plighted word ; and oh , that it were lawful to deny the promised boon . — For [I]549-phoebus confess , [O son]5139-o son , this only [I]549-phoebus should keep from [thee]5139-o son — and yet ' Tis lawful to dissuade . It is unsafe to satisfy [thy]5139-o son will . It is a great request , [O Phaethon]501-phaethon , which neither suits [thy]5139-o son utmost strength nor tender years ; for [thou]5139-o son art mortal , and [thou]5139-o son hast aspired to things immortal . Ignorance has made [thy]5139-o son thought transcend [the province of [the Gods]1395-the gods]5140-the province of the gods . [I]549-phoebus vaunt no vain exploits ; but only [I]549-phoebus can stand securely on the flame - fraught axle - tree : even [the Ruler of Olympian Gods , who hurls fierce lightnings with [his]549-phoebus great right hand , may never dare to drive [this chariot]5142-this chariot , and what art [thou]5139-o son to equal mighty Jove]456-jove ? “[549-phoebus] The opening path is steep and difficult , for scarcely can the steeds , refreshed at dawn , climb up the steeps : and when is reached the height , extreme of [midmost Heaven]5-heaven , and [sea and earth]1557-sea and earth are viewed below , [my]0-i trembling breast is filled with fearful apprehensions : and requires the last precipitous descent a sure command . Then , also , [Tethys]507-tethys , who receives [me]0-i in [her]507-tethys subject waves , is wo nt to fear lest [I]0-i should fall disastrous . And around the hastening sky revolves in constant whirl , drawing the lofty stars with rapid twist . “ [I]507-tethys struggle on . The force that overcomes the heavenly bodies overwhelms [me]507-tethys not , and [I]507-tethys am borne against that rapid globe . Suppose [the chariot]5143-the chariot thine : what canst [thou]1558-thou do ? Canst [thou]1558-thou drive straight against the twisted pole and not be carried from [the lofty path]5144-the lofty path by [the swift car]5145-the swift car ? Art [thou]1558-thou deceived to think there may be groves and cities of [the Gods]1395-the gods , and [costly temples wondrously endowed]5147-costly temples wondrously endowed ? “[507-tethys] The journey is beset with dreadful snares and shapes of savage animals . If [thou]1558-thou shouldst hold upon [thy]1558-thou way without mistake yet must [thy]1558-thou journey be through [Taurus]508-taurus ' horns , and through the Bow Haemonian , and the jaws of the fierce Lion , and the cruel arms of [Scorpion]509-scorpion , bent throughout a vast expanse , — and [Cancer]510-cancer 's curving arms reversely bent . “ It is no easy task for [thee]1558-thou to rule [the mettled four - foot steeds]5148-the mettled four - foot steeds , enflamed in fires that kindle in [their]5148-the mettled four - foot steeds breasts , forth issuing in breathings from [their]5148-the mettled four - foot steeds mouths and nostrils hot ; — [I]510-cancer scarce restrain [them]5148-the mettled four - foot steeds , as [their]5148-the mettled four - foot steeds struggling necks pull on the harness , when [their]5148-the mettled four - foot steeds heated fires are thus aroused . “[510-cancer] And , O [[my]0-i son]5122-my son , lest [I]0-i may be [the author of a baneful gift]1560-the author of a baneful gift , beware , and as the time permits recall [thy]1558-thou rash request . Forsooth [thou]1558-thou hast besought undoubted signs of [thy]1558-thou descent from [me]0-i ? [My]0-i fears for [thee]1558-thou are certain signs that [thou]1558-thou art of [[my]0-i race]1561-my race — by [my]0-i paternal fears ' Tis manifest [I]0-i am [[thy]1558-thou father]1562-thy father . Lo ! Behold [my]0-i countenance ! and oh , that [thou]1558-thou couldst even pierce [my]0-i bosom with thine eyes , and so discover [my]0-i paternal cares ! “ Look round [thee]1558-thou on [the treasured world]5149-the treasured world 's delights and ask the greatest blessing of the sky , or [sea]1296-sea or [land]1301-land , and [thou]1558-thou shalt suffer no repulse : but only this [I]0-i must deplore , which rightly named would be a penalty and not an honour . — [Thou]1558-thou hast made request of punishment and not a gift indeed . [O witless boy]5152-o witless boy ! why dost [thou]1558-thou hold [my]0-i neck with [thy]1558-thou caressing arms ? For , doubt it not , as [I]0-i have sworn it by the Stygian Waves , whatever [thou]1558-thou shalt wish , it shall be given — but [thou]1558-thou shouldst wish more wisely . ”[0-i] So were all [his]0-i admonitions said , availing naught ; for [Phaethon]501-phaethon resisted [his]0-i advice , and urged again [his]0-i claim , and eagerly burned to use [the chariot]5143-the chariot . Wherefore , [Phoebus]549-phoebus long delaying and reluctant , took [the youth]1554-the youth to view [the spacious chariot]1565-the spacious chariot , gift of [Vulcan]511-vulcan . — gold was the axle and the beam was gold , the great Wheel had a golden tire and spokes of silver ; chrysolites and diamonds reflected from the spangled yoke the light of [Phoebus]549-phoebus . While [aspiring Phaethon]501-phaethon admired [the glittering chariot]1566-the glittering chariot and its workmanship , [the vigilant Aurora]512-aurora opened forth [her]512-aurora purple portals from the ruddy east , disclosing halls replete with roses . All the stars took flight , while [Lucifer]513-lucifer , the last to quit [his]513-lucifer vigil , gathered [that great host]1567-that great host and disappeared from [his]513-lucifer celestial watch . And when [[his]0-i father]1530-his father , [Phoebus]549-phoebus , saw [the earth]1289-the earth and [the wide universe]1570-the wide universe in glowing tints arrayed , as waned the Moon 's diminished horns , far - distant , then [he]1530-his father bade the nimble Hours to yoke the steeds . — At once [the Deities]1400-the deities accomplished [his]1530-his father commands , and led the steeds , ambrosia - fed and snorting flames , from out [[their]1572-their spacious stalls]1573-their spacious stalls ; and fixed [their]1572-their sounding bits . Then with a hallowed drug [the father]1574-the father touched [the stripling]1575-the stripling 's face , to make [him]1575-the stripling proof against the rapid flame , and wrought around [his]1575-the stripling hair the sun - rays . But , foreboding grief , [he]1574-the father said , while many a sigh heaved from [his]1574-the father anxious breast ; “ If [thou]5153-thou canst only heed [[thy]5153-thou father]1562-thy father 's voice — be sparing of the whip and use with nerve the reins ; for of [their]1572-their own accord [the steeds]5155-the steeds will hasten .
