and yelping [Babbler]587-babbler : these and others , more than patience leads [us]5577-us to recount or name . All eager for [their]5578-their prey the pack surmount rocks , [cliffs and crags]5579-cliffs and crags , precipitous — where [paths are steep , where roads]5580-paths are steep , where roads are none . [He]1684-your master flies by routes so oft pursued but now , alas , [his]1684-your master flight is from [his]1684-your master own ! — [He]1684-your master would have cried , “[1682-your] Behold [[your]1683-your master]1684-your master ! — It is [I]0-i — [Actaeon]574-actaeon ! ” Words refused [his]1684-your master will . The yelping pack pressed on . [First Blackmane]588-first blackmane seized and tore [[his]1684-your master master]1634-his master 's back , [Savage]589-savage the next , then [Rover]590-rover 's teeth were clinched deep in [his]590-rover shoulder . — [These]5582-these , though tardy out , cut through a by - path and arriving first clung to [[their]5582-these master]5532-their master till the pack came up . [The whole pack]5584-the whole pack fastened on [[their]5582-these master]5532-their master 's flesh till place was none for [others]4906-others . [Groaning]591-groaning [he]5532-their master made frightful sounds that not the human voice could utter nor the stag ; and filled [the hills]1416-the hills with dismal moans ; and as [a suppliant]5588-a suppliant fell down to the ground upon [his]5532-their master trembling knees ; and turned [his]5532-their master stricken eyes on [his]5532-their master own dogs , entreating [them]5584-the whole pack to spare [him]5532-their master from [their]5584-the whole pack fangs . But [[his]5532-their master companions]5589-his companions , witless of [his]5532-their master plight , urged on the swift pack with [their]5589-his companions hunting cries . [They]5589-his companions sought [Actaeon]574-actaeon and [they]5589-his companions vainly called , “[574-actaeon] [Actaeon]574-actaeon ! Hi ! [Actaeon]574-actaeon ! ” just as though [he]5532-their master was away from [them]5589-his companions . Each time [they]5589-his companions called [he]5532-their master turned [his]5532-their master head . And when [they]5589-his companions chided [him]5532-their master , whose indolence denied the joys of sport , how much [he]5532-their master wished an indolent desire had haply held [him]5532-their master from [his]5532-their master ravenous pack . Oh , how much;better ' tis to see the hunt , and the fierce dogs , than feel [their]5584-the whole pack savage deeds ! [They]5589-his companions gathered round [him]5532-their master , and [they]5589-his companions fixed [their]5589-his companions snouts deep in [his]5532-their master flesh : tore [him]5532-their master to pieces , [he]5532-their master whose features only as a stag appeared . — ' Tis said [Diana]484-diana 's fury raged with none abatement till the torn flesh ceased to live . [Hapless Actaeon]574-actaeon 's end in various ways was now regarded ; some deplored [his]5532-their master doom , but others praised [Diana]484-diana 's chastity ; and all gave many reasons . But [the spouse of [Jove]456-jove]5590-the spouse of jove , alone remaining silent , gave nor praise nor blame . Whenever calamity befell the race of [Cadmus]561-cadmus [she]1685-her rejoiced , in secret , for [she]1685-her visited [her]1685-her rage on all [Europa]592-europa 's kindred . Now a fresh occasion has been added to [her]1685-her grief , and wild with jealousy of [Semele]593-semele , [her]1685-her tongue as ever ready to [her]1685-her rage , lets loose a torrent of abuse ; “[574-actaeon] Away ! Away with words ! Why should [I]0-i speak of it ? Let [me]0-i attack [her]1685-her ! Let [me]0-i spoil that jade ! Am [I]0-i not [[Juno]488-juno the supreme of Heaven]1686-juno the supreme of heaven ? [Queen of the flashing scepter]1687-queen of the flashing scepter ? Am [I]0-i not sister and [wife of [Jove omnipotent]456-jove]1688-wife of jove omnipotent ? [She]1685-her even wishes to be known by [him]456-jove [a mother of [a Deity]1690-a deity]1689-a mother of a deity , a joy almost denied to [me]0-i ! Great confidence has [she]1685-her in [her]1685-her great beauty — nevertheless , [I]0-i shall so weave the web the bolt of [Jove]456-jove would fail to save [her]1685-her . — Let [the Gods]1395-the gods deny that [I]0-i am [[Saturn]463-saturn 's daughter]1507-saturn 's daughter , if [her]1685-her shade descend not stricken to the Stygian wave . ” [She]1685-her rose up quickly from [her]1685-her shining throne , and hidden in a cloud of fiery hue descended to [the home of [Semele]593-semele]5591-the home of semele ; and while encompassed by the cloud , transformed [her]1685-her whole appearance as to counterfeit [old Beroe]594-old beroe , [an Epidaurian nurse]5592-an epidaurian nurse , who tended [Semele]593-semele . [Her]1685-her tresses changed to grey , [her]1685-her smooth skin wrinkled and [her]1685-her step grown feeble as [she]1685-her moved with trembling limbs ; — [her]1685-her voice was quavering as [an ancient dame]5593-an ancient dame 's , as [Juno]488-juno , thus disguised , began to talk to [Semele]593-semele . When presently the name of [Jove]456-jove was mentioned — artful [Juno]488-juno thus ; ( doubtful that [Jupiter]475-jupiter could be [her]1685-her love ) — “[456-jove] When [Jove]456-jove appears to pledge [his]456-jove love to [you]1693-you , implore [him]456-jove to assume [his]456-jove majesty and all [his]456-jove glory , even as [he]456-jove does in presence of [[his]456-jove stately Juno]1694-his stately juno — Yea , implore [him]456-jove to caress [you]1693-you as [a God]4898-a god . ” With artful words as these [the goddess]4979-the goddess worked upon the trusting mind of [Semele]593-semele , [daughter of [Cadmus]561-cadmus]5595-daughter of cadmus , till [she]593-semele begged of [Jove]456-jove a boon , that only hastened [her]593-semele sad death ; for [Jove]456-jove not knowing [her]1696-her design replied , “[456-jove] Whatever [thy]1696-her wish , it shall not be denied , and that [thy]1696-her heart shall suffer no distrust , [I]0-i pledge [me]0-i by [that Deity]1697-that deity , the Waves of [the deep Stygian Lake]108-the deep stygian lake , — oath of [the Gods]456-jove . ” All overjoyed at [her]1696-her misfortune , proud that [she]1696-her prevailed , and pleased that [she]1696-her secured of [him]456-jove a promise , that could only cause [her]1696-her own disaster , [Semele]593-semele addressed [almighty Jove]456-jove ; “[456-jove] Come unto [me]0-i in all the splendour of [thy]1696-her glory , as [thy]1696-her might is shown to [Juno]488-juno , goddess of [the skies]1340-the skies . ” [Fain]595-fain would [he]595-fain stifle [her]1696-her disastrous tongue ; before [he]595-fain knew [her]1696-her quest the words were said ; and , knowing that [his]595-fain greatest oath was pledged , [he]595-fain sadly mounted to the lofty skies , and by [his]595-fain potent nod assembled there the deep clouds : and the rain began to pour , and thunder - bolts resounded . But [he]595-fain strove to mitigate [his]595-fain power , and armed [him]595-fain not with flames overwhelming as had put to flight [[his]595-fain hundred - handed foe]5596-his hundred - handed foe [Typhoeus]596-typhoeus — flames too dreadful . Other thunder - bolts [he]595-fain took , forged by the Cyclops of a milder heat , with which insignia of [[his]595-fain majesty]5597-his majesty , sad and reluctant , [he]595-fain appeared to [her]1696-her . — [her]1696-her mortal form could not endure the shock and [she]1696-her was burned to ashes in [his]595-fain sight . [An unformed babe]5598-an unformed babe was rescued from [her]1696-her side , and , nurtured in the thigh of [Jupiter]475-jupiter , completed Nature 's time until [his]5598-an unformed babe birth . [Ino]597-ino , [[his]595-fain aunt]5599-his aunt , in secret nursed [the boy]5600-the boy and cradled [him]5600-the boy . And [him]5600-the boy [Nyseian nymphs concealed in caves and fed with needful milk]5601-nyseian nymphs concealed in caves and fed with needful milk . While these events according to the laws of destiny occurred , and while [the child]5602-the child , [the twice - born Bacchus]5603-the twice - born bacchus , in [his]5602-the child cradle lay , ' Tis told that [Jupiter]475-jupiter , [a careless hour]5604-a careless hour , indulged too freely in the nectar cup ; and having laid aside all weighty cares , jested with [Juno]488-juno as [she]488-juno idled by . Freely [the god]5013-the god began ; “[488-juno] Who doubts the truth ? The female 's pleasure is a great delight , much greater than the pleasure of [a male]1699-a male . ” [Juno]488-juno denied it ; wherefore ' twas agreed to ask [Tiresias]598-pentheus to declare the truth , than whom [none knew both male and female joys]5606-none knew both male and female joys : for wandering in [a green wood]5607-a green wood [he]598-pentheus had seen two serpents coupling ; and [he]598-pentheus took [his]598-pentheus staff and sharply struck them , till [they]5608-they broke and fled . ' Tis marvelous , that instant [he]598-pentheus became [a woman]5609-a woman from [a man]5610-a man , and so remained while seven autumns passed . When eight were told , again [he]598-pentheus saw [them]5608-they in [their]5608-they former plight , and thus [he]598-pentheus spoke ; “[1699-a male] Since such a power was wrought , by one stroke of a staff [my]0-i sex was changed — again [I]0-i strike ! ” And even as [he]598-pentheus struck the same two snakes , [his]598-pentheus former sex returned ; [his]598-pentheus manhood was restored . — as [both]5611-both agreed to choose [him]598-pentheus umpire of the sportive strife , [he]598-pentheus gave decision in support of [Jove]456-jove ; from this the disappointment [Juno]488-juno felt surpassed all reason , and enraged , decreed eternal night should seal [Tiresias]598-pentheus ' eyes . — [immortal Deities]5612-immortal deities may never turn decrees and deeds of [other Gods]5613-other gods to naught , but [Jove]456-jove , to recompense [his]598-pentheus loss of sight , endowed [him]598-pentheus with the gift of prophecy . [Tiresias]598-pentheus ' fame of prophecy was spread through [all the cities of [Aonia]20-aonia]5614-all the cities of aonia , for [his]598-pentheus unerring answers unto all who listened to [his]598-pentheus words . And first of those that harkened to [his]598-pentheus fateful prophecies , a lovely Nymph , named [Liriope]599-liriope , came with [[her]599-liriope dear son]5615-her dear son , who then fifteen , might seem a man or boy — [he]5615-her dear son who was born to [her]599-liriope upon [the green merge of [Cephissus]564-cephissus ' stream]5616-the green merge of cephissus ' stream — that mighty River - God whom [she]599-liriope declared [the father of [[her]599-liriope boy]5618-her boy]5617-the father of her boy . — [she]599-liriope questioned [him]598-pentheus . Imploring [him]598-pentheus to tell [her]599-liriope if [[her]599-liriope son]5619-her son , unequalled for [his]598-pentheus beauty , whom [she]599-liriope called [Narcissus]600-narcissus , might attain a ripe old age . To which [the blind seer]5620-the blind seer answered in these words , “[0-i] If [he]1700-he but fail to recognize [himself]1700-he , a long life [he]1700-he may have , beneath the sun , ” — so , frivolous [the prophet]5621-the prophet 's words appeared ; and yet the event , the manner of [his]598-pentheus death , the strange delusion of [his]598-pentheus frenzied love , confirmed it . Three times five years so were passed . Another five - years , and [the lad]5180-the lad might seem [a young man]5623-a young man or [a boy]5624-a boy . And [many a youth]5625-many a youth , and [many a damsel]5626-many a damsel sought to gain [his]598-pentheus love ; but such [his]598-pentheus mood and spirit and [his]598-pentheus pride , none gained [his]598-pentheus favour . Once [a noisy Nymph]5627-a noisy nymph , ( who never held [her]5627-a noisy nymph tongue when [others spoke]5628-others spoke , who never spoke till [others had begun]5629-others had begun ) mocking [Echo]601-echo , spied [him]601-echo as [he]601-echo drove , in [his]601-echo delusive nets , [some timid stags]5630-some timid stags . — for [Echo]601-echo was [a Nymph , in olden time , — and , more than vapid sound]5631-a nymph , in olden time , — and , more than vapid sound , — possessed a form : and [she]5627-a noisy nymph was then deprived the use of speech , except to babble and repeat the words , once spoken , over and over . [Juno]488-juno confused [her]488-juno silly tongue , because [she]488-juno often held [that glorious goddess]5632-that glorious goddess with [her]488-juno endless tales , till [many a hapless Nymph]5633-many a hapless nymph , from [Jove]456-jove 's embrace , had made escape adown [a mountain]5634-a mountain . But for this , [the goddess]4979-the goddess might have caught [them]5636-them . Thus the glorious [Juno]488-juno , when [she]488-juno knew [her]488-juno guile ; “[1701-your] [Your]1701-your tongue , so freely wagged at [my]0-i expense , shall be of little use ; [your]1701-your endless voice , much shorter than [your]1701-your tongue . ” At once [the Nymph]5012-the nymph was stricken as [the goddess]4979-the goddess had decreed ; — and , ever since , [she]5627-a noisy nymph only mocks the sounds of [others]4906-others ' voices , or , perchance , returns [their]5636-them final words . One day , when [she]5627-a noisy nymph observed [Narcissus]600-narcissus wandering in [the pathless woods]5640-the pathless woods , [she]5627-a noisy nymph loved [him]600-narcissus and [she]5627-a noisy nymph followed [him]600-narcissus , with soft and stealthy tread . — The more [she]5627-a noisy nymph followed [him]600-narcissus the hotter did [she]5627-a noisy nymph burn , as when the flame flares upward from the sulphur on the torch . Oh , how [she]5627-a noisy nymph longed to make [her]5627-a noisy nymph passion known ! To plead in soft entreaty ! to implore [his]600-narcissus love ! But now , till [others]4906-others have begun , a mute of Nature [she]5627-a noisy nymph must be . [She]5627-a noisy nymph can not choose but wait the moment when [his]600-narcissus voice may give to [her]5627-a noisy nymph an answer . Presently [the youth]1554-the youth , by chance divided from [[his]1554-the youth trusted friends]5643-his trusted friends , cries loudly , “[1701-your] Who is here ? ” and [Echo]601-echo , “[1701-your] Here ! ” Replies . Amazed , [he]1554-the youth casts [his]1554-the youth eyes around , and calls with louder voice , “[1701-your] Come here ! ” “[1701-your] Come here ! ” [She]5627-a noisy nymph calls [the youth who calls]5644-the youth who calls . — [He]1554-the youth turns to see who calls [him]1554-the youth and , beholding naught exclaims , “[1701-your] Avoid [me]0-i not ! ” “[1701-your] Avoid [me]0-i not ! ” returns . [He]1554-the youth tries again , again , and is deceived by this alternate voice , and calls aloud ; “[1701-your] Oh let [us]1702-us come together ! ” [Echo]601-echo cries , “[1701-your] Oh let [us]1702-us come together ! ” Never sound seemed sweeter to [the Nymph]602-ida , and from [the woods]1317-the woods [she]5627-a noisy nymph hastens in accordance with [her]5627-a noisy nymph words , and strives to wind [her]5627-a noisy nymph arms around [his]1554-the youth neck . [He]1554-the youth flies from [her]5627-a noisy nymph and as [he]1554-the youth leaves [her]5627-a noisy nymph says , “[1701-your] Take off [your]0-i hands ! [you]0-i shall not fold [your]0-i arms around [me]0-i . Better death than [such a one]1703-such a one should ever caress [me]0-i ! ” Naught [she]5627-a noisy nymph answers save , “[1703-such a one] Caress [me]0-i ! ” Thus rejected [she]5627-a noisy nymph lies hid in [the deep woods]1480-the deep woods , hiding [her]5627-a noisy nymph blushing face with the green leaves ; and ever after lives concealed in [lonely caverns in [the hills]1416-the hills]5647-lonely caverns in the hills . But [her]5627-a noisy nymph great love increases with neglect ; [her]5627-a noisy nymph miserable body wastes away , wakeful with sorrows ; leanness shrivels up [her]5627-a noisy nymph skin , and all [her]5627-a noisy nymph lovely features melt , as if dissolved upon the wafting winds — nothing remains except [her]5627-a noisy nymph bones and voice — [her]5627-a noisy nymph voice continues , in [the wilderness]5027-the wilderness ; [her]5627-a noisy nymph bones have turned to stone . [She]5627-a noisy nymph lies concealed in [the wild woods]5650-the wild woods , nor is [she]5627-a noisy nymph ever seen on [lonely mountain range]5651-lonely mountain range ; for , though [we]5652-we hear [her]5627-a noisy nymph calling in [the hills]1416-the hills , ' tis but a voice , a voice that lives , that lives among [the hills]1416-the hills . Thus [he]1704-he deceived [the Nymph]5012-the nymph and [many more]5656-many more , sprung from [the mountains]5190-the mountains or the sparkling waves ; and thus [he]1704-he slighted [many an amorous youth]5658-many an amorous youth . — and therefore , [some one whom [he]1704-he once despised , lifting [his]1704-he hands to Heaven]5659-some one whom he once despised , lifting his hands to heaven , implored [the Gods]1395-the gods , “[0-i] If [he]1704-he should love deny [him]1704-he what [he]1704-he loves ! ” and as the prayer was uttered it was heard by [Nemesis]603-nemesis , who granted [her]603-nemesis assent . There was a fountain silver - clear and bright , which [neither shepherds]5661-neither shepherds nor the wild she - goats , that range [the hills]1416-the hills , nor any cattle 's mouth had touched — [its]5663-its waters were unsullied — birds disturbed it not ; nor animals , nor boughs that fall so often from the trees . Around sweet grasses nourished by [the stream]5090-the stream grew ; trees that shaded from the sun let balmy airs temper [its]5663-its waters . Here [Narcissus]600-narcissus , tired of hunting and the heated noon , lay down , attracted by the peaceful solitudes and by [the glassy spring]5665-the glassy spring . There as [he]600-narcissus stooped to quench [his]600-narcissus thirst another thirst increased . While [he]600-narcissus is drinking [he]600-narcissus beholds [himself]600-narcissus reflected in the mirrored pool — and loves ; loves an imagined body which contains no substance , for [he]600-narcissus deems the mirrored shade a thing of life to love . [He]600-narcissus can not move , for so [he]600-narcissus marvels at [himself]600-narcissus , and lies with countenance unchanged , as if indeed a statue carved of Parian marble . Long , supine upon [the bank]5666-the bank , [his]600-narcissus gaze is fixed on [his]600-narcissus own eyes , twin stars ; [his]600-narcissus fingers shaped as [Bacchus]593-semele might desire , [his]600-narcissus flowing hair as glorious as [Apollo]549-phoebus 's , and [his]600-narcissus cheeks youthful and smooth ; [his]600-narcissus ivory neck , [his]600-narcissus mouth dreaming in sweetness , [his]600-narcissus complexion fair and blushing as the rose in snow - drift white . All that is lovely in [himself]600-narcissus [he]600-narcissus loves , and in [his]600-narcissus witless way [he]600-narcissus wants [himself]600-narcissus : — [he]600-narcissus who approves is equally approved ; [he]600-narcissus seeks , is sought , [he]600-narcissus burns and [he]600-narcissus is burnt . And how [he]600-narcissus kisses the deceitful fount ; and how [he]600-narcissus thrusts [his]600-narcissus arms to catch the neck that 's pictured in the middle of [the stream]5090-the stream ! Yet never may [he]600-narcissus wreathe [his]600-narcissus arms around that image of [himself]600-narcissus . [He]600-narcissus knows not what [he]600-narcissus there beholds , but what [he]600-narcissus sees inflames [his]600-narcissus longing , and the error that deceives allures [his]600-narcissus eyes . But why , [O foolish boy]5668-o foolish boy , so vainly catching at this flitting form ? The cheat that [you]5668-o foolish boy are seeking has no place . Avert [your]5668-o foolish boy gaze and [you]5668-o foolish boy will lose [your]5668-o foolish boy love , for this that holds [your]5668-o foolish boy eyes is nothing save the image of [yourself]5668-o foolish boy reflected back to [you]5668-o foolish boy . It comes and waits with [you]5668-o foolish boy ; it has no life ; it will depart if [you]5668-o foolish boy will only go . Nor food nor rest can draw [him]600-narcissus thence — outstretched upon the overshadowed green , [his]600-narcissus eyes fixed on the mirrored image never may know [their]5669-their longings satisfied , and by [their]5669-their sight [he]600-narcissus is [himself]600-narcissus undone . Raising [himself]600-narcissus a moment , [he]600-narcissus extends [his]600-narcissus arms around , and , beckoning to [the murmuring forest]5670-the murmuring forest ; “[0-i] Oh , [ye]1705-ye aisled wood was ever [man]1330-man in love more fatally than [I]0-i ? [[Your]1705-ye silent paths]1707-your silent paths have sheltered many [a one whose love was told]1708-a one whose love was told , and [ye]1705-ye have heard [their]1708-a one whose love was told voices . Ages vast have rolled away since [your]1705-ye forgotten birth , but who is [he]1330-man through all those weary years that ever pined away as [I]0-i ? Alas , this fatal image wins [my]0-i love , as [I]0-i behold it . But [I]0-i can not press [my]0-i arms around the form [I]0-i see , the form that gives [me]0-i joy . What strange mistake has intervened betwixt [us]1709-us and [our]1709-us love ? It grieves [me]0-i more that neither lands nor [seas nor mountains]1710-seas nor mountains , no , nor walls with closed gates deny [our]1709-us loves , but only a little water keeps [us]1709-us far asunder . Surely [he]1330-man desires [my]0-i love and [my]0-i embraces , for as oft [I]0-i strive to kiss [him]1330-man , bending to the limpid stream [my]0-i lips , so often does [he]1330-man hold [his]1330-man face fondly to [me]0-i , and vainly struggles up . It seems that [I]0-i could touch [him]1330-man . ' Tis a strange delusion that is keeping [us]1709-us apart . “ Whoever [thou]5671-thou art , Come up ! Deceive [me]1711-i not ! Oh , whither when [I]1711-i fain pursue art [thou]5671-thou ? Ah , surely [I]1711-i am young and fair , [the Nymphs]5672-the nymphs have loved [me]1711-i ; and when [I]1711-i behold [thy]5672-the nymphs smiles [I]1711-i can not tell [thee]5672-the nymphs what sweet hopes arise . When [I]1711-i extend [my]1711-i loving arms to [thee]5672-the nymphs thine also are extended [me]1711-i — [thy]5672-the nymphs smiles return [my]1711-i own . When [I]1711-i was weeping , [I]1711-i have seen [thy]5672-the nymphs tears , and every sign [I]1711-i make [thou]5672-the nymphs cost return ; and often [thy]5672-the nymphs sweet lips have seemed to move , that , peradventure words , which [I]1711-i have never heard , [thou]5672-the nymphs hast returned . “[1711-i] No more [my]0-i shade deceives [me]0-i , [I]0-i perceive ' Tis [I]0-i in [thee]1711-i — [I]0-i love [myself]0-i — the flame arises in [my]0-i breast and burns [my]0-i heart — what shall [I]0-i do ? Shall [I]0-i at once implore ? Or should [I]0-i linger till [my]0-i love is sought ? What is it [I]0-i implore ? The thing that [I]0-i desire is [mine]0-i — abundance makes [me]0-i poor . Oh , [I]0-i am tortured by a strange desire unknown to [me]0-i before , for [I]0-i would fain put off this mortal form ; which only means [I]0-i wish the object of [my]0-i love away . Grief saps [my]0-i strength , the sands of life are run , and in [my]0-i early youth am [I]0-i cut off ; but death is not [my]0-i bane — it ends [my]0-i woe . — [I]0-i would not death for this that is [my]0-i love , as [two united in a single soul]1712-two united in a single soul would die as one . ” [He]0-i spoke ; and crazed with love , returned to view the same face in the pool ; and as [he]0-i grieved [his]0-i tears disturbed the stream , and ripples on the surface , glassy clear , defaced [his]0-i mirrored form . And thus [the youth]1554-the youth , when [he]0-i beheld that lovely shadow go ; “[0-i] Ah whither cost [thou]1713-she fly ? Oh , [I]0-i entreat [thee]1713-she leave [me]0-i not . Alas , [[thou]1713-she cruel boy]1714-thou cruel boy thus to forsake [[thy]1713-she lover]1715-thy lover . Stay with [me]0-i that [I]0-i may see [thy]1713-she lovely form , for though [I]0-i may not touch [thee]1713-she [I]0-i shall feed [my]0-i eyes and soothe [my]0-i wretched pains . ” And while [he]0-i spoke [he]0-i rent [his]0-i garment from the upper edge , and beating on [his]0-i naked breast , all white as marble , every stroke produced a tint as lovely as the apple streaked with red , or as the glowing grape when purple bloom touches the ripening clusters . When as glass again the rippling waters smoothed , and when such beauty in the stream [the youth]1554-the youth observed , no more could [he]0-i endure . As in the flame the yellow wax , or as the hoar - frost melts in early morning ' neath the genial sun ; so did [he]0-i pine away , by love consumed , and slowly wasted by a hidden flame . No vermeil bloom now mingled in the white of [his]0-i complexion fair ; no strength has [he]0-i , no vigor , nor the comeliness that wrought for love so long : alas , that handsome form by [Echo]601-echo fondly loved may please no more . But when [she]1713-she saw [him]0-i in [his]0-i hapless plight , though angry at [his]0-i scorn , [she]1713-she only grieved . As often as [the love - lore boy]5675-the love - lore boy complained , “[0-i] Alas ! ” “[0-i] Alas ! ” [her]1713-she echoing voice returned ; and as [he]0-i struck [his]0-i hands against [his]0-i arms , [she]1713-she ever answered with [her]1713-she echoing sounds . And as [he]0-i gazed upon [the mirrored pool]5676-the mirrored pool [he]0-i said at last , “[0-i] Ah , youth beloved in vain ! ” “[0-i] In vain , in vain ! ” the spot returned [his]0-i words ; and when [he]0-i breathed a sad “[0-i] farewell ! ” “[0-i] Farewell ! ” sighed [Echo]601-echo too . [He]0-i laid [his]0-i wearied head , and rested on the verdant grass ; and those bright eyes , which had so loved to gaze , entranced , on [[their]5677-their own master]5678-their own master 's beauty , sad Night closed . And now although among the nether shades [his]0-i sad sprite roams , [he]0-i ever loves to gaze on [his]0-i reflection in the Stygian wave . [[His]0-i Naiad sisters]5679-his naiad sisters mourned , and having clipped [their]5679-his naiad sisters shining tresses laid them on [his]0-i corpse : and [all the Dryads]5680-all the dryads mourned : and [Echo]601-echo made lament anew . And these would have upraised [his]0-i funeral pyre , and waved the flaming torch , and made [his]0-i bier ; but as [they]5679-his naiad sisters turned [their]5679-his naiad sisters eyes where [he]0-i had been , alas [he]0-i was not there ! And in [his]0-i body 's place a sweet flower grew , golden and white , the white around the gold . [Narcissus]600-narcissus ' fate , when known throughout [the land]1295-the land and [cities of Achaia]5682-cities of achaia , added fame deserved , to [blind Tiresias]598-pentheus , — mighty seer . Yet [Pentheus]598-pentheus , [bold despiser of [the Gods]1395-the gods]5683-bold despiser of the gods , [son of Echion]5685-son of echion , scoffed at all [his]598-pentheus praise , and , sole of man deriding [the great seer]5686-the great seer , upbraided [him]0-i [his]0-i hapless loss of sight . And shaking [his]0-i white temples , hoar with age . [Tiresias of Pentheus]598-pentheus prophesied , “[0-i] Oh glad the day to [thee]1716-thee , if , light denied , thine eyes , most fortunate , should not behold the Bacchanalian rites ! The day will come , and soon the light will dawn , when [Bacchus , born of Semele]593-semele , shall make [his]1717-his advent known — all hail [the new god Bacchus]1718-the new god bacchus ! Either [thou]1719-thou must build [a temple to [this Deity]1721-this deity]1720-a temple to this deity , or shalt be torn asunder ; [thy]1719-thou remains , throughout [the forest scattered]1722-the forest scattered , will pollute [the wood]1723-the wood with sanguinary streams ; and [thy]1719-thou life - blood bespatter with corrupting blots [[thy]1719-thou frenzied mother]1724-thy frenzied mother and [[her]1724-thy frenzied mother sisters]1541-her sisters twain . And all shall come to pass , as [I]0-i have told , because [thou]1719-thou wilt not honour [the New God]1726-the new god . And [thou]1719-thou shalt wail and marvel at the sight of [blind Tiresias]598-pentheus , though veiled in night . ” And as [he]0-i spoke , lo , [Pentheus]598-pentheus drove [the seer]5687-the seer : but all [his]0-i words , prophetic , were fulfilled , and confirmation followed in [his]0-i steps . — [Bacchus]593-semele at once appears , and all [the fields]5475-the fields resound with shouts of [everybody there]5689-everybody there . — [men]1399-men , [brides]5691-brides and [matrons]5692-matrons , and a howling rout — [nobles]5693-nobles and [commons]5694-commons and [the most refined — a motley multitude]5695-the most refined — a motley multitude — resistless borne to join those rites of [Bacchus]593-semele , there begun . Then [Pentheus]598-pentheus cries ; “[598-pentheus] What madness , O [[ye]1727-your brave descendants of the Dragon]1728-ye brave descendants of the dragon ! [Sons of Mars]1729-sons of mars ! What frenzy has confounded [you]1727-your ? Can sounds of clanging brass prevail ; and pipes and horns , and magical delusions , drunkenness , and yelling [women]1730-women , and obscene displays , and hollow drums , overcome [you]1727-your , whom the sword , nor [troops of war]1731-troops of war , nor trumpet could affright ? “ How shall [I]1732-his wonder at [these ancient men , who , crossing boundless seas from [distant Tyre]98-tyre]5696-these ancient men , who , crossing boundless seas from distant tyre , hither transferred [[their]5696-these ancient men , who , crossing boundless seas from distant tyre exiled Household Gods]5697-their exiled household gods , and founded [a new Tyre]5698-a new tyre ; but now are shorn , and even as [captives]5699-captives would be led away without appeal to [Mars]565-mars ? And , [O young men]5700-o young men , of active prime whose vigor equals [mine]1732-his ! Cast down [your]1727-your ivy scepters ; take up arms ; put on [your]1727-your helmets ; strip [your]1727-your brows of leaves ; be mindful of the mighty stock [you]1727-your are , and let [your]1727-your souls be animated with the spirit of that dauntless dragon , which , unaided , slew so many , and at last died to defend [[his]1732-his fountain]5701-his fountain and [[his]1732-his lake]5702-his lake . — so [ye]1727-your may conquer in the hope of fame . “[1732-his] [He]1732-his gave [the brave]1733-the brave to death , but with [your]1734-your arms [ye]1734-your shall expel [the worthless]1735-the worthless , and enhance the glory of [[your]1734-your land]1736-your land . If Fate decree the fall of [Thebes]103-thebes , Oh , let the engines of war and [men]1399-men pull down its walls , and let the clash of steel and roaring flames resound . Thus , blameless in great misery , [our]1738-our woes would be the theme of lamentations , known to story ; and [our]1738-our tears would shame [us]1738-our not . “ But now [an unarmed boy]5703-an unarmed boy will conquer [Thebes]103-thebes : [a lad whom neither weapons , wars nor steeds delight ; whose ringlets reek with myrrh]5704-a lad whom neither weapons , wars nor steeds delight ; whose ringlets reek with myrrh ; adorned with chaplets , purple and embroidered robes of interwoven gold . Make way for [me]598-pentheus ! And [I]598-pentheus will soon compel [him]5703-an unarmed boy to confess [[his]5703-an unarmed boy father]1530-his father is assumed and all [his]5703-an unarmed boy rites are frauds . “[598-pentheus] If in days gone [Acrisius]604-acrisius so held [this vain god]1739-this vain god in deserved contempt , and shut the Argive gates against [his]604-acrisius face , why , therefore , should not [Pentheus]598-pentheus close the gates of [Thebes]103-thebes , with equal courage — Hence ! Away ! Fetch [the vile leader of [these rioters in chains]1741-these rioters in chains]1740-the vile leader of these rioters in chains ! Let not [my]0-i mandate be delayed . ” [Him]598-pentheus to restrain [[his]598-pentheus grandsire]5706-his grandsire , [Cadmus]561-cadmus , strove ; and [Athamas]605-athamas , and [many of [[his]598-pentheus trusted friends]5643-his trusted friends]5707-many of his trusted friends united in vain efforts to rebuke [his]598-pentheus reckless rage ; but greater violence was gained from every admonition . — [his]598-pentheus rage increased the more it was restrained , and injury resulted from [[his]598-pentheus friends]5709-his friends . So have [I]1742-they seen a stream in open course , run gently on its way with pleasant noise , but whensoever logs and rocks detained , it foamed , with violence increased , against obstruction . Presently returning came [[his]598-pentheus servants]5710-his servants stained with blood , to whom [he]598-pentheus said , “[1742-they] What have [ye]1742-they done with [Bacchus]593-semele ? ” And to [him]598-pentheus [they]1742-they made reply ; “[1742-they] Not [Bacchus]593-semele have [we]1742-they seen , but [we]1742-they have taken [[his]1743-his attendant lad]1744-his attendant lad , [the chosen servant of [his]1743-his sacred rites]1745-the chosen servant of his sacred rites . ” And [they]1742-they delivered to [the noble king]5711-the noble king , [a youth whose hands were lashed behind [his]5711-the noble king back]5712-a youth whose hands were lashed behind his back . Then [Pentheus]598-pentheus , terrible in anger , turned [his]0-i awful gaze upon [the lad]5180-the lad , and though [he]0-i scarce deferred [his]0-i doom , addressed [him]5180-the lad thus ; “[1745-the chosen servant of his sacred rites] Doomed to destruction , [thou]1746-thou art soon to give example to [[my]0-i people]1747-my people by [thy]1747-my people death : tell [me]0-i [thy]1747-my people name ; what are [[thy]1747-my people parents]1748-thy parents called ; where is [[thy]1747-my people land]1749-thy land ; and wherefore art [thou]1747-my people found [attendant on these Bacchanalian rites]1750-attendant on these bacchanalian rites . ” But fearless [he]0-i replied ; “[1747-my people] [They]1751-they call [my]0-i name [Acoetes]606-acoetes ; and [Maeonia]110-maeonia is [the land]1295-the land from whence [I]0-i came . [[My]0-i parents]1753-my parents were so poor , [[my]0-i father]1438-my father left [me]0-i neither fruitful fields , tilled by [the lusty ox]1755-the lusty ox , nor fleecy sheep , nor lowing kine ; for , [he]1438-my father [himself]1438-my father was poor , and with [his]1438-my father hook and line was wo nt to catch the leaping fishes , landed by [his]1438-my father rod . [His]1438-my father skill was all [his]1438-my father wealth . And when to [me]0-i [he]1438-my father gave [his]1438-my father trade , [he]1438-my father said , ‘ [You]0-i are [the heir of [my]0-i employment]1756-the heir of my employment , therefore unto [you]0-i all that is [mine]0-i [I]0-i give , ’ and , at [his]1438-my father death , [he]1438-my father left [me]0-i nothing but the running waves . — they are the sum of [my]0-i inheritance . “ And , afterwhile , that [I]0-i might not be bound forever to [[[my]0-i father]1438-my father 's rocky shores]5715-my father 's rocky shores , [I]0-i learned to steer the keel with dextrous hand ; and marked with watchful gaze the guiding stars ; the watery Constellation of the Goat , [Olenian]607-olenian , and the Bear , [the Hyades]608-the hyades , the Pleiades , [the houses of the winds]5716-the houses of the winds , and [every harbour suitable for [ships]5718-ships]5717-every harbour suitable for ships . “[0-i] So chanced it , as [I]0-i made for [Delos]111-delos , first [I]0-i veered close to [the shores of [Chios]112-chios]1757-the shores of chios : there [I]0-i steered , by plying on the starboard oar , and nimbly leaping gained [the sea - wet strand]1758-the sea - wet strand . “ Now when the night was past and lovely dawn appeared , [I]0-i , rose from slumber , and [I]0-i bade [[my]0-i men]5719-my men to fetch fresh water , and [I]0-i showed the pathway to [the stream]5090-the stream . Then did [I]0-i climb [a promontory]5721-a promontory 's height , to learn from there the promise of the winds ; which having done , [I]0-i called [the men]5722-the men and sought once more [[my]0-i ship]5723-my ship . [Opheltes]609-opheltes , first of [[my]0-i companions]5724-my companions , cried , ‘ Behold [we]5724-my companions come ! ’ And , thinking [he]609-opheltes had caught a worthy prize in [that unfruitful land]5725-that unfruitful land , [he]609-opheltes led [a boy , of virgin - beauty formed]5726-a boy , of virgin - beauty formed , across [the shore]5443-the shore . “[0-i] Heavy with wine and sleep [the lad]5180-the lad appeared to stagger on [his]5180-the lad way , — with difficulty moving . When [I]0-i saw the manner of [his]5180-the lad dress , [his]5180-the lad countenance and grace , [I]0-i knew it was not [mortal man]1760-mortal man , and being well assured , [I]0-i said to [them]1761-them ; ‘ What [Deity]610-deity abideth in that form [I]0-i can not say ; but ' tis [a god]4898-a god in truth . — O whosoever [thou]1763-thou art , vouchsafe to [us]1764-us propitious waters ; ease [our]1764-us toils , and grant to these [thy]1763-thou grace . ’ “ At this , [the one of [all [my]4898-a god mariners]5729-all my mariners who was the quickest hand , who ever was [the nimblest on the yards , and first to slip the ropes]5730-the nimblest on the yards , and first to slip the ropes , [Dictys]611-dictys]5728-the one of all my mariners who was the quickest hand , who ever was the nimblest on the yards , and first to slip the ropes , dictys exclaimed ; ‘ Pray not for [us]1764-us ! ’ and [all]5537-all approved [his]611-dictys words . [The golden haired]5732-the golden haired , [the guardian of the prow]5733-the guardian of the prow , [Melanthus]612-melanthus , [Libys]613-libys and [Alcimedon]614-alcimedon approved it ; and [Epopeus]615-epopeus who should urge the flagging spirits , and with rhythmic chants give time and measure to the beating oars , and [all the others]5734-all the others praised [[their]5734-all the others leader]5735-their leader 's words , — so blind is greed of gain . — Then [I]4898-a god rejoined , ‘ [Mine]4898-a god is the greatest share in [this good ship]5736-this good ship , which [I]4898-a god will not permit to be destroyed , nor injured by this sacred freight : ’ and [I]4898-a god opposed [them]1766-that impious crew as [they]1766-that impious crew came . “[4898-a god] Then [Lycabas]616-lycabas , [the most audacious of [that impious crew]1766-that impious crew]1765-the most audacious of that impious crew , began to rage . [He]616-lycabas was [a criminal , who , for a dreadful murder , had been sent in exile from [a Tuscan city]1768-a tuscan city 's gates]1767-a criminal , who , for a dreadful murder , had been sent in exile from a tuscan city 's gates . Whilst [I]0-i opposed [he]616-lycabas gripped [me]0-i by the throat , and shook [me]0-i as would cast [me]0-i in the deep , had [I]0-i not firmly held a rope , half stunned : and [all that wicked crew]1769-all that wicked crew approved the deed . “ Then [Bacchus]593-semele ( be assured it was [the God]5013-the god ) as though the noise disturbed [his]616-lycabas lethargy from wine , and reason had regained its power , at last bespake [the men]5722-the men , ‘ What deeds are these ? What noise assails [my]1769-all that wicked crew ears ? What means decoyed [my]1769-all that wicked crew wandering footsteps ? Whither do [ye]5722-the men lead ? ’ ‘ Fear not , ’ [the steersman]5739-the steersman said , ‘ but tell [us]5722-the men fair the haven of [your]0-i hope , and [you]0-i shall land whereso [your]0-i heart desires . ’ ‘ To [Naxos]115-naxos steer , ’ [Quoth Bacchus]617-bacchus , ‘ for it is indeed [[my]1769-all that wicked crew home]5740-my home , and there [the mariner]5741-the mariner finds welcome cheer . ’ [Him]617-bacchus to deceive , [they]1771-they pledged [themselves]1771-they , and swore by Gods of seas and skies to do [his]617-bacchus will : and [they]1771-they commanded [me]1769-all that wicked crew to steer that way . “[1769-all that wicked crew] [The Isle of [Naxos]115-naxos]114-the isle of naxos was upon [our]1770-our right ; and when [they]1771-they saw the sails were set that way , [they]1771-they all began to shout at once , ‘ What , ho ! [Thou]1772-thou madman ! what insanity is this , [Acoetes]606-acoetes ? Make [our]1770-our passage to the left . ’ And all the while [they]1771-they made [their]1771-they meaning known by artful signs or whispers in [my]0-i ears . “ [I]1771-they was amazed and answered , ‘ Take the helm . ’ And [I]1771-they refused to execute [their]1771-they will , atrocious , and at once resigned command . Then [all]5537-all began to murmur , and [the crew]5743-the crew reviled [me]1771-they . Up [Aethalion]618-aethalion jumped and said , ‘ As if [our]1770-our only safety is in [you]1771-they ! ’ With this [he]618-aethalion swaggered up and took command ; and leaving [Naxos]115-naxos steered for [other shores]5744-other shores . “[1771-they] Then [Bacchus]617-bacchus , mocking [them]1771-they , — as if but then [he]617-bacchus had discovered [their]1771-they deceitful ways , — looked on [the ocean]1288-the ocean from the rounded stern , and seemed to sob as [he]617-bacchus addressed [the men]5722-the men ; ‘ [Ah]1775-ah [mariners]1776-mariners , what [alien shores]1346-alien shores are these ? ' Tis not [the land [you]1776-mariners promised]1778-the land you promised nor [the port [my]0-i heart]1779-the port my heart desires . For what have [I]0-i deserved this cruel wrong ? What honour can accrue if [strong men]1780-strong men mock [a boy]5624-a boy ; [a lonely youth]1782-a lonely youth if many should deceive ? ’ And as [he]617-bacchus spoke , [I]0-i , also , wept to see [their]1771-they wickedness . “ [The impious gang]5745-the impious gang made merry at [our]1771-they tears , and lashed the billows with [their]5745-the impious gang quickening oars . By [Bacchus]617-bacchus do [I]0-i swear to [you]1776-mariners ( and naught celestial is more potent ) all the things [I]0-i tell [you]1776-mariners are as true as [they]1771-they surpass the limit of belief . [The ship]5746-the ship stood still as if [a dry dock]5747-a dry dock held it in [the sea]1298-the sea . — “[0-i] [The wondering sailors]1783-the wondering sailors laboured at the oars , and [they]1783-the wondering sailors unfurled the sails , in hopes to gain some headway , with redoubled energies ; but twisting ivy tangled in the oars , and interlacing held them by its weight . And [Bacchus]617-bacchus in the midst of all stood crowned with chaplets of grape - leaves , and shook a lance covered with twisted fronds of leafy vines . Around [him]617-bacchus crouched the visionary forms of tigers , lynxes , and the mottled shapes of panthers . “ Then [the mariners]5749-the mariners leaped out , possessed by fear or madness . [Medon]620-medon first began to turn a swarthy hue , and fins grew outward from [his]620-medon flattened trunk , and with a curving spine [his]620-medon body bent . — then [Lycabas]616-lycabas to [him]620-medon , ‘ What prodigy is this that [I]1784-they behold ? ’ Even as [he]620-medon spoke , [his]620-medon jaws were broadened and [his]620-medon nose was bent ; [his]620-medon hardened skin was covered with bright scales . And [Libys]613-libys , as [he]613-libys tried to pull the oars , could see [his]613-libys own hands shrivel into fins ; [another of [the crew]5743-the crew]5750-another of the crew began to grasp the twisted ropes , but even as [he]620-medon strove to lift [his]620-medon arms [they]1784-they fastened to [his]620-medon sides ; — with bending body and a crooked back [he]620-medon plunged into the waves , and as [he]620-medon swam displayed a tail , as crescent as the moon . “[1784-they] Now here , now there , [they]1784-they flounce about [the ship]5746-the ship ; [they]1784-they spray [her]5746-the ship decks with brine ; [they]1784-they rise and sink ; [they]1784-they rise again , and dive beneath the waves ; [they]1784-they seem in sportive dance upon the main ; out from [their]1784-they nostrils [they]1784-they spout sprays of brine ; [they]1784-they toss [their]1784-they supple sides . And [I]0-i alone , of [twenty mariners that manned [that ship]1787-that ship]1786-twenty mariners that manned that ship , remained . A cold chill seized [my]0-i limbs , — [I]0-i was so frightened ; but [the gracious God]1788-the gracious god now spake [me]0-i fair , ‘ Fear not and steer for [Naxos]115-naxos . ’ And when [we]1789-we landed [there]1500-there [I]0-i ministered on smoking altars Bacchanalian rites . ” But [Pentheus]598-pentheus answered [him]598-pentheus : “[0-i] A parlous tale , and [we]1789-we have listened to the dreary end , hoping [our]1789-we anger might consume its rage ; — away with [him]1791-his ! hence drag [him]1791-his , hurl [him]1791-his out , with dreadful torture , into Stygian night . ” Quickly [they]1789-we seized and dragged [Acoetes]606-acoetes forth , and cast [him]1791-his in [a dungeon triple - strong]5752-a dungeon triple - strong . And while [they]1789-we fixed the instruments of death , kindled the fires , and wrought the cruel irons , the legend says , though [no one]5311-no one aided [him]1791-his , the chains were loosened and slipped off [his]1791-his arms ; the doors flew open of their own accord . But [Pentheus]598-pentheus , long - persisting in [his]598-pentheus rage , not caring to command [[his]598-pentheus men]5488-his men to go , [himself]598-pentheus went forth to [Mount Cithaeron]53-mount cithaeron , where resound with singing and with shrilly note the votaries of [Bacchus]617-bacchus at [their]1789-we rites . As when with sounding brass the trumpeter alarms of war , [the mettled charger]5755-the mettled charger neighs and scents the battle ; so the clamored skies resounding with the dreadful outcries fret the wrath of [Pentheus]598-pentheus and [his]598-pentheus rage enflame . About the middle of [the mount]5756-the mount ( with groves around [its]5756-the mount margin ) was [a treeless plain , where nothing might conceal]5757-a treeless plain , where nothing might conceal . Here as [he]1791-his stood to view the sacred rites with impious eyes , [[his]1791-his mother]1520-his mother saw [him]1791-his first . [She]1520-his mother was so wrought with frenzy that [she]1520-his mother failed to know [[her]1520-his mother son]5619-her son , and cast [her]1520-his mother thyrsus that it wounded [him]1791-his ; and shouted , “[0-i] Hi ! come hither , Ho ! Come hither [[my]0-i two sisters]1792-my two sisters ! a great boar hath strayed into [[our]1793-our fields]1794-our fields ; come ! see [me]0-i strike and wound [him]1795-him ! ” As [he]1791-his fled from [them]1792-my two sisters in fright [the raging multitude]5760-the raging multitude rushed after [him]1791-his ; and , as [they]1792-my two sisters gathered round ; in cowardice [he]1791-his cried for mercy and condemned [himself]1791-his , confessing [he]1791-his had sinned against [a God]4898-a god . And as [they]1792-my two sisters wounded [him]1791-his [he]1791-his called [[his]1791-his aunt]5599-his aunt ; “[0-i] Autonoe have mercy ! Let the shade of sad Actaeon move [thee]1796-thee to relent ! ” No pity moved [her]5599-his aunt when [she]5599-his aunt heard that name ; in a wild frenzy [she]5599-his aunt forgot [[her]5599-his aunt son]5619-her son . While [Pentheus]598-pentheus was imploring [her]5599-his aunt , [she]5599-his aunt tore [his]1791-his right arm out ; [[her]5599-his aunt sister]1501-her sister [Ino]597-ino wrenched the other from [his]1791-his trunk . [He]1791-his could not stretch [his]1791-his arms out to [[his]1791-his mother]1520-his mother , but [he]1791-his cried , “[5115-mother] Behold [me]0-i , [mother]5115-mother ! ” When [Agave]621-agave saw , [his]1791-his bleeding limbs , torn , scattered on the ground , [she]621-agave howled , and tossed [her]621-agave head , and shook [her]621-agave hair that streamed upon the breeze ; and when [his]1791-his head was wrenched out from [his]1791-his mangled corpse , [she]621-agave clutched it with [her]621-agave blood - smeared fingers , while [she]621-agave shouted , “[5115-mother] Ho ! [companions]1798-companions ! victory ! The victory is [ours]1799-ours ! ” So when the wind strips from a lofty tree its leaves , which touched by autumn 's cold are loosely held , [they]5766-their fall not quicker than the wretch 's bleeding limbs were torn asunder by [their]5766-their cursed hands . Now , frightened by this terrible event , [the women of [Ismenus]523-ismenus]5767-the women of ismenus celebrate the new Bacchantian rites ; and [they]5767-the women of ismenus revere the sacred altars , heaped with frankincense . [Alcithoe]622-alcithoe , [daughter of [King Minyas]623-king minyas]5768-daughter of king minyas , consents not to the orgies of [the God]5013-the god ; denies that [Bacchus]617-bacchus is [the son of [Jove]456-jove]5370-the son of jove , and [[her]622-alcithoe two sisters]5771-her two sisters join [her]622-alcithoe in that crime . ' Twas festal - day when [matrons]5692-matrons and [[their]5692-matrons maids]5773-their maids , keeping it sacred , had forbade all toil . — And having draped [their]5766-their bosoms with wild skins , [they]5766-their loosed [their]5766-their long hair for the sacred wreaths , and took the leafy thyrsus in [their]5766-their hands ; — for so [the priest]5774-the priest commanded [them]5766-their . Austere the wrath of [Bacchus]617-bacchus if [his]617-bacchus power be scorned . [Mothers]5775-mothers and [youthful brides]5776-youthful brides obeyed [the priest]5774-the priest ; and putting by [their]5766-their wickers and [their]5766-their webs , dropt [their]5766-their unfinished toils to offer up frankincense to [the God]5013-the god ; invoking [him]5013-the god with many names : — “[1799-ours] O [Bacchus]617-bacchus ! [O Twice - born]1800-o twice - born ! [O Fire - begot]1801-o fire - begot ! [[Thou]1802-thou only child Twice - mothered]1803-thou only child twice - mothered ! God of [all those who plant the luscious grape]1804-all those who plant the luscious grape ! O Liber ! ” All these names and many more , for ages known — throughout [the lands of [Greece]117-greece]5779-the lands of greece . “[1802-thou] [[Thy]1802-thou youth]1805-thy youth is not consumed by wasting time ; and lo , [thou]1802-thou art [an ever - youthful boy , most beautiful of all the Gods of [Heaven]5-heaven]1806-an ever - youthful boy , most beautiful of all the gods of heaven , smooth as [a virgin]1462-a virgin when [thy]1802-thou horns are hid . — [The distant east]1808-the distant east to [[tawny India]118-india 's clime , where [rolls remotest Ganges]66-the ganges to [the sea]1298-the sea]1809-tawny india 's clime , where rolls remotest ganges to the sea , was conquered by [thy]1802-thou might . — O Most - revered ! [Thou]1802-thou didst destroy the doubting Pentheus , and hurled [the sailors]1811-the sailors ' bodies in the deep , and smote Lycurgus , wielder of the ax . “ And [thou]1802-thou dost guide [thy]1802-thou lynxes , double - yoked , with showy harness . — [Satyrs]1417-satyrs follow [thee]1802-thou ; and [Bacchanals]624-bacchanals , and [old Silenus]625-silenus , drunk , unsteady on [his]625-silenus staff ; jolting so rough on [his]625-silenus small back - bent ass ; and all the way resounds a youthful clamour ; and the screams of [women]1730-women ! and the noise of tambourines ! And the hollow cymbals ! and the boxwood flutes , — fitted with measured holes . — [Thou]1802-thou art implored by [all Ismenian women]5782-all ismenian women to appear peaceful and mild ; and [they]5782-all ismenian women perform [thy]1802-thou rites . ”[1802-thou] Only [the daughters of [King Minyas]623-king minyas]1812-the daughters of king minyas are carding wool within [their]1812-the daughters of king minyas fastened doors , or twisting with [their]1812-the daughters of king minyas thumbs the fleecy yarn , or working at the web . So [they]1812-the daughters of king minyas corrupt the sacred festival with needless toil , keeping [their]1812-the daughters of king minyas hand - maids busy at the work . And one of [them]1812-the daughters of king minyas , while drawing out the thread with nimble thumb , [anon]1813-anon began to speak ; “ While [others]4906-others loiter and frequent these rites fantastic , [we]5784-we the wards of [Pallas]694-pallas , much to be preferred , by speaking novel thoughts may lighten labour . Let [us]5784-we each in turn , relate to [an attentive audience]5785-an attentive audience , a novel tale ; and so the hours may glide . ”[1813-anon] it pleased [[her]1813-anon sisters]1541-her sisters , and [they]1541-her sisters ordered [her]1813-anon to tell the story that [she]1813-anon loved the most . So , as [she]1813-anon counted in [her]1813-anon well - stored mind the many tales [she]1813-anon knew , first doubted [she]1813-anon whether to tell the tale of Derceto , — that [Babylonian]626-babylonian , who , aver [the tribes of [Palestine]120-palestine]1815-the tribes of palestine , in limpid ponds yet lives , — [her]626-babylonian body changed , and scales upon [her]626-babylonian limbs ; or how [[her]1813-anon daughter]1816-her daughter , having taken wings , passed [her]1816-her daughter declining years in whitened towers . Or should [she]1813-anon tell of [Nais]627-nais , who with herbs , too potent , into fishes had transformed the bodies of [[her]627-nais lovers]1817-her lovers , till [she]627-nais met [herself]627-nais the same sad fate ; or of that tree which sometime bore white fruit , but now is changed and darkened by the blood that stained its roots . — Pleased with the novelty of this , at once [she]1813-anon tells the tale of [Pyramus]628-pyramus and [Thisbe]629-thisbe ; — and swiftly as [she]1813-anon told it unto [them]1818-their , the fleecy wool was twisted into threads . When [Pyramus]628-pyramus and [Thisbe]629-thisbe , who were known the one most handsome of [all youthful men]1819-all youthful men , [the other loveliest of [all eastern girls]1821-all eastern girls]1820-the other loveliest of all eastern girls , — lived in [adjoining houses]1822-adjoining houses , near the walls that [Queen Semiramis]630-queen semiramis had built of brick around [[her]630-queen semiramis famous city]1823-her famous city , [they]1818-their grew fond , and loved [each other]1824-each other — meeting often there — and as the days went by [their]1818-their love increased . [They]1818-their wished to join in marriage , but that joy [[their]1818-their fathers]1384-their fathers had forbidden [them]1818-their to hope ; and yet the passion that with equal strength inflamed [their]1818-their minds [no parents]1826-no parents could forbid . [No relatives]1827-no relatives had guessed [their]1818-their secret love , for all [their]1818-their converse was by nods and signs ; and as a smoldering fire may gather heat , the more ' tis smothered , so [their]1818-their love increased . Now , it so happened , a partition built between [[their]1818-their houses]1828-their houses , many years ago , was made defective with a little chink ; a small defect observed by [none]1829-none , although for ages there ; but what is hid from love ? [[Our]1830-we lovers]1831-our lovers found the secret opening , and used its passage to convey the sounds of gentle , murmured words , whose tuneful note passed oft in safety through that hidden way . There , many a time , [they]1818-their stood on either side , thisbe on one and [Pyramus]628-pyramus the other , and when [their]1818-their warm breath touched from lip to lip , [their]1818-their sighs were such as this : “ [Thou]5786-thou envious wall why art [thou]5786-thou standing in the way of [those who die for love]5787-those who die for love ? What harm could happen [thee]5786-thou shouldst [thou]5786-thou permit [us]1830-we to enjoy [our]1830-we love ? But if [we]1830-we ask too much , let [us]1830-we persuade that [thou]5786-thou wilt open while [we]1830-we kiss but once : for , [we]1830-we are not ungrateful ; unto [thee]5786-thou [we]1830-we own [our]1830-we debt ; here [thou]5786-thou hast left a way that breathed words may enter loving ears . , ”[1818-their] so vainly whispered [they]1818-their , and when the night began to darken [they]1818-their exchanged farewells ; made presence that [they]1818-their kissed a fond farewell vain kisses that to love might none avail . When dawn removed the glimmering lamps of night , and the bright sun had dried the dewy grass again [they]1818-their met where [they]1818-their had told [their]1818-their love ; and now complaining of [their]1818-their hapless fate , in murmurs gentle , [they]1818-their at last resolved , away to slip upon the quiet night , elude [[their]1818-their parents]1832-their parents , and , as soon as free , quit [the great builded city]1833-the great builded city and [[their]1818-their homes]1407-their homes . Fearful to wander in [the pathless fields]1835-the pathless fields , [they]1818-their chose [a trysting place]1836-a trysting place , [the tomb of [Ninus]631-ninus]1837-the tomb of ninus , where safely [they]1818-their might hide unseen , beneath the shadow of [a tall mulberry tree , covered with snow - white fruit , close by a spring]1838-a tall mulberry tree , covered with snow - white fruit , close by a spring . All is arranged according to [their]1818-their hopes : and now the daylight , seeming slowly moved , sinks in the deep waves , and the tardy night arises from the spot where day declines . Quickly , [the clever Thisbe]1839-the clever thisbe having first deceived [[her]1839-the clever thisbe parents]1840-her parents , opened the closed door . [She]1839-the clever thisbe flitted in the silent night away ; and , having veiled [her]1839-the clever thisbe face , reached [the great tomb]1841-the great tomb , and sat beneath the tree ; love made [her]1839-the clever thisbe bold . There , as [she]1839-the clever thisbe waited , a great lioness approached the nearby spring to quench [her]1839-the clever thisbe thirst : [her]1839-the clever thisbe frothing jaws incarnadined with blood of slaughtered oxen . As the moon was bright , [Thisbe]629-thisbe could see [her]1839-the clever thisbe , and affrighted fled with trembling footstep to [a gloomy cave]1842-a gloomy cave ; and as [she]1839-the clever thisbe ran [she]1839-the clever thisbe slipped and dropped [her]1839-the clever thisbe veil , which fluttered to the ground . [She]1839-the clever thisbe did not dare to save it . Wherefore , when the savage beast had taken a great draft and slaked [her]1839-the clever thisbe thirst , and thence had turned to seek [[her]1839-the clever thisbe forest lair]1843-her forest lair , [she]1839-the clever thisbe found it on [her]1839-the clever thisbe way , and full of rage , tore it and stained it with [her]1839-the clever thisbe bloody jaws : but [Thisbe]629-thisbe , fortunate , escaped unseen . Now [Pyramus]628-pyramus had not gone out so soon as [Thisbe]629-thisbe to the tryst ; and , when [he]1844-he saw the certain traces of that savage beast , imprinted in the yielding dust , [his]1844-he face went white with fear ; but when [he]1844-he found the veil covered with blood , [he]1844-he cried ; “ Alas , one night has caused the ruin of [two lovers]5788-two lovers ! [Thou]5789-thee wert most deserving of completed days , but as for [me]1844-he , [my]1844-he heart is guilty ! [I]1844-he destroyed [thee]5789-thee ! O [my]1844-he love ! [I]1844-he bade [thee]5789-thee come out in the dark night to a lonely haunt , and failed to go before . Oh ! whatever lurks beneath [this rock]5790-this rock , though ravenous lion , tear [my]1844-he guilty flesh , and with most cruel jaws devour [my]1844-he cursed entrails ! What ? Not so ; it is a craven 's part to wish for death ! ”[1844-he] So [he]1844-he stopped briefly ; and took up the veil ; went straightway to the shadow of the tree ; and as [his]1844-he tears bedewed the well - known veil , [he]1844-he kissed it oft and sighing said , “ Kisses and tears are thine , receive [my]1844-he blood as well . ”[1844-he] And [he]1844-he imbrued the steel , girt at [his]1844-he side , deep in [his]1844-he bowels ; and plucked it from the wound , a - faint with death . As [he]1844-he fell back to earth , [his]1844-he spurting blood shot upward in the air ; so , when decay has rift a leaden pipe a hissing jet of water spurts on high . — By that dark tide the berries on the tree assumed a deeper tint , for as the roots soaked up the blood the pendent mulberries were dyed a purple tint . [Thisbe]629-thisbe returned , though trembling still with fright , for now [she]629-thisbe thought [[her]629-thisbe lover]1845-her lover must await [her]629-thisbe at the tree , and [she]629-thisbe should haste before [he]1845-her lover feared for [her]629-thisbe . Longing to tell [him]1845-her lover of [her]629-thisbe great escape [she]629-thisbe sadly looked for [him]1845-her lover with faithful eyes ; but when [she]629-thisbe saw the spot and the changed tree , [she]629-thisbe doubted could they be the same , for so the colour of the hanging fruit deceived . While doubt dismayed [her]629-thisbe , on the ground [she]629-thisbe saw the wounded body covered with its blood ; — [she]629-thisbe started backward , and [her]629-thisbe face grew pale and ashen ; and [she]629-thisbe shuddered like the sea , which trembles when its face is lightly skimmed by the chill breezes ; — and [she]629-thisbe paused a space ; — but when [she]629-thisbe knew it was [the one [she]629-thisbe loved]1846-the one she loved , [she]629-thisbe struck [her]629-thisbe tender breast and tore [her]629-thisbe hair . Then wreathing in [her]629-thisbe arms [his]1845-her lover loved form , [she]629-thisbe bathed the wound with tears , mingling [her]629-thisbe grief in [his]1845-her lover unquenched blood ; and as [she]629-thisbe kissed [his]1845-her lover death - cold features wailed ; “ Ah [Pyramus]628-pyramus , what cruel fate has taken [thy]628-pyramus life away ? [Pyramus]628-pyramus ! [Pyramus]628-pyramus ! awake ! awake ! It is [thy]628-pyramus dearest Thisbe calls [thee]628-pyramus ! Lift [thy]628-pyramus drooping head ! Alas , ”[629-thisbe] — At [Thisbe]629-thisbe 's name [he]1845-her lover raised [his]1845-her lover eyes , though languorous in death , and darkness gathered round [him]1845-her lover as [he]1845-her lover gazed . And then [she]629-thisbe saw [her]629-thisbe veil ; and near it lay [his]1845-her lover ivory sheath — but not the trusty sword and once again [she]629-thisbe wailed ; “ [Thy]628-pyramus own right hand , and [thy]628-pyramus great passion have destroyed [thee]1845-her lover ! — And [I]629-thisbe ? [my]629-thisbe hand shall be as bold as thine — [my]629-thisbe love shall nerve [me]629-thisbe to the fatal deed — [thee]628-pyramus , [I]629-thisbe will follow to eternity — though [I]629-thisbe be censured for the wretched cause , so surely [I]629-thisbe shall share [thy]628-pyramus wretched fate : — alas , whom death could [me]629-thisbe alone bereave , [thou]628-pyramus shalt not from [my]629-thisbe love be reft by death ! And , O [[ye]628-pyramus wretched parents]5791-ye wretched parents , [mine]629-thisbe and [his]1845-her lover , let [our]1849-our misfortunes and [our]1849-our pleadings melt [your]628-pyramus hearts , that [ye]628-pyramus no more deny to [those whom constant love and lasting death]5792-those whom constant love and lasting death unite — entomb [us]1849-our in a single sepulchre . “[629-thisbe] And , O [thou]1847-thou tree of many - branching boughs , spreading dark shadows on the corpse of [one , destined to cover twain]1848-one , destined to cover twain , take [thou]1847-thou [our]1849-our fate upon [thy]1847-thou head ; mourn [our]1849-our untimely deaths ; let [thy]1847-thou fruit darken for a memory , an emblem of [our]1849-our blood . ” No more [she]629-thisbe said ; and having fixed the point below [her]629-thisbe breast , [she]629-thisbe fell on the keen sword , still warm with [his]1845-her lover red blood . But though [her]629-thisbe death was out of [Nature]570-nature 's law [her]629-thisbe prayer was answered , for it moved [the Gods]1395-the gods and moved [[their]5794-their parents]1832-their parents . Now [the Gods]1395-the gods have changed the ripened fruit which darkens on the branch : and from the funeral pile [[their]5794-their parents]1832-their parents sealed [their]5794-their gathered ashes in a single urn . So ended [she]629-thisbe ; at once [Leuconoe]632-leuconoe took [the narrator]5798-the narrator 's thread ; and as [she]632-leuconoe spoke [[her]632-leuconoe sisters]1541-her sisters all were silent . “[39-the sun] Even the Sun that rules [the world]1360-the world was captive made of Love . ' Tis said [the Lord of Day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire]1851-the lord of day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire , witnessed the loves of [Mars]565-mars and [Venus]996-venus . Grieved to know the wrong , [he]1851-the lord of day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire called [the son of [Juno]488-juno]1852-the son of juno , [Vulcan]511-vulcan , and gave full knowledge of the deed , showing how [Mars]565-mars and [Venus]996-venus shamed [his]1851-the lord of day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire love , as [they]1853-they defiled [his]1851-the lord of day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire bed . [Vulcan]511-vulcan amazed , — the nimble - thoughted [Vulcan]511-vulcan lost [his]511-vulcan wits , so that [he]511-vulcan dropped the work [his]511-vulcan right hand held . But turning from all else at once [he]1851-the lord of day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire set to file out chains of brass , delicate , fine , from which to fashion nets invisible , filmy of mesh and airy as the thread of insect - web , that from the rafter swings . — [Implicit]634-implicit woven that [they]1853-they yielded soft the slightest movement or the gentlest touch , with cunning skill [he]1851-the lord of day , whose wakeful eye beholds at once whatever may transpire drew [them]1853-they round the bed where [they]1853-they were sure to dally . Presently appeared [the faithless wife]1854-the faithless wife , and on the couch lay down to languish with [[her]1854-the faithless wife paramour]1855-her paramour . — Meshed in the chains [they]1853-they could not thence arise , nor could [they]1853-they else but lie in strict embrace , — cunningly thus entrapped by [Vulcan]511-vulcan 's wit . — At once [the Lemnian cuckold]1856-the lemnian cuckold opened wide the folding ivory doors and called [the Gods]1395-the gods , — to witness . There [they]1853-they lay disgraced and bound . [I]0-i wot were [many of the lighter Gods who wished [themselves]1858-many of the lighter gods who wished themselves in like disgraceful bonds in like disgraceful bonds]1858-many of the lighter gods who wished themselves in like disgraceful bonds . — [The Gods]1395-the gods were moved to laughter : and the tale was long most noted in [the courts of [Heaven]5-heaven]1860-the courts of heaven . Son of [Hyperion]121-hyperion ! what avails [thy]1861-thy light ? What is the profit of [thy]1861-thy glowing heat ? Lo , [thou]1861-thy whose flames have parched [innumerous lands]1862-innumerous lands , [thyself]1863-thyself art burning with another flame ! And [thou]1861-thy whose orb should joy [the universe]1323-the universe art gazing only on [Leucothea]635-leucothea 's charms . [Thy]1861-thy glorious eye on [one fair maid]1865-one fair maid is fixed , forgetting all besides . Too early [thou]1861-thy art rising from [[thy]1861-thy bed of [orient skies]1867-orient skies]1866-thy bed of orient skies , too late [thy]1861-thy setting in [the western waves]1868-the western waves ; so taking time to gaze upon [thy]1861-thy love , [thy]1861-thy frenzy lengthens out the wintry hour ! And often [thou]1861-thy art darkened in eclipse , dark shadows of this trouble in [thy]1861-thy mind , unwonted aspect , casting [man]1330-man perplexed in abject terror . Pale [thou]1861-thy art , though not betwixt [thee]1861-thy and [the earth]1289-the earth the shadowous moon bedims [thy]1861-thy devious way . [Thy]1861-thy passion gives to grief [thy]1861-thy countenance — for [her]635-leucothea [thy]1861-thy heart alone is grieving — [Clymene]502-clymene and [Rhodos]636-rhodos , and [Persa]637-persa , [mother of deluding Circe]1871-mother of deluding circe , are all forgotten for [thy]1861-thy doting hope ; even [Clytie]638-clytie , who is yearning for [thy]1861-thy love , no more can charm [thee]1861-thy ; [thou]1861-thy art so foredone . [Leucothea]635-leucothea is the cause of many tears , [Leucothea]635-leucothea , [daughter of [Eurynome]639-eurynome]1872-daughter of eurynome , [most beauteous matron of [Arabia]122-arabia 's strand , where spicey odours blow . [The dark - night pastures of [Apollo]549-phoebus 's steeds]1877-the dark - night pastures of apollo 's steeds are hid below [the western skies]1878-the western skies ; when there , and spent with toil , in lieu of nibbling herbs [they]1879-they take ambrosial food : it gives [their]1879-they limbs restoring strength and nourishes anew . [Thou]5805-thou art to [me]5013-the god the glory of [the earth]1289-the earth ! ”[5013-the god] Filled with alarm , from [her]635-leucothea relaxed fingers [she]635-leucothea let fall the distaff and the spindle , but , [her]635-leucothea fear so lovely in [her]635-leucothea beauty seemed , [the God]5013-the god no longer brooked delay : [he]5013-the god changed [his]5013-the god form back to [his]5013-the god wonted beauty and resumed [his]5013-the god bright celestial . Startled at the sight [the maid]1503-the maid recoiled a space ; but presently the glory of [the god]5013-the god inspired [her]1503-the maid love ; and all [her]1503-the maid timid doubts dissolved away ; without complaint [she]1503-the maid melted in [his]5013-the god arms . So ardently [the bright Apollo]1891-the bright apollo loved , that [Clytie]638-clytie , envious of [Leucothea]635-leucothea 's joy , where evil none was known , a scandal made ; and having published wide [their]1892-their secret love , [[leucothea]635-leucothea 's father]1876-leucothea 's father also heard the tale . Relentlessly and fierce , [his]5013-the god cruel hand buried [[his]5013-the god living daughter]1894-his living daughter in the ground , who , while [her]1894-his living daughter arms implored the glowing Sun , complained . “ For love of [thee]1894-his living daughter [my]5013-the god life is lost . ”[5013-the god] And as [she]1894-his living daughter wailed [[her]1894-his living daughter father]5022-her father sowed [her]1894-his living daughter there . [[Hyperion]121-hyperion 's Son]1896-hyperion 's son began with piercing heat to scatter the loose sand , a way to open , that [she]1894-his living daughter might look with beauteous features forth too late ! for smothered by [the compact earth]1897-the compact earth , [thou]1898-thou canst not lift [thy]1898-thou drooping head ; alas ! A lifeless corse remains . No sadder sight since [Phaethon]501-phaethon was blasted by the bolt , down - hurled by [Jove]456-jove , had ever grieved [the God who daily drives [his]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds winged steeds]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds . In vain [he]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds strives with all the magic of [his]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds rays to warm [her]1894-his living daughter limbs anew . — The deed is done — what vantage gives [his]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds might if fate deny ? [He]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds sprinkles fragrant nectar on [her]1894-his living daughter grave , and lifeless corse , and as [he]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds wails exclaims , “ But naught shall hinder [you]1894-his living daughter to reach [the skies]1340-the skies . ”[1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds] At once [the maiden]5425-the maiden 's body , steeped in dews of nectar , sweet and odourate , dissolves and adds its fragrant juices to the earth : slowly from this a sprout of Frankincense takes root in riched soil , and bursting through [the sandy hillock]1901-the sandy hillock shows [its]1901-the sandy hillock top . No more to [Clytie]638-clytie comes [the author of sweet light]1902-the author of sweet light , for though [her]1894-his living daughter love might make excuse of grief , and grief may plead to pardon jealous words , [his]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds heart disdains the schemist of [his]1899-the god who daily drives his winged steeds woe ; and [she]1894-his living daughter [who turned to sour the sweet of love , from that unhallowed moment pined away]1903-who turned to sour the sweet of love , from that unhallowed moment pined away . Envious and hating all [[her]1894-his living daughter sister]1501-her sister Nymphs , day after day , — and through the lonely nights , all unprotected from the chilly breeze , [her]1894-his living daughter hair dishevelled , tangled , unadorned , [she]1894-his living daughter sat unmoved upon the bare hard ground . Nine days [the Nymph]5012-the nymph was nourished by the dews , or haply by [her]5012-the nymph own tears ' bitter brine ; — all other nourishment was naught to [her]5012-the nymph . — [She]1894-his living daughter never raised [herself]1894-his living daughter from the bare ground , though on [the god]5013-the god [her]1894-his living daughter gaze was ever fixed ; — [she]1894-his living daughter turned [her]1894-his living daughter features towards [him]5013-the god as [he]5013-the god moved : [they]1907-they say that afterwhile [her]1894-his living daughter limbs took root and fastened to the around . A pearly white overspread [her]1894-his living daughter countenance , that turned as pale and bloodless as the dead ; but here and there a blushing tinge resolved in violet tint ; and something like the blossom of that name a flower concealed [her]1894-his living daughter face . Although a root now holds [her]1894-his living daughter fast to [earth]1287-earth , [the Heliotrope]1909-the heliotrope turns ever to the Sun , as if to prove that all may change and love through all remain . Thus was the story ended . [All]5537-all were charmed to hear recounted such mysterious deeds . While [some]4905-some were doubting whether such were true others affirmed that to [the living Gods]1912-the living gods is nothing to restrain [their]1912-the living gods wondrous works , though surely of [the Gods]1395-the gods , immortal , none accorded [Bacchus]617-bacchus even thought or place . When [all]5537-all had made an end of argument , [they]1907-they bade [Alcithoe]622-alcithoe take up the word : [she]622-alcithoe , busily working on the pendent web , still shot [the shuttle]1915-the shuttle through the warp and said ; “ The amours of [the shepherd Daphnis]5808-the shepherd daphnis , known to many of [you]5809-you , [I]622-alcithoe shall not relate ; [the shepherd Daphnis of [Mount Ida]123-mount ida , who was turned to stone obdurate , for the Nymph whose love [he]5808-the shepherd daphnis slighted]602-ida — so the rivalry of love neglected rouses to revenge : neither shall [I]622-alcithoe relate the story told of [Scython]645-scython , double - sexed , who first was [man]1330-man , then altered to [a woman]5609-a woman : so [I]622-alcithoe pass the tale of [Celmus]646-celmus turned to adamant , who reared [almighty Jove from tender youth]5812-almighty jove from tender youth : so , likewise [the Curetes whom the rain brought forth to life]5813-the curetes whom the rain brought forth to life : [Smilax]647-smilax and [Crocus]648-crocus , too , transpeciated into little flowers : all these [I]622-alcithoe pass to tell a novel tale , which haply may resolve in pleasant thoughts . Learn how the fountain , [Salmacis]649-salmacis , became so infamous ; learn how it enervates and softens the limbs of those who chance to bathe . Although the fountain 's properties are known , the cause is yet unknown . [The Naiads]650-the naiads nursed [an infant son of [Hermes]651-hermes]5814-an infant son of hermes , surely [his]5814-an infant son of hermes of [Aphrodite]652-aphrodite gotten in [the caves of [Ida]602-ida]5815-the caves of ida , for [the child]5602-the child resembled both [the god]5013-the god and [goddess]1607-goddess , and [his]5602-the child name was [theirs]650-the naiads . The years passed by , and when [the boy]5600-the boy had reached the limit of three lustrums , [he]5600-the boy forsook [[his]5600-the boy native mountains]5820-his native mountains ; for [he]5600-the boy loved to roam through [unimagined places]5821-unimagined places , by [the banks of undiscovered rivers]5822-the banks of undiscovered rivers ; and the joy of finding wonders made [his]5600-the boy labour light . Leaving [Mount Ida]123-mount ida , where [his]5600-the boy youth was spent , [he]5600-the boy reached [the land of Lycia]5823-the land of lycia , and from thence [the verge of [Caria]125-caria]5824-the verge of caria , where [a pretty pool of soft translucent water may be seen]5825-a pretty pool of soft translucent water may be seen , so clear the glistening bottom glads the eye : no barren sedge , no fenny reeds annoy , no rushes with their sharpened arrow - points , but all around the edges of that pool the softest grass engirdles with its green . [A Nymph dwells there , unsuited to the chase , unskilled to bend the bow , slothful of foot]5826-a nymph dwells there , unsuited to the chase , unskilled to bend the bow , slothful of foot , the only Naiad in [the world]1360-the world unknown to rapid - running [Dian]653-dian . Whensoever [[her]649-salmacis Naiad sisters]5828-her naiad sisters pled in winged words , “[622-alcithoe] Take up the javelin , [sister Salmacis]649-salmacis , take up the painted quiver and unite [your]649-salmacis leisure with the action of the chase ; ” [she]649-salmacis only scorned the javelin and the quiver , nor joined [her]649-salmacis leisure to the active chase . Rather [she]649-salmacis bathes [her]649-salmacis smooth and shapely limbs ; or combs [her]649-salmacis tresses with a boxwood comb , [Citorian]5829-citorian ; or looking in the pool consults the glassed waters of effects increasing beauty ; or [she]649-salmacis decks [herself]649-salmacis in gauzy raiment , and reposing lolls on cushioned leaves , or grass - enverdured beds ; or gathers posies from the spangled lawns . Now , haply as [she]649-salmacis culled the sweetest flowers [she]649-salmacis saw [the youth]1554-the youth , and longing in [her]649-salmacis heart made havoc as [her]649-salmacis greedy eyes beheld . Although [her]649-salmacis love could scarcely brook delay , [she]649-salmacis waited to enhance [her]649-salmacis loveliness , in beauty hoping to allure [his]1554-the youth love .
