[Medea]835-medea worked on [Aegeus]855-aegeus to present [[his]855-aegeus own son]1377-his own son , [Theseus]856-theseus , with a deadly cup of aconite ; prevailing by [her]835-medea art so that [he]855-aegeus deemed [[his]855-aegeus son]5099-his son an enemy . [Theseus]856-theseus unwittingly received the cup , but just before [he]856-theseus touched it to [his]856-theseus lips , [[his]856-theseus father]1530-his father recognized the sword [he]1530-his father wore , for , graven on its ivory hilt was wrought a known device — the token of [[his]1530-his father race]6670-his race . Astonished , [Aegeus]855-aegeus struck the poison - cup from [[his]855-aegeus devoted son]6671-his devoted son 's confiding lips . [Medea]835-medea suddenly escaped from death , in a dark whirlwind [her]835-medea witch - singing raised . Recoiling from such utter wickedness , rejoicing that [[his]855-aegeus son]5099-his son escaped from death , [the grateful father]6673-the grateful father kindled altar - fires , and gave rich treasure to [the living Gods]1912-the living gods . — [He]6673-the grateful father slaughtered scores of oxen , decked with flowers and gilded horns . The sun has never shone upon a day more famous in [that land]5048-that land , for all [the elders]6676-the elders and [the common folk]6677-the common folk united in festivities , — with wine inspiring wit and song ; — “[2540-you] O [you]2541-you , ” [they]6678-they sang , “[2541-you] Immortal Theseus , victory was [yours]2541-you ! Did [you]2541-you not slaughter the huge bull of [Crete]100-crete ? “ Yes , [you]2541-you did slay the boar of [Cromyon]221-cromyon — where now [the peasant unmolested plows]6679-the peasant unmolested plows ; “[2541-you] And Periphetes , wielder of the club , was worsted when [he]2542-he struggled with [your]2541-you strength ; “ And fierce Procrustes , matched with [you]2541-you beside [the rapid river]6680-the rapid river , met [his]222-cercyon death ; “[2542-he] And even [Cercyon]222-cercyon , in [Eleusis]858-eleusis lost [his]222-cercyon wicked life — inferior to [your]2541-you might ; “ And [Sinis]859-sinis , [a monstrosity of strength , who bent the trunks of trees]6681-a monstrosity of strength , who bent the trunks of trees , and used [his]222-cercyon might “[222-cercyon] Against [the world]1360-the world for everything that 's wrong . For evil , [he]222-cercyon would force down to [the earth]1289-the earth , “ Pine tops to shoot [men]1399-men 's bodies through the air . Even [the road]6683-the road to [Megara]223-megara is safe , “[222-cercyon] For [you]2541-you did hurl [the robber Scyron]2545-the robber scyron , — sheer — over [the cliff]2546-the cliff . Both land and [sea]1296-sea denied “ [His]2545-the robber scyron bones a resting place — as tossed about they changed into the cliffs that bear [his]2545-the robber scyron name . “[222-cercyon] How can [we]2548-we tell the number of [your]2541-you deeds , — deeds glorious , that now exceed [your]2541-you years ! “ For [you]2541-you , [brave hero]6684-brave hero , [we]2548-we give public thanks and prayers ; to [you]2541-you [we]2548-we drain [our]2548-we cups of wine ! ”[222-cercyon] And all [the palace]2549-the palace rings with happy songs , and with the grateful prayers of [all the people]2550-all the people . And sorrow in [that city]5869-that city is not known . — But pleasure always is alloyed with grief , and sorrow mingles in the joyous hour . While [the king Aegeus]2552-the king aegeus and [[his]2552-the king aegeus son]5099-his son rejoiced , [Minos]860-minos prepared for war . [He]860-minos was invincible in [men]1399-men and [ships]5718-ships — and stronger in [his]860-minos rage to wreak due vengeance on [the king who slew [[his]2552-the king aegeus son [Androgeus]861-androgeus]2557-his son androgeus]2556-the king who slew his son androgeus . But first [he]860-minos sought [some friends]2558-some friends to aid [his]860-minos warfare ; and [he]860-minos scoured [the sea]1298-the sea with [a swift fleet]2560-a swift fleet — which was [his]860-minos strength . [Anaphe]862-anaphe and [Astypalaea]224-astypalaea , both agreed to join [his]860-minos cause — [the first one]2561-the first one moved by promises , [the second]2562-the second by [his]860-minos threats . [Level Myconus]225-level myconus and [the chalky fields of [Cimolus]226-cimolus]2563-the chalky fields of cimolus agreed to aid , and [Syros]227-syros covered with wild thyme , level [Seriphos]228-seriphos , Paros of [marble cliffs]2564-marble cliffs , and [that place which [Arne the impious Siphnian]863-arne the impious siphnian had betrayed , who having got the gold which in [her]863-arne the impious siphnian greed [she]863-arne the impious siphnian had demanded]2565-that place which arne the impious siphnian had betrayed , who having got the gold which in her greed she had demanded , was changed to a bird which ever since that day imagines gold its chief delight — a black - foot black - winged daw . But [Oliarus]864-oliarus , [Didymae]229-didymae , and [Tenos]230-tenos , [Gyaros]231-gyaros , [Andros]232-andros , and [Peparethos]233-peparethos rich in its glossy olives , gave no aid to the strong Cretan fleet . Sailing from [them]2566-them [Minos]860-minos went to [Oenopia]234-oenopia , [known realm of [the Aeacidae]235-the aeacidae]2567-known realm of the aeacidae . — [Men of old time]2568-men of old time had called [the place Oenopia]2569-the place oenopia ; but [Aeacus]865-aeacus styled [it]2569-the place oenopia [Aegina]788-aegina from [[his]865-aeacus mother]1520-his mother 's name . At [his]860-minos approach [an eager rabble]2571-an eager rabble rushed resolved to see and know so great [a man]5610-a man . [Telamon]866-telamon met [him]860-minos , and [[his]866-telamon brother]2004-his brother , younger than [Telamon]866-telamon , and [Phocus]867-phocus who was third in age . Even [Aeacus]865-aeacus appeared , slow with the weight of years , and asked [him]865-aeacus what could be a reason for [his]865-aeacus coming [there]1500-there . [The ruler of [a hundred cities]2576-a hundred cities]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities , sighed , as [he]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities beheld [the sons of [Aeacus]865-aeacus]2577-the sons of aeacus , for [they]2577-the sons of aeacus reminded [him]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities of [[his]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities lost son]2578-his lost son ; — and heavy with [his]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities sorrow , [he]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities replied : “ [I]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities come imploring [you]2577-the sons of aeacus to take up arms , and aid [me]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities in the war against [[my]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities foes]6685-my foes ; for [I]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities must give that comfort to the shade of [[my]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities misfortuned son]6686-my misfortuned son — whose blood [they]2577-the sons of aeacus shed . ”[2575-the ruler of a hundred cities] But [Aeacus]865-aeacus replied to [Minos]860-minos , “ Nay , it is a vain request [you]860-minos make , for [we]2580-their are bound in strict alliance to [the land and people of [Cecropia]237-cecropia]6687-the land and people of cecropia . ”[865-aeacus] Full of rage , because [he]2575-the ruler of a hundred cities was denied , [the king of [Crete]100-crete]2579-the king of crete , [Minos]860-minos , as [he]860-minos departed from [[their]2580-their shores]2581-their shores replied , “ Let such a treaty be [your]860-minos bane . ”[860-minos] And [he]860-minos departed with [his]860-minos crafty threat , believing it expedient not to waste [his]860-minos power in wars until the proper time . Before [the ships of [Crete]100-crete]2582-the ships of crete had disappeared , before the mist and blue of waves concealed [their]2582-the ships of crete fading outlines from [the anxious throng which gathered on [Oenopian shores]2584-oenopian shores]2583-the anxious throng which gathered on oenopian shores , [a ship of [Athens]95-athens]2585-a ship of athens covered with wide sails appeared , and anchored safely by [[their]2580-their friendly shore]2586-their friendly shore ; and , presently , [the mighty Cephalus , well known through all [that nation]2588-that nation for [his]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people deeds , addressed [them]2580-their as [he]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people landed , and declared the good will of [[his]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people people]4897-his people]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people . [Him]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people [the sons of [Aeacus]865-aeacus]2577-the sons of aeacus remembered well , although [they]2577-the sons of aeacus had not seen [him]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people for some untold years . [They]2577-the sons of aeacus led [him]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people to [[[their]2577-the sons of aeacus father]2081-their father 's welcome home]2592-their father 's welcome home ; and with [him]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people , also , [[his]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people two comrades]2593-his two comrades went , [Clytus]705-clytus and [Butes]868-butes . [Center of all eyes]2594-center of all eyes , [the hero]5496-the hero still retained [his]5496-the hero charm , the customary greetings were exchanged , [the graceful hero]2596-the graceful hero , bearing in [his]2596-the graceful hero hands a branch of olive from [[his]2596-the graceful hero native soil]2597-his native soil , delivered the Athenian message , which requested aid and offered for [their]2598-their thought the treaty and the ancestral league between [[their]2598-their nations]2599-their nations . And [he]2596-the graceful hero added , [Minos]860-minos sought not only conquest of [the Athenian state]2600-the athenian state but sovereignty of [all the states of [Greece]117-greece]2601-all the states of greece . And when this eloquence had shown [his]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people cause ; with left hand on [his]2587-the mighty cephalus , well known through all that nation for his deeds , addressed them as he landed , and declared the good will of his people gleaming sceptre 's hilt , [King Aeacus]865-aeacus exclaimed : “ Ask not [our]2598-their aid , but take it , [Athens]95-athens ; and count boldly [yours]95-athens all of the force [this island]6688-this island holds , and all things which the state of [my]865-aeacus affairs supplies . [My]865-aeacus strength for this war is not light , and [I]865-aeacus have many soldiers for [myself]865-aeacus and for [[my]865-aeacus enemy]5319-my enemy . Thanks to [the Gods]1395-the gods ! the times are happy , giving no excuse for [my]865-aeacus refusal . ”[865-aeacus] “ May it prove so , ”[826-cephalus] [Cephalus]826-cephalus replied , “ and may [[your]95-athens city]6691-your city multiply in [men]1399-men : just now as [I]826-cephalus was landing , [I]826-cephalus rejoiced to meet [youths]6693-youths , fair and matched in age . And yet [I]826-cephalus miss among [them]6693-youths many whom [I]826-cephalus saw before when last [I]826-cephalus visited [[your]95-athens city]6691-your city . ”[826-cephalus] [Aeacus]865-aeacus then groaned and with sad voice replied : “ With weeping [we]6695-we began , but better fortune followed . Would that [I]865-aeacus could tell the last of it , and not the first ! Giving [my]865-aeacus heart command that simple words and briefly spoken may not long detain . [Those happy youths who waited at [your]95-athens need , who smiled upon [you]95-athens and for whom [you]95-athens ask , because [their]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind absence grieves [your]95-athens noble mind]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind , [they]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind 've perished ! and [their]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind bleaching bones or scattered ashes , only may remain , sad remnants , impotent , of vanished power , so recently [my]865-aeacus hope and [my]865-aeacus resource . “[865-aeacus] Because [this island]6688-this island bears [a rival]5081-a rival 's name , a deadly pestilence was visited on [[my]0-i confiding people]2604-my confiding people , through the rage of jealous Juno flaming for revenge . This great calamity at first appeared a natural disease — but soon its power baffled [our]2605-our utmost efforts . [Medicines]870-medicines availing not , a reign of terror swept from [shore]4969-shore to [shore]4969-shore and fearful havoc raged . “ Thick darkness , gathered from descending skies , enveloped [[our]2605-our devoted land]6697-our devoted land with heat and languid sickness , for the space of full four moons . — Four times the Moon increased [her]6698-her size . Hot south winds blew with pestilential breath upon [us]2605-our . At the same time the diseased infection reached [our]2605-our needed springs and pools , thousands of serpents crawling over [[our]2605-our deserted fields]6699-our deserted fields , defiled [our]2605-our rivers with [their]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind poison . The swift power of the disease at first was limited to death of dogs and birds and cattle , or among wild beasts . [The luckless plowman]6700-the luckless plowman marvels when [he]6700-the luckless plowman sees [his]6700-the luckless plowman strong bulls fall while at [their]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind task and sink down in the furrow . Woolly flocks bleat feebly while [their]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind wool falls off without a cause , and while [their]6696-those happy youths who waited at your need , who smiled upon you and for whom you ask , because their absence grieves your noble mind bodies pine away . [The prized horse of high courage , and of great renown when on the race - course]6701-the prized horse of high courage , and of great renown when on the race - course , has now lost victorious spirit , and forgetting [his]6701-the prized horse of high courage , and of great renown when on the race - course remembered glory groans in [his]6701-the prized horse of high courage , and of great renown when on the race - course shut stall , doomed for inglorious death . [The boar]6702-the boar forgets to rage , the stag to trust [his]6701-the prized horse of high courage , and of great renown when on the race - course speed ; and even the famished bear to fight the stronger herd . “[870-medicines] Death seizes on the vitals of all life ; and in [the woods]1317-the woods , and in [the fields]5475-the fields and [roads]2610-roads the loathsome bodies of the dead corrupt the heavy - hanging air . Even the dogs , the vultures and the wolves refuse to touch the putrid flesh , there in the sultry sun rotting upon [the earth]1289-the earth ; emitting steams , and exhalations , with a baneful sweep increasing the dread contagion 's wide extent . So spreading , with renewed destruction gained from its own poison , the fierce pestilence appeared to leap from moulding carcases of all the brute creation , till it struck the wretched tillers of the soil , and then extended its dominion over all [this mighty city]2612-this mighty city . “ Always it began as if [the patient]6703-the patient 's bowels were scorched with flames ; red blotches on the body next appeared , and sharp pains in the lungs prevented breath . The swollen tongue would presently loll out , rough and discolored from the gaping mouth , wide - gasping to inhale the noxious air — and show red throbbing veins . The softest bed . And richest covering gave to none relief ; but rather , [the diseased]6704-the diseased would bare [himself]6704-the diseased to cool [his]6704-the diseased burning breast upon the ground , only to heat [the earth]1289-the earth — and no relief returned . And [no physician]6706-no physician could be found ; for [those who ministered among [the sick]6708-the sick]6707-those who ministered among the sick were first to suffer from the dread disease — the cruel malady broke out upon [the very ones who offered remedies]6709-the very ones who offered remedies . The hallowed art of medicine became a deadly snare to [those who knew it best]6710-those who knew it best . “[2613-the stricken ones] The only safety was in flight ; and those who were the nearest to [the stricken ones]2613-the stricken ones , and who most faithfully observed [their]2613-the stricken ones wants , were always first to suffer as [their]2613-the stricken ones wards . “ And [many , certain of approaching death]6711-many , certain of approaching death , indulged [their]6711-many , certain of approaching death wicked passions — recklessly abandoned and without the sense of shame , promiscuously huddled by [the wells]6712-the wells , and [rivers and cool fountains]6713-rivers and cool fountains ; but [their]6711-many , certain of approaching death thirst no water could assuage , and death alone was able to extinguish [their]6711-many , certain of approaching death desire . Too weak to rise , [they]2613-the stricken ones die in water [they]2613-the stricken ones pollute , while [others]4906-others drink its death . “[2613-the stricken ones] A madness seizing on [them]2613-the stricken ones made [their]2613-the stricken ones beds become most irksome to [their]2613-the stricken ones tortured nerves . Demented [they]2613-the stricken ones could not endure the pain , and leaped insanely forth . Or if too weak , [the wretches]2614-the wretches rolled [their]2614-the wretches bodies on the ground , insistent to escape from [hated homes]2615-hated homes — imagined sources of calamity ; for , since the cause was hidden and unknown , the horrible locality was blamed . Suspicion seizes on each frail presence as proof of what can never be resolved . “ And [many half - dead wretches]6715-many half - dead wretches staggered out on [sultry roads]6716-sultry roads as long as [they]6715-many half - dead wretches could stand ; and [others]4906-others weeping , stretched out on the ground , died in convulsions , as [their]4906-others rolling eyes gazed upwards at the overhanging clouds ; under the sad stars [they]4906-others breathed out [their]4906-others souls . “[2616-the sovereign of that wretched people] And oh , the deep despair that seized on [me]0-i , [the sovereign of [that wretched people]2617-that wretched people]2616-the sovereign of that wretched people ! [I]0-i was tortured with a passionate desire to die the same death — And [I]0-i hated life . “ No matter where [my]0-i shrinking eyes were turned , [I]0-i saw a multitude of gruesome forms in ghastly attitudes bestrew the ground , scattered as rotten apples that have dropped from moving branches , or as acorns thick around a gnarled oak . “[0-i] Lift up [your]2618-your eyes ! Behold [that holy temple]2619-that holy temple ! unto Jove long dedicated ! — What availed the prayers of [frightened multitudes]2620-frightened multitudes , or incense burned on those devoted altars ? — In the midst of [his]0-i most fervent supplications , [the husband]1379-the husband as [he]0-i pled for [[his]0-i dear wife]2622-his dear wife , or [the fond father for [[his]0-i stricken son]2624-his stricken son]2623-the fond father for his stricken son , would suddenly , before a word prevailed , die clutching at the altars of [[his]0-i Gods]2625-his gods , while holding in [his]0-i stiffened hand , a spray of frankincense still waiting for the fire . How often [sacrificial bulls]2626-sacrificial bulls have been brought to [those temples]2627-those temples , and while [white - robed priest]2628-white - robed priest was pouring offered wine between [their]2626-sacrificial bulls horns , have fallen without waiting for the stroke . “ While [I]0-i prepared a sacrifice to [Jove]456-jove , for [my]0-i behalf , [[my]0-i country]6718-my country and [three sons]6719-three sons , [the victim]6059-the victim , ever moaning dismal sounds , before a blow was struck , fell suddenly beside the altar ; and [his]0-i scanty blood ran thinly from the knives that slaughtered [him]0-i . [His]0-i entrails , wanting all the marks of truth were so diseased , the warnings of [the Gods]1395-the gods could not be read — the baneful malady had penetrated to the heart of life . “[0-i] And [I]0-i have seen the carcases of [men]1399-men lie rotting at the sacred temple gates , or by the very altars , where [they]1399-men fell , making death odious to [the living Gods]1912-the living gods . And often [I]0-i have seen [some desperate man]2631-some desperate man end life by [his]2631-some desperate man own halter , and so cheat by voluntary death [his]2631-some desperate man fear of death , in mad haste to outrun approaching fate . “ The bodies of the dead , indecently were cast forth , lacking sacred funeral rites as hitherto the custom . All the gates were crowded with processions of the dead . Unburied , [they]2626-sacrificial bulls might lie upon the ground , or else , deserted , on [their]2626-sacrificial bulls lofty pyres with [no one]5311-no one to lament [their]2626-sacrificial bulls dismal end , dissolve in [their]2626-sacrificial bulls dishonored ashes . All restraint forgotten , [a mad rabble]6723-a mad rabble fought and took possession of the burning pyres , and [even the dead]6724-even the dead were ravished of [their]2626-sacrificial bulls rest . — And who should mourn [them]2626-sacrificial bulls wanting , all the souls of [sons]5526-sons and [husbands , and of old and young]6726-husbands , and of old and young , must wander unlamented : and [the land]1295-the land sufficed not for [the crowded sepulchers]6728-the crowded sepulchers : and [the dense forest]6729-the dense forest was denuded of all trees . “[2631-some desperate man] Heart - broken at the sight of this great woe , [I]0-i wailed , ‘ O [Jupiter]475-jupiter ! if truth were told of [your]2632-your sweet comfort in [Aegina]788-aegina 's arms , if [you]2632-your were not ashamed of [me]0-i , [[your]2632-your son]1935-your son , restore [[my]0-i people]1747-my people , or entomb [my]0-i corpse , that [I]0-i may suffer as [the ones [I]0-i love]2635-the ones i love . ’ — Great lightning flashed around [me]0-i , and the sound of thunder proved that [my]0-i complaint was heard . Accepting it , [I]0-i cried , ‘ Let these , Great Jove , the happy signs of [your]2632-your assent , be shown good omens given as a sacred pledge . ’ “ Near by , a sacred oak tree grown from seed brought thither from [Dodona]238-dodona , spread abroad its branches thinly covered with green leaves ; and creeping as [an army]6730-an army , on the tree [we]6731-we saw [a train of ants that carried grain , half - hidden in the deep and wrinkled bark]6732-a train of ants that carried grain , half - hidden in the deep and wrinkled bark . And while [I]0-i wondered at the endless line [I]0-i said , ‘ [Good father]6733-good father , give [me]0-i citizens of equal number for [[my]0-i empty walls]6734-my empty walls . ’ Soon as [I]0-i said those words , though not a wind was moving nor a breeze , — the lofty tree began to tremble , and [I]0-i heard a sound of motion in its branches . Wonder not that sudden fear possessed [me]0-i ; and [my]0-i hair began to rise ; and [I]0-i could hardly stand for so [my]0-i weak knees tottered ! — As [I]0-i made obeisance to the soil and sacred tree , perhaps [I]0-i cherished in [my]0-i heart a thought , that , not acknowledged , cheered [me]0-i with some hope . “[0-i] At night [I]0-i lay exhausted by such thoughts , a deep sleep seized [my]0-i body , but the tree seemed always present — to [my]0-i gaze distinct with all its branches — [I]0-i could even see the birds among its leaves ; and from its boughs , that trembled in the still air , moving ants were scattered to the ground in troops below ; and ever , as [they]2636-they touched the soil , [they]2636-they grew larger and larger . — As [they]2636-they raised [themselves]2636-they , [they]2636-they stood with upright bodies , and put off [their]2636-they lean shapes ; and absorbed [their]2636-they many feet : and even as [their]2636-they dark brown color changed , [their]2636-they rounded forms took on a human shape . “ When [my]2637-my brave son strange dream departed , [I]2637-my brave son awoke , the vision vanished , [I]2637-my brave son complained to [Heaven]5-heaven against the idle comfort of such dreams ; but as [I]2637-my brave son voiced [my]2637-my brave son own lament , [I]2637-my brave son heard a mighty murmur echoing through the halls of [[my]2637-my brave son deserted palace]6735-my deserted palace , and a multitude of voices in confusion ; where the sound of scarce an echo had disturbed [the still deserted chambers]6736-the still deserted chambers for so many days . “[2637-my brave son] All this [I]0-i thought the fancy of [my]0-i dream , until [[my]0-i brave son]2637-my brave son [Telamon]866-telamon , in haste threw open the closed doorway , as [he]2637-my brave son called , ‘ Come quickly [father]1933-father , and behold a sight beyond the utmost of [your]1933-father fondest dreams ! ’ [I]0-i did go out , and there [I]0-i saw [such men]2639-such men each in [his]2637-my brave son turn , as [I]0-i had seen transformed in that weird vision of the moving ants . “ [They]2639-such men all advanced , and hailed [me]2637-my brave son as [[their]2639-such men king]6737-their king . So soon as [I]2637-my brave son had offered vows to [Jove]456-jove , [I]2637-my brave son subdivided [the deserted farms]6738-the deserted farms , and dwellings in [the cities]2098-the cities to [these men]6740-these men miraculously raised — which now are called [my]2637-my brave son Myrmidons , — the living evidence of [my]2637-my brave son strange vision . [You]6741-you have seen [these men]6740-these men ; and since that day , [their]6740-these men name has been declared , ‘ Decisive evidence . ’ [They]6740-these men have retained the well - known customs of the days before [their]6740-these men transformation . Patiently [they]6740-these men toil ; [they]6740-these men store the profits of [their]6740-these men labor ; which [they]6740-these men guard with valiant skill . [They]6740-these men 'll follow [you]6741-you to any war , well matched in years and courage , and [I]2637-my brave son do promise , when this east wind turns , this wind that favored [you]6741-you and brought [you]6741-you here , and when a south wind favors [our]6743-our design , then [[my]2637-my brave son brave Myrmidons]6744-my brave myrmidons will go with [you]6741-you . ”[2637-my brave son] This narrative and many other tales had occupied the day . As twilight fell , festivities were blended in the night — the night , in turn , afforded sweet repose . Soon as the golden Sun had shown [his]2640-his light , the east wind blowing still , [the ships]2641-the ships were stayed from sailing [home]2642-home . [The sons of [Pallas]694-pallas]2643-the sons of pallas came to [Cephalus]826-cephalus , who was [the elder called]2644-the elder called ; and [Cephalus]826-cephalus together with [the sons of [Pallas]694-pallas]2643-the sons of pallas , went to see [the king]6107-the king . Deep sleep still held [the king]6107-the king ; and [Phocus]867-phocus who was [son of [Aeacus]865-aeacus]2648-son of aeacus , received [them]2643-the sons of pallas at the gate , instead of [Telamon]866-telamon and [Peleus]872-peleus who were marshalling [the men]5722-the men for war . Into [the inner court]2650-the inner court and [beautiful apartments]2651-beautiful apartments [Phocus]867-phocus conducted [the Athenians]2652-the athenians , and [they]2643-the sons of pallas sat down together . [Phocus]867-phocus then observed that [Cephalus]826-cephalus held in [his]826-cephalus hand a curious javelin with golden head , and shaft of some rare wood . And as [they]2643-the sons of pallas talked , [he]826-cephalus said ; “ It is [my]826-cephalus pleasure to explore [the forest]5365-the forest in the chase of startled game , and so [I]826-cephalus 've learned the nature of rare woods , but never have [I]826-cephalus seen the match of this from which was fashioned this good javelin ; it lacks the yellow tint of forest ash , it is not knotted like all corner - wood ; although [I]826-cephalus can not name the kind of wood , [my]826-cephalus eyes have never seen a javelin - shaft so beautiful as this . ”[826-cephalus] To [him]826-cephalus replied [a friend of [Cephalus]826-cephalus]2653-a friend of cephalus ; “ But [you]6746-you will find its beauty is not equal to its worth , for whatsoever it is aimed against , its flight is always certain to the mark , nor is it subject to the shift of chance ; and after it has struck , although no hand may cast it back , it certainly returns , bloodstained with [every victim]6747-every victim . ”[826-cephalus] Then indeed , was [Phocus]867-phocus anxious to be told , whence came and who had given such a precious gift . And [Cephalus]826-cephalus appeared to tell [him]867-phocus all ; but craftily was silent on one strange condition of the fatal gift . As [he]826-cephalus recalled the mournful fate of [[his]826-cephalus dear wife]2622-his dear wife , [his]826-cephalus eyes filled up with tears . “ Ah , pity [me]826-cephalus , ”[826-cephalus] [he]826-cephalus said , “ If Fate should grant [me]826-cephalus many years , [I]826-cephalus must weep every time that [I]826-cephalus regard this weapon which has been [my]826-cephalus cause of tears ; the unforgiven death of [[my]826-cephalus dear wife]6748-my dear wife — ah , would that [I]826-cephalus had never handled it ! “[826-cephalus] [[My]0-i sweet wife]2655-my sweet wife , Procris ! — if [you]2656-you could compare [her]2655-my sweet wife beauty with [[her]2655-my sweet wife sister]1501-her sister 's — [Orithyia]827-orithyia 's , ( ravished by the blustering [Boreas]460-boreas ) [you]2656-you would declare [[my]0-i wife]2658-my wife more beautiful . “ ' Tis [she]2655-my sweet wife [her]2655-my sweet wife sire [Erectheus]873-erectheus joined to [me]2658-my wife , ' Tis [she]2655-my sweet wife [the god Love]6749-the god love also joined to [me]2658-my wife . [They]6749-the god love called [me]2658-my wife happy , and in truth [I]2658-my wife was , and all pronounced [us]6750-us so until [the Gods]1395-the gods decreed it otherwise . Two joyful months of [our]6750-us united love were almost passed , when , as the grey light of the dawn dispelled , upon [the summit of Hymettus green]6752-the summit of hymettus green , [Aurora]512-aurora , glorious in [her]512-aurora golden robes , observed [me]2658-my wife busy with encircling nets , trapping the antlered deer . “[2658-my wife] Against [my]0-i will incited by desire , [she]2658-my wife carried [me]0-i away with [her]2658-my wife . Oh , let [me]0-i not increase [her]2658-my wife anger , for [I]0-i tell [you]2659-you what is true , [I]0-i found no comfort in [her]2658-my wife lovely face ! And , though [she]2658-my wife is [the very queen of light]2660-the very queen of light , and reigns upon the edge of shadowy space where [she]2658-my wife is nourished on rich nectar - wine , adding delight to beauty , [I]0-i could give no heed to [her]2658-my wife entreaties , for the thought of [my]0-i beloved [Procris]874-procris intervened ; and only [her]874-procris sweet name was on [my]0-i lips . “ [I]874-procris told [Aurora]512-aurora of [our]6753-our wedding joys and all refreshing joys of love — and [my]874-procris first union of [[my]874-procris couch]6754-my couch deserted now : “[874-procris] Enraged against [me]0-i , then [the goddess]4979-the goddess said : ‘ Keep to [[your]0-i Procris]2662-your procris , [I]0-i but trouble [you]0-i , [ungrateful clown]2663-ungrateful clown ! but , if [you]0-i can be warned , [you]0-i will no longer wish for [her]2658-my wife ! ’ And so , in anger , [she]4979-the goddess returned [me]0-i to [[my]0-i wife]2658-my wife . “ Alas , as [I]4979-the goddess retraced the weary way , long - brooding over all [Aurora]512-aurora said , suspicion made [me]4979-the goddess doubtful of [[my]4979-the goddess wife]2658-my wife , so faithful and so fair . — But many things reminding [me]4979-the goddess of steadfast virtue , [I]4979-the goddess suppressed all doubts ; until the dreadful thought of [my]4979-the goddess long absence filled [my]4979-the goddess jealous mind : from which [I]4979-the goddess argued to the criminal advances of [Aurora]512-aurora ; for if [she]512-aurora , so lovely in appearance , did conceal such passion in the garb of innocence until the moment of temptation , how could [I]4979-the goddess be certain of the purity of even the strongest when the best are frail ? “[4979-the goddess] So brooding — every effort [I]0-i devised to cause [my]0-i own undoing . By the means of bribing presents , favored by disguise , [I]0-i sought to win [her]2658-my wife guarded chastity . [Aurora]512-aurora had disguised [me]0-i , and [her]2658-my wife guile determined [me]0-i to work in subtle snares . “ Unknown to all [[my]2658-my wife friends]6756-my friends , [I]2658-my wife paced [the streets of sacred [Athens]95-athens]6757-the streets of sacred athens till [I]2658-my wife reached [[my]2658-my wife home]5740-my home . [I]2658-my wife hoped to search out evidence of guilt : but everything seemed waiting [my]2658-my wife return ; and [all the household]6759-all the household breathed an air of grief . “[2658-my wife] With difficulty [I]0-i , disguised , obtained an entrance to [her]2658-my wife presence by the use of artifices many : and when [I]0-i there saw [her]2658-my wife , silent in [her]2658-my wife grief , — amazed , [my]0-i heart no longer prompted [me]0-i to test such constant love . An infinite desire took hold upon [me]0-i . [I]0-i could scarce restrain an impulse to caress and kiss [her]2658-my wife . Pale with grief that [I]0-i was gone , [her]2658-my wife lovely face in sorrow was more beautiful — [the world]1360-the world has not another so divinely fair . “ Ah , [Phocus]867-phocus , it is wonderful to think of beauty so surpassing fair it seems more lovable in sorrow ! Why relate to [you]867-phocus how often [she]2658-my wife repulsed [my]2658-my wife feigned attempts upon [her]2658-my wife virtue ? To each plea [she]2658-my wife said : ‘ [I]2658-my wife serve [one man]6498-one man : no matter where [he]6498-one man may be [I]2658-my wife will keep [my]2658-my wife love for one . ’ “[2658-my wife] Who but [a man insane with jealousy]2666-a man insane with jealousy , would doubt the virtue of [a loving wife]2667-a loving wife , when tempted by the most insidious wiles , whose hallowed honor was [[her]2667-a loving wife husband]1381-her husband 's love ? But [I]0-i , not satisfied with proof complete , would not abandon [my]0-i depraved desire to poison the pure fountain [I]0-i should guard ; — increasing [my]0-i temptations , [I]0-i caused [her]2667-a loving wife to hesitate , and covet a rich gift . “ Then , angered at [my]0-i own success [I]0-i said , discarding all disguise , ‘ Behold [the man whose lavish promise has established proof]6761-the man whose lavish promise has established proof , the witness of [your]2667-a loving wife shameful treachery ; [[your]2667-a loving wife absent husband]6762-your absent husband has returned to this ! ’ “[0-i] Unable to endure [a ruined home]2669-a ruined home , where desecration held [her]2667-a loving wife sin to view , despairing and in silent shame [she]2667-a loving wife fled ; and [I]0-i , [the author of that wickedness]2670-the author of that wickedness ran after : but enraged at [my]0-i deceit and hating [all mankind]5332-all mankind , [she]2667-a loving wife wandered far in [wildest mountains]2672-wildest mountains ; hunting [the wild game]2673-the wild game . “ [I]2667-a loving wife grieved at [her]2667-a loving wife desertion ; and the fires of [my]2667-a loving wife neglected love consumed [my]2667-a loving wife health ; with greater violence [my]2667-a loving wife love increased , until unable to endure such pain , [I]2667-a loving wife begged forgiveness and acknowledged fault : nor hesitated to declare that [I]2667-a loving wife might yield , the same way tempted , if such great gifts had been offered to [me]2667-a loving wife . When [I]2667-a loving wife had made abject confession and [she]2667-a loving wife had avenged [her]2667-a loving wife outraged feelings , [she]2667-a loving wife came back to [me]2667-a loving wife and [we]6763-we spent golden years in harmony . “[2667-a loving wife] [She]2667-a loving wife gave to [me]0-i the hound [she]2667-a loving wife fondly loved , the very one [Diana]484-diana gave to [her]2667-a loving wife when lovingly [the goddess]4979-the goddess had declared , ‘ This hound all others shall excel in speed . ’ Nor was that gift the only one was given by kind [Diana]484-diana when [[my]0-i wife]2658-my wife was [hers]2658-my wife , as [you]2676-you may guess — this javelin [I]0-i hold forth , no other but [a goddess]5320-a goddess could bestow . “ Would [you]2676-you be told the story of both gifts attend [my]2678-the son of laius words and [you]2676-you shall be amazed , for never such another sad event has added sorrow to the grieving world . “[2678-the son of laius] After [the son of Laius]2678-the son of laius , — [Oedipus]875-oedipus , — had solved the riddle of the monster - sphinx , so often baffling to the wits of [men]1399-men , and after [she]2667-a loving wife had fallen from [[her]2667-a loving wife hill]2680-her hill , mangled , forgetful of [her]2667-a loving wife riddling craft ; not unrevenged [the mighty Themis]2681-the mighty themis brooked [her]2667-a loving wife loss . Without delay [that goddess]5913-that goddess raised another savage beast to ravage [Thebes]103-thebes , by which [the farmer]2683-the farmer 's cattle were devoured , [the land]1295-the land was ruined and [its people]2685-its people slain . “ Then [all the valiant young men of [the realm]6765-the realm]6764-all the valiant young men of the realm , with whom [I]2686-i also went , enclosed [the field]5024-the field ( where lurked the monster ) in a mesh of many tangled nets : but not a strand could stay its onrush , and it leaped the crest of every barrier where the toils were set . “[2686-i] Already [they]2686-i had urged [their]2686-i eager dogs , which swiftly as a bird it left behind , eluding [all the hunters]2687-all the hunters as it fled . “ At last all begged [me]2686-i to let slip the leash of [straining Tempest]579-tempest ; such [I]2686-i called the hound , [[my]2686-i dear wife]6748-my dear wife 's present . As [he]2690-i tugged and pulled upon the tightened cords , [I]2686-i let [them]6768-them slip : no sooner done , then [he]2690-i was lost to sight ; although , wherever struck [his]2690-i rapid feet the hot dust whirled . Not swifter flies the spear , nor whizzing bullet from the twisted sling , nor feathered arrow from the twanging bow ! “[2686-i] [A high hill]2688-a high hill jutted from [a rolling plain , on which [I]0-i mounted to enjoy the sight of that unequalled chase]2689-a rolling plain , on which i mounted to enjoy the sight of that unequalled chase . One moment caught , the next as surely free , the wild beast seemed now here now there , elusive in its flight ; swiftly sped onward , or with sudden turn doubled in circles to deceive or gain . With equal speed pursuing at each turn , the rapid hound could neither gain nor lose . Now springing forward and now doubling back , [his]2690-i great speed foiled , [he]2690-i snapped at empty air . “ [I]2690-i then turned to [my]2690-i javelin 's aid ; and while [I]2690-i poised it in [my]2690-i right hand , turned away [my]2690-i gaze a moment as [I]2690-i sought to twine [my]2690-i practiced fingers in the guiding thongs ; but when again [I]2690-i lifted up [my]2690-i eyes , to cast the javelin where [the monster]5004-the monster sped , [I]2690-i saw two marble statues standing there , transformed upon [the plain]5033-the plain . [One statue]6771-one statue seemed to strain in attitude of rapid flight , [the other with wide - open jaws]6772-the other with wide - open jaws was changed , just in the act of barking and pursuit . Surely [some God]6773-some god — if [any god]6774-any god controls — decreed both equal , neither could succeed . ”[2690-i] Now after these miraculous events , it seemed [he]2690-i wished to stop , but [Phocus]867-phocus said . “ What charge have [you]2690-i against the javelin ? ”[867-phocus] And [Cephalus]826-cephalus rejoined ; “ [I]826-cephalus must relate [my]826-cephalus sorrows last ; for [I]826-cephalus would tell [you]2690-i first the story of [my]826-cephalus joys — ' Tis sweet to think , upon the gliding tide of those few years of married life , when [[my]826-cephalus dear wife]6748-my dear wife and [I]826-cephalus were happy in [our]6776-our love and confidence . [No woman]6777-no woman could allure [me]826-cephalus then from [her]6748-my dear wife ; and even [Venus]996-venus could not tempt [my]826-cephalus love ; all [my]826-cephalus great passion for [[my]826-cephalus dearest wife]6778-my dearest wife was equalled by the passion [she]6748-my dear wife returned . “[826-cephalus] As early as the sun , when golden rays first glittered on [the mountains]5190-the mountains , [I]0-i would rise in youthful ardor , to explore [the fields]5475-the fields in search of game . With [no companions]2693-no companions , [hounds]2694-hounds , nor steeds nor nets , this javelin was alone [my]0-i safety and companion in [my]0-i sport . “ And often when [my]0-i right hand felt its weight , a - wearied of the slaughter it had caused , [I]0-i would come back to rest in the cool shade , and breezes from [cool vales]6779-cool vales — the breeze [I]0-i wooed , blowing so gently on [me]0-i in the heat ; the breeze [I]0-i waited for ; [she]6780-she was [my]0-i rest from labor . [I]0-i remember , ‘ [Aura]876-aura come , ’ [I]0-i used to say , ‘ Come soothe [me]0-i , come into [my]0-i breast most welcome one , and yes indeed , [you]876-aura do relieve the heat with which [I]0-i burn . ’ “[0-i] And as [I]0-i felt the sweet breeze of the morn , as if in answer to [my]0-i song , [my]0-i fate impelled [me]0-i further to declare [my]0-i joy in song ; “ ‘ [You]876-aura are [my]0-i comfort , [you]876-aura are [my]0-i delight ! Refresh [me]0-i , cherish [me]0-i , breathe on [my]0-i face ! [I]0-i love [you]876-aura child of lonely haunts and trees ! ’ “[0-i] Such words [I]0-i once was singing , not aware of [some one]2695-some one spying on [me]0-i from the trees , who thought [I]0-i sang to [some beloved Nymph]2696-some beloved nymph , or [goddess by the name of Aura]2697-goddess by the name of aura — so [I]0-i always called the breeze . — [Unhappy man]2698-unhappy man ! The meddling tell - tale went to [Procris]874-procris with a story of supposed unfaithfulness , and slyly told in whispers all [he]2699-he heard . True love is credulous ; ( and as [I]0-i heard the story ) [Procris]874-procris in a swoon fell down . When [she]874-procris awakened from [her]874-procris bitter swoon , [she]874-procris ceased not wailing [her]874-procris unhappy fate , and , wretched , moaned for an imagined woe . “ So [she]874-procris lamented what was never done ! [Her]874-procris woe incited by a whispered tale , [she]874-procris feared the fiction of a harmless name ! But hope returning soothed [her]874-procris wretched state ; and now , no longer willing to believe such wrong , unless [her]874-procris own eyes saw it , [she]874-procris refused to think [[her]874-procris husband]1381-her husband sinned . “[874-procris] When dawn had banished night , and [I]0-i , rejoicing , ranged [the breathing woods]2700-the breathing woods , victorious in the hunt paused and said , ‘ Come [Aura]876-aura — lovely breeze — relieve [my]0-i panting breast ! ’ It seemed [I]0-i heard the smothered moans of sorrow as [I]0-i spoke : but not conceiving harm , [I]0-i said again ; “ ‘ Come here , oh [my]0-i delight ! ’ And as those words fell from [my]0-i lips , [I]0-i thought [I]0-i heard a soft sound in the thicket , as of moving leaves ; and thinking surely ' twas a hidden beast , [I]0-i threw this winged javelin at the spot . — “[0-i] It was [[my]0-i own wife]2701-my own wife , [Procris]874-procris , and the shaft was buried in [her]2701-my own wife breast — ‘ Ah , wretched [me]0-i ! ’ [She]2701-my own wife cried ; and when [I]0-i heard [her]2701-my own wife well - known voice , distracted [I]0-i ran towards [her]2701-my own wife , — only to find [her]2701-my own wife bathed in blood , and dying from the wound of that same javelin [she]2701-my own wife had given to [me]0-i : and in [her]2701-my own wife agony [she]2701-my own wife drew it forth , — ah [me]0-i ! alas ! from [her]2701-my own wife dear tender side . “ [I]2701-my own wife lifted [her]2701-my own wife limp body to [my]2701-my own wife own , in these blood - guilty arms , and wrapped the wound with fragments of [my]2701-my own wife tunic , that [I]2701-my own wife tore in haste to staunch [her]2701-my own wife blood ; and all the while [I]2701-my own wife moaned , ‘ Oh , do not now forsake [me]2701-my own wife — slain by these accursed hands ! ’ “[2701-my own wife] Weak with the loss of blood , and dying , [she]2701-my own wife compelled [herself]2701-my own wife to utter these few words , ‘ It is [my]0-i death ; but let [my]0-i eyes not close upon this life before [I]0-i plead with [you]0-i ! — By the dear ties of sacred marriage ; by [[your]0-i god]2702-your god and [mine]0-i ; and if [my]0-i love for [you]0-i can move [your]0-i heart ; and even by the cause of [my]0-i sad death , — [my]0-i love for [you]0-i increasing as [I]0-i die , — ah , put away that Aura [you]0-i have called , that [she]2703-i may never separate [your]0-i soul , — [your]0-i love from [me]0-i . ’ “ So , by those dying words [I]2703-i knew that [she]2704-her had heard [me]2703-i call the name of [Aura]876-aura , when [I]2703-i wished the cooling breeze , and thought [I]2703-i called [a goddess]5320-a goddess , — cause of all [her]2704-her jealous sorrow and [my]2703-i bitter woe “[2703-i] Alas , too late , [I]0-i told [her]2704-her the sad truth ; but [she]2704-her was sinking , and [her]2704-her little strength swiftly was ebbing with [her]2704-her flowing blood . As long as life remained [her]2704-her loving gaze was fixed on [mine]0-i ; and [her]2704-her unhappy life at last was breathed out on [my]0-i grieving face . It seemed to [me]0-i a look of sweet content was in [her]2704-her face , as if [she]2704-her feared not death . ” In tears [he]0-i folds these things ; and , as [they]6783-they wept in came [the aged monarch]6784-the aged monarch , [Aeacus]865-aeacus , and with [the monarch]6443-the monarch [[his]865-aeacus two valiant sons]6786-his two valiant sons , and [troops , new - levied , trained to glorious arms]6787-troops , new - levied , trained to glorious arms . Now [Lucifer]513-lucifer unveiled the glorious day , and as the session of the night dissolved , the cool east wind declined , and vapors wreathed [the moistened valleys]6788-the moistened valleys . Veering to the south the welcome wind gave passage to [the sons of [Aeacus]865-aeacus]2577-the sons of aeacus , and wafted [Cephalus]826-cephalus on [his]826-cephalus returning way , propitious ; where before the wonted hour , [they]6783-they entered port . [King Minos]860-minos , while the fair wind moved [[their]6783-they ship]6790-their ship , was laying waste [the land of [Megara]223-megara]6791-the land of megara . [He]860-minos gathered a great army round [the walls built by [Alcathous]239-alcathous]6792-the walls built by alcathous , where reigned in splendor [King Nisus]877-nisus — mighty and renowned in war — upon the center of whose hoary head a lock of purple hair was growing . — Its proved virtue gave protection to [his]860-minos throne . Six times the horns of rising [Phoebe]517-phoebe grew , and still the changing fortune of the war was in suspense ; so , Victory day by day between [them]6783-they hovered on uncertain wings . Within [that city]5869-that city was [a regal tower on tuneful walls]6794-a regal tower on tuneful walls ; where once [Apollo]549-phoebus laid [his]549-phoebus golden harp ; and in the throbbing stone the sounds remained . And there , in times of peace [the daughter of king [Nisus]877-nisus]6795-the daughter of king nisus loved to mount the walls and strike the sounding stone with pebbles : so , when the war began , [she]6795-the daughter of king nisus often viewed the dreadful contest from that height ; until , so long [the hostile camp]6796-the hostile camp remained , [she]6795-the daughter of king nisus had become acquainted with the names , and knew the habits , horses and the arms of [many a chief]6797-many a chief , and could discern the signs of [their]6783-they Cydonean quivers . More than all , the features of [King Minos]860-minos were engraved upon the tablets of [her]6795-the daughter of king nisus mind . And when [he]860-minos wore [his]860-minos helmet , crested with gay plumes , [she]6795-the daughter of king nisus deemed it glorious ; when [he]860-minos held [his]860-minos shield shining with gold , no other seemed so grand ; and when [he]860-minos poised to hurl the tough spear home , [she]6795-the daughter of king nisus praised [his]860-minos skill and strength ; and when [he]860-minos bent [his]860-minos curving bow with arrow on the cord , [she]6795-the daughter of king nisus pictured [him]860-minos as [Phoebus]549-phoebus taking aim , — but when , arrayed in purple , and upon the back of [his]860-minos white war horse , proudly decked with richly broidered housings , [he]860-minos reined in [the nervous steed]6798-the nervous steed , and took [his]860-minos helmet off , showing [his]860-minos fearless features , then [the maid]1503-the maid , [daughter of [Nisus]877-nisus]6800-daughter of nisus , could control [herself]1503-the maid no longer ; and a frenzy seized [her]1503-the maid mind . [She]1503-the maid called the javelin happy which [he]860-minos touched , and blessed were the reins within [his]860-minos hand . [She]1503-the maid had an impulse to direct [her]1503-the maid steps , [a tender virgin]6801-a tender virgin , through the hostile ranks , or cast [her]1503-the maid body from the topmost towers into [the Gnossian camp]6802-the gnossian camp . [She]1503-the maid had a wild desire to open to [the enemy]6803-the enemy the heavy brass - bound gates , or anything that [Minos]860-minos could desire . And as [she]1503-the maid sat beholding [the white tents]6804-the white tents , [she]1503-the maid cried , “[2704-her] Alas ! Should [I]0-i rejoice or grieve to see this war ? [I]0-i grieve that [Minos]860-minos is the enemy of [her]2705-her who loves [him]860-minos ; but unless the war had brought [him]860-minos , how could [he]860-minos be known to [me]0-i ? But should [he]860-minos take [me]0-i for a hostage ? That might end the war — a pledge of peace , [he]860-minos might keep [me]0-i for [[his]860-minos companion]6077-his companion . “ O , supreme of [mankind]5938-mankind ! [she]2705-her who bore [you]0-i must have been as beautiful as [you]0-i are ; ample cause for [Jove]456-jove to lose [his]456-jove heart . “[860-minos] O , happy hour ! If moving upon wings through yielding air , [I]0-i could alight within [the hostile camp]6796-the hostile camp in front of [Minos]860-minos , and declare to [him]860-minos [my]0-i name and passion ! “ Then would [I]860-minos implore what dowry [he]860-minos could wish , and would provide whatever [he]860-minos might ask , except alone [the city of [[my]860-minos father]1438-my father]6806-the city of my father . Perish all [my]860-minos secret hopes before one act of [mine]860-minos should offer treason to accomplish it . And yet , the kindness of [a conqueror]6808-a conqueror has often proved a blessing , manifest to [those who were defeated]6809-those who were defeated . Certainly the war [he]860-minos carries on is justified by [[his]860-minos slain son]6810-his slain son . “[860-minos] [He]860-minos is [a mighty king]2708-a mighty king , thrice strengthened in [his]860-minos cause . Undoubtedly [we]2709-we shall be conquered , and , if such a fate awaits [[our]2709-we city]2710-our city , why should [he]860-minos by force instead of [my]0-i consuming love , prevail to open the strong gates ? Without delay and dreadful slaughter , it is best for [him]860-minos to conquer and decide this savage war . “ Ah , [Minos]860-minos , how [I]860-minos fear the bitter fate should [any warrior]6811-any warrior hurl [his]6811-any warrior cruel spear and pierce [you]860-minos by mischance , for surely [none]1829-none can be so hardened to transfix [your]860-minos breast with purpose known . ”[860-minos] Oh , let [her]2711-her love prevail to open for [his]860-minos army the great gates . Only the thought of it , has filled [her]2711-her soul ; [she]2711-her is determined to deliver up [[her]2711-her country]5983-her country as a dowry with [herself]2711-her , and so decide the war ! But what avails this idle talk . “ [A guard]6813-a guard surrounds the gates , [[my]2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires father]1438-my father keeps the keys , and [he]1438-my father alone is [[my]2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires obstruction]6815-my obstruction , and the innocent account of [my]2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires despair . Would to [the Gods [I]2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires had [no father]6817-no father]6816-the gods i had no father ! Is not [man]1330-man the God of [his]1330-man own fortune , though [his]1330-man idle prayers avail not to compel [his]1330-man destiny ? “[2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires] [Another woman crazed with passionate desires]2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires , which now inflame [me]0-i , would not hesitate , but with a fierce abandon would destroy whatever checked [her]2713-another woman crazed with passionate desires passion . Who is there with love to equal [mine]0-i ? [I]0-i dare to go through flames and swords ; but swords and flames are not now needed , for [I]0-i only need [[my]0-i royal father]2714-my royal father 's lock of purple hair . More precious than fine gold , it has a power to give [my]0-i heart all that it may desire . ” While [Scylla]878-scylla said this , night that heals [our]6819-our cares came on , and [she]878-scylla grew bolder in the dark . And now it is the late and silent hour when slumber takes possession of the breast . Outwearied with the cares of busy day ; then as [[her]878-scylla father]5022-her father slept , with stealthy tread [she]878-scylla entered [[his]5022-her father abode]6821-his abode , and there despoiled , and clipped [his]5022-her father fatal lock of purple hair . Concealing in [her]878-scylla bosom the sad prize of crime degenerate , [she]878-scylla at once went forth a gate unguarded , and with shameless haste sped through the hostile army to [the tent of [Minos]860-minos]6822-the tent of minos , whom , astonished , [she]878-scylla addressed : “[0-i] Only [my]0-i love has led [me]0-i to this deed . [The daughter of [King Nisus]877-nisus]6795-the daughter of king nisus , [I]0-i am called [the maiden Scylla]878-scylla . Unto [you]2716-you [I]0-i come and offer up a power that will prevail against [[my]0-i country]6718-my country , and [I]0-i stipulate no recompense except [yourself]2716-you . Take then this purple hair , a token of [my]0-i love . — Deem it not lightly as a lock of hair held idly forth to [you]2716-you ; it is in truth [[my]0-i father]1438-my father 's life . ” And as [she]878-scylla spoke [she]878-scylla held out in [her]878-scylla guilty hand the prize , and begged [him]1438-my father to accept it with [her]878-scylla love . Shocked at the thought of such a heinous crime , [Minos]860-minos refused , and said , “[2719-despised abomination of our time] O execrable thing ! [Despised abomination of [our]2720-our time]2719-despised abomination of our time ! May [all the Gods]5318-all the gods forever banish [you]2716-you from [[their]5318-all the gods wide universe]2722-their wide universe , and may [the earth]1289-the earth and [the deep ocean]2724-the deep ocean be denied to [you]2716-you ! So great a monster shall not be allowed to desecrate [the sacred Isle of [Crete]100-crete]2725-the sacred isle of crete , where [Jupiter]475-jupiter was born . ” So [Minos]860-minos spoke . Nevertheless [he]860-minos conquered [Megara]223-megara , ( so aided by [the damsel]6823-the damsel 's wicked deed ) and as [a just and mighty king]6824-a just and mighty king imposed [his]860-minos own conditions on [the vanquished land]6825-the vanquished land . [He]860-minos ordered [his]860-minos great fleet to tarry not ; [the hawsers]6826-the hawsers were let loose , and the long oars quickly propelled [[his]860-minos brazen - pointed ships]6827-his brazen - pointed ships . — When [Scylla]878-scylla saw [them]6827-his brazen - pointed ships launching forth , observed [them]6827-his brazen - pointed ships sailing on [the mighty deep]6828-the mighty deep , [she]878-scylla called with vain entreaties ; but at last , aware [the prince]6829-the prince ignored [her]878-scylla and refused to recompense [her]878-scylla wickedness , enraged , and raving , [she]878-scylla held up [her]878-scylla impious hands , [her]878-scylla long hair streaming on the wind , — and said : “[475-jupiter] Oh , wherefore have [you]2726-you flown , and left behind the author of [your]2726-you glory . Oh , wretch ! wretch to whom [I]0-i offered up [[my]0-i native land]2167-my native land , and sacrificed [[my]0-i father]1438-my father ! Where have [you]2726-you now flown , [ungrateful man whose victory is both [my]0-i crime and virtue]2729-ungrateful man whose victory is both my crime and virtue ? And the gift presented to [you]2726-you , and [my]0-i passion , have these not moved [you]2726-you ? All [my]0-i love and hope in [you]2726-you alone ! “ Forsaken by [[my]5112-your mother prince]6830-my prince , shall [I]5112-your mother return to [[my]5112-your mother defeated land]6831-my defeated land ? If never ruined it would shut [its]6831-my defeated land walls against [me]5112-your mother . — Shall [I]5112-your mother seek [[my]5112-your mother father]1438-my father 's face whom [I]5112-your mother delivered to all - conquering arms ? [[My]5112-your mother fellow - citizens]6833-my fellow - citizens despise [my]5112-your mother name ; [[my]5112-your mother friends]6756-my friends and [neighbors]6835-neighbors hate [me]5112-your mother ; [I]5112-your mother have shut [the world]1360-the world against [me]5112-your mother , only in the hope that [Crete]100-crete would surely welcome [me]5112-your mother ; — and now , [he]2730-this thankless wretch has forbidden [me]5112-your mother . “[5112-your mother] And is it so [I]0-i am requited by [this thankless wretch]2730-this thankless wretch ! [Europa]592-europa could not be [[your]2731-you mother]5112-your mother ! [Spawn of cruel [Syrtis]242-syrtis]2733-spawn of cruel syrtis ! [Savage cub of fierce Armenian tigress]2734-savage cub of fierce armenian tigress ; — or [Charybdis]879-charybdis , tossed by [the wild South - wind]2735-the wild south - wind begot [you]2731-you ! Can [you]2731-you be [the son of [Jupiter]475-jupiter]5400-the son of jupiter ? [[Your]2731-you mother]5112-your mother was not ever tricked by the false semblance of a bull . All that story of [your]2731-you birth is false ! [You]2731-you are [the offspring of a bull as fierce as [you]2731-you are]2738-the offspring of a bull as fierce as you are ! “ Let [your]2731-you vengeance fall upon [me]2739-that woman , O [[my]2739-that woman father]1438-my father [Nisus]877-nisus , let [the ruined city]6838-the ruined city [I]2739-that woman betrayed rejoice at [my]2739-that woman misfortunes — richly merited — destroy [me]2739-that woman , [you]2731-you whom [I]2739-that woman have ruined ; — [I]2739-that woman should perish for [my]2739-that woman crimes ! But why should [you]2731-you , who conquered by [my]2739-that woman crime , abandon [me]2739-that woman ? The treason to [[my]2739-that woman father]1438-my father and [[my]2739-that woman land]6840-my land becomes an act of kindness in [your]2731-you cause . “[2739-that woman] [That woman]2739-that woman is a worthy mate for [you]2740-you who hid in wood deceived the raging bull , and bore to [him]2741-his the infamy of [Crete]100-crete . [I]0-i do not wonder that [Pasiphae]880-pasiphae preferred the bull to [you]2740-you , more savage than the wildest beast . Alas , alas for [me]0-i ! “ Do [my]880-pasiphae complaints reach [your]2740-you unwilling ears ? Or do the same winds waft away [my]880-pasiphae words that blow upon [[your]2740-you ships]6841-your ships , [ungrateful man]6842-ungrateful man ? — Ah , wretched that [I]880-pasiphae am , [he]2741-his takes delight in hastening from [me]880-pasiphae . The deep waves resound as smitten by the oars , [[his]2741-his ship]6843-his ship departs ; and [I]880-pasiphae am lost and even [[my]880-pasiphae native land]2167-my native land is fading from [his]2741-his sight . “[880-pasiphae] Oh heart of flint ! [you]2740-you shall not prosper in [your]2740-you cruelty , and [you]2740-you shall not forget [my]0-i sacrifice ; in spite of everything [I]0-i follow [you]2740-you ! [I]0-i 'll grasp the curving stern of [[your]2740-you swift ship]2742-your swift ship , and [I]0-i will follow through unending seas . ” And as [she]880-pasiphae spoke , [she]880-pasiphae leaped into the waves , and followed [the receding ships]6845-the receding ships — for strength from passion came to [her]880-pasiphae . And soon [she]880-pasiphae clung unwelcome , to [the sailing Gnossian ship]6846-the sailing gnossian ship . Meanwhile , [the Gods]456-jove had changed [[her]880-pasiphae father]5022-her father 's form and now [he]5022-her father hovered over [the salt deep]6848-the salt deep , a hawk with tawny wings . So when [he]5022-her father saw [[his]5022-her father daughter]5054-his daughter clinging to [the hostile ship]6850-the hostile ship [he]5022-her father would have torn [her]880-pasiphae with [his]5022-her father rending beak ; — [he]5022-her father darted towards [her]880-pasiphae through the yielding air . In terror [she]880-pasiphae let go , but as [she]880-pasiphae fell the light air held [her]880-pasiphae from the ocean spray ; [her]880-pasiphae feather - weight supported by the breeze ; [she]880-pasiphae spread [her]880-pasiphae wings , and changed into a bird . [They]6851-they called [her]880-pasiphae “[881-ciris] [Ciris]881-ciris ” when [she]880-pasiphae cut the wind , and “[881-ciris] [Ciris]881-ciris ” — cut - the - lock — remains [her]880-pasiphae name . [King Minos]860-minos , when [he]860-minos reached [the land of [Crete]100-crete]6852-the land of crete and left [[his]860-minos ships]6853-his ships , remembered [he]860-minos had made a vow to [Jupiter]475-jupiter , and offered up a hundred bulls . — The splendid spoils of war adorned [[his]860-minos palace]5898-his palace . — Now the infamous reproach of [Crete]100-crete had grown , till it exposed the double - natured shame . So , [Minos]860-minos , moved to cover [his]860-minos disgrace , resolved to hide [the monster]5004-the monster in [a prison]6856-a prison , and [he]860-minos built with intricate design , by [Daedalus]882-daedalus contrived , [an architect of wonderful ability , and famous]6857-an architect of wonderful ability , and famous . This [he]860-minos planned of mazey wanderings that deceived the eyes , and labyrinthic passages involved . so sports the clear Maeander , in [the fields of [Phrygia]175-phrygia winding doubtful]6858-the fields of phrygia winding doubtful ; back and forth [it]6859-it meets itself , until [the wandering stream]6860-the wandering stream fatigued , impedes [its]6859-it wearied waters ' flow ; from source to [sea]1296-sea , from [sea]1296-sea to source involved . So [Daedalus]882-daedalus contrived innumerous paths , and windings vague , so intricate that [he]882-daedalus , [the architect]6863-the architect , hardly could retrace [his]882-daedalus steps . In this [the Minotaur]883-the minotaur was long concealed , and there devoured Athenian victims sent three seasons , nine years each , till [Theseus]856-theseus , [son of [Aegeus]855-aegeus]6864-son of aegeus , slew [him]883-the minotaur and retraced [his]883-the minotaur way , finding the path by [Ariadne]884-ariadne 's thread . Without delay [the victor]6397-the victor fled from [Crete]100-crete , together with [the loving maid]6866-the loving maid , and sailed for [Dia Isle]243-dia isle of [Naxos]115-naxos , where [he]6397-the victor left [the maid forlorn]6867-the maid forlorn , abandoned . [Her]6866-the loving maid , in time , lamenting and deserted , [Bacchus]617-bacchus found and for [his]6397-the victor love immortalized [her]6866-the loving maid name . [He]6397-the victor set in [the dark heavens]6868-the dark heavens the bright crown that rested on [her]6866-the loving maid brows . Through the soft air it whirled , while all the sparkling jewels changed to flashing fires , assuming in the sky between the Serpent - holder and the Kneeler the well - known shape of [Ariadne]884-ariadne 's Crown . But [Daedalus]882-daedalus abhorred [the Isle of [Crete]100-crete]6869-the isle of crete — and [his]882-daedalus long exile on [that sea - girt shore]6870-that sea - girt shore , increased the love of [[his]882-daedalus own native place]6871-his own native place . “[860-minos] Though [Minos]860-minos blocks escape by [sea]1296-sea and [land]1301-land . ” [He]882-daedalus said , “[860-minos] The unconfined skies remain though [Minos]860-minos may be lord of [all the world]5463-all the world [his]860-minos sceptre is not regnant of the air , and by that untried way is [our]2746-our escape . ” This said , [he]882-daedalus turned [his]882-daedalus mind to arts unknown and nature unrevealed . [He]882-daedalus fashioned quills and feathers in due order — deftly formed from small to large , as any rustic pipe prom straws unequal slants . [He]882-daedalus bound with thread the middle feathers , and the lower fixed with pliant wax ; till so , in gentle curves arranged , [he]882-daedalus bent them to the shape of birds . While [he]882-daedalus was working , [[his]882-daedalus son]5099-his son [Icarus]885-icarus , with smiling countenance and unaware of danger to [himself]885-icarus , perchance would chase the feathers , ruffled by the shifting breeze , or soften with [his]885-icarus thumb the yellow wax , and by [his]885-icarus playfulness retard the work [[his]885-icarus anxious father]6873-his anxious father planned . But when at last [the father]1574-the father finished it , [he]1574-the father poised [himself]1574-the father , and lightly floating in the winnowed air waved [his]1574-the father great feathered wings with bird - like ease . And , likewise [he]1574-the father had fashioned for [[his]1574-the father son]5099-his son such wings ; before they ventured in the air [he]1574-the father said , “[0-i] [[My]0-i son]5122-my son , [I]0-i caution [you]5122-my son to keep the middle way , for if [your]5122-my son pinions dip too low the waters may impede [your]5122-my son flight ; and if they soar too high the sun may scorch them . Fly midway . Gaze not at the boundless sky , far [Ursa Major]244-ursa major and Bootes next . Nor on [Orion]886-orion with [his]886-orion flashing brand , but follow [my]0-i safe guidance . ” As [he]1574-the father spoke [he]1574-the father fitted on [[his]1574-the father son]5099-his son the plumed wings with trembling hands , while down [his]1574-the father withered cheeks the tears were falling . Then [he]1574-the father gave [[his]1574-the father son]5099-his son a last kiss , and upon [his]1574-the father gliding wings assumed a careful lead solicitous . As when the bird leads forth [[her]1574-the father tender young]6878-her tender young , from high - swung nest to try the yielding air ; so [he]1574-the father prevailed on willing [Icarus]885-icarus ; encouraged and instructed [him]885-icarus in a]l the fatal art ; and as [he]1574-the father waved [his]1574-the father wings looked backward on [[his]1574-the father son]5099-his son . Beneath [their]6880-their flight , [the fisherman]6881-the fisherman while casting [his]6881-the fisherman long rod , or [the tired shepherd]6882-the tired shepherd leaning on [his]6881-the fisherman crook , or [the rough plowman]6883-the rough plowman as [he]1574-the father raised [his]1574-the father eyes , astonished might observe them on the wing , and worship [them]6880-their as [Gods]6543-gods . Upon the left [they]6880-their passed by [Samos]245-samos , [[Juno]488-juno 's sacred isle]6885-juno 's sacred isle ; [Delos]111-delos and [Paros]887-paros too , were left behind ; and on the right [Lebinthus]888-lebinthus and [Calymne]889-calymne , fruitful in honey . Proud of [his]1574-the father success , [the foolish Icarus]885-icarus forsook [[his]1574-the father guide]6886-his guide , and , bold in vanity , began to soar , rising upon [his]1574-the father wings to touch the skies ; but as [he]1574-the father neared the scorching sun , its heat softened the fragrant wax that held [his]1574-the father plumes ; and heat increasing melted the soft wax — [he]1574-the father waved [his]1574-the father naked arms instead of wings , with no more feathers to sustain [his]1574-the father flight . And as [he]1574-the father called upon [[his]1574-the father father]1530-his father 's name [his]1574-the father voice was smothered in [the dark blue sea]6888-the dark blue sea , now called [Icarian]890-icarian from [the dead boy]6889-the dead boy 's name . [The unlucky father]6890-the unlucky father , not [a father]1601-a father , called , “[2748-you] Where are [you]2748-you , [Icarus]885-icarus ? ” and “[2748-you] Where are [you]2748-you ? In what place shall [I]0-i seek [you]2748-you , [Icarus]885-icarus ? ” [He]0-i called again ; and then [he]0-i saw the wings of [[his]0-i dear]6892-his dear [Icarus]885-icarus , floating on the waves ; and [he]0-i began to rail and curse [his]0-i art . [He]0-i found the body on [an island shore]6893-an island shore , now called [Icaria]246-icaria , and at once prepared to bury the unfortunate remains ; but while [he]0-i labored a pert partridge near , observed [him]885-icarus from the covert of an oak , and whistled [his]885-icarus unnatural delight . Know [you]2748-you the cause ? ' [Twas]891-twas then a single bird , the first one of its kind . ' [Twas]891-twas never seen before [the sister of [Daedalus]882-daedalus]6894-the sister of daedalus had brought [him]0-i [Perdix]892-perdix , [[her]6894-the sister of daedalus dear son]5615-her dear son , to be [[his]0-i pupil]5349-his pupil . And as the years went by [the gifted youth]6897-the gifted youth began to rival [[his]0-i instructor]6898-his instructor 's art . [He]0-i took the jagged backbone of a fish , and with it as a model made a saw , with sharp teeth fashioned from a strip of iron . And [he]0-i was first to make two arms of iron , smooth hinged upon the center , so that one would make a pivot while the other , turned , described a circle . Wherefore [Daedalus]882-daedalus enraged and envious , sought to slay [the youth]1554-the youth and cast [him]1554-the youth headlong from [Minerva]543-minerva 's fane , — then spread the rumor of an accident . But [Pallas]694-pallas , [goddess of ingenious men , saving the pupil]6900-goddess of ingenious men , saving the pupil changed [him]1554-the youth to a bird , and in the middle of the air [he]1554-the youth flew on feathered wings ; and so [his]1554-the youth active mind — and vigor of [his]1554-the youth genius were absorbed into [his]1554-the youth wings and feet ; although the name of [Perdix]892-perdix was retained . [The Partridge]893-the partridge hides in shaded places by the leafy trees its nested eggs among the bush 's twigs ; nor does it seek to rise in lofty flight , for it is mindful of its former fall . Wearied with travel [Daedalus]882-daedalus arrived at [Sicily]158-sicily , — where [Cocalus]894-cocalus was [king]6901-king ; and when [the wandering Daedalus]6902-the wandering daedalus implored [the monarch]6443-the monarch 's kind protection from [[his]882-daedalus foe]6079-his foe , [he]882-daedalus gathered [a great army for [[his]882-daedalus guest]6243-his guest]6905-a great army for his guest , and gained renown from [an applauding world]6907-an applauding world . Now after [Theseus]856-theseus had destroyed in [Crete]100-crete [the dreadful monster]6908-the dreadful monster , [Athens]95-athens then had ceased to pay [her]95-athens mournful tribute ; and with wreaths [[her]95-athens people]2280-her people decked [the temples of [the Gods]1395-the gods]6910-the temples of the gods ; and [they]2280-her people invoked [Minerva]543-minerva , [Jupiter]475-jupiter , and [many other Gods whom [they]2280-her people adored , with sacrifice and precious offerings , and jars of Frankincense]6912-many other gods whom they adored , with sacrifice and precious offerings , and jars of frankincense . Quick - flying Fame had spread reports of [Theseus]856-theseus through [the land]1295-the land ; and [all the peoples of [Achaia]671-achaia]6914-all the peoples of achaia , from that day , when danger threatened would entreat [his]856-theseus aid . So it befell , [the land of [Calydon]187-calydon]6915-the land of calydon , through [Meleager]895-meleager and [[her]95-athens native hero]6916-her native hero , implored [the valiant Theseus]6917-the valiant theseus to destroy a raging boar , the ravage of [[her]95-athens realm]6918-her realm . [Diana]484-diana in [her]484-diana wrath had sent the boar to wreak [her]484-diana vengeance ; and [they]2280-her people say the cause was this : — [The nation]6919-the nation had a fruitful year , for which [the good king Oeneus]6920-the good king oeneus had decreed that all should offer the first fruits of corn to [Ceres]758-ceres — and to Bacchus wine of grapes — and oil of olives to [the golden haired Minerva]6921-the golden haired minerva . Thus , [the Gods]456-jove were all adored , beginning with the lowest to the highest , except alone [Diana]484-diana , and of all the Gods [her]484-diana altars only were neglected . No frankincense unto [her]484-diana was given ! Neglect enrages even [Deities]753-o thespian deities . “[0-i] Am [I]0-i to suffer this indignity ? ” [she]484-diana cried , “[0-i] Though [I]0-i am thus dishonored , [I]0-i will not be unrevenged ! ” And so the boar was sent to ravage [the fair land of [Calydon]187-calydon]6922-the fair land of calydon . And this avenging boar was quite as large as bulls now feeding on [the green Epirus]247-the green epirus , and larger than [the bulls of [Sicily]158-sicily]6923-the bulls of sicily . [A dreadful boar]6924-a dreadful boar . — [His]6924-a dreadful boar burning , bloodshot eyes seemed coals of living fire , and [his]6924-a dreadful boar rough neck was knotted with stiff muscles , and thick - set with bristles like sharp spikes . A seething froth dripped on [his]6924-a dreadful boar shoulders , and [his]6924-a dreadful boar tusks were like the spoils of Ind. Discordant roars reverberated from [his]6924-a dreadful boar hideous jaws ; and lightning — belched forth from [his]6924-a dreadful boar horrid throat — scorched [the green fields]6925-the green fields . [He]6924-a dreadful boar trampled the green corn and doomed [the farmer]2683-the farmer to lament [his]6924-a dreadful boar crops , in vain the threshing - floor has been prepared , in vain [the barns]6927-the barns await the promised yield . Long branches of the vine and heavy grapes are scattered in confusion , and the fruits and branches of the olive tree , whose leaves should never wither , are cast on the ground . [His]6924-a dreadful boar spleen was vented on the simple flocks , which neither dogs nor [shepherd]5362-shepherd could protect ; and the brave bulls could not defend [their]6923-the bulls of sicily herds . [The people]1439-the people fled in all directions from [the fields]5475-the fields , for safety to [the cities]2098-the cities . Terror reigned . There seemed no remedy to save [the land]1295-the land , till [Meleager]895-meleager chose [a band of youths , united for the glory of great deeds]6933-a band of youths , united for the glory of great deeds . What heroes shall immortal song proclaim ? [Jason]833-jason , too , was [there]1500-there , [the glorious builder of [the world]1360-the world 's first ship]6936-the glorious builder of the world 's first ship , and [Theseus]856-theseus with [[his]856-theseus friend]6633-his friend [Perithous]899-perithous , and [Toxeus]900-toxeus and [Plexippus]901-plexippus , [fated sons of [Thestius]902-thestius]6939-fated sons of thestius , and [the son of Aphareus]6940-the son of aphareus , [Lynkeus]903-lynkeus with [[his]903-lynkeus fleet - foot brother]6941-his fleet - foot brother [Idas]707-idas and [Caeneus]904-caeneus , first [a woman]5609-a woman then [a man the brave Leucippus]6943-a man the brave leucippus and [the argonaut Acastus , swift of dart]6944-the argonaut acastus , swift of dart ; and [warlike [Dryas]700-elis , [Hippothous]700-elis and [Phoenix]700-elis , not then blind , the son of [King Amyntor]700-elis , and the twain who sprung from [Actor]700-elis , Phyleus thither brought from [Elis]700-elis]6945-warlike dryas , hippothous and phoenix , not then blind , the son of king amyntor , and the twain who sprung from actor , phyleus thither brought from elis ;
