Out of the multitude — [[his]3592-the god of sleep , dissolved in sloth thousand sons]3597-his thousand sons — [the god of sleep]3595-the god of sleep raised [Morpheus]1032-morpheus by [his]1032-morpheus power . Most skillful of [[his]3592-the god of sleep , dissolved in sloth sons]3599-his sons , [who had the art of imitating any human shape]3600-who had the art of imitating any human shape ; and dexterously could imitate in [men]1399-men the gait and countenance , and every mode of speaking . [He]1032-morpheus could simulate the dress and customary words of [any man [he]1032-morpheus chose to represent]3602-any man he chose to represent — but [he]1032-morpheus could not assume the form of anything but [man]1330-man . Such was [his]3592-the god of sleep , dissolved in sloth art . [Another of [Sleep]1033-sleep 's sons]3604-another of sleep 's sons could imitate all kinds of animals ; such as a wild beast or a flying bird , or even a serpent with its twisted shape ; and [that son]3605-that son , by [the gods above]3606-the gods above was called [Icelos]298-icelos — but [the inhabitants of [earth]1287-earth]3607-the inhabitants of earth called [him]3605-that son [Phobetor]1034-phobetor — and [a third son]3609-a third son , named [Phantasos]1035-phantasos , cleverly could change [himself]3609-a third son into the forms of [earth that have no life]3610-earth that have no life ; into a statue , water , or a tree . It was the habit of [these three]3611-these three to show [themselves]3611-these three at night to [kings]5447-kings and [generals]3613-generals ; and [other sons]3614-other sons would frequently appear among [the people of the common class]3615-the people of the common class . All such [the aged god of [Sleep]1033-sleep]3616-the aged god of sleep passed by . Selecting only [Morpheus]1032-morpheus from among [the many brothers]3617-the many brothers to accomplish this , and execute what [Iris]471-iris had desired . And after all that work , [he]1032-morpheus dropped [his]1032-morpheus head , and sank again in languid drowsiness , shrinking to sloth within [[his]1032-morpheus lofty couch]3618-his lofty couch . [Morpheus]1032-morpheus at once flew through the night of darkness , on [his]1032-morpheus wings that make no sound , and in brief space of intervening time , arrived at [the Haemonian city walls]3619-the haemonian city walls ; and there [he]1032-morpheus laid aside [his]1032-morpheus wings , and took the face and form of [Ceyx]1020-ceyx . In that form as [one deprived of life , devoid of clothes]3620-one deprived of life , devoid of clothes , wan and ghastly , [he]1032-morpheus stood beside the bed of [the sad wife]3621-the sad wife . [The hero]5496-the hero 's beard seemed dripping , sea water streamed down from [his]5496-the hero drenching hair . Then leaning on the bed , while dropping tears were running down [his]5496-the hero cheeks , [he]5496-the hero said these words : “ [Most wretched wife]7824-most wretched wife , can [you]7824-most wretched wife still recognize [your]7824-most wretched wife own loved [Ceyx]1020-ceyx , or have [my]5496-the hero looks changed : so much with death [you]7824-most wretched wife can not ? — Look at [me]5496-the hero , and [you]7824-most wretched wife will be assured [I]5496-the hero am [your]7824-most wretched wife own : but here instead of [[your]7824-most wretched wife dear husband]7825-your dear husband , [you]7824-most wretched wife will find only [his]7825-your dear husband ghost . [Your]7824-most wretched wife faithful prayers did not avail , [Halcyone]1030-halcyone , and [I]5496-the hero have perished . Give up all deluding hopes of [my]5496-the hero return . The stormy Southwind caught [[my]5496-the hero ship]5723-my ship while sailing [the Aegean sea]7827-the aegean sea ; and there , tossed by the mighty wind , [[my]5496-the hero ship]5723-my ship was dashed to pieces . While [I]5496-the hero vainly called upon [your]7824-most wretched wife name , the angry waters closed above [my]5496-the hero drowning head and it is no uncertain messenger that tells [you]7824-most wretched wife this and nothing from vague rumors has been told . But it is [I]5496-the hero [myself]5496-the hero , come from the wreck , now telling [you]7824-most wretched wife [my]5496-the hero fate . Come then , arise shed tears , and put on mourning ; do not send [me]5496-the hero unlamented , down to [Tartarus]77-tartarus . ”[5496-the hero] And [Morpheus]1032-morpheus added to these words a voice which [she]3623-she would certainly believe was [[her]3623-she beloved husband]3624-her beloved husband 's ; and [he]3624-her beloved husband seemed to be shedding fond human tears ; and even [his]3624-her beloved husband hands were moved in gestures that [Ceyx]1020-ceyx often used . [Halcyone]1030-halcyone shed tears and groaned aloud , and , as [she]1030-halcyone moved [her]1030-halcyone arms and caught at [his]3624-her beloved husband dear body , [she]1030-halcyone embraced the vacant air [she]1030-halcyone cried out loudly , “ Stay , oh stay with [me]1030-halcyone ! Why do [you]3624-her beloved husband hurry from [me]1030-halcyone ? [We]7829-we will go together ! ”[1030-halcyone] Agitated by [her]1030-halcyone own excited voice ; and by what seemed to be [[her]1030-halcyone own dear husband]3625-her own dear husband , [she]1030-halcyone awoke from sleep . And first looked all about [her]1030-halcyone to persuade [herself]1030-halcyone that [he]3624-her beloved husband whom [she]1030-halcyone had lately seen must yet be with [her]1030-halcyone , for [she]1030-halcyone had aroused [the servants who in haste brought lights desired]3626-the servants who in haste brought lights desired . When [she]1030-halcyone could find [him]3624-her beloved husband nowhere , in despair [she]1030-halcyone struck [her]1030-halcyone face and tore [her]1030-halcyone garment from [her]1030-halcyone breast and beat [her]1030-halcyone breast with mourning hands . [She]1030-halcyone did not wait to loosen [her]1030-halcyone long hair ; but tore it with [her]1030-halcyone hands and to [[her]1030-halcyone nurse]7575-her nurse , who asked the cause of [her]1030-halcyone wild grief , [she]1030-halcyone cried : “ Alas , [Halcyone]1030-halcyone is no more ! no more ! with [her]1030-halcyone own Ceyx [she]1030-halcyone is dead ! is dead ! Away with words of comfort , [he]3624-her beloved husband is lost by shipwreck ! [I]1030-halcyone have seen [him]3624-her beloved husband , and [I]1030-halcyone knew [him]3624-her beloved husband surely — as a ghost [he]3624-her beloved husband came to [me]1030-halcyone ; and when desirous to detain [him]3624-her beloved husband , [I]1030-halcyone stretched forth [my]1030-halcyone arms to [him]3624-her beloved husband , [his]3624-her beloved husband ghost left [me]1030-halcyone — it vanished from [me]1030-halcyone ; but it surely was [the ghost of [[my]1030-halcyone dead husband]7831-my dead husband]7830-the ghost of my dead husband . If [you]7832-you ask description of it , [I]1030-halcyone must truly say [he]3629-his did not have [his]3629-his well known features — [he]3629-his was not so cheerful as [he]3629-his was in life ! Alas , [I]1030-halcyone saw [him]3629-his pale and naked , with [his]3629-his hair still dripping — [his]3629-his ghost from the waves stood on this very spot : ”[1030-halcyone] and while [she]3628-i moaned [she]3628-i sought [his]3629-his footprints on the floor . “ Alas , this was [my]3628-i fear , and this is what [my]3628-i mind shuddered to think of , when [I]3628-i begged that [you]7832-you would not desert [me]3628-i for the wind 's control . But how [I]3628-i wish , since [you]7832-you were sailing forth to perish , that [you]7832-you had but taken [me]3628-i with [you]7832-you . If [I]3628-i had gone with [you]7832-you , it would have been advantage to [me]3628-i , for [I]3628-i should have shared the whole course of [my]3628-i life with [you]7832-you and [you]7832-you would not have met a separate death . [I]3628-i linger here but [I]3628-i have met [my]3628-i death , [I]3628-i toss on waves , and drift upon [the sea]1298-the sea . “[3628-i] [My]0-i heart would be more cruel than the waves , if it should ask [me]0-i to endure this life — if [I]0-i should struggle to survive such grief . [I]0-i will not strive nor leave [you]3630-she so forlorn , at least [I]0-i 'll follow [you]3630-she to death . If not the urn at least the lettered stone shall keep [us]3631-us still together . If [your]3630-she bones are not united with [my]0-i bones , ' tis sure [our]3631-us names must be united . ”Overcome with grief , [she]3630-she could not say another word — but [she]3630-she continued wailing , and [her]3630-she groans were heaved up from [her]3630-she sorrow - stricken breast . At early dawn , [she]3630-she went from [[her]3630-she abode]7834-her abode down to [the seashore]7835-the seashore , where most wretchedly , [she]3630-she stood upon the spot from which [he]3632-he sailed , and sadly said ; “[3632-he] [He]3632-he lingered [here]2893-here while [he]3632-he was loosening the cables , and [he]3632-he kissed [me]0-i on [this seashore]3634-this seashore when [he]3632-he left [me]0-i [here]2893-here . ” And while [she]3630-she called to recollection all that [she]3630-she had seen when standing there , and while [she]3630-she looked far out on flowing waves from [there]1500-there , [she]3630-she noticed floating on [the distant sea]7837-the distant sea — what shall [I]3632-he say ? At first even [she]3630-she could not be sure of what [she]3630-she saw . But presently although still distant — it was certainly a floating corpse . [She]3630-she could not see what [man]1330-man [he]1330-man might be , but because it seemed to [her]3630-she it surely was a shipwrecked body , [she]3630-she was moved as at an omen and began to weep ; and , moaning as [she]3630-she stood there , said : — “[3632-he] [Ah]3636-you wretched one , whoever it may be , ah , wretched is [the wife whom [you]3636-you have left]3637-the wife whom you have left ! ” As driven by the waves the body came still nearer to [her]3630-she , [she]3630-she was less and less [the mistress of [herself]3630-she]7839-the mistress of herself , the more [she]3630-she looked upon it ; and , when it was close enough for [her]3630-she to see its features , [she]3630-she beheld [[her]3630-she husband]1381-her husband . “[3638-he] It is [he]3638-he , ” [she]3630-she cried and then [she]3630-she tore [her]3630-she face , [her]3630-she hair , [her]3630-she royal robe and then , extending both [her]3630-she trembling hands towards [Ceyx]1020-ceyx , “[3638-he] [So dearest one]3639-so dearest one ! So do [you]3636-you come to [me]0-i again ? ” [She]3630-she cried , “[3636-you] [O luckless mate]3640-o luckless mate . ” A mole , made by the craft of [man]1330-man , adjoins [the sea]1298-the sea and breaks the shoreward rush of waves . To this [she]3630-she leaped — it seemed impossible — and then , while beating the light air with wings that instant formed upon [her]3630-she , [she]3630-she flew on , a mourning bird , and skimmed above the waves . And while [she]3630-she lightly flew across [the sea]1298-the sea [her]3630-she clacking mouth with its long slender bill , full of complaining , uttered moaning sounds : but when [she]3630-she touched the still and pallied form , embracing [his]1020-ceyx dear limbs with [her]3630-she new wings , [she]3630-she gave cold kisses with [her]3630-she hardened bill . [All those who saw it]7844-all those who saw it doubted whether [Ceyx]1020-ceyx could feel [her]3630-she kisses ; and it seemed to [them]7844-all those who saw it the moving waves had raised [his]1020-ceyx countenance . But [he]1020-ceyx was truly conscious of [her]3630-she grief ; and through the pity of [the gods above]3606-the gods above , at last [they]7846-their both were changed to flying birds , together in [their]7846-their fate . [Their]7846-their love lived on , nor in these birds were marriage bonds dissolved , and [they]7846-their soon coupled and were [parent birds]7847-parent birds . Each winter during seven full days of calm [Halcyone]1030-halcyone broods on [her]1030-halcyone floating nest — [her]1030-halcyone nest that sails upon [a halcyon sea]7848-a halcyon sea : the passage of [the deep]1961-the deep is free from storms , throughout those seven full days ; and [Aeolus]665-aeolus restraining harmful winds , within [[their]7846-their cave]7850-their cave , for [[his]665-aeolus descendants]7851-his descendants ' sake gives [halcyon seas]7852-halcyon seas . [An old man]7853-an old man saw [the two birds]7854-the two birds fly across [the wide extended sea]7855-the wide extended sea and praised [their]7854-the two birds love , undying to the end . [[His]7853-an old man old friend who stood near [him]7853-an old man]7856-his old friend who stood near him , said , “[3636-you] There is another bird , which [you]3641-you can see skimming above the waves with folded legs drawn up ; ” and as [he]7853-an old man spoke , [he]7853-an old man pointed at a divedapper , which had a long throat , and continued , “[3636-you] It was first [the son of [a great king]3643-a great king]3642-the son of a great king , as [Ceyx]1020-ceyx , was : and if [you]3641-you wish to know [his]3642-the son of a great king ancestry , [I]0-i can assure [you]3641-you [he]3642-the son of a great king descended from [Ilus]299-ilus , [Assaracus]300-assaracus , and [Ganymede]301-ganymede — taken by [Jupiter]475-jupiter , and [old Laomedon]782-laomedon , and [Priam]1036-priam , [ruler at the fall of]3644-ruler at the fall of [Troy]250-troy . “ [Aesacus]1037-aesacus was [the brother of [the great illustrious Hector]7858-the great illustrious hector]7857-the brother of the great illustrious hector ; and , if [he]1037-aesacus had not been victimized by a strange fate in youth , [he]1037-aesacus would have equalled [Hector]1038-hector 's glorious fame , [Hector]1038-hector was [child of Hecuba]7859-child of hecuba , who was [daughter of [Dymas]1039-dymas]7860-daughter of dymas . [Alexirhoe]1040-alexirhoe , [the daughter of [the two - horned Granicus]7862-the two - horned granicus]7861-the daughter of the two - horned granicus , so rumor has it , secretly brought forth [Aesacus]1037-aesacus , hidden under [Ida]602-ida 's shade . “[3645-he] [He]3645-he loathed [the city]5520-the city and away from [court]3647-court , frequented [lonely mountains]3648-lonely mountains and [the fields of [unambitious peasants]3650-unambitious peasants]3649-the fields of unambitious peasants . Rarely [he]3645-he was seen among [the throngs of [Ilium]302-ilium]3651-the throngs of ilium . — yet , neither churlish nor impregnable to love 's appeal , [he]3645-he saw [Hesperia]1041-hesperia , [the daughter of Cebrenus]3652-the daughter of cebrenus , while [she]1041-hesperia was once resting on the velvet - shaded banks of [[her]1041-hesperia sire]6289-her sire ['s cherished stream]3654-'s cherished stream . [Aesacus]1037-aesacus had so often sought for [her]1041-hesperia throughout [the woods]1317-the woods . “ Just when [he]3645-he saw [her]1041-hesperia , while [she]1041-hesperia rested there , [her]1041-hesperia hair spread on [her]1041-hesperia shoulders to the sun , [she]1041-hesperia saw [him]3645-he , and without delay [she]1041-hesperia fled , even as the frightened deer runs from the wolf or as the water - duck , when [she]1041-hesperia has left [[her]1041-hesperia favored stream]7863-her favored stream , surprised , flies from the hawk . [Aesacus]1037-aesacus followed [her]1041-hesperia , as swift with love as [she]1041-hesperia was swift with fear . But in the grass a lurking snake struck at [her]1041-hesperia rosy heel and left its venom in [her]1041-hesperia flesh . — And so , [her]1041-hesperia flight was ended by untimely death . “[1037-aesacus] Oh , frantic , [he]1037-aesacus embraced [her]1041-hesperia breathless form , and cried : ‘ Alas , alas , that [I]0-i pursued ! [I]0-i did not dream of such a dreadful fate ! Success was not worth such a price [I]0-i and the snake together caused [your]1041-hesperia death — [the serpent]3656-the serpent gave the wound , [I]0-i was the cause . [Mine]0-i is the greater guilt , and by [my]0-i death [I]0-i 'll give [you]1041-hesperia consolation for [your]1041-hesperia death ! ’ ” “[1037-aesacus] [He]1037-aesacus said those words and leaped on a high rock , which years of sounding waves had undermined , and hurled [himself]1037-aesacus into [the sea below]3657-the sea below . “ [Tethys]507-tethys was moved with pity for [his]1037-aesacus fall , received [him]1037-aesacus softly , and then covered [him]1037-aesacus with feathers , as [he]1037-aesacus swam among the waves . The death [he]1037-aesacus sought for was not granted [him]1037-aesacus . At this [the lover]7864-the lover was wroth . Against [his]1037-aesacus will , [he]1037-aesacus was obliged to live in [his]1037-aesacus distress , with opposition to [his]1037-aesacus spirit that desired departure from the wretched pain of life . “[1037-aesacus] As [he]1037-aesacus assumed upon [his]1037-aesacus shoulders wings newformed , [he]1037-aesacus flew aloft and from that height again [he]1037-aesacus plunged [his]1037-aesacus body in the waves [his]1037-aesacus feathers broke all danger of that fall — and this new bird , [Aesacus]1037-aesacus , plunged headlong into [the deep]1961-the deep , and tried incessantly that method of destruction . [His]1037-aesacus great love unsatisfied , made [his]1037-aesacus sad body lean , till even the spaces fixed between the joints of [his]1037-aesacus legs have grown long ; [his]1037-aesacus neck is long ; so that [his]1037-aesacus head is far away from [his]1037-aesacus lean body . Still [he]1037-aesacus hunts [the sea]1298-the sea and takes [his]1037-aesacus name from diving in the waves . Sadly [[his]1037-aesacus father]1530-his father , [Priam]1036-priam , mourned for [him]1037-aesacus , not knowing that [young Aesacus]1037-aesacus had assumed wings on [his]1037-aesacus shoulders , and was yet alive . Then also [Hector]1038-hector with [[his]1038-hector brothers]5518-his brothers made complete but unavailing sacrifice , upon [a tomb which bore [his]1038-hector carved name]3662-a tomb which bore his carved name . [Paris]845-paris was absent . But soon afterwards , [he]1038-hector brought into [that land]5048-that land [a ravished wife]3664-a ravished wife , [Helen]1042-helen , the cause of a disastrous war , together with [a thousand ships]3665-a thousand ships , and all [the great Pelasgian nation]3666-the great pelasgian nation . Vengeance would not long have been delayed , but the fierce winds raged over seas impassable , and held [the ships]2641-the ships at [fishy Aulis]303-fishy aulis . [They]2641-the ships could not be moved from [the Boeotian land]3668-the boeotian land . Here , when a sacrifice had been prepared to Jove , according to the custom of [[their]2641-the ships land]2458-their land , and when the ancient altar glowed with fire , [the Greeks]2456-the greeks observed an azure colored snake crawling up in a plane tree near [the place where [they]2641-the ships had just begun [their]2641-the ships sacrifice]3671-the place where they had just begun their sacrifice . Among the highest branches was a nest , with twice four birds — and those the serpent seized together with the mother - bird as [she]3664-a ravished wife was fluttering round [her]3664-a ravished wife loss . And every bird the serpent buried in [his]1038-hector greedy maw . [All]5537-all stood amazed : but [Calchas]1043-calchas , who perceived the truth , exclaimed , “ Rejoice [Pelasgian men]7865-pelasgian men , for [we]7865-pelasgian men shall conquer ; [Troy]250-troy will fall ; although the toil of war must long continue — so the nine birds equal nine long years of war . ”[1043-calchas] And while [he]3673-he prophesied , the serpent , coiled about the tree , was transformed to a stone , curled crooked as a snake . but [Nereus]467-nereus stormed in those Aonian waves , and not [a ship]5175-a ship moved forward . [Some]4905-some declared that [Neptune]472-neptune thus was aiding [Troy]250-troy , because [he]472-neptune built the walls of [that great city]3676-that great city . Not so [Calchas]1043-calchas , [son of Thestor]3677-son of thestor ! [He]3673-he knew all the truth , and told [them]5537-all plainly that [a virgin]1462-a virgin 's blood alone might end [a virgin goddess]3679-a virgin goddess ' wrath . The public good at last prevailed above affection , and the duty of [a king]3680-a king at last proved stronger than [a father]1601-a father 's love : when [Iphigenia]1044-iphigenia as a sacrifice , stood by the altar with [[her]1044-iphigenia weeping maids]3682-her weeping maids and was about to offer [her]1044-iphigenia chaste blood , [the goddess]4979-the goddess , moved by pity , spread a mist before [their]5537-all eyes , amid the sacred rites and mournful supplications . It is said [she]4979-the goddess left a hind there in [[the maiden]5425-the maiden 's place]3685-the maiden 's place and carried Iphigenia away . The hind , as it was fitting , calmed [Diana]484-diana 's rage and also calmed the anger of [the sea]1298-the sea . [The thousand ships]3687-the thousand ships received the winds astern and gained [the Phrygian shore]3688-the phrygian shore . There is [a spot convenient in the center of [the world]1360-the world]3689-a spot convenient in the center of the world , between [the land]1295-the land and [sea]1296-sea and [the wide heavens]3693-the wide heavens , the meeting of [the threefold universe]3694-the threefold universe . From there is seen all things that anywhere exist , although in [distant regions far]3695-distant regions far ; and there all sounds of [earth and space]3696-earth and space are heard . Fame is possessor of [this chosen place]3697-this chosen place , and has [her]4979-the goddess habitation in [a tower]3698-a tower , which aids [her]4979-the goddess view from [that exalted highs]3699-that exalted highs . And [she]4979-the goddess has fixed there numerous avenues , and openings , a thousand , to [[her]4979-the goddess tower]3700-her tower and no gates with closed entrance , for [the house]5402-the house is open , night and day , of sounding brass , reechoing the tones of every voice . [It]5402-the house must repeat whatever [it]5402-the house may hear ; and there 's no rest , and silence in no part . There is no clamor ; but the murmuring sound of subdued voices , such as may arise from waves of [a far sea]3702-a far sea , which [one]1998-one may hear who listens at a distance ; or the sound which ends a thunderclap , when [Jupiter]475-jupiter has clashed black clouds together . [Fickle crowds]3704-fickle crowds are always in [that hall]3705-that hall , that come and go , and myriad rumors — false tales mixed with true — are circulated in confusing words . [Some]4905-some fill [their]4905-some empty ears with all this talk , and some spread elsewhere all that 's told to [them]4905-some . The volume of wild fiction grows apace , and [each narrator]3707-each narrator adds to what [he]3707-each narrator hears . Credulity is there and rash Mistake , and empty Joy , and coward Fear alarmed by quick Sedition , and soft Whisper — all of doubtful life . [Fame]691-fame sees what things are done in [heaven]1454-heaven and on [the sea]1298-the sea , and on [the earth]1289-the earth . [She]691-fame spies all things in [the wide universe]1570-the wide universe . [Fame]691-fame now had spread the tidings , [a great fleet of [Greek ships]3713-greek ships]3712-a great fleet of greek ships was at that time on [its]3712-a great fleet of greek ships way , [an army of [brave men]3715-brave men]3714-an army of brave men . [The Trojans]3716-the trojans stood , all ready to prevent [the hostile Greeks]3717-the hostile greeks from landing on [[their]3716-the trojans shores]2581-their shores . By the decree of [Fate]959-fate , [the first man killed of [the invaders]3720-the invaders ' force]3719-the first man killed of the invaders ' force was strong Protesilaus , by the spear of [valiant Hector]1038-hector , whose unthought - of power at that time was discovered by [the Greeks]1045-the greeks to [their]1045-the greeks great cost . [The Phyrgians]1046-the phyrgians also learned , at no small cost of blood , what warlike strength came from [the Grecian land]3721-the grecian land . [The Sigean shores]3722-the sigean shores grew red with death - blood : [Cygnus]1047-cygnus , [[Neptune]472-neptune 's son]3723-neptune 's son , there slew [a thousand men]3415-a thousand men : for which , in wrath , [Achilles]1048-achilles pressed [[his]1048-achilles rapid chariot]3725-his rapid chariot straight through [the Trojan army]3726-the trojan army ; making a lane with [his]1048-achilles great spear , shaped from a Pelion tree . And as [he]1048-achilles sought through the fierce battle 's press , either for [Cygnus]1047-cygnus or for [Hector]1038-hector , [he]1048-achilles met [Cygnus]1047-cygnus and engaged at once with [him]1047-cygnus ( Fate had preserved [great Hector]1038-hector from such foe till ten years from that day ) . Cheering [his]1048-achilles steeds , [their]3727-their white necks pressed upon the straining yoke , [he]1048-achilles steered [the chariot]5143-the chariot towards [[his]1048-achilles foe]6079-his foe , and , brandishing the spear with [his]1048-achilles strong arm , [he]1048-achilles cried , “ Whoever [you]6079-his foe may be , [you]6079-his foe have the consolation of a glorious death [you]6079-his foe die by [me]1048-achilles , [Haemonian Achilles]1048-achilles ! ”[1048-achilles] [His]1048-achilles heavy spear flew after the fierce words . Although the spear was whirled direct and true , yet nothing it availed with sharpened point . It only bruised , as with a blunted stroke , the breast of [Cygnus]1047-cygnus ! “ By report [we]7866-we knew of [you]1048-achilles before this battle , [goddess born]7867-goddess born . ”[5036-the other] [The other]5036-the other answered [him]1048-achilles , “ But why are [you]1048-achilles surprised that [I]5036-the other escape the threatened wound ? ”[5036-the other] ( [Achilles]1048-achilles was surprised ) . “ This helmet crowned , great with its tawny horse - hair , and this shield , broad - hollowed , on [my]1048-achilles left arm , are not held for help in war : they are but ornament , as [Mars]565-mars wears armor . All of [them]7868-them shall be put off , and [I]1048-achilles will fight with [you]6079-his foe unhurt . It is a privilege that [I]1048-achilles was born not as [you]6079-his foe , of [a Nereid but of [him]1048-achilles whose powerful rule is over [Nereus]467-nereus , [[his]1048-achilles daughters]6515-his daughters and [[their]6515-his daughters ocean]7871-their ocean]7869-a nereid but of him whose powerful rule is over nereus , his daughters and their ocean . ”[1048-achilles] So , [he]1048-achilles spoke . Immediately [he]1048-achilles threw [his]1048-achilles spear against [Achilles]1048-achilles , destined to pierce the curving shield through brass , and through nine folds of tough bull 's hide . It stopped there , for it could not pierce the tenth . [The hero]5496-the hero wrenched it out , and hurled again a quivering spear at [Cygnus]1047-cygnus , with great strength . [The Trojan]1049-aeneas stood unwounded and unharmed . Nor did a third spear injure [Cygnus]1047-cygnus , though [he]1047-cygnus stood there with [his]1047-cygnus body all exposed . [Achilles]1048-achilles raged at this , as a wild bull in open circus , when with dreadful horns [he]1048-achilles butts against the hanging purple robes which stir [his]1048-achilles wrath and there observes how [they]3732-they evade [him]1048-achilles , quite unharmed by [his]1048-achilles attack . [Achilles]1048-achilles then examined [his]1048-achilles good spear , to see if by some chance the iron point was broken from it , but the point was firm , fixed on the wooden shaft . “ [My]1048-achilles hand is weak , ”[1048-achilles] [he]1048-achilles said , “ but is it possible [its]7872-its strength forsook [me]1048-achilles though it never has before ? For surely [I]1048-achilles had [my]1048-achilles accustomed strength , when first [I]1048-achilles overthrew [Lyrnessus]304-lyrnessus ' walls , or when [I]1048-achilles won [the isle of Tenedos]7873-the isle of tenedos or [Thebes]103-thebes ( then under King Eetion ) and [I]1048-achilles drenched both with [[their]7874-their own peoples]7875-their own peoples ' blood , or when [the river Caycus]7876-the river caycus ran red with slaughter of [[its]7876-the river caycus people]2685-its people , or , when twice [Telephus]1050-telephus felt the virtue of [my]1048-achilles spear . On [this field]3280-this field also , where such heaps lie slain , [my]1048-achilles right hand surely has proved its true might ; and it is mighty . ”[1048-achilles] So [he]1048-achilles spoke of strength , remembered . But as if in proof against [his]1048-achilles own distrust , [he]1048-achilles hurled a spear against [Menoetes]1051-menoetes , [a soldier in the Lycian ranks]3733-a soldier in the lycian ranks . The sharp spear tore [the victim]6059-the victim 's coat of mail and pierced [his]1051-menoetes breast beneath . [Achilles]1048-achilles , when [he]1048-achilles saw [his]1048-achilles dying head strike on the earth wrenched the same spear from out the reeking wound , and said , “ This is the hand , and this the spear [I]1048-achilles conquered with ; and [I]1048-achilles will use the same against [him]1051-menoetes who in luck escaped [their]7879-their power ; and the result should favor as [I]1048-achilles pray [the helpful gods]7880-the helpful gods . ”[1048-achilles] And , as [he]1048-achilles said such words , in haste [he]1048-achilles hurled [his]1048-achilles ashen spear , again at [Cygnus]1047-cygnus . It went straight and struck unshunned . Resounding on the shoulder of [that foe]3735-that foe , it bounced back as if it hit a wall or [solid cliff]3736-solid cliff . Yet when [Achilles]1048-achilles saw just where the spear struck , [Cygnus]1047-cygnus there was stained with blood . [He]1048-achilles instantly rejoiced ; but vainly , for it was [Menoetes]1051-menoetes ' blood ! Then in a sudden rage , [Achilles]1048-achilles leaped down headlong from [[his]1048-achilles lofty chariot]3737-his lofty chariot ; and , seeking [[his]1048-achilles god - favored foe]3738-his god - favored foe , [he]1048-achilles struck in conflict fiercely , with [his]1048-achilles gleaming sword . Although [he]1048-achilles saw that [he]1048-achilles had pierced both shield and helmet through , [he]1048-achilles did not harm [the foe]3739-the foe — [his]1048-achilles sword was even blunted on the flesh . [Achilles]1048-achilles could not hold [himself]1048-achilles for rage , but furious , with [his]1048-achilles sword - hilt and [his]1048-achilles shield [he]1048-achilles battered wildly the uncovered face and hollow - temples of [[his]1048-achilles Trojan foe]3740-his trojan foe . [Cygnus]1047-cygnus gave way ; [Achilles]1048-achilles rushed on [him]1047-cygnus , buffeting fiercely , so that [he]1047-cygnus could not recover from the shock . Fear seized upon [Cygnus]1047-cygnus , and darkness swam before [his]1047-cygnus eyes . Then , as [he]1047-cygnus moved back with retreating steps , a large stone hindered [him]1047-cygnus and blocked [his]1047-cygnus way . [His]1047-cygnus back pushed against this , [Achilles]1048-achilles seized and dashed [him]1047-cygnus violently to the ground . Then pressing with buckler and hard knees the breast of [Cygnus]1047-cygnus , [he]1048-achilles unlaced the helmet thongs , wound them about [the foeman]3741-the foeman 's neck and drew them tightly under [his]1047-cygnus chin , till [Cygnus]1047-cygnus ' throat could take no breath of life . [Achilles]1048-achilles rose eager to strip [[his]1048-achilles conquered foe]3742-his conquered foe but found [his]1048-achilles empty armor , for [the god of ocean]1647-the god of ocean had changed [the victim]6059-the victim into that white bird whose name [he]1048-achilles lately bore . There was a truce for many days after this opening fight while [both sides]3745-both sides resting , laid aside [their]3745-both sides arms . [A watchful guard]3746-a watchful guard patroled the Phrygian walls ; [the Grecian trenches]3747-the grecian trenches had [[their]3747-the grecian trenches watchful guard]3748-their watchful guard . Then , on a festal day , [Achilles]1048-achilles gave the blood of [a slain heifer]3749-a slain heifer to obtain the favor of [Athena]1052-athena for [their]3750-their cause . The entrails burned upon the altar , while the odor , grateful to [the deities]1400-the deities , was mounting to the skies . When sacred rites were done , a banquet for [the heroes]3752-the heroes was served on [their]3752-the heroes tables . There [the Grecian chiefs]3753-the grecian chiefs reclined on couches ; while [they]3753-the grecian chiefs satisfied [themselves]3753-the grecian chiefs with roasted flesh , and banished cares : and thirst with wine . Nor harp nor singing voice nor long pipe made of boxwood pierced with holes , delighted [them]3753-the grecian chiefs . [They]3753-the grecian chiefs talked of [their]3753-the grecian chiefs own deeds and valor , all that thrilling night : and even the strength of [enemies whom [they]3753-the grecian chiefs had met and overcome]3754-enemies whom they had met and overcome . What else could [they]3753-the grecian chiefs admit or think of , while [the great Achilles]3397-the great achilles spoke or listened to [them]3753-the grecian chiefs ? But especially the recent victory over [Cygnus]1047-cygnus held [them]3753-the grecian chiefs ardent . [Wonderful]1053-wonderful it seemed to [them]3753-the grecian chiefs that [such a youth]3756-such a youth could be composed of flesh not penetrable by the sharpest spear ; of flesh which blunted even hardened steel , and never could be wounded . [All the Greeks]3757-all the greeks , and even [Achilles]1048-achilles wondered at the thought . Then [Nestor]911-nestor said to [them]3753-the grecian chiefs : “ During [your]3753-the grecian chiefs time , [Cygnus]1047-cygnus has been [the only man [you]3753-the grecian chiefs [knew who could despise all weapons and whose flesh could not be pierced by thrust of sword or spear]7882-knew who could despise all weapons and whose flesh could not be pierced by thrust of sword or spear]7881-the only man you knew who could despise all weapons and whose flesh could not be pierced by thrust of sword or spear . But long ago [I]911-nestor saw [another man able to bear unharmed a thousand strokes]7883-another man able to bear unharmed a thousand strokes , Caeneus of [Thessaly]27-thessaly , Caeneus who lived upon [Mt. Othrys]519-othrys . [He]3758-he was famed in war yet , strange to say , by birth [he]3758-he was [a woman]5609-a woman ! ”[911-nestor] Then all expressed the greatest wonderment , and begged to hear the story of [his]3758-he life . [Achilles]1048-achilles cried , “ [O eloquent old man]7885-o eloquent old man ! The wisdom of [our]3760-our age ! [All of [us]3760-our]7886-all of us wish to hear , who was [this Caeneus]7887-this caeneus ? Why was [he]7887-this caeneus changed to the other sex ? in what campaigns , and in what wars was [he]7887-this caeneus so known to [you]3753-the grecian chiefs ? Who conquered [him]7887-this caeneus , if any ever did ? ”[1048-achilles] [The aged man]3759-the aged man replied to [them]3760-our with care : — “ Although [my]3759-the aged man great age is a harm to [me]3759-the aged man , and many actions of [my]3759-the aged man early days escape [my]3759-the aged man memory ; yet , most of them are well remembered . Nothing of old days , amid so many deeds of war and peace , can be more firmly fixed upon [my]3759-the aged man mind than the strange story [I]3759-the aged man shall tell of [him]7887-this caeneus . “[3759-the aged man] If long extent of years made [anyone a witness of most wonderful events]3761-anyone a witness of most wonderful events and many , truly [I]0-i may say to [you]3760-our that [I]0-i have lived two hundred years ; and now have entered [my]0-i third century . [The daughter of [Elatus]1054-elatus]3762-the daughter of elatus , [Caenis]1055-caenis , was remarkable for charm — most beautiful of [all Thessalian maidens]3763-all thessalian maidens — many sighed for [her]3762-the daughter of elatus in vain through all [the neighboring towns]3764-the neighboring towns and [yours]3765-yours , [Achilles]1048-achilles , for that was [[her]3762-the daughter of elatus home]2383-her home . But [Peleus]872-peleus did not try to win [her]3762-the daughter of elatus love , for [he]872-peleus was either married at that time to [[your]3765-yours dear mother]3767-your dear mother , or was pledged to [her]3762-the daughter of elatus . “ [Caenis]1055-caenis never became [the willing bride of [any suitor]7889-any suitor]7888-the willing bride of any suitor ; but [report]1056-report declares , while [she]1055-caenis was walking on [a lonely shore]7890-a lonely shore , [the god of ocean]1647-the god of ocean saw and ravished [her]1055-caenis . And in the joy of that love [Neptune]472-neptune said , ‘ Request of [me]3768-the son of bold ixion whatever [you]1055-caenis desire , and nothing shall deny [your]1055-caenis dearest wish ! ’ — the story tells [us]7892-us that [he]472-neptune made this pledge . And [Caenis]1055-caenis said to [Neptune]472-neptune , ‘ The great wrong , which [I]3768-the son of bold ixion have suffered from [you]472-neptune justifies the wonderful request that [I]3768-the son of bold ixion must make ; [I]3768-the son of bold ixion ask that [I]3768-the son of bold ixion may never suffer such an injury again . Grant [I]3768-the son of bold ixion may be no longer [woman]1432-woman , and [I]3768-the son of bold ixion 'll ask no more . ’ while [she]1055-caenis was speaking to [him]472-neptune , the last words of [her]1055-caenis strange prayer were uttered in so deep , in such a manly tone , it seemed indeed they must be from [a man]5610-a man . — That was a fact : [Neptune]472-neptune not only had allowed [her]1055-caenis prayer but made [the new man]7895-the new man proof against all wounds of spear or sword . Rejoicing in the gift [he]472-neptune went [his]472-neptune way as [Caeneus Atracides]904-caeneus , spent years in every manful exercise , and roamed [the plains of [northern Thessaly]27-thessaly]7896-the plains of northern thessaly . “[3768-the son of bold ixion] [The son of [bold Ixion]660-ixion]3768-the son of bold ixion , [Pirithous wedding Hippodame]1057-pirithous wedding hippodame , had asked as [guests the cloud - born centaurs]3769-guests the cloud - born centaurs to recline around the ordered tables , in [a cool cave]3770-a cool cave , set under some shading trees . [Thessalian chiefs]3771-thessalian chiefs were there and [I]0-i [myself]0-i was with [them]3771-thessalian chiefs [there]1500-there . [The festal place]3773-the festal place resounded with the rout in noisy clamor , singing nuptial verse ; and in [the great room]3774-the great room , filled with smoking fire , [the maiden]5425-the maiden came escorted by [a crowd of [matrons]5692-matrons and [young married women]3778-young married women]3776-a crowd of matrons and young married women ; [she]5425-the maiden most beautiful of all that lovely throng . “ And so [Pirithous]1058-pirithous , [the fortunate son]7897-the fortunate son , of [bold Ixion]660-ixion , was so praised by [all]5537-all , for [his]1058-pirithous pure joy and lovely wife , it seemed [his]1058-pirithous very blessings must have led to fatal harm : for [savage Eurytus]1059-eurytus , wildest of [the wild centaurs , now inflamed with sudden envy , drunkenness , and lust]7899-the wild centaurs , now inflamed with sudden envy , drunkenness , and lust , upset the tables and made havoc there so dreadful , that the banquet suddenly was changed from love to uproar . Seized by the hair , [the bride]6113-the bride was violently dragged away . When [Eurytus]1059-eurytus caught up [Hippodame]1057-pirithous wedding hippodame [each one of [all the centaurs]7902-all the centaurs]7901-each one of all the centaurs took at will [the maid or matron that [he]1059-eurytus longed for most]7903-the maid or matron that he longed for most . [The palace]2549-the palace , seeming like [a captured town]7905-a captured town , resounded with affrighted shrieks of [women]1730-women . At once [we]7907-we all sprang up . And [Theseus]856-theseus cried , “[5425-the maiden] What madness , [Eurytus]1059-eurytus , has driven [you]1059-eurytus to this vile wickedness ! While [I]0-i have life , [you]1059-eurytus dare attack [Pirithous]1058-pirithous . [You]1059-eurytus know not what [you]1059-eurytus do , for one wrong injures both ! ’ [The valiant hero]3779-the valiant hero did not merely talk : [he]3779-the valiant hero pushed [them]3780-them off as [they]3780-them were pressing on , and rescued [her]3781-her whom [Eurytus]1059-eurytus had seized . Since [Eurytus]1059-eurytus could not defend such deeds with words , [he]1059-eurytus turned and beat with violent hands the face of [him]1059-eurytus who saved [the bride]6113-the bride and struck [his]1059-eurytus generous breast . By chance , an ancient bowl was near at hand . This rough with figures carved , [the son of [Aegeus]855-aegeus]3783-the son of aegeus caught and hurled it full in [that vile centaur]3784-that vile centaur 's face . [He]3779-the valiant hero , spouting out thick gouts of blood , and bleeding from [his]3779-the valiant hero wounds — [his]3779-the valiant hero brains and wine mixed , — kicked the blood - soaked sand . [[His]3779-the valiant hero double membered centaur brothers]3785-his double membered centaur brothers , wild with passion at [his]3779-the valiant hero death , all shouted out , ‘ To arms ! to arms ! ’ [Their]3785-his double membered centaur brothers courage raised by wine ! In [their]3785-his double membered centaur brothers first onset , hurled cups flew about , and shattered wine casks , hollow basins — things before adapted to a banquet , now for death and carnage in the furious fight . [Amycus]1060-amycus first ( [[Opinion]1061-opinion 's son]3786-opinion 's son ) began to spoil the inner sanctuary of [its]3787-its gifts . [He]1060-amycus snatched up from that shrine a chandelier , adorned with glittering lamps , and lifted high , with all the force of one who strives to break the bull s white neck with sacrificial axe , [he]1060-amycus dashed it at the head of [Celadon]728-mendesian celadon , [one of [the Lapithae]3789-the lapithae]3788-one of the lapithae , and crushed [his]1060-amycus skull into the features of [his]1060-amycus face . [His]1060-amycus eyes leaped from [his]1060-amycus sockets , and the shattered bones of [his]1060-amycus smashed face gave way so that [his]1060-amycus nose was driven back and fastened in [his]1060-amycus throat . But [Belates of Pella]1062-belates of pella tore away a table - leg of maple wood and felled [Amycus]1060-amycus to the ground ; [his]1060-amycus sunken chin cast down upon [his]1060-amycus breast ; and , as [he]1060-amycus spat [his]1060-amycus teeth out mixed with blood , a second blow despatched [him]1060-amycus to the shades of [Tartarus]77-tartarus . “ [Gryneus]1063-gryneus , seeing a smoking altar , cried , ‘ Good use for this , ’ with which words [he]1063-gryneus raised up that heavy , blazing altar . Hurling it into the middle of [the Lapithae]308-the lapithae , [he]1063-gryneus struck down [Broteas]716-broteas and [Orius]1064-orius : [Mycale]1065-mycale , [mother of [that Orius]7909-that orius]7908-mother of that orius , was famous for [her]1065-mycale incantations , which [she]1065-mycale had often used to conjure down the shining twin - horns of the unwilling moon . [Exadius]1066-exadius threatened , ‘ [You]1063-gryneus shall not escape ! Let [me]1069-victorious but have a weapon ! ’ And with that , [he]1063-gryneus whirled the antlers of a votive stag , which [he]1063-gryneus found there , hung on a tall pine - tree ; and with that double - branching horn [he]1063-gryneus pierced the eyes of [Gryneus]1063-gryneus , and [he]1063-gryneus gouged them out . One eye stuck to the horn ; the other rolled down on [his]1063-gryneus beard , to which it strictly clung in dreadful clotted gore . Then [Rhoetus]693-rhoetus snatched a blazing brand of plum - wood from an altar and whirling it upon the right , smashed through the temples of [Charaxus]1067-charaxus , [wonderful with golden hair]7910-wonderful with golden hair . Seized by the violent flames , [his]1067-charaxus yellow locks burned fiercely , as a field of autumn grain ; and even the scorching blood gave from the sore wound a terrific noise as a red - hot iron in pincers which [the smith]7911-the smith lifts out and plunges in the tepid pool , hissing and sizzling . [Charaxus]1067-charaxus shook the fire from [his]1067-charaxus burnt locks ; and heaved up on [his]1067-charaxus shoulders a large threshold stone torn from the ground — a weight sufficient for [a team of oxen]7912-a team of oxen . The vast weight impeded [him]1067-charaxus , so that it could not even touch [[his]1067-charaxus foe]6079-his foe — and yet , the massive stone did hit [[his]1067-charaxus friend]6633-his friend , [Cometes]1068-cometes , who was standing near to [him]1067-charaxus , and crushed [him]1067-charaxus down . Then [Rhoetus]693-rhoetus , crazed with joy , exulting yelled , ‘ [I]1069-victorious pray that all of [you]6079-his foe may be so strong ! ’ Wielding [his]1067-charaxus half - burnt stake with heavy blows again and again , [he]1067-charaxus broke the sutures of [[his]1067-charaxus enemy]6083-his enemy 's skull , until the bones were mingled with [his]1067-charaxus oozing brains . “[1069-victorious] [Victorious]1069-victorious , then rushed [he]1069-victorious upon [Evagrus]1070-evagrus , and [Corythus]721-corythus and [Dryas]700-elis . First of these was [youthful Corythus]721-corythus , whose cheeks were then just covered with soft down . When [he]721-corythus fell dead , [Evagrus]1070-evagrus cried , ‘ What glory do [you]1069-victorious get , killing [a boy]5624-a boy ? ’ But [Rhoetus]693-rhoetus did not give [him]1069-victorious time for uttering one word more . [He]693-rhoetus pushed the red hot stake into [the foeman]3741-the foeman 's mouth , while [he]693-rhoetus still spoke , and down into [his]693-rhoetus lungs . [He]693-rhoetus then pursued [the savage Dryas]3792-the savage dryas , while whirling the red fire fast about [his]3792-the savage dryas head ; but not with like success , for , while [he]693-rhoetus still rejoiced in killings , [Dryas]700-elis turned and pierced [him]693-rhoetus with a stake where neck and shoulder meet . “ [Rhoetus]693-rhoetus groaned and with a great effort pulled the stake out from the bone , then fled away , drenched in [his]693-rhoetus blood . And [Orneus]1071-orneus followed [him]693-rhoetus . [Lycabas]616-lycabas fled , and [Medon]620-medon with a wound in [his]620-medon right shoulder . [Thaumas]661-thaumas and [Pisenor]1072-pisenor and [Mermerus]1073-mermerus fled with [them]7916-them . [Mermerus]1073-mermerus , who used to excell all others in a race , ran slowly , crippled by a recent wound . [Pholus]1074-pholus and [Melaneus]723-melaneus ran for [their]7916-them lives and with [them]7916-them [Abas]672-abas , hunter of wild boars and [Asbolus]1075-asbolus , [the augur , who in vain had urged [[his]672-abas friends]5709-his friends to shun that hapless fight]7917-the augur , who in vain had urged his friends to shun that hapless fight . As [Nessus]938-nessus joined the rout , [he]938-nessus said to [him]938-nessus , ‘ [You]938-nessus need not flee , for [you]938-nessus shall be reserved [a victim]7919-a victim for the bow of [Hercules]857-hercules ! ’ but [neither Lycidas]7920-neither lycidas , [Eurynomus]1076-eurynomus nor [Areos]1077-areos , nor [Imbreus]1078-imbreus had escaped from death : for all of these the strong right hand of [Dryas]700-elis pierced , as [they]7920-neither lycidas confronted [him]938-nessus . [Crenaeus]1079-crenaeus there received a wound in front . Although [he]1079-crenaeus turned in flight , as [he]1079-crenaeus looked back , a heavy javelin between [his]1079-crenaeus eyes pierced through [him]1079-crenaeus , where [his]1079-crenaeus nose and forehead joined . “[700-elis] In all this uproar , [Aphidas]1080-aphidas lay flat , in endless slumber from the wine [he]1080-aphidas drank , incessant , and [his]1080-aphidas nerveless hand still held the cup of mixed wine , as [he]1080-aphidas lay full stretched , upon a shaggy bear - skin from [Mount Ossa]309-mount ossa . When [Phorbas]697-phorbas saw [him]1080-aphidas , harmless in that sleep , [he]697-phorbas laid [his]697-phorbas fingers in [his]697-phorbas javelin 's thong , and shouted loudly , ‘ Mix [your]1080-aphidas wine , down there , with waters of [the Styx]278-the styx ! ’ And stopping talk , let fly [his]697-phorbas javelin at [the sleeping youth]3793-the sleeping youth — the ashen shaft , iron - tipped , was driven through [his]1080-aphidas neck , exposed , as [he]1080-aphidas by chance lay there — [his]1080-aphidas head thrown back . [He]1080-aphidas did not even feel a touch of death — and from [his]1080-aphidas deep - pierced throat [his]1080-aphidas crimson blood flowed out upon the couch , and in the wine - bowl still grasped in [his]1080-aphidas hand . “ [I]3794-i saw [Petraeus]1081-petraeus when [he]1081-petraeus strove to tear up from the earth , an acorn - bearing oak . And , while [he]1081-petraeus struggled with it , back and forth , and was just ready to wrench up the trunk , [Pirithous]1058-pirithous hurled a well aimed spear at [him]1081-petraeus , transfixed [his]1081-petraeus ribs , and pinned [his]1081-petraeus body tight , writhing , to that hard oak : and [Lycus]1082-lycus fell and [Chromis]715-chromis fell , before [Pirithous]1058-pirithous . “[3794-i] [They]3794-i gave less glory to [the conqueror]3795-the conqueror than [Helops]1083-helops or than [Dictys]611-dictys . [Helops]1083-helops was killed by a javelin , which pierced [his]1083-helops temples from the right side , clear through to [his]1083-helops left ear . And [Dictys]611-dictys , running in a desperate haste , hoping in vain , to escape [[Ixion]660-ixion 's son]2798-ixion 's son , slipped on the steep edge of a precipice ; and , as [he]1083-helops fell down headlong crashed into the top of a huge ash - tree , which impaled [his]1083-helops dying body on its broken spikes . “ [Aphareus]1084-aphareus , eager to avenge [him]1083-helops tried to lift a rock from [that steep mountain side]7921-that steep mountain side ; but as [he]1084-aphareus heaved , [the son of [Aegeus]855-aegeus]3783-the son of aegeus struck [him]1084-aphareus squarely with an oaken club ; and smashed , and broke the huge bones of that centaur 's arm . [He]1084-aphareus has no time , and does not want to give [that useless foe]7923-that useless foe to death . [He]1084-aphareus leaps upon the back of tall Bienor , never trained to carry [riders]7924-riders , and [he]1084-aphareus fixed [his]1084-aphareus knees firm in the centaur 's ribs , and holding tight to the long hair , seized by [his]1084-aphareus left hand , struck and shattered the hard features and fierce face and bony temples with [his]1084-aphareus club of gnarled strong oak . And with it , [he]1084-aphareus struck to [the ground]7925-the ground [Nedymnus]1085-nedymnus and Lycopes , dart expert , and [Hippasus]910-hippasus , whose beard hid all [his]1083-helops breast . And Rhipheus taller than the highest trees and [Thereus]1086-thereus , who would carry home alive the raging bears , caught in [Thessalian hills]7926-thessalian hills . [Demoleon]1087-demoleon could no longer stand and look on [Theseus]856-theseus and [his]1087-demoleon unrestrained success . [He]1087-demoleon struggled with vast effort to tear up an old pine , trunk and all , with its long roots , and , failing shortly in that first attempt , [he]1087-demoleon broke it off and hurled it at [[his]1087-demoleon foe]6079-his foe . But [Theseus]856-theseus saw the pine tree in its flight and , warned by [Pallas]694-pallas , got beyond its range — [his]856-theseus boast was , [Pallas]694-pallas had directed [him]856-theseus ! And yet , the missle was not launched in vain . It sheared the left shoulder and the breast from tall [Crantor]1088-crantor . [He]1088-crantor , [Achilles]1048-achilles , was [[your]7928-your father 's armor bearer]7929-your father 's armor bearer and was given by [King Amyntor]700-elis , when [he]700-elis sued for peace . “[872-peleus] When [Peleus]872-peleus at a distance saw [him]872-peleus torn and mangled , [he]872-peleus exclaimed , ‘ At least receive this sacrifice , [O Crantor]1088-crantor ! most beloved ! [Dearest of [young men]3798-young men]3797-dearest of young men ! ’ And with sturdy arm and all [his]872-peleus strength of soul as well , [he]872-peleus hurled [his]872-peleus ashen lance against [Demoleon]1087-demoleon , which piercing through [his]872-peleus shivered ribs , hung there and quivered in the bones . [The centaur]5348-the centaur wrenched the wooden shaft out , with [his]5348-the centaur frenzied hands , but could not move the pointed head , which stuck within [his]5348-the centaur lungs . [His]872-peleus very anguish gave [him]872-peleus such a desperation , that [he]872-peleus rose against [[his]872-peleus foe]6079-his foe and trampled and beat down [the hero]5496-the hero with [his]872-peleus hoofs , [Peleus]872-peleus allowed the blows to fall on helm and ringing shield . Protected so , [he]872-peleus watched [his]872-peleus time and thrust up through [the centaur]5348-the centaur 's shoulder . By one stroke [he]872-peleus pierced two breasts , where horse and [man - form]3803-man - form met . Before this , [Peleus]872-peleus with the spear had killed both [Myles]1089-myles and [Phlegraeus]1090-phlegraeus and with the sword [Iphinous]1091-iphinous and [Clanis]726-clanis . Now [he]872-peleus killed [Dorylas]724-dorylas , who was clad in a wolfskin cap and fought with curving bull 's horns dripping blood . “ To [him]724-dorylas [I]872-peleus said , for courage gave [me]872-peleus strength , ‘ [Your]724-dorylas horns ! how much inferior to [my]872-peleus steel ! ’ — and threw [my]872-peleus spear . Since [he]724-dorylas could not avoid the gleaming point , [he]724-dorylas held up [his]724-dorylas right hand to shield [his]724-dorylas forehead from the threatened wound . [His]724-dorylas hand was pierced and pinned against [his]724-dorylas forehead . [He]724-dorylas shouted madly . [Peleus]872-peleus , near [him]724-dorylas while [he]724-dorylas stood there pinned and helpless with [his]724-dorylas wound , struck [him]724-dorylas with sharp sword in the belly deep . [He]724-dorylas leaped forth fiercely , as [he]724-dorylas trailed [his]724-dorylas bowels upon the ground , with [his]724-dorylas entangled legs treading upon them , bursting them , [he]724-dorylas fell with empty belly , lifeless to the earth . “[872-peleus] [Cyllarus]1092-cyllarus , beauty did not save [your]1092-cyllarus life — if beauty is in any of [[your]1092-cyllarus tribe]3804-your tribe — [your]1092-cyllarus golden beard was in its early growth , [your]1092-cyllarus golden hair came flowing to [your]1092-cyllarus shoulders . in [your]1092-cyllarus bright face there was a pleasing glance . The neck and shoulders and the hands and breast , : and every aspect of [his]1092-cyllarus human form resembled those admired statues which [[our]3805-our gifted artists]3806-our gifted artists carve . Even the shape of the fine horse beneath the human form was perfect too . Give [him]1092-cyllarus the head and neck of a full - blooded horse , and [he]1092-cyllarus would seem a steed for [Castor]896-castor , for [his]1092-cyllarus back was shaped so comfortable to be sat upon and muscle swelled upon [his]1092-cyllarus arching chest . [His]1092-cyllarus lustrous body was as black as pitch , and yet [his]1092-cyllarus legs and flowing tail were white as snow . [Many a female of [his]1092-cyllarus kind]3807-many a female of his kind loved [him]1092-cyllarus , but only [Hylonome]1093-hylonome gained [his]1092-cyllarus love . There was [no other centaur maid]3808-no other centaur maid so beautiful as [she]1093-hylonome within [the woods]1317-the woods . By coaxing ways [she]1093-hylonome had won [Cyllarus]1092-cyllarus , by loving and confessing love . By daintiness , so far as that was possible in one of such a form , [she]1093-hylonome held [his]1092-cyllarus love ; for now [she]1093-hylonome smoothed [her]1093-hylonome long locks with a comb ; and now [she]1093-hylonome decked [herself]1093-hylonome with rosemary and now with violets or with roses in [her]1093-hylonome hair ; and sometimes [she]1093-hylonome wore lilies , white as snow ; and twice each day [she]1093-hylonome bathed [her]1093-hylonome lovely face , in [the sweet stream that falls down from the height of [wooded Pagasa]310-wooded pagasa]3810-the sweet stream that falls down from the height of wooded pagasa ; and daily , twice [she]1093-hylonome dipped [her]1093-hylonome body in [the stream]5090-the stream . [She]1093-hylonome wore upon [her]1093-hylonome shoulders and left side a skin , greatly becoming , of selected worth . “ [Their]7930-they love was equal , and together [they]7930-they would wander over [mountain - sides]7931-mountain - sides , and rest together in [cool caves]7932-cool caves ; and so it was , [they]7930-they went together to [that palace - cave , known to [the Lapithae]308-the lapithae]7933-that palace - cave , known to the lapithae . Together [they]7930-they fought fiercely in this battle , side by side . Thrown by an unknown hand , a javelin pierced [Cyllarus]1092-cyllarus , just below the fatal spot where the chest rises to the neck — [his]1092-cyllarus heart , though only slightly wounded , grew quite cold , and [his]1092-cyllarus whole body felt cold , afterwards , as quickly as the weapon was drawn out . Then [Hylonome]1093-hylonome held in [her]1093-hylonome embrace [the dying body]7934-the dying body ; fondled the dread wound and , fixing [her]1093-hylonome lips closely to [his]1092-cyllarus lips endeavored to hold back [his]1092-cyllarus dying breath . But soon [she]1093-hylonome saw that [he]1092-cyllarus indeed was dead . With mourning words , which clamor of the fight prevented [me]1093-hylonome from hearing , [she]1093-hylonome threw [herself]1093-hylonome on the spear that pierced [her]1093-hylonome Cyllarus and fell upon [his]1092-cyllarus breast , embracing [him]1092-cyllarus in death . “[1093-hylonome] Another sight still comes before [my]0-i eyes , [the centaur Phaeocomes]3812-the centaur phaeocomes with [his]3812-the centaur phaeocomes log . [He]3812-the centaur phaeocomes wore six lion skins well wrapped around [his]3812-the centaur phaeocomes body , and with fixed connecting knots [they]3813-they covered [him]3812-the centaur phaeocomes , both horse and [man]1330-man . [He]3812-the centaur phaeocomes hurled a trunk [two yokes of oxen scarce could move]3815-two yokes of oxen scarce could move and struck [the hapless son of [Olenus]1094-olenus]3816-the hapless son of olenus a crushing blow upon the head . The broad round dome was shattered , and [his]3812-the centaur phaeocomes dying brains oozed out through hollow nostrils , mouth , and ears , as curdled milk seeps down through oaken twigs ; or other liquors , crushed out under weights , flow through a well - pierced sieve and , thick , squeeze out through numerous holes . As [he]3812-the centaur phaeocomes began to spoil [[his]3812-the centaur phaeocomes victim]6101-his victim — and [[your]3818-your father]5123-your father can affirm the truth of this — [I]0-i thrust [my]0-i sword deep in the wretch 's groin . [Chthonius]1095-chthonius , too , and [Teleboas]1096-teleboas fell there by [my]0-i sword . [The former]3820-the former had a two - pronged stick as [his]3820-the former sole weapon , and [the other]5036-the other had a spear , with which the wounded [me]0-i . [You]3818-your see the scar . The old scar still is surely visible ! “ Those were [my]3822-the centaurs caeneus days of youth and strength , and then [I]3822-the centaurs caeneus ought to have warred against [the citadel of [Pergama]311-pergama]7935-the citadel of pergama . [I]3822-the centaurs caeneus could have checked , or even vanquished , the arms of [Hector]1038-hector : but , alas , [Hector]1038-hector had not been born , or was perhaps [a boy]5624-a boy . Old age has dulled [my]3822-the centaurs caeneus youthful strength . What use is it , to speak of [Periphas]1097-periphas , who overcame [Pyretus]1098-pyretus , double - formed ? Why tell of [Ampyx]736-ampyx , who with pointless shaft , victorious thrust [Echeclus]1099-echeclus through the face ? [Macareus]1100-macareus , hurling a heavy crowbar pierced [Erigdupus]1101-erigdupus and laid [him]1101-erigdupus low . A hunting spear that [Nessus]938-nessus strongly hurled , was buried in [the groin of [Cymelus]1102-cymelus]7937-the groin of cymelus . Do not believe that [Mopsus]1103-mopsus , [son of [Ampycus]717-ampycus]7938-son of ampycus , was merely [a prophet of events to come]7939-a prophet of events to come , [he]1103-mopsus slew a daring two - formed monster there . [Hodites]1104-hodites tried in vain to speak , before [his]1104-hodites death , but could not , for [his]1104-hodites tongue was nailed against [his]1104-hodites chin , [his]1104-hodites chin against [his]1104-hodites throat . “[3822-the centaurs caeneus] Five of [the centaurs [Caeneus]904-caeneus]3822-the centaurs caeneus put to death : [Styphelus]1105-styphelus , [Bromus]1106-bromus , and [Antimachus]1107-antimachus , [Elymus]1108-elymus , and [Pyracmos]1109-pyracmos with [his]904-caeneus axe . [I]0-i have forgot [their]3823-their wounds but noted well [their]3823-their names and number . [Latreus , huge of limb]3824-latreus , huge of limb , had killed and stripped [Emathian Halesus]1110-emathian halesus . Now in [his]3824-latreus , huge of limb armor [he]3824-latreus , huge of limb came rushing out , in years [he]3824-latreus , huge of limb was between old age and youth ; but [he]3824-latreus , huge of limb retained the vigor of [his]3824-latreus , huge of limb youth ; [his]3824-latreus , huge of limb temples showed [his]3824-latreus , huge of limb hair was mixed with grey . [Conspicuous]1111-conspicuous for [his]3824-latreus , huge of limb Macedonian lance and sword and shield , facing both sides — each way , [he]3824-latreus , huge of limb insolently clashed [his]3824-latreus , huge of limb arms ; and while [he]3824-latreus , huge of limb rode poured out these words in empty air . “ ‘ Shall [I]3824-latreus , huge of limb put up with one like [you]3824-latreus , huge of limb , [O Caeneus]904-caeneus ? For [you]3824-latreus , huge of limb are still [a woman in [my]3824-latreus , huge of limb sight]7940-a woman in my sight . Have [you]3824-latreus , huge of limb forgot [your]3824-latreus , huge of limb birth or that disgrace by which [you]3824-latreus , huge of limb won reward — at what a price [you]3824-latreus , huge of limb got the false resemblance to [a man]5610-a man ? ! Consider both [your]3824-latreus , huge of limb birth , and what [you]3824-latreus , huge of limb have submitted to ! Take up a distaff , and wool basket ! Twist [your]3824-latreus , huge of limb threads with practiced thumb ! Leave warfare to [[your]3824-latreus , huge of limb men]7942-your men ! ’ “[3824-latreus , huge of limb] While [puffed - up pride]3825-puffed - up pride was vaunting out such nonsense , [Caeneus]904-caeneus hurled a spear and pierced the stretched out running side , just where [the man]5560-the man was joined upon the horse . “ [The Centaur]5348-the centaur , [Latreus]1112-latreus , raved with pain and struck with [his]1112-latreus great pike , the face of [Caeneus]904-caeneus . [His]1112-latreus pike rebounded as the hail that slants up from the roof ; or as a pebble might rebound from hollow drum . Then coming near , [he]1112-latreus tried to drive a sword into the hard side of [Caeneus]904-caeneus , but it could not make a wound . ‘ Aha ! ’ [he]1112-latreus cried , ‘ this will not get [you]904-caeneus off . The good edge of [my]904-caeneus sword will take [your]904-caeneus life , although the point is blunt ! ’ [He]1112-latreus turned the edge against the flank of [Caeneus]904-caeneus and swung round [the hero]5496-the hero 's loins with [his]1112-latreus long , curving arm . The flesh resounded like a marble block , the keen blade shattered on the unyielding skin . “[904-caeneus] And , after [Caeneus]904-caeneus had exposed [his]904-caeneus limbs unhurt to [Latreus]1112-latreus , who stood there amazed , ‘ Come now , ’ [he]1112-latreus said , ‘ and let [us]3827-we try [my]0-i steel against [your]904-caeneus body ! ’ And , clear to the hilt , down through [the monster]5004-the monster 's shoulder - blade [he]1112-latreus plunged [his]1112-latreus deadly sword and , turning it again , deep in the [Centaur]1113-centaur 's entrails , made new wounds within [his]1112-latreus wound . “ Then , quite beside [themselves]5004-the monster , [the double - natured monsters]7945-the double - natured monsters rushed against [that single - handed youth]7946-that single - handed youth with huge uproar , and thrust and hurled [their]5004-the monster weapons all at [him]7946-that single - handed youth . [Their]5004-the monster blunted weapons fell and [he]7946-that single - handed youth remained unharmed and without even a mark . ”[1112-latreus] “ That strange sight left [them]5004-the monster speechless . ‘ Oh what shame ! ’ at length cried [Monychus]1114-monychus , ‘ [[Our]3827-we mighty host]7947-our mighty host , — [a nation of [us]3827-we]7948-a nation of us , are defeated and defied by one who hardly is [a man]5610-a man . Although indeed , [he]7946-that single - handed youth is [a man]5610-a man , and [we]3827-we have proved , by [our]3827-we weak actions , [we]3827-we are certainly what [he]7946-that single - handed youth was ! Shame on [us]3827-we ! Oh , what if [we]3827-we have twofold strength , of what avail [our]3827-we huge and mighty limbs , doubly united in the strongest , hugest bodies in [this world]7951-this world ? And how can [I]3829-he believe that [we]3827-we were born of [any goddess]7952-any goddess ? It is surely vain to claim descent of [great Ixion , who high - souled , sought [Juno]488-juno for [his]3829-he mighty mate]7953-great ixion , who high - souled , sought juno for his mighty mate ; imagine it , while [we]3827-we are conquered by [an enemy , who is but half a man]7954-an enemy , who is but half a man ! Wake up ! and let [us]3827-we heap tree - trunks and stones and mountains on [him]3829-he ! Crush [his]3829-he stubborn life ! Let forests smother [him]3829-he to death ! Their weight will be as deadly as a hundred wounds ! ’ “[3829-he] While [he]3829-he was raving , by some chance [he]3829-he found a tree thrown down there by the boisterous wind : example to the rest , [he]3829-he threw that tree against [the powerful foe]3830-the powerful foe ; and in short time [Othrys]519-othrys was bare of trees , and [Pelion]204-pelion had no shade . Buried under [that mountainous forest heap]3831-that mountainous forest heap , [Caeneus]904-caeneus heaved up against the weight of oaks upon [his]904-caeneus brawny shoulders piled . But , as the load increased above [his]904-caeneus face and head , [he]904-caeneus could not draw a breath . Gasping for life , [he]904-caeneus strove to lift [his]904-caeneus head into the air , and sometimes [he]904-caeneus convulsed the towering mass , as if [great Ida]602-ida , now before [our]3832-our eyes , should tremble with some heaving of the earth . “ What happened to [him]904-caeneus could not well be known . [Some]4905-some thought [his]904-caeneus body was borne down by weight into [the vast expanse of [Tartarus]77-tartarus]7956-the vast expanse of tartarus . [The son of Ampycus]7957-the son of ampycus did not agree , for from the middle of the pile [we]3832-our saw a bird with golden wings mount high in air . Before or since , [I]904-caeneus never saw the like . “[904-caeneus] When [Mopsus]1103-mopsus was aware of that bird 's flight — it circled round [the camp]3833-the camp on rustling wings — with eyes and mind [he]1103-mopsus followed it and shouted aloud : ‘ Hail , [glory of [the Lapithaean race]3835-the lapithaean race]3834-glory of the lapithaean race , [[their]3835-the lapithaean race greatest hero]3836-their greatest hero , now a bird unique ! ’ and [we]3832-our believed the verdict of [the seer]5687-the seer . “ [Our]3832-our grief increased resentment , and [we]3832-our bore it with disgust that [one]1998-one was overwhelmed by such a multitude . Then in revenge [we]3832-our plied [our]3832-our swords , till [half [our]3832-our foes]7959-half our foes were dead , and only flight and darkness saved [the rest]7960-the rest . ”[911-nestor] [Nestor]911-nestor had hardly told this marvellous tale of bitter strife betwixt [the Lapithae]308-the lapithae and [those half - human]3838-those half - human , vanquished [Centaurs]1117-centaurs , when [Tlepolemus]1118-tlepolemus , incensed because no word of praise was given to [Hercules]857-hercules , replied in this way ; “ [Old sir]7961-old sir , it is very strange , [you]7961-old sir have neglected to say one good word in praise of [Hercules]857-hercules . [[My]911-nestor father]1438-my father told [me]911-nestor often , that [he]1438-my father overcame in battle those cloud born centaurs . ”[911-nestor] [Nestor]911-nestor , very loth , replied , “ Why force [me]911-nestor to recall old wrongs , to uncover sorrow buried by the years , that made [me]911-nestor hate [[your]7961-old sir father]5123-your father ? It is true [his]1438-my father deeds were wonderful beyond belief , heaven knows , and filled [the earth]1289-the earth with well earned praise which [I]911-nestor should rather wish might be denied . [Deiphobus]1119-deiphobus , [the wise Polydamas]7965-the wise polydamas , and [even great Hector]7966-even great hector get no praise from [me]911-nestor . [[Your]7961-old sir father]5123-your father , [I]911-nestor recall once overthrew [Messene]1120-messene 's walls and with no cause destroyed [Elis]700-elis and [Pylos]91-pylos and with fire and sword ruined [[my]911-nestor own loved home]7968-my own loved home . [I]911-nestor can not name all whom [he]1438-my father killed . But there were [twelve of [us]7970-us]7969-twelve of us , [the sons of [Neleus]92-rich neleus]7971-the sons of neleus and [all warrior youths]7972-all warrior youths , and [all those twelve but [me]911-nestor alone [he]1438-my father killed]7973-all those twelve but me alone he killed . [Ten of [them]7969-twelve of us]7974-ten of them met the common fate of war , but sadder was the death of [Periclymenus]1123-periclymenus . “[911-nestor] [Neptune]472-neptune , [the founder of [[my]0-i family]3840-my family]3839-the founder of my family , had granted [him]472-neptune a power to assume whatever shape [he]472-neptune chose , and when [he]472-neptune wished to lay that shape aside . When [he]472-neptune , in vain , had been transformed to many other shapes [he]472-neptune turned into the form of that bird , which is wo nt to carry in [his]472-neptune crooked talons the forked lightnings , favorite bird of [Jove]456-jove . With wings and crooked bill and sharp - hooked talons , [he]472-neptune assailed and tore the face of [Hercules]857-hercules . But , when [he]472-neptune soared away on eagle wings up to the clouds and hovered , poised in air , [that hero]3841-that hero aimed [his]3841-that hero too unerring bow and hit [him]472-neptune where the new wing joined [his]472-neptune side . The wound was not large , but [his]472-neptune sinews cut failed to uphold [him]472-neptune , and denied [his]472-neptune wings their strength and motion . [He]472-neptune fell down to [earth]1287-earth ; [his]472-neptune weakened pinions could not catch the air . And the sharp arrow , which had lightly pierced the wing , was driven upward through the side into the left part of [[my]0-i brother]6054-my brother 's neck . “ [O noble leader of [the Rhodian fleet]7976-the rhodian fleet]7975-o noble leader of the rhodian fleet , why should [I]911-nestor sing the praise of [Hercules]857-hercules ? But for [[my]911-nestor brothers]6524-my brothers [I]911-nestor take no revenge except withholding praise of [his]857-hercules great deeds . With [you]6524-my brothers , [my]911-nestor friendship will remain secure . ”[911-nestor] When [Nestor]911-nestor with [his]911-nestor honied tongue had told these tales of old , [they]3844-they all took wine again and [they]3844-they arose and gave the night to sleep . But [Neptune]472-neptune , who commands [the ocean waves]3845-the ocean waves , lamented with [a father]1601-a father 's grief [[his]472-neptune son]5099-his son , whose person [he]472-neptune had changed into a bird — the swan of [Phaethon]501-phaethon , and towards [Achilles]1048-achilles , grim victor in the fight , [his]472-neptune lasting hate made [him]472-neptune pursue resentment far beyond the ordinary manner of [the gods]1395-the gods . After nine years of war [he]472-neptune spoke these words , addressing long haired [Sminthean Apollo]1124-apollo : “ [O nephew the most dear to [me]472-neptune of all [[my]472-neptune brother 's sons]7979-my brother 's sons]7978-o nephew the most dear to me of all my brother 's sons , with [me]472-neptune [you]7978-o nephew the most dear to me of all my brother 's sons built in vain [the walls of [Troy]250-troy]7980-the walls of troy : [you]7978-o nephew the most dear to me of all my brother 's sons must be lost in grief , when [you]7978-o nephew the most dear to me of all my brother 's sons look on [those towers]5385-those towers so soon to fall ? Or do [you]7978-o nephew the most dear to me of all my brother 's sons not lament [the multitudes slain]7982-the multitudes slain in defence of [them]5385-those towers — To name but one : “[472-neptune] Does not the ghost of [Hector]1038-hector , dragged around [his]1038-hector [Pergama]311-pergama , appear to [you]3849-you ? And yet [the fierce [Achilles]1048-achilles , who is bloodstained more than slaughtering war , lives on [this earth]3851-this earth , for the destruction of [[our]3852-our toil]3853-our toil]3850-the fierce achilles , who is bloodstained more than slaughtering war , lives on this earth , for the destruction of our toil . Let [him]1048-achilles once get into [my]0-i power , and [I]0-i will make [him]1048-achilles feel the action of [my]0-i triple spear . But , since [I]0-i may not meet [him]1048-achilles face to face , do [you]3849-you with sudden arrow give [him]1048-achilles death . ” [The Delian god]3334-the delian god , [Apollo]1124-apollo , gave assent , both for [his]1124-apollo own hate and [[his]1124-apollo uncle]7984-his uncle 's rage . Veiled in a cloud , [he]0-i found [the Trojan host]7985-the trojan host and , there , while bloody strife went on , [he]0-i saw [the hero]5496-the hero [Paris]845-paris shoot at intervals [his]5496-the hero arrows at [the nameless host of [Greeks]7988-greeks]7987-the nameless host of greeks . Revealing [his]0-i divinity , [he]0-i said : “[3849-you] Why spend [your]3849-you arrows on [the common men]3854-the common men if [you]3849-you would serve [[your]3849-you people]2908-your people , take good aim at [great Achilles]1048-achilles and at last avenge [[your]3849-you hapless brothers]3856-your hapless brothers whom [he]1048-achilles gave to death . ” [He]0-i pointed out [Achilles]1048-achilles — laying low [the Trojan warriors]7989-the trojan warriors with [his]1048-achilles mighty spear . On [him]1048-achilles [he]0-i turned [the Trojan]1049-aeneas 's willing bow and guided with [his]0-i hand the fatal shaft . It was the first joy that [old Priam]1036-priam knew since [Hector]1038-hector 's death . So then [Achilles]1048-achilles [you]3849-you , who overcame the mighty , were subdued by [a coward who seduced [a Grecian wife]7991-a grecian wife]7990-a coward who seduced a grecian wife ! Ah , if [you]3849-you could not die by manly hands , [your]3849-you choice had been the axe . Now that great terror of [the Trojan race]7992-the trojan race , the glory and defence of [the Pelasgians]7993-the pelasgians , [Achilles]1048-achilles , first in war , lay on the pyre . [The god of Fire]7994-the god of fire first armed , then burned , [his]1048-achilles limbs . And now [he]1048-achilles is but ashes ; and of [him]1048-achilles , so great , renowned and mighty , but a pitiful handful of small dust insufficient for a little urn ! But all [his]1048-achilles glory lives enough to fill [the world]1360-the world — a great reward . And in that glory is [his]1048-achilles real life : in a true sense [he]1048-achilles will never know [the void of [Tartarus]77-tartarus]7996-the void of tartarus . But soon [his]1048-achilles very shield — that [men]1399-men might know to whom it had belonged — brings war , and arms are taken for [his]1048-achilles arms . Neither [Diomed]1125-diomed nor [Ajax]1126-ajax called [the less]7998-the less ventured to claim [the hero]5496-the hero 's mighty shield . [Menelaus]1127-menelaus and [other warlike chiefs]8000-other warlike chiefs , even [Agamemnon]1128-agamemnon , all withdrew [their]8000-other warlike chiefs claims . Only [the greater Ajax]1126-ajax and [Ulysses]1129-ulysses had such assurance that [they]8000-other warlike chiefs dared contest for that great prize . Then [Agamemnon]1128-agamemnon chose to avoid the odium of preferring one . [He]1128-agamemnon bade [the Argolic chieftains]8001-the argolic chieftains take [their]8001-the argolic chieftains seats within [the camp]3833-the camp and left to all of [them]8001-the argolic chieftains the hearing and decision of the cause . [The chiefs]8003-the chiefs were seated , and [the soldiers]8004-the soldiers form a circle round [them]8003-the chiefs . Then [Ajax]1126-ajax , [the approved lord of the seven - fold shield]8005-the approved lord of the seven - fold shield , arose and spoke . Impatient in [his]1128-agamemnon wrath , [he]1128-agamemnon looked with stern , set features , out over [Sigaean shores]8006-sigaean shores , and over [the fleet of ships upon [the beach]8008-the beach]8007-the fleet of ships upon the beach , and , stretching out [his]1128-agamemnon hands , [he]1128-agamemnon said , “[3857-we] [We]3857-we plead , O [Jupiter]475-jupiter , [our]3857-we cause before [the ships]2641-the ships , — [Ulysses]1129-ulysses vies with [me]0-i ! [He]1129-ulysses did not shrink from giving way before the flames of [Hector]1038-hector , when [I]0-i withstood [them]3859-them and [I]0-i saved [the fleet]3860-the fleet . ' Tis safer then to fight with lying words than with [his]1129-ulysses hands . [I]0-i am not prompt to speak , nor [he]1129-ulysses to act . [I]0-i am as good in war and deadly battle as [he]1129-ulysses is in talk . [Pelasgians]1130-pelasgians , [I]0-i do not suppose [my]0-i deeds must here be mentioned : [you]3861-you have witnessed them but let [Ulysses]1129-ulysses tell of deeds which [he]1129-ulysses performed without [a witness]3862-a witness and which [Night]643-night alone is conscious of .
