And why prefer [his]4197-the cyclops smiles to [my]0-i embraces , but let [him]4197-the cyclops please [himself]4197-the cyclops , and let [him]4197-the cyclops please [you]1181-galatea , [Galatea]1181-galatea , though against [my]0-i will . ‘ If [I]0-i am given an opportunity [he]4197-the cyclops will be shown that [I]0-i have every strength proportioned to a body vast as [mine]0-i : [I]0-i will pull out [his]4197-the cyclops palpitating entrails , and scatter [his]4197-the cyclops torn limbs about [the fields]5475-the fields and over and throughout [your]1181-galatea salty waves ; and then let [him]4197-the cyclops unite [himself]4197-the cyclops to [you]1181-galatea . — [I]0-i burn so , and [my]0-i slighted passion raves with greater fury and [I]0-i seem to hold and carry Aetna in [my]0-i breast — transferred there with its flames — Oh [Galatea]1181-galatea ! can [you]1181-galatea listen to [my]0-i passion thus unmoved ! ’ “ [I]0-i saw all this ; and , after [he]4197-the cyclops in vain had uttered such complaints , [he]4197-the cyclops stood up like a raging bull whose heifer has been lost , that can not stand still , but must wander on through [brush and forests]8293-brush and forests , that [he]4197-the cyclops knows so well : when [that fierce monster]8294-that fierce monster saw [me]0-i and [[my]0-i Acis]8295-my acis — [we]8296-we neither knew nor guessed [our]8296-we fate — [he]4197-the cyclops roared : ‘ [I]0-i see [you]1181-galatea and [you]1181-galatea never will again parade [your]1181-galatea love before [me]0-i ! ’ In such a voice as matched [his]4197-the cyclops giant size . [All Aetna]762-aetna shook and trembled at the noise ; and [I]0-i amazed with horror , plunged into [the adjoining sea]8297-the adjoining sea . “[0-i] [[My]0-i loved]4199-my loved one , [Acis]1182-acis turned [his]1182-acis back and fled and cried out , ‘ Help [me]0-i [Galatea]1181-galatea , help ! 0 , let [[your]1181-galatea parents]4200-your parents help [me]0-i , and admit [me]0-i safe within [[their]4200-your parents realm]4201-their realm ; for [I]0-i am now near [my]0-i destruction ! ’ But [the Cyclops]4197-the cyclops rushed at [him]1182-acis and hurled a fragment , [he]1182-acis had torn out from [the mountain]4203-the mountain , and although the extreme edge only of the rock could reach [him]1182-acis there . It buried [him]1182-acis entirely . “ Then [I]0-i did the only thing [the Fates]8298-the fates permitted [me]0-i : [I]0-i let [[my]0-i Acis]8295-my acis take ancestral power of river deities . The purple blood flowed from beneath the rock , but soon the sanguine richness faded and became at first the color of a stream , disturbed and muddied by a shower . And presently it clarified . — The rock that had been thrown then split in two , and through the cleft a reed , stately and vigorous , arose to life . And soon the hollow mouth in [the great rock]8300-the great rock , resounded with the waters gushing forth . And wonderful to tell , [a youth]2864-a youth emerged , the water flowing clear about [his]2864-a youth waist , [his]2864-a youth new horns circled with entwining reeds , and [the youth]1554-the youth certainly was [Acis]1182-acis , though [he]1182-acis was of larger stature and [his]1182-acis face and features all were azure . [Acis]1182-acis changed into a stream which ever since that time has flowed [there and retained]8303-there and retained [its]1182-acis former name . So Galatea , after [she]8304-she had told [her]8304-she sorrow , ceased ; and , when [the company]8305-the company had gone from [there]1500-there , [the Nereids]1187-the nereids swam again in the calm and quiet waves . But [Scylla]878-scylla soon returned ( because [she]878-scylla did not trust [herself]878-scylla in [deep salt waters]8307-deep salt waters ) and [she]878-scylla wandered there naked of garments on [the thirsty sand]8308-the thirsty sand ; but , tired , by chance [she]878-scylla found [a lonely bay]8309-a lonely bay , and cooled [her]878-scylla limbs with its enclosing waves . Then suddenly appeared [a newly made inhabitant of [that deep sea]8311-that deep sea]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea , whose name was [Glaucus]842-glaucus . Cleaving through the blue sea waves , [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea swam towards [her]878-scylla . [His]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea shape had been transformed but lately for this watery life , while [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea was living at [Anthedon]350-anthedon in [Euboea]336-euboea . — now [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea is lingering from desire for [her]878-scylla [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea saw there and speaks whatever words [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea thought might stop [her]878-scylla as [she]878-scylla fled from [him]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea . Yet still [she]878-scylla fled from [him]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea , and swift through fear , climbed to [a mountain top above [the sea]1298-the sea]8312-a mountain top above the sea . Facing the waves , [it]8312-a mountain top above the sea rose in one huge peak , parting [the waters]5216-the waters with a forest crown . [She]878-scylla stood on that high summit quite secure : and , doubtful whether [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea might be [a god]4898-a god or monster , wondered at [his]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea flowing hair which covered [his]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea broad shoulders and [his]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea back , — and marvelled at the color of [his]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea skin and at [his]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea waist merged into a twisted fish . All this [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea noticed , and while leaning there against a rock that stood near by , [he]8310-a newly made inhabitant of that deep sea said : — “[0-i] [I]0-i am [no monster]4204-no monster , [maiden]4205-maiden , [I]0-i am not [a savage beast]4206-a savage beast ; [I]0-i am in truth [a god of waters]4207-a god of waters , with such power upon [the seas]6344-the seas as that of [Proteus]928-proteus , [Triton]476-triton , or [Palaemon]4209-palaemon — reared on land [the son of [Athamas]605-athamas]4210-the son of athamas . “ Not long ago [I]605-athamas was [a mortal man]8316-a mortal man , yet even then [my]605-athamas thought turned to [the sea]1298-the sea and all [my]605-athamas living came from waters deep , for [I]605-athamas would drag the nets that swept up fish , or , seated on a rock , [I]605-athamas flung the line forth from the rod . [The shore]5443-the shore [I]605-athamas loved was near [a verdant meadow]8319-a verdant meadow . One side were the waves , the other grass , which never had been touched by horned , grazing cattle . Harmless sheep and shaggy goats had never cropped [it]5443-the shore — [no industrious bee]8320-no industrious bee came [there]1500-there to harvest flowers ; no festive garlands had been gathered [there]1500-there , adornments of the head ; [no mower]8323-no mower 's hands had ever cut it . [I]605-athamas was certainly the first who ever sat upon that turf , — while [I]605-athamas was drying there the dripping nets . And so that [I]605-athamas might in due order count the fish that [I]605-athamas had caught , [I]605-athamas laid out those which by good chance were driven into [my]605-athamas nets , or credulous , were caught on [my]605-athamas barbed hooks . “[605-athamas] It all seems like a fiction ( but what good can [I]0-i derive from fictions ? ) just as soon as any of [my]0-i fish - prey touched the grass , [they]4211-they instantly began to move and skip as usual in [sea water]4033-sea water . While [I]0-i paused and wondered , all of [them]4211-they slid to the waves , and left [me]0-i , [[their]4211-they late captor]4213-their late captor , and [the shore]5443-the shore . “ [I]0-i was amazed and doubtful , a long time ; while [I]0-i considered what could be the cause . What [god]8324-god had done this ? Or perhaps the juice of some herb caused it ? ‘ But , ’ [I]0-i said , ‘ what herb can have such properties ? ’ and with [my]0-i hand [I]0-i plucked the grass and chewed it with [my]0-i teeth . [My]0-i throat had hardly time to swallow those unheard of juices , when [I]0-i suddenly felt all [my]0-i entrails throbbing inwardly , and [my]0-i entire mind also , felt possessed by passions foreign to [my]0-i life before . “[0-i] [I]0-i could not stay in [that place]5935-that place , and [I]0-i said with shouting , ‘ Farewell ! [dry land]4216-dry land ! never more shall [I]0-i revisit [you]4217-you ; ’ and with those words upon [my]0-i lips , [I]0-i plunged beneath the waves . [The gods of that deep water]4218-the gods of that deep water gave to [me]0-i , when [they]4218-the gods of that deep water received [me]0-i , kindred honors , while [they]4218-the gods of that deep water prayed [Oceanus]967-oceanus and [Tethys]507-tethys both to take from [me]0-i such mortal essence as might yet remain . So [I]0-i was purified by [them]4218-the gods of that deep water and after a good charm had been nine times repeated over [me]0-i , which washed away all guilt , [I]0-i was commanded then to put [my]0-i breast beneath a hundred streams . “ So far [I]0-i can relate to [you]4217-you all things most worthy to be told ; for all so far [I]0-i can remember ; but from that time on [I]0-i was unconscious of the many things that followed . When [my]0-i mind returned to [me]0-i , [I]0-i found [myself]0-i entirely different from what [I]0-i was before ; and [my]0-i changed mind was not the same as it had always been . Then , for the first time [I]0-i beheld this beard so green in its deep color , and [I]0-i saw [my]0-i flowing hair which now [I]0-i sweep along [the spacious seas]8325-the spacious seas , and [my]0-i huge shoulders with [their]4219-the ocean deities azure colored arms , and [I]0-i observed [my]0-i leg extremities hung tapering exactly perfect as a finny fish . “[0-i] But what avail is this new form to [me]0-i . Although it pleased [the Ocean deities]4219-the ocean deities ? What benefit , although [I]0-i am [a god]4898-a god , if [you]4221-you are not persuaded by these things ? ” While [he]0-i was telling wonders such as these — quite ready to say more — [Scylla]878-scylla arose and left [the god]5013-the god . [Provoked]1188-provoked at [his]0-i repulse — enraged , [he]0-i hastened to [the marvellous court of Circe , well known [daughter of the Sun]8328-daughter of the sun]8327-the marvellous court of circe , well known daughter of the sun . Now [the Euboean dweller in great waves]8329-the euboean dweller in great waves , [Glaucus]842-glaucus , had left behind the crest of [Aetna]762-aetna , raised upward from a giant 's head ; and left [the Cyclops ' fields]8330-the cyclops ' fields , that never had been torn by harrow or by plough and never were indebted to the toil of [oxen yoked]8331-oxen yoked ; left [Zancle]351-zancle , also , and [the opposite walls of Rhegium]8332-the opposite walls of rhegium , and [the sea]1298-the sea , abundant cause of shipwreck , which confined with double shores bounds [[the Ausonian]352-the ausonian and [Sicilian]353-sicilian lands]8334-the ausonian and sicilian lands . All these behind [him]0-i , [Glaucus]842-glaucus , swimming on with [his]0-i huge hands through [those Tyrrhenian seas]8335-those tyrrhenian seas , drew near the hills so rich in magic herbs and [halls of [Circe]1189-circe]8336-halls of circe , daughter of the Sun , — [halls filled with [men]1399-men in guise of animals]8337-halls filled with men in guise of animals . After due salutations had been given — received by [her]1189-circe as kindly — [Glaucus]842-glaucus said , “[4222-you] [You]4222-you as [a goddess]5320-a goddess , certainly should have compassion upon [me]0-i , [a god]4898-a god ; for [you]4222-you alone ( if [I]0-i am worthy of it ) can relieve [my]0-i passion . What the power of herbs can be , [Titania]1190-titania , [none]1829-none knows more than [I]0-i , for by [their]4226-their power [I]0-i was [myself]0-i transformed . To make the cause of [my]0-i strange madness known , [I]0-i have found [Scylla]878-scylla on [Italian shores]4227-italian shores , directly opposite Messenian walls . “ It shames [me]0-i to recount [my]0-i promises , entreaties , and caresses , and at last rejection of [my]0-i suit . If [you]4222-you have known a power of incantation , [I]0-i implore [you]4222-you now repeat that incantation here , with sacred lips — If herbs have greater power , use the tried power of herbs . But [I]0-i would not request a cure — the healing of this wound . Much better than an end of pain , let [her]1189-circe share , and feel with [me]0-i [my]0-i impassioned flame . ”[0-i] But [Circe]1189-circe was more quick than any other to burn with passion 's flame . It may have been [her]1189-circe nature or it may have been the work of [Venus]996-venus , angry at [her]1189-circe tattling sire . “ [You]4222-you might do better , ”[1189-circe] [she]1189-circe replied , “ to court one who is willing , one who wants [your]4222-you love , and feels a like desire . [You]4222-you did deserve to win [her]1189-circe love , yes , to be wooed [yourself]4222-you . In fact [you]4222-you might be . If [you]4222-you give some hope , [you]4222-you have [my]1189-circe word , [you]4222-you shall indeed be wooed . That [you]4222-you may have no doubt , and so retain all confidence in [your]4222-you attraction 's power — behold ! [I]1189-circe am [a goddess]5320-a goddess , and [I]1189-circe am [the daughter also , of the radiant Sun]8340-the daughter also , of the radiant sun ! And [I]1189-circe who am so potent with [my]1189-circe charms , and [I]1189-circe who am so potent with [my]1189-circe herbs , wish only to be [yours]4222-you . Despise [her]1189-circe who despises [you]4222-you , and [her]1189-circe who is attached to [you]4222-you repay with like attachment — so by one act offer each [her]1189-circe just reward . ”[1189-circe] But [Glaucus]842-glaucus answered [her]4228-she attempt of love , “ The trees will sooner grow in ocean waves , the sea - weed sooner grow on [mountain tops]4951-mountain tops , than [I]842-glaucus shall change [my]842-glaucus love for graceful ! [Scylla]878-scylla . ”[842-glaucus] [The goddess]4979-the goddess in [her]4228-she jealous rage could not and would not injure [him]4230-him , whom [she]4228-she still loved , but turned [her]4228-she wrath upon [the one preferred]4231-the one preferred . [She]4228-she bruised immediately the many herbs most infamous for horrid juices , which , when bruised , [she]4228-she mingled with most artful care and incantations given by [Hecate]794-hecate . Then , clothed in azure vestments , [she]4228-she passed through [her]4228-she troop of fawning savage animals , and issued from the center of [[her]4228-she hall]4232-her hall . Pacing from there to [Rhegium]355-rhegium , opposite [the dangerous rocks of [Zancle]351-zancle]4233-the dangerous rocks of zancle , [she]4228-she at once entered the tossed waves boiling up with tides : on these as if [she]4228-she walked on [the firm shore]4234-the firm shore , [she]4228-she set [her]4228-she feet and , hastening on [dry shod]4235-dry shod , [she]4228-she skimmed along the surface of [the deep]1961-the deep . Not far away there was [an inlet]4237-an inlet curved , round as a bent bow , which was often used by [Scylla]878-scylla as a favorite retreat . There , [she]4228-she withdrew from heat of sea and sky when in the zenith blazed the unclouded sun and cast the shortest shadows on the ground . [Circe]1189-circe infected it before that hour , polluting it with monster - breeding drugs . [She]1189-circe sprinkled juices over it , distilled from an obnoxious root , and thrice times nine [she]1189-circe muttered over it with magic lips , [her]1189-circe most mysterious charm involved in words of strangest import and of dubious thought . [Scylla]878-scylla came there and waded in waist deep , then saw [her]878-scylla loins defiled with barking shapes . Believing they could be no part of [her]878-scylla , [she]878-scylla ran and tried to drive them back and feared the boisterous canine jaws . But what [she]878-scylla fled [she]878-scylla carried with [her]878-scylla . And , feeling for [her]878-scylla thighs , [her]878-scylla legs , and feet , [she]878-scylla found Cerberian jaws instead . [She]878-scylla rises from a rage of dogs , and shaggy backs encircle [her]878-scylla shortened loins . [The lover Glaucus]4238-the lover glaucus wept . [He]4238-the lover glaucus fled the embrace of [Circe]1189-circe and [her]1189-circe hostile power of herbs and magic spells . But [Scylla]878-scylla did not leave the place of [her]878-scylla disaster ; and , as soon as [she]878-scylla had opportunity , for hate of [Circe]1189-circe , [she]878-scylla robbed [Ulysses]1129-ulysses of [[his]1129-ulysses men]5488-his men . [She]878-scylla would have wrecked [the Trojan ships]4240-the trojan ships , if [she]878-scylla had not been changed beforehand to a rock which to this day reveals a craggy rim . And even the rock awakes [the sailors]1811-the sailors ' dread . After [the Trojan ships]4240-the trojan ships , pushed by [their]4240-the trojan ships oars , had safely passed by [Scylla]878-scylla and [the fierce Charybdis]879-charybdis , and with care had then approached near [the Ausonian shore]4243-the ausonian shore , a roaring gale bore [them]4240-the trojan ships far southward to [the Libyan coast]4244-the libyan coast . And then [Sidonian Dido]1191-sidonian dido , who was doomed not calmly to endure the loss of [[her]1191-sidonian dido loved]4245-her loved [Phrygian husband]4246-phrygian husband , graciously received [Aeneas]1143-aeneas to [[her]1191-sidonian dido home]2383-her home and [her]1191-sidonian dido regard : and on a pyre , erected with pretense of holy rites , [she]1191-sidonian dido fell upon the sword . Deceived [herself]1191-sidonian dido , [she]1191-sidonian dido there deceived [them]4240-the trojan ships all . [Aeneas]1143-aeneas , fleeing the new walls built on [that sandy shore]4248-that sandy shore , revisited [the land of [Eryx]739-eryx and [Acestes]1192-acestes]4249-the land of eryx and acestes , [[his]1143-aeneas true friend]4250-his true friend . [There]1500-there [he]1143-aeneas performed a hallowed sacrifice and paid due honor to [[[his]1143-aeneas father]1530-his father 's tomb]4253-his father 's tomb . And presently [he]1143-aeneas loosened from that shore the ships which [Iris]471-iris , [[Juno]488-juno 's minister]4254-juno 's minister , had almost burned ; and sailing , passed far off [the kingdom of [the son of [Hippotas]679-hippotas]4256-the son of hippotas , in [those hot regions]4257-those hot regions smoking with the fumes of burning sulphur]4255-the kingdom of the son of hippotas , in those hot regions smoking with the fumes of burning sulphur , and [he]1143-aeneas left behind [the rocky haunt of [[Achelous]922-achelous ' daughters]4259-achelous ' daughters]4258-the rocky haunt of achelous ' daughters , [the Sirens]358-the sirens . Then , when [[his]1143-aeneas good ship]4260-his good ship had lost [the pilot]5176-the pilot , [he]1143-aeneas coasted near [Inarime]359-inarime , near [Prochyta]360-prochyta , and near [the barren hill]4262-the barren hill which marks [another island , [Pithecusae]361-pithecusae]4263-another island , pithecusae , [an island named from [strange inhabitants]4265-strange inhabitants]4264-an island named from strange inhabitants . [The father of the gods]5078-the father of the gods abhorred the frauds and perjuries of [the Cercopians]1193-the cercopians and for the crimes of [that bad treacherous race]4267-that bad treacherous race , transformed [its men]4268-its men to ugly animals , appearing unlike [men]1399-men , although like [men]1399-men . [He]5078-the father of the gods had contracted and had bent [their]1399-men limbs , and flattened out [their]1399-men noses , bent back towards [their]1399-men foreheads ; [he]5078-the father of the gods had furrowed every face with wrinkles of old age , and made [them]1399-men live in that spot , after [he]5078-the father of the gods had covered all [their]1399-men bodies with long yellow ugly hair . Besides all that , [he]5078-the father of the gods took away from [them]1399-men the use of language and control of tongues , so long inclined to dreadful perjury ; and left [them]1399-men always to complain of life and [their]1399-men ill conduct in harsh jabbering . After [Aeneas]1143-aeneas had passed by [all those]4271-all those and seen to [his]1143-aeneas right hand [the distant walls guarding [the city of Parthenope]4273-the city of parthenope]4272-the distant walls guarding the city of parthenope , [he]1143-aeneas passed on [his]1143-aeneas left hand a mound , grave of [the tuneful son of Aeolus]4274-the tuneful son of aeolus . Landing on [[Cumae]362-cumae 's marshy shore]4275-cumae 's marshy shore , [he]1143-aeneas reached [a cavern]4276-a cavern , home of [the long lived Sibylla]4277-the long lived sibylla , and prayed that [she]4277-the long lived sibylla would give [him]1143-aeneas at [the lake]4278-the lake , [Avernus]1194-avernus , access to [[[his]1143-aeneas father]1530-his father 's shade]4280-his father 's shade . [She]4277-the long lived sibylla raised [her]4277-the long lived sibylla countenance , from gazing on the ground , and with an inspiration given to [her]4277-the long lived sibylla by influence of [the god]5013-the god , [she]4277-the long lived sibylla said , “ Much [you]1143-aeneas would have , [O man of famous deeds , whose courage is attested by the sword , whose filial piety is proved by flame]8342-o man of famous deeds , whose courage is attested by the sword , whose filial piety is proved by flame . But , [Trojan]1049-aeneas , have no fear . [I]4277-the long lived sibylla grant [your]1143-aeneas wish , and with [my]4277-the long lived sibylla guidance [you]1143-aeneas shall look upon [the latest kingdom of [the world]1360-the world]8343-the latest kingdom of the world , shall see [Elysian homes]8345-elysian homes and [[[your]1143-aeneas dear father]3025-your dear father 's shade]8347-your dear father 's shade , for virtue there is everywhere a way . ”[4277-the long lived sibylla] [She]4277-the long lived sibylla spoke , and pointed out to [him]4282-him a branch refulgent with bright gold , found in [the woods of [Juno of Avernus]363-juno of avernus]4283-the woods of juno of avernus , and commanded [him]4282-him to pluck it from the stem . [Aeneas]1049-aeneas did what [she]4277-the long lived sibylla advised [him]1049-aeneas . Then [he]1049-aeneas saw the wealth of [the dread Orcus]4284-the dread orcus , and [he]1049-aeneas saw [[his]1049-aeneas own ancestors]4285-his own ancestors , and beheld [the aged ghost of [great Anchises]958-old anchises]4286-the aged ghost of great anchises . There [he]1049-aeneas learned the laws of [that deep region]4287-that deep region , and what dangers must be undergone by [him]1049-aeneas in future wars . Retracing with [his]1049-aeneas weary steps the path up to the light , [he]1049-aeneas found relief from toil in converse with [the sage Cumaean guide]4288-the sage cumaean guide . While in thick dusk [he]1049-aeneas trod the frightful way , “ Whether [you]4277-the long lived sibylla are [a deity]1690-a deity , ”[1049-aeneas] [he]1049-aeneas said , “ Or human and most favored by [the gods]1395-the gods , to [me]1049-aeneas [you]4277-the long lived sibylla always will appear divine . [I]1049-aeneas will confess , too , [my]1049-aeneas existence here is due to [your]4277-the long lived sibylla kind aid , for by [your]4277-the long lived sibylla will [I]1049-aeneas visited the dark abodes of death , and [I]1049-aeneas escaped the death which [I]1049-aeneas beheld . For this great service , when [I]1049-aeneas shall emerge into the sunlit air , [I]1049-aeneas will erect for [you]4277-the long lived sibylla [a temple]3295-a temple and will burn for [you]4277-the long lived sibylla sweet incense kindled at the altar flame . ”[1049-aeneas] [The prophetess]4289-the prophetess looked on [him]1049-aeneas and with sighs , “ [I]4289-the prophetess am [no goddess]6350-no goddess , ”[4289-the prophetess] [she]4289-the prophetess replied , “ nor is it well to honor any mortal head with tribute of the holy frankincense . And , that [you]4277-the long lived sibylla may not err through ignorance , [I]4289-the prophetess tell [you]4277-the long lived sibylla life eternal without end was;offered to [me]4289-the prophetess , if [I]4289-the prophetess would but yield virginity to [Phoebus]549-phoebus for [his]549-phoebus love . And , while [he]549-phoebus hoped for this and in desire offered to bribe [me]4289-the prophetess for [my]4289-the prophetess virtue , first with gifts , [he]549-phoebus said , ‘ [Maiden of Cumae]1195-maiden of cumae choose whatever [you]4289-the prophetess may wish , and [you]4289-the prophetess shall gain all that [you]4289-the prophetess wish . ’ [I]4289-the prophetess pointed to a heap of dust collected there , and foolishly replied , ‘ As many birthdays must be given to [me]4289-the prophetess as there are particles of sand . ’ “[4289-the prophetess] For [I]0-i forgot to wish them days of changeless youth . [He]4290-he gave long life and offered youth besides , if [I]0-i would grant [his]4290-he wish . This [I]0-i refused , [I]0-i live unwedded still . [My]0-i happier time has fled away , now comes with tottering step infirm old age , which [I]0-i shall long endure . [You]4291-you find [me]0-i ending seven long centuries , and there remain for [me]0-i , before [my]0-i years equal the number of those grains of sand , three hundred harvests , three hundred vintages ! The time will come , when long increase of days will so contract [me]0-i from [my]0-i present size and so far waste away [my]0-i limbs with age that [I]0-i shall dwindle to a trifling weight , so trifling , it will never be believed [I]0-i once was loved and even pleased [a god]4898-a god . Perhaps , even [Phoebus]549-phoebus will not recognize [me]0-i , or will deny [he]549-phoebus ever bore [me]0-i love . But , though [I]0-i change till eye would never know [me]0-i , [my]0-i voice shall live , the fates will leave [my]0-i voice . ” [Sibylla]1196-sibylla with such words beguild [their]1196-sibylla way from [Stygian]365-stygian realms up to [the Euboean town]8352-the euboean town . [Trojan Aeneas]1049-aeneas , after [he]1049-aeneas had made due sacrifice in [Cumae]362-cumae , touched the shore that had not yet been given [[his]1049-aeneas nurse]8353-his nurse 's name . There [Macareus of Neritus]1100-macareus had come , [companion of long tried [Ulysses]1129-ulysses]8354-companion of long tried ulysses , there [he]1049-aeneas rested , weary of [his]1049-aeneas lengthened toils . [He]1049-aeneas recognized one left in [[Aetna]762-aetna 's cave]8355-aetna 's cave , greek Achaemenides , and , all amazed to find [him]1049-aeneas yet alive , [he]1049-aeneas said to [him]1049-aeneas , “[1197-achaemenides] What chance , or what god , [Achaemenides]1197-achaemenides , preserves [you]4293-you ? Why is this barbarian ship conveying [you]4293-you [a Greek]4294-a greek ? [What land]4295-what land is sought ? ” No longer ragged in the clothes [he]0-i wore and [[his]0-i own master]8356-his own master , wearing clothes not tacked with sharp thorns , [Achaemenides]1197-achaemenides replied , “[4294-a greek] Again may [I]0-i see [Polyphemus]1184-polyphemus ' jaws out - streaming with [their]1184-polyphemus slaughtered human blood ; if [[my]0-i own home and [Ithaca]332-ithaca]4296-my own home and ithaca give more delight to [me]0-i than [this barbarian bark]4297-this barbarian bark , or if [I]0-i venerate [Aeneas]1049-aeneas less than [[my]0-i own father]4298-my own father . If [I]0-i should give [my]0-i all , it never could express [my]0-i gratitude , that [I]0-i can speak and breath , and see the heavens illuminated by the gleaming sun — how can [I]0-i be ungrateful and forget all this ? Because of [him]1049-aeneas these limbs of [mine]0-i were spared [the Cyclops]470-the cyclops ' jaws ; and , though [I]0-i were even now to leave the light of life , [I]0-i should at worst be buried in [a tomb]5238-a tomb — not in [his]1049-aeneas maw . “ What were [my]4197-the cyclops feelings when ( unless indeed [my]4197-the cyclops terror had deprived [me]4197-the cyclops of all sense ) left [there]1500-there , [I]4197-the cyclops saw [you]8358-you making for [the open sea]5904-the open sea ? [I]4197-the cyclops wished to shout aloud , but was afraid it would betray [me]4197-the cyclops to [the enemy]6803-the enemy . The shoutings of [Ulysses]1129-ulysses nearly caused destruction of [[your]8358-you ship]8361-your ship and there [I]4197-the cyclops saw [the Cyclops]4197-the cyclops , when [he]4197-the cyclops tore a crag away and hurled the huge rock in the whirling waves ; [I]4197-the cyclops saw [him]4197-the cyclops also throw tremendous stones with [his]4197-the cyclops gigantic arms . They flew afar , as if impelled by catapults of war , [I]4197-the cyclops was struck dumb with terror lest the waves or stones might overwhelm [the ship]5746-the ship , forgetting that [I]4197-the cyclops still was on [the shore]5443-the shore ! “[4197-the cyclops] But when [your]4300-your flight had saved [you]4300-your from that death of cruelty , [the Cyclops]4197-the cyclops , roaring rage , paced all about [Mount Aetna]367-mount aetna , groping through [its]367-mount aetna forests with [his]4197-the cyclops outstretched arms . Deprived of sight , [he]4197-the cyclops stumbled there against the rocks , until [he]4197-the cyclops reached [the sea]1298-the sea ; and stretching out [his]4197-the cyclops gore stained arms into [its]1298-the sea waters there , [he]4197-the cyclops cursed all of [the Grecian race]4303-the grecian race , and said , ‘ Oh ! that some accident would carry back [Ulysses]1129-ulysses to [me]0-i , or but [one of [[his]1129-ulysses companions]5589-his companions ; against whom [my]0-i rage might vent itself , whose joints [my]0-i hand might tear whose blood might drench [my]0-i throat , whose living limbs might quiver in [my]0-i teeth]4304-one of his companions ; against whom my rage might vent itself , whose joints my hand might tear whose blood might drench my throat , whose living limbs might quiver in my teeth . How trifling then , how insignificant would be the loss , of [my]0-i sight which [he]1129-ulysses took from [me]0-i ! ’ “ All this and more [he]4197-the cyclops said . A ghastly horror took possession of [me]1129-ulysses when [I]1129-ulysses saw [his]4197-the cyclops face and every feature streaming yet with blood , [his]4197-the cyclops ruthless hands , and the vile open space where [his]4197-the cyclops one eye had been , and [his]4197-the cyclops coarse limbs , and [his]4197-the cyclops beard matted through with human blood . “[1129-ulysses] It seemed as if Death were before [my]0-i eyes , yet that was but the least part of [my]0-i woe . [I]0-i seemed upon the point of being caught , [my]0-i flesh about to be the food of [his]1129-ulysses . Before [my]0-i mind was fixed the time [I]0-i saw [two bodies of [[my]0-i loved companions]4307-my loved companions]4306-two bodies of my loved companions dashed three or four times hard against the ground , when [he]1129-ulysses above [them]4306-two bodies of my loved companions , like a lion , crouched , devouring quickly in [his]1129-ulysses hideous jaws , [their]4306-two bodies of my loved companions entrails and [their]4306-two bodies of my loved companions flesh and [their]4306-two bodies of my loved companions crushed bones , white marrowed , and [their]4306-two bodies of my loved companions mangled quivering limbs . A trembling fear seized on [me]0-i as [I]0-i stood pallid and without power to move from there , while [I]0-i recalled [him]1129-ulysses chewing greedily , and belching out [his]1129-ulysses bloody banquet from [his]1129-ulysses huge mouth — vomiting crushed pieces mixed with phlegmy wine — and [I]0-i feared such a doom in readiness , awaited wretched [me]0-i . “ Most carefully concealed for many days , trembling at every sound and fearing death , although desiring death ; [I]0-i fed [myself]0-i on grass and acorns , mixed with leaves ; alone and destitute , despondent unto death , awaiting [my]0-i destruction [I]0-i lost hope . In that condition a long while , at last [I]0-i saw [a ship]5175-a ship not far off , and by signs prayed for deliverance , as [I]0-i ran in haste , down to [the shore]5443-the shore . [My]0-i prayers prevailed on [them]8367-they . [A Trojan ship]8368-a trojan ship took in and saved [a Greek]4294-a greek ! “[0-i] And now , O dearest to [me]0-i of [all men]1428-all men , tell [me]0-i of [your]4309-your adventures , of [[your]4309-your chief]4310-your chief and [comrades]4311-comrades , when [you]4309-your sailed out on [the sea]1298-the sea . ” Then [Macareus]1100-macareus told [him]1100-macareus of [Aeolus]665-aeolus , [the son of [Hippotas]679-hippotas , whose kingdom is [the Tuscan sea]8371-the tuscan sea]8370-the son of hippotas , whose kingdom is the tuscan sea , whose prison holds the winds , and how [Ulysses]1129-ulysses had received the winds tied in a bull 's hide bag , an awesome gift , how nine days with a favoring breeze [they]8367-they sailed and saw afar [their]8367-they longed for [native land]8158-native land . How , as the tenth day dawned , [the crew]5743-the crew was moved by envy and a lust for gold , which [they]5743-the crew imagined hidden in that leathern bag and so untied the thong which held the winds . These , rushing out , had driven [the vessel]5177-the vessel back over the waves which [they]8367-they had safely passed , back to [the harbor of [King Aeolus]665-aeolus]8375-the harbor of king aeolus . “[0-i] From [there]1500-there , ” [he]0-i said , “[0-i] [we]4314-we sailed until [we]4314-we reached [the ancient city of [Lamus]368-lamus]4315-the ancient city of lamus , [Laestrygon]369-laestrygon . — [Antiphates]1199-antiphates was reigning in [that land]5048-that land , and [I]0-i was sent with [two men of [[our]4314-we troop]4318-our troop]4317-two men of our troop , ambassadors to see [him]4319-him . [Two of [us]4314-we]4320-two of us escaped with difficulty , but [the third]4321-the third stained the accursed [Lestrygonian]1200-lestrygonian 's jaws with [his]4321-the third devoted blood . [Antiphates]1199-antiphates pursued [us]4314-we , calling out [his]4319-him murderous horde . [They]4322-they came and , hurling stones and heavy beams , [they]4322-they overwhelmed and sank [both ships]4323-both ships and [men]1399-men . [One ship]4325-one ship escaped , on which [Ulysses]1129-ulysses sailed . “ Grieving , lamenting for [companions lost]8376-companions lost , [we]4314-we finally arrived at [that land]5048-that land which [you]8378-you may discern far off , and , trust [my]1129-ulysses word , far off it should be seen — [I]1129-ulysses saw it near ! And oh most righteous [Trojan]1049-aeneas , [[Venus]996-venus ' son]8379-venus ' son , [Aeneas]1049-aeneas , whom [I]1129-ulysses call no more [a foe]8380-a foe , [I]1129-ulysses warn [you]8378-you now : avoid [the shores of [Circe]1189-circe]8381-the shores of circe . “[1129-ulysses] [We]4326-we moored [[our]4326-we ship]4327-our ship beside [that country]4328-that country too ; but , mindful of the dangers [we]4326-we had run with [Laestrygons]1201-laestrygons and [cruel Polyphemus]1184-polyphemus , refused to go ashore . [Ulysses]1129-ulysses chose [some men]4329-some men by [lot]4330-lot and told [them]4329-some men to seek out a roof which [he]1129-ulysses had seen among the trees . [The lot]4331-the lot took [me]0-i , then [staunch Polytes]1202-staunch polytes next , [Eurylochus]1203-eurylochus , [Elpenor]1204-elpenor fond of wine , and eighteen more and brought [us]4326-we to the walls of [[Circe]1189-circe 's dwelling]4332-circe 's dwelling . “ As [we]4326-we drew near and stood before the door , a thousand wolves rushed out from [woods near by]8382-woods near by , and with the wolves there ran [she]8383-she bears and lionesses , dread to see . And yet [we]4326-we had no cause to fear , for [none]1829-none would harm [us]4326-we with the smallest scratch . Why , [they]8385-they in friendship even wagged [their]8385-they tails and fawned upon [us]4326-we , while [we]4326-we stood in doubt . “[4333-handmaids] Then [handmaids]4333-handmaids took [us]4326-we in and led [us]4326-we on through [marble halls]4334-marble halls to the presence of [[their]4333-handmaids queen]4335-their queen . [She]4335-their queen , in a beautiful recess , sat on [her]4335-their queen throne , clad richly in a shining purple robe , and over it [she]4335-their queen wore a golden veil . Nereids and nymphs , who never carded fleece with motion of [their]4336-their fingers , nor drew out a ductile thread , were setting potent herbs in proper order and arranging them in baskets — a confusing wealth of flowers were scattered among leaves of every hue : and [she]4335-their queen prescribed the tasks [they]4337-they all performed . “ [She]4335-their queen knew the natural use of every leaf and combinations of [their]4337-they virtues , when mixed properly ; and , giving [them]4337-they [her]4335-their queen close attention , [she]4335-their queen examined every herb as it was weighed . When [she]4335-their queen observed [us]4338-our there , and had received [our]4338-our greetings and returned them , [she]4335-their queen smiled , as if [we]4338-our should be well received . At once [she]4335-their queen had [[her]4335-their queen maidens]8386-her maidens bring a drink of parched barley , of honey and strong wine , and curds of milk . And in the nectarous draught [she]4335-their queen added secretly [her]4335-their queen baleful drugs . “[4338-our] [We]4338-our took the cups presented to [us]4338-our by [her]4335-their queen sacred right hand ; and , as soon as [we]4338-our , so thirsty , quaffed them with [our]4338-our parching mouths , [that ruthless goddess with [her]4335-their queen outstretched wand]4339-that ruthless goddess with her outstretched wand touched lightly the topmost hair upon [our]4338-our heads . ( Although [I]0-i am ashamed , [I]0-i tell [you]4340-you this ) stiff bristles quickly grew out over [me]0-i , and [I]0-i could speak no more . Instead of words [I]0-i uttered hoarse murmurs and towards the ground began to bend and gaze with all [my]0-i face . [I]0-i felt [my]0-i mouth take on a hardened skin with a long crooked snout , and [my]0-i neck swell with muscles . With [the very member which a moment earlier had received the cup]4341-the very member which a moment earlier had received the cup [I]0-i now made tracks in sand of [the palace court]4342-the palace court . Then with [[my]0-i friends]6756-my friends , who suffered a like change ( [charms have such power]4344-charms have such power ! ) [I]0-i was prisoned in a stye . “ [We]4338-our saw [Eurylochus]1203-eurylochus alone avoid [our]4338-our swinish form , for [he]1203-eurylochus refused the cup . If [he]1203-eurylochus had drained it , [I]1205-peace bearing hermes should still remain one of a bristly herd . Nor would [his]1203-eurylochus news have made [Ulysses]1129-ulysses sure of [our]4338-our disaster and brought a swift avenger of [our]4338-our fate . “[1205-peace bearing hermes] [Peace bearing Hermes]1205-peace bearing hermes gave [him]4345-he a white flower from a black root , called [Moly]1206-moly by [the gods]1395-the gods . With this protection and [the god]5013-the god 's advice [he]4345-he entered [[Circe]1189-circe 's hall]4348-circe 's hall and , as [she]1189-circe gave the treacherous cup and with [her]1189-circe magic wand essayed to touch [his]4345-he hair , [he]4345-he drove [her]1189-circe back and terrified [her]1189-circe with [his]4345-he quick drawn sword . [She]1189-circe gave [her]1189-circe promise , and , right hands exchanged , [he]4345-he was received unharmed into [[her]1189-circe couch]4349-her couch , where [he]4345-he required the bodies of [[his]4345-he friends]5709-his friends awarded [him]4345-he , as [his]4345-he prized marriage gift . “ [We]8387-we then were sprinkled with more favored juice of harmless plants , and smitten on the head with the magic wand reversed . And new charms were repeated , all conversely to the charms which had degraded [us]8387-we . Then , as [she]1189-circe sings , more and yet more [we]8387-we raise [ourselves]8387-we erect , the bristles fall off and the fissures leave [our]8387-we cloven feet , [our]8387-we shoulders overcome their lost shape and [our]8387-we arms become attached , as they had been before . With tears of joy [we]8387-we all embrace [him]4345-he , also weeping tears ; and [we]8387-we cling fondly to [[our]8387-we chieftain]8388-our chieftain 's neck ; — not one of [us]8387-we could say a single word till thus [we]8387-we had attested gratitude . ”[4345-he] “ The full space of a year detained [us]8387-we [there]1500-there , and [I]1207-picus , remaining that long stretch of time , saw many things and heard as much besides : and this among the many other things , was told [me]1207-picus secretly by [one of [the four handmaidens of those rites]8391-the four handmaidens of those rites]8390-one of the four handmaidens of those rites . While [Circe]1189-circe passed [her]1189-circe time from all apart except [[my]1207-picus chief]8392-my chief , [she]1189-circe brought [me]1207-picus to a white marble shape , [a youth who bore a woodpecker upon [his]8393-a youth who bore a woodpecker upon his head . it stood erected in a hallowed place , adorned with many wreaths head . It stood erected in [a hallowed place]8394-a hallowed place , adorned with many wreaths]8393-a youth who bore a woodpecker upon his head . it stood erected in a hallowed place , adorned with many wreaths . When [I]1207-picus had asked the statue 's name and why [he]8393-a youth who bore a woodpecker upon his head . it stood erected in a hallowed place , adorned with many wreaths stood revered in [that most sacred temple]8395-that most sacred temple , and what caused that bird [he]8393-a youth who bore a woodpecker upon his head . it stood erected in a hallowed place , adorned with many wreaths carried on [his]8393-a youth who bore a woodpecker upon his head . it stood erected in a hallowed place , adorned with many wreaths head ; [she]1189-circe said : — ‘ Listen , [Macareus]1100-macareus , and learn from this tale too the power of [Circe]1189-circe , and weigh the knowledge well ! ’ “[1207-picus] [Picus]1207-picus , [offspring of [Saturn]463-saturn]4351-offspring of saturn , was [the king of [the Ausonian land]4123-the ausonian land]4352-the king of the ausonian land , [one very fond of horses raised for war]4354-one very fond of horses raised for war . [The young man]4355-the young man 's form was just what [you]4356-you now see , and had [you]4356-you known [him]4355-the young man as [he]4355-the young man lived , [you]4356-you would not change a line . [His]4355-the young man nature was as noble as [his]4355-the young man shape . [He]4355-the young man could not yet have seen the steeds contend four times in races held with each fifth year at [Grecian Elis]371-grecian elis . But [his]4355-the young man good looks had charmed the dryads born on [Latin hills]4357-latin hills , [Naiads]7697-naiads would pine for [him]4355-the young man — [both goddesses of spring and goddesses of fountains]4359-both goddesses of spring and goddesses of fountains , pined for [him]4355-the young man , and nymphs that live in [streaming Albula]372-streaming albula , Numicus , Anio 's course , brief flowing Almo , and rapid Nar and [Farfarus]373-farfarus , so cool in its delightful shades ; all these and those which haunt [the forest lake of [Scythian Diana]374-scythian diana and [the other nearby lakes]4361-the other nearby lakes]4360-the forest lake of scythian diana and the other nearby lakes . “ ‘ But , heedless of all these , [he]4355-the young man loved a nymph whom on [the hill]7433-the hill , called [Palatine]387-the palatine , ' tis said , [Venilia]1208-venilia bore to [Janus]1209-janus double faced . When [she]1208-venilia had reached the age of marriage , [she]1208-venilia was given to [Picus Laurentine]1207-picus , preferred by [her]1208-venilia above all others — wonderful indeed [her]1208-venilia beauty , but more wonderful [her]1208-venilia skill in singing , from which art [they]8397-they called [her]1208-venilia [Canens]1210-canens . The fascination of [her]1208-venilia voice would move [the woods]1317-the woods and rocks and tame wild beasts , and stay long rivers , and it even detained the wandering bird . Once , while [she]1208-venilia sang a lay with high , clear voice , [Picus]1207-picus on [his]1207-picus keen horse rode in [Laurentian fields]8399-laurentian fields to hunt the boar , two spears in [his]1207-picus left hand , [his]1207-picus purple cloak fastened with gold . [The daughter of the Sun]3131-the daughter of the sun wandered in [woods near by]8382-woods near by to find new herbs growing on [fertile hills]8402-fertile hills , for [she]4362-she had left [Circaean fields]8403-circaean fields called so from [her]4362-she own name . “[4362-she] ‘ From a concealing thicket [she]4362-she observed [the youth]1554-the youth with wonder . All the gathered herbs dropped from [her]4362-she hands , forgotten , to the ground and a hot fever - flame seemed to pervade [her]4362-she marrow . When [she]4362-she could collect [her]4362-she thought [she]4362-she wanted to confess [her]4362-she great desire , but the swift horse and [[his]1554-the youth surrounding guards]4364-his surrounding guards prevented [her]4362-she approach . “ Still [you]1554-the youth shall not escape [me]4362-she , ”[4362-she] [she]4362-she declared , “ although [you]1554-the youth may be borne on winds , if [I]4362-she but know [myself]4362-she , and if some potency in herbs remains , and if [my]4362-she art of charms does not deceive . ”[4362-she] “ ‘ Such were her;thoughts , and then [she]4362-she formed an image of [a bodiless wild swine]8404-a bodiless wild swine and let [it]8404-a bodiless wild swine cross the trail before [the king]6107-the king and rush into [a woodland dense with trees]8406-a woodland dense with trees , which fallen trunks made pathless for [his]6107-the king horse . [Picus]1207-picus at once , unconscious of all harm , followed [the phantom - prey]8407-the phantom - prey and , hastily quitting the reeking back of [his]1207-picus good steed , [he]1207-picus wandered in pursuit of a vain hope , on foot through [that deep wood]8408-that deep wood . [She]4365-she seized the chance and by [her]4365-she incantation called strange gods with a strange charm , which had the power to hide the white moon 's features and draw thirsty clouds about [[her]4365-she father]5022-her father 's head . The changing sky then lowered more black at each repeated tone of incantation , and the ground exhaled its vapours , while [[his]6107-the king people]4897-his people wandered there along [the darkened paths]8411-the darkened paths until [no guard]8412-no guard was near to aid [the imperiled king]8413-the imperiled king . “[4365-she] ‘ Having now gained an opportunity and place , [she]4365-she said , “ O , [youth most beautiful]8414-youth most beautiful ! By those fine eyes , which captivated [mine]4365-she , and by that graceful person , which brings [me]4365-she , even [me]4365-she , [a goddess]5320-a goddess , suppliant to [you]8413-the imperiled king , have pity on [my]4365-she passion ; let [the Sun , who looks on all things]8416-the sun , who looks on all things , be [[your]8413-the imperiled king father - in - law]3475-your father - in - law ; do not despise [Circe]1189-circe , [the Titaness]8418-the titaness . ”[4365-she] “ But fiercely [he]0-i repelled [her]4366-you and [her]4366-you prayer , “[4366-you] Whoever [you]4366-you may be , [you]4366-you are not mine , ” [he]0-i said . “[4367-another lady] [Another lady]4367-another lady has [my]0-i heart . [I]0-i pray that for a lengthening space of time [she]4367-another lady may so hold [me]0-i . [I]0-i will not pollute conjugal ties with the unhallowed loves of [any stranger]4368-any stranger , while [the Fates]8298-the fates preserve to [me]0-i [the child of [Janus]1209-janus]4370-the child of janus , [[my]0-i dear [Canens]1210-canens]4371-my dear canens . ” “[8298-the fates] ‘ [Titan 's daughter]4372-titan 's daughter , when many pleas had failed , said angrily , “ [You]4366-you shall not leave [me]4372-titan 's daughter with impunity , and [you]4366-you shall not return to [Canens]1210-canens ; and by [your]4366-you experience [you]4366-you shall now learn what can be done by [her]4367-another lady so slighted — what [a woman deep in love]8419-a woman deep in love can do — and [Circe]1189-circe is that slighted love . ”[4372-titan 's daughter] “ ‘ Then twice [she]4367-another lady turned [herself]4367-another lady to face [the west]8420-the west and twice to face [the East]377-the east ; and three times then [she]4367-another lady touched [the young man]4355-the young man with [her]4367-another lady wand , and sang three incantations . [Picus]1207-picus fled , but , marvelling at [his]1207-picus unaccustomed speed , [he]1207-picus saw new wings , that spread on either side and bore [him]1207-picus onward . Angry at the thought of transformation — all so suddenly added a strange bird to [the Latian woods]8422-the latian woods , [he]1207-picus struck the wild oaks with [his]1207-picus hard new beak , and in [his]1207-picus rage inflicted many wounds on the long waving branches [his]1207-picus wings took the purple of [his]1207-picus robe . The piece of gold which [he]1207-picus had used so nicely in [his]1207-picus robe was changed to golden feathers , and [his]1207-picus neck was rich as yellow gold . Nothing remained of [Picus]1207-picus as [he]1207-picus was except the name . “[8298-the fates] ‘ While all this happened [[his]4373-his attendants]7131-his attendants called on [Picus]1207-picus often but in vain throughout [surrounding fields]4375-surrounding fields , and finding not a trace of [[their]7131-his attendants young king]4376-their young king , at length by chance [they]7131-his attendants met with [Circe]1189-circe , who had cleared the darkened air and let the clouds disperse before the wind and clear rays of the sun . Then with good cause [they]7131-his attendants blamed [her]1189-circe , [they]7131-his attendants demanded the return of [[their]7131-his attendants lost king]4377-their lost king , and with [their]7131-his attendants hunting spears [they]7131-his attendants threatened [her]1189-circe . [She]1189-circe , sprinkling baleful drugs and poison juices over [them]7131-his attendants , invoked the aid of [Night]643-night and [all the gods of Night]4378-all the gods of night from [Erebus]164-erebus and [Chaos]1211-chaos , and desired the aid of [Hecat]1212-hecat with long , wailing cries . “ ‘ Most wonderful to tell , [the forests]5189-the forests leaped from fixed localities and the torn soil uttered deep groans , the trees surrounding changed from life - green to sick pallor , and the grass was moistened with besprinkling drops of blood ; the stones sent forth harsh longings , unknown dogs barked loudly , and the ground became a mass of filthy snakes , and unsubstantial hosts of the departed flitted without sound . [The men]5722-the men all quaked appalled . With magic rod [she]1189-circe touched [their]5722-the men faces , pale and all amazed , and at [her]1189-circe touch [the youths]8425-the youths took on strange forms of wild animals . [None]1829-none kept [his]1829-none proper shape . “[1212-hecat] ‘ The setting sun is resting low upon [the far Tartessian shores]4379-the far tartessian shores , and now in vain [[her]1189-circe husband]1381-her husband is expected by the eyes of longing [Canens]1210-canens . [[Her]1189-circe slaves]4381-her slaves and [people]4382-people run about through all [the forest]5365-the forest , holding lights to meet [him]1381-her husband . Nor is it enough for [that dear nymph]4384-that dear nymph to weep and frenzied tear [her]1189-circe hair and beat [her]1189-circe breast — [she]1189-circe did all that and more . Distracted [she]1189-circe rushed forth and wandered through [the Latin fields]4385-the latin fields . Six nights , six brightening dawns found [her]1189-circe quite unrefreshed with food or sleep wandering at random over [hill and dale]4386-hill and dale . [The Tiber]528-the tiber saw [her]1189-circe last , with grief and toil wearied and lying on [[his]528-the tiber widespread bank]4387-his widespread bank . In tears [she]1189-circe poured out words with a faint voice , lamenting [her]1189-circe sad woe , as when the swan about to die sings a funereal dirge . Melting with grief at last [she]1189-circe pined away ; [her]1189-circe flesh , [her]1189-circe bones , [her]1189-circe marrow liquified and vanished by degrees as formless air and yet the story lingers near [that place]5935-that place , fitly named [Canens]1210-canens by old - time Camenae ! . ’ “ Such things [I]1100-macareus heard and saw through a long year . Sluggish , inactive through [our]8427-our idleness , [we]8427-our were all ordered to embark again out on [the deep]1961-the deep , again to set [our]8427-our sails . [The Titaness]8418-the titaness explained the doubtful paths , the great extent and peril , of [wild seas]8430-wild seas . [I]1100-macareus was alarmed , [I]1100-macareus will confess to [you]8431-you ; so , having reached [these shores]8238-these shores , [I]1100-macareus have remained . ”[1100-macareus] [Macareus]1100-macareus finished . And [[Aeneas]1049-aeneas ' nurse]4389-aeneas ' nurse , now buried in a marble urn , had this brief , strange inscription on [[her]4389-aeneas ' nurse tomb]7334-her tomb : — “ [[My]1100-macareus foster - child of proven piety]8433-my foster - child of proven piety , burned [me]1100-macareus [Caieta]379-caieta here : although [I]1100-macareus was at first preserved from Argive fire , [I]1100-macareus later burned with fire which was [my]1100-macareus due . ”[1100-macareus] The cable loosened from [the grassy bank]4391-the grassy bank , [they]4392-they steered a course which kept [them]4392-they well away from ill famed Circe 's wiles and from [[her]4393-her home]2383-her home and sought [the groves where [Tiber]528-the tiber dark with shade , breaks with [his]528-the tiber yellow sands into [the sea]1298-the sea]4395-the groves where tiber dark with shade , breaks with his yellow sands into the sea . [Aeneas]1049-aeneas then fell heir to [the home]4397-the home and won [the daughter of [Latinus]1213-latinus]4398-the daughter of latinus , [[Faunus]1183-faunus ' son]4399-faunus ' son , not without war . [A people very fierce]4400-a people very fierce made war , and [Turnus]1214-turnus , [[their]4400-a people very fierce young chief]4401-their young chief , indignant fought to hold a promised bride . With [Latium]380-latium all [Etruria]381-etruria was embroiled , a victory hard to win was sought through war . By foreign aid [each side]4402-each side got further strength : [the camp of [Rutuli]382-rutuli]4403-the camp of rutuli abounds in [men]1399-men , and [many]8134-many throng [the opposing camp of [Troy]250-troy]4406-the opposing camp of troy . [Aeneas]1049-aeneas did not find [[Evander]1215-evander 's home]4407-evander 's home in vain . But [Venulus]1216-venulus with no success came to the realm of [exiled [Diomed]1125-diomed]4408-exiled diomed . [That hero]3841-that hero had marked out [[his]3841-that hero mighty walls]4410-his mighty walls with favor of [Iapygian Daunus]1217-iapygian daunus and held fields that came to [him]3841-that hero as [marriage dower]4411-marriage dower . When [Venulus]1216-venulus , by [Turnus]1214-turnus ' orders , made request for aid , [the Aetolian hero]4412-the aetolian hero said that [he]4412-the aetolian hero was poor in [men]1399-men : [he]4412-the aetolian hero did not wish to risk in battle [himself]4412-the aetolian hero nor [any troops belonging to [[his]4412-the aetolian hero father - in - law]6448-his father - in - law and had [no troops of [his]4412-the aetolian hero that [he]4412-the aetolian hero could arm for battle]4416-no troops of his that he could arm for battle]4414-any troops belonging to his father - in - law and had no troops of his that he could arm for battle . “ Lest [you]8434-you should think [I]4412-the aetolian hero feign , ”[4412-the aetolian hero] [he]4412-the aetolian hero then went on “ Although [my]4412-the aetolian hero grief must be renewed because of bitter recollections of the past , [I]4412-the aetolian hero will endure recital now to [you]8434-you : — “[4412-the aetolian hero] After [the lofty Ilion]4417-the lofty ilion was burnt and [Pergama]311-pergama had fed the Grecian flames , and [Ajax]1126-ajax , [the Narycian hero]4418-the narycian hero , had brought from [a virgin]1462-a virgin , for [a virgin wronged]4420-a virgin wronged , the punishment which [he]1126-ajax alone deserved on [our]4421-our whole expedition , [we]4421-our were then dispersed and driven by violent winds over [the hostile seas]4422-the hostile seas ; and [we]4421-our , [the Greeks]2456-the greeks , had to endure in darkness , lightning , rain , the wrath both of the heavens and of [the sea]1298-the sea , and [Caphareus]1219-caphareus , the climax of [our]4421-our woe . Not to detain [you]4425-you by relating such unhappy things in order , [Greece]117-greece might then have seemed to merit even [Priam]1143-aeneas 's tears . “ Although well armed [Minerva]543-minerva 's care preserved [me]0-i then and brought [me]0-i safe through rocks and waves , from [[my]0-i native [Argos]60-argos]8435-my native argos [I]0-i was driven again , for outraged [Venus]996-venus took [her]996-venus full revenge remembering still that wound of long ago ; and [I]0-i endured such hardships on [the deep]1961-the deep , and hazards amid armies on [the shore]5443-the shore , that often [I]0-i called [those happy whom the storm — an ill that came on all]8438-those happy whom the storm — an ill that came on all , or [Cephareus]1220-cephareus had drowned . [I]0-i even wished [I]0-i had been [one of [them]4426-my best companions]2067-one of them . “[0-i] [[My]0-i best companions]4426-my best companions having now endured utmost extremities in wars and [seas]1413-seas , lost courage and demanded a swift end of [our]4428-we long wandering . [Acmon]1221-acmon , by nature hot , and much embittered by misfortune , said , ‘ What now remains for [you]4426-my best companions , [[my]0-i friends]6756-my friends , that patience can endure ? What can be done by [Venus]996-venus ( if [she]996-venus wants to ) more than [she]996-venus already has done ? While [we]4428-we have a dread of greater evils , reason will be found for patience ; but , when fortune brings [her]996-venus worst , [we]4428-we scorn and trample fear beneath [our]4428-we feet . Upon the height of woe , why should [we]4428-we care ? Let [Venus]996-venus listen , let [her]996-venus hate [Diomed]1125-diomed more than all others — as indeed [she]996-venus does , [we]4428-we all despise [her]996-venus hate . At a great price [we]4428-we have bought and won the right to such contempt ! ’ “ With language of this kind [Pleuronian Acmon]1221-acmon . Provoking [Venus]996-venus further than before , revived [her]996-venus former anger . [His]0-i fierce words were then approved of by [a few]8440-a few , while [we]4428-we [the greater number of [[his]0-i real friends]8442-his real friends]8441-the greater number of his real friends , rebuked the words of [Acmon]1221-acmon : and while [he]0-i prepared to answer [us]4428-we , [his]0-i voice , and even the passage of [his]0-i voice , were both at once diminished , [his]0-i hair changed to feathers , while [his]0-i neck took a new form . [His]0-i breast and back covered themselves with down , and both [his]0-i arms grew longer feathers , and [his]0-i elbows curved into light wings , much of each foot was changed to long toes , and [his]0-i mouth grew still and hard with pointed horn . “[4430-his] Amazed at [his]4430-his swift change were [Lycus]1082-lycus , [Abas]672-abas , [Nycteus]1222-nycteus and Rhexenor . And , while [they]4431-they stared , [they]4431-they took [his]4430-his feathered shape . [The larger portion of [[my]0-i company]4433-my company]4432-the larger portion of my company flew from [[their]4431-they boat]4434-their boat , resounding all around [our]4435-our oars with flapping of new - fashioned wings . If [you]4436-you should ask the form of [these strange birds]4437-these strange birds [they]4437-these strange birds were like snowy swans , though not the same . “ Now as [[Iapygian Daunus]1217-iapygian daunus ' son - in - law]8443-iapygian daunus ' son - in - law [I]4437-these strange birds scarcely hold [this town]8444-this town and [arid fields]8445-arid fields with [[my]4437-these strange birds small remnant of [trustworthy men]8447-trustworthy men]8446-my small remnant of trustworthy men . ”[4437-these strange birds] So [Diomed]1125-diomed made answer . [Venulus]1216-venulus soon after left [the Calydonian realms]4438-the calydonian realms , [Peucetian bays]383-peucetian bays , and [the Messapian fields]4439-the messapian fields . Among [those fields]4440-those fields [he]1216-venulus saw a darkened cave in woods and waving reeds . [The halfgoat Pan]4441-the halfgoat pan now lives [there]1500-there , but in older time [the nymphs]5672-the nymphs possessed it . [An Apulian shepherd]4444-an apulian shepherd scared [them]5672-the nymphs from [that spot]4445-that spot . At first [he]1216-venulus terrified [them]5672-the nymphs with a sudden fear , but soon in scorn , as [they]5672-the nymphs considered what [the intruder]4446-the intruder was , [they]5672-the nymphs danced before [him]1216-venulus , moving feet to time . [The shepherd]4447-the shepherd clown abused [them]5672-the nymphs , capering , grotesquely imitating graceful steps , and railed at [them]5672-the nymphs with coarse and foolish words . [He]1216-venulus was not silent till a tree 's new bark had closed [his]1216-venulus mouth for now [he]1216-venulus is a tree . And the wild olive 's fruit took bitterness from [him]1216-venulus . It has the tartness of [his]1216-venulus tongue . When [the ambassadors]4448-the ambassadors returned and told [their]4448-the ambassadors tale about Aetolian arms refused , [the bold Rutulians]4449-the bold rutulians carried on the war without [those forces]4450-those forces , and much blood was shed . Then [Turnus]1214-turnus with a greedy torch drew near [the Trojan fleet , well built of close - knit pine]4451-the trojan fleet , well built of close - knit pine . What had escaped the waves , now feared the flame . Soon [Mulciber]504-mulciber was burning pitch and wax and other food of fire , up the high masts [he]504-mulciber ran and fed upon the tight furled sails , and even the benches in the curved hull smoked . When [the holy mother of the gods]4452-the holy mother of the gods , recalling how those same pines were felled on [Ida]602-ida 's crest , filled the wind with a sound of cymbals clashed and trill of boxwood flutes . Borne through light air by [her]4452-the holy mother of the gods famed lion yoke , [she]4452-the holy mother of the gods came and said , “ In vain [you]1214-turnus cast the fire with impious hand , [Turnus]1214-turnus , for [I]4452-the holy mother of the gods will save this burning fleet . [I]4452-the holy mother of the gods will not let the greedy flame consume trees that were part and members of [[my]4452-the holy mother of the gods grove]8448-my grove . ”[4452-the holy mother of the gods] It thundered while [she]4452-the holy mother of the gods spoke , and heavy clouds , following the thunder , brought a storm of bounding hail . [The Astraean brothers]4453-the astraean brothers filled both air and swollen waters with [their]4453-the astraean brothers rage and rushed to battle . With the aid of one of [them]4453-the astraean brothers [the kindly mother]4454-the kindly mother broke the ropes which held [the Phrygian ships]4455-the phrygian ships , and , drawing all prow foremost , plunged [them]4455-the phrygian ships underneath the wave . Softening quickly in [the waters quiet depth]4456-the waters quiet depth , [their]4455-the phrygian ships wood was changed to flesh , the curving prows were metamorphosed into human heads , blades of the oars made feet , the looms were changed to swimming legs , the sides turned human flanks , each keel below the middle of [a ship]5175-a ship transformed became a spine , the cordage changed to soft hair , and the sail yards changed to arms . The azure color of [the ships]2641-the ships remained . As sea - nymphs in [the water]6010-the water [they]4453-the astraean brothers began to agitate with virgin sports the waves , which [they]4453-the astraean brothers had always dreaded . Natives of [the rugged mountains]5302-the rugged mountains [they]4453-the astraean brothers are now so changed , [they]4453-the astraean brothers swim and dwell in [the soft flowing sea]4461-the soft flowing sea , with every influence of birth forgot . Never forgetful of the myriad risks [they]4453-the astraean brothers have endured among the boisterous waves , [they]4453-the astraean brothers often give a helping hand to [ships tossed in the power of storms]4462-ships tossed in the power of storms — unless , of course , [the ship]5746-the ship might carry [men of Grecian race]4464-men of grecian race . Never forgetful of [the Phrygians]1223-the phrygians and catastrophe , [their]4453-the astraean brothers hatred was so great of all [Pelasgians]1130-pelasgians , that [they]4453-the astraean brothers looked with joy upon the fragments of [[Ulysses]1129-ulysses ' ship]4465-ulysses ' ship ; and were delighted when [they]4453-the astraean brothers saw [the ship of [King Alcinous]1224-king alcinous]4466-the ship of king alcinous growing hard upon the breakers , as its wood was turned to stone . [Many]8134-many were hopeful that [a fleet which had received life strangely in the forms of nymphs]4468-a fleet which had received life strangely in the forms of nymphs would cause [the chieftain of the Rutuli]4469-the chieftain of the rutuli to feel such awe that [he]4469-the chieftain of the rutuli would end [their]4453-the astraean brothers strife . But [he]4469-the chieftain of the rutuli continued fighting , and each side had [[its]4470-its own gods]4471-its own gods , and each had courage too , which often can be as potent as [the gods]1395-the gods . Now [they]4453-the astraean brothers forgot [the kingdom]5991-the kingdom as [a dower]4474-a dower , forgot the scepter of [a father - in - law]1623-a father - in - law , and even forgot [the pure Lavinia]4476-the pure lavinia : [their]4453-the astraean brothers one thought was to conquer , and [they]4453-the astraean brothers waged war to prevent the shame of a defeat . But [Venus]996-venus finally beheld the arms of [[her]996-venus victorious son]4477-her victorious son ; for [Turnus]1214-turnus fell , and [Ardea]1225-ardea fell , [a town which , while [he]1214-turnus lived , was counted strong]4478-a town which , while he lived , was counted strong . The Trojan swords destroyed [it]4479-it . — [All [its]4479-it houses]4480-all its houses burned and sank down in the heated embers : and a bird not known before that time , flew upward from a wrecked heap , beating the dead ashes with its flapping wings . The voice , the lean pale look , the sorrows of [a captured city]4481-a captured city , even the name of [the ruined city]6838-the ruined city , all these things remain in that bird — [Ardea]1225-ardea 's fallen walls are beaten in lamentation by [his]1214-turnus wings . The merit of [Aeneas]1143-aeneas now had moved [the gods]1395-the gods . Even [Juno]488-juno stayed [her]488-juno lasting hate , when , with the state of young Iulus safe , [the hero son of [Cytherea]384-cytherea]4484-the hero son of cytherea was prepared for [heaven]1454-heaven . In [a council of the gods]4486-a council of the gods [Venus]996-venus arose , embraced [[her]996-venus father]5022-her father 's neck , and said : “ [[My]996-venus father]1438-my father , ever kind to [me]996-venus , [I]996-venus do beseech [your]1438-my father kind indulgence now ; grant , dearest , to [Aeneas]1143-aeneas , [[my]996-venus own son]7311-my own son and also [[your]1438-my father own grandson]8451-your own grandson , grant to [him]1143-aeneas a godhead power , although of lowest class , sufficient if but granted . It is enough to have looked once upon [the unlovely realm]8452-the unlovely realm . And once to have gone across [the Stygian streams]8453-the stygian streams . ”[996-venus] [The gods]1395-the gods assented , and [the queen of [Jove]456-jove]4489-the queen of jove nodded consent with calm , approving face . [The father]1574-the father said , “ [You]4489-the queen of jove well deserve the gift , both [you]4489-the queen of jove who ask it , and [the one for whom]8454-the one for whom [you]4489-the queen of jove ask it : what [you]4489-the queen of jove most desire is [yours]4489-the queen of jove , [[my]1574-the father daughter]1458-my daughter . ”[1574-the father] [He]1574-the father decreed , and [she]4489-the queen of jove rejoiced and thanked [[her]4489-the queen of jove parent]4491-her parent . Borne by harnessed doves over and through the light air , [she]4489-the queen of jove arrived safe on [Laurentine shores]385-laurentine shores : [Numicius]1226-numicius there winds through [his]1574-the father tall reeds to [the neighboring sea]4492-the neighboring sea the waters of [[his]1574-the father stream]4493-his stream : and there [she]4489-the queen of jove willed [Numicius]1226-numicius should wash perfectly away from [her]4489-the queen of jove Aeneas every part that might be subject unto death ; and bear it far with quiet current into [[Neptune]472-neptune 's realm]4494-neptune 's realm . The horned [Numicius]1226-numicius satisfied the will of [Venus]996-venus ; and with flowing waters washed from [her]4489-the queen of jove [Aeneas]1143-aeneas every mortal part , and sprinkled [him]1143-aeneas , so that the essential part of immortality remained alone , and [she]4489-the queen of jove anointed [him]1143-aeneas , thus purified , with heavenly essence , and [she]4489-the queen of jove touched [his]1143-aeneas face with sweetest nectar and ambrosia mixt , thereby transforming [him]1143-aeneas into [a god]4898-a god . [The throng of the Quirini]4496-the throng of the quirini later named [the new god Indiges]4497-the new god indiges , and honored [him]1143-aeneas . Under the scepter of [Ascanius]1170-ascanius [the Latin state]4498-the latin state , transferred , was [Alban]1227-alban too . [Silvius]1228-silvius ruled after [him]1228-silvius . [Latinus]1213-latinus then , wearing the crown , brought back an older name . [Illustrious Alba]1229-illustrious alba followed after [him]1143-aeneas , [Epytus]1230-epytus next in time , and [Capys]1231-capys next , then [Capetus]1232-capetus . And reigning after [them]1229-illustrious alba [King Tiberinus]1233-king tiberinus followed . [He]1233-king tiberinus was drowned in waves of [that Etrurian stream]4499-that etrurian stream , to which [he]1233-king tiberinus gave [his]1233-king tiberinus name . [[His]1233-king tiberinus sons]3599-his sons were [Remulus]1234-remulus and fierce [Acrota]1235-acrota — [each in turn]4501-each in turn was [king]6901-king . [The elder]4503-the elder , [Remulus]1234-remulus , would imitate the lightning , and [he]4503-the elder perished by a flash of lightning . Then [Acrota]1235-acrota , not so rash , succeeded to [[his]1235-acrota brother]2004-his brother , and [he]1235-acrota left [his]1235-acrota scepter to [the valiant Aventinus]1236-the valiant aventinus , hill - buried on [the very mountain which [he]1235-acrota ruled upon and which received [his]1235-acrota name]4505-the very mountain which he ruled upon and which received his name . And Proca ruled then — on [the Palatine]387-the palatine . Under [this king]4506-this king , [Pomona]1237-pomona lived , and [none of all the Latin hamadryads]4507-none of all the latin hamadryads could attend [[her]1237-pomona garden]4508-her garden with more skill , and [none]1829-none was more attentive to the fruitful trees , because of [them]4510-them [her]1237-pomona name was given to [her]1237-pomona . [She]1237-pomona cared not for [the forests]5189-the forests or [the streams]5267-the streams , but loved [the country]4513-the country and the boughs that bear delicious fruit . [Her]1237-pomona right hand never felt a javelin 's weight , always [she]1237-pomona loved to hold a sharp curved pruning - knife with which [she]1237-pomona would at one time crop too largely growing shoots , or at another time reduce the branch that straggled ; at another time [she]1237-pomona would engraft a sucker in divided bark , and so find nourishment for [some young , strange nursling]4514-some young , strange nursling . [She]1237-pomona never suffered [them]4514-some young , strange nursling to thirst , for [she]1237-pomona would water every winding thread of twisting roots with freshly flowing streams . All this was [her]1237-pomona delight , [her]1237-pomona chief pursuit ; [she]1237-pomona never felt the least desire of love ; but fearful of [some rustic]4515-some rustic 's violence , [she]1237-pomona had [her]1237-pomona orchard closed within a wall ; and both forbade and fled the approach of [males]4516-males . What did [not satyrs]4517-not satyrs do to gain [her]1237-pomona love , [a youthful crew expert at every dance]4518-a youthful crew expert at every dance ? And also Pans [their]4519-they brows wreathed with the pine , [Silenus]625-silenus too , more youthful than [his]625-silenus years , and [that god who is ever scaring [thieves]4521-thieves with pruning - hook or limb]4520-that god who is ever scaring thieves with pruning - hook or limb — what did [they]4519-they not to gain [her]1237-pomona love ? And though [Vertumnus]1238-vertumnus did exceed [them]4519-they in [his]1238-vertumnus love , yet [he]1238-vertumnus was not more fortunate than [they]4519-they . How often disguised as [a rough reaper]4522-a rough reaper [he]1238-vertumnus brought [her]1237-pomona barley ears — truly [he]1238-vertumnus seemed [a reaper to the life]4523-a reaper to the life ! Often [he]1238-vertumnus came , [his]1238-vertumnus temples wreathed with hay , as if [he]1238-vertumnus had been tossing new mown grass . [He]1238-vertumnus often held a whip in [his]1238-vertumnus tough hand , [you]4524-you could have sworn [he]1238-vertumnus had a moment before unyoked [his]1238-vertumnus wearied oxen . When [he]1238-vertumnus had a pruning - knife , [he]1238-vertumnus seemed to rear fine fruit in orchard trees or in the well kept vines . When [he]1238-vertumnus came with a ladder , [you]4524-you would think [he]1238-vertumnus must be gathering fruit . Sometimes [he]1238-vertumnus was [a soldier with a sword]4525-a soldier with a sword — [a fisherman]4526-a fisherman , the rod held in [his]1238-vertumnus hand . — In fact by means of many shapes [he]1238-vertumnus often had obtained access to [her]4527-her and joyed in seeing [her]4527-her beauty . At length [he]1238-vertumnus had [his]1238-vertumnus brows bound with a cap of color , and then leaning on a stick , with white hair round [his]1238-vertumnus temples , [he]1238-vertumnus assumed the shape of [an old woman]4528-an old woman . Entering so [the cultivated garden]4529-the cultivated garden , [he]1238-vertumnus admired the fruit and said , “ But [you]4527-her are so much lovelier ! ”[1238-vertumnus] And , while [he]1238-vertumnus praised [her]4527-her , gave some kisses too , such as [no real beldame]4530-no real beldame ever gave . [The bent old creature]4531-the bent old creature then sat on the grass . Gazing at branches weighed down with their fruit of autumn . Opposite to [them]4532-them there was an elm - tree beautiful with shining grapes ; and , after [he]1238-vertumnus had praised [it]4533-it with the vine embracing it , [he]1238-vertumnus said , “ But only think , if this trunk stood unwedded to this vine , it would have nothing to attract [our]8456-our hearts beyond its leaves , and this delightful vine , united to the elm tree finds its rest ; but , if not so joined to it , would fall down , prostrate upon the ground . And yet [you]8457-you find no warning in the example of this tree . [You]8457-you have avoided marriage , with no wish to be united — [I]1238-vertumnus must wish that [you]8457-you would change and soon desire it . [Helen]1042-helen would not have so many suitors for [her]1042-helen hand , nor [she]1042-helen who caused the battles of [the Lapithae]308-the lapithae , nor would [the wife of timid , and not bold , Ulysses]8458-the wife of timid , and not bold , ulysses . Even now , while [you]8457-you avoid those who are courting [you]8457-you , and while [you]8457-you turn in [your]8457-you disgust , [a thousand suitors]8459-a thousand suitors want to marry [you]8457-you — [the demigods and gods]8460-the demigods and gods , and deities of [[Alba]388-alba 's mountain - tops]8461-alba 's mountain - tops . “[1238-vertumnus] But [you]4534-you , if [you]4534-you are wise , and wish to make a good match , listen patiently to [me]0-i , [an old , old woman]4535-an old , old woman ( [I]0-i love [you]4534-you much more than all of [them]4536-them , more than [you]4534-you dream or think ) . Despise [all common persons]4537-all common persons , and choose now [Vertumnus]1238-vertumnus as [the partner of [your]4534-you couch]4538-the partner of your couch , and [you]4534-you may take [me]0-i as a surety for [him]1238-vertumnus . [He]1238-vertumnus is not better known even to [himself]1238-vertumnus , than [he]1238-vertumnus is known to [me]0-i . And [he]1238-vertumnus is not now wandering everywhere , from here to there throughout [the world]1360-the world . [He]1238-vertumnus always will frequent [the places near here]4540-the places near here ; and [he]1238-vertumnus does not , like so many of [[your]4534-you wooers]4541-your wooers , fall in love with [her]4542-her [he]1238-vertumnus happens to have seen the last . [You]4534-you are [his]1238-vertumnus first and last love , and to [you]4534-you alone will [he]1238-vertumnus devote [his]1238-vertumnus life . Besides all — [he]1238-vertumnus is young and has a natural gift of grace , so that [he]1238-vertumnus can most readily transform [himself]1238-vertumnus to any wanted shape , and will become whatever [you]4534-you may wish — even though [you]4534-you ask [him]1238-vertumnus things unseen before . “ And only think , have [you]4534-you not the same tastes ? Will [he]1238-vertumnus not be the first to welcome fruits which are [your]4534-you great delight ? And does [he]1238-vertumnus not hold [your]4534-you gifts safely in [his]1238-vertumnus glad right hand ? But now [he]1238-vertumnus does not long for any fruit plucked from the tree , and has no thought of herbs with pleasant juices that [the garden]8462-the garden gives ; [he]1238-vertumnus can not think of anything but [you]4534-you .
