[[His]8519-the founder of the roman state country]5467-his country and [his]8519-the founder of the roman state cares forgotten , this desire led [him]8519-the founder of the roman state to visit [[the city]5520-the city that once welcomed [Hercules]857-hercules]8529-the city that once welcomed hercules . [Numa]1252-numa desired to know what founder built [a Grecian city]8530-a grecian city on [Italian shores]4227-italian shores . One of [the old inhabitants , who was well acquainted with past history]8532-the old inhabitants , who was well acquainted with past history , replied : “[0-i] Rich in Iberian herds , [the son of Jove]5370-the son of jove turned from [the ocean]1288-the ocean and with favoring wind ' Tis said [he]5370-the son of jove landed on [Lacinian shores]4591-lacinian shores . And , while the herd strayed in the tender grass , [he]5370-the son of jove visited [the house]5402-the house , [the friendly home , of far - famed [Croton]1256-croton]4593-the friendly home , of far - famed croton . There [he]5370-the son of jove rested from [his]5370-the son of jove arduous labors . At the time of [his]5370-the son of jove departure , [he]5370-the son of jove said , ‘ [Here]2893-here in future days shall be [a city of [your]4596-your numerous race]4595-a city of your numerous race . ’ The passing years have proved the promise true , for [Myscelus]1253-myscelus , choosing [that site]4597-that site , marked out [a city]6165-a city 's walls . [[Argive Alemon]1254-argive alemon 's son]4599-argive alemon 's son , of [all men in [his]1254-argive alemon generation]4600-all men in his generation , [he]4599-argive alemon 's son was most acceptable to [the heavenly gods]4601-the heavenly gods . Bending over [him]4599-argive alemon 's son once at dawn , while [he]4599-argive alemon 's son was overwhelmed with drowsiness of sleep , [the huge club - bearer Hercules]4602-the huge club - bearer hercules addressed [him]4599-argive alemon 's son thus : ‘ Come now , desert [[your]4599-argive alemon 's son native shores]4603-your native shores . Go quickly to [the pebbly flowing stream of [distant Aesar]399-distant aesar]4604-the pebbly flowing stream of distant aesar . ’ And [he]4599-argive alemon 's son threatened ill in fearful words , unless [he]4599-argive alemon 's son should obey . “ Sleep and [the god]5013-the god departed instantly . [[Alemon]1254-argive alemon 's son]8534-alemon 's son , arising from [his]4599-argive alemon 's son couch , pondered [his]4599-argive alemon 's son recent vision thoughtfully , with [his]4599-argive alemon 's son conclusions at cross purposes . — [the god]5013-the god commanded [him]4599-argive alemon 's son to quit [that land]5048-that land , the laws forbade departure , threatening death to [all who sought to leave [[their]8537-all who sought to leave their native land native land]8538-their native land]8537-all who sought to leave their native land . “[4599-argive alemon 's son] [The brilliant Sun]4605-the brilliant sun had hidden in [the sea]1298-the sea [his]4605-the brilliant sun shining head , and darkest Night had then put forth [her]4607-her starry face ; and at that time it seemed as if [the same god Hercules]4608-the same god hercules was present and repeating [his]4608-the same god hercules commands , threatening still more and graver penalties , if [he]4608-the same god hercules should fail to obey . Now sore afraid [he]4608-the same god hercules set about to move [[his]4608-the same god hercules household gods]4609-his household gods to [a new settlement]4610-a new settlement , but rumors then followed [him]4608-the same god hercules through [the city]5520-the city , and [he]4608-the same god hercules was accused of holding statutes in contempt . “ The accusation hardly had been made when [his]4608-the same god hercules offense was evidently proved , even without [a witness]3862-a witness . Then [he]4608-the same god hercules raised [his]4608-the same god hercules face and hands up to [the gods above and suppliant in neglected garb]8540-the gods above and suppliant in neglected garb , exclaimed , ‘ Oh mighty [Hercules]857-hercules , for whom alone [the twice six labors gave the privilege of heavenly residence]8541-the twice six labors gave the privilege of heavenly residence , give [me]4608-the same god hercules [your]857-hercules aid , for [you]857-hercules were the true cause of [my]4608-the same god hercules offence . ’ “[4608-the same god hercules] It was an ancient custom of [that land]5048-that land to vote with chosen pebbles , white and black . The white absolved , [the black]4613-the black condemned [the man]5560-the man . And so that day the fateful votes were given — : all cast into the cruel urn were black ! Soon as that urn inverted poured forth all the pebbles to be counted , every one was changed completely from its black to white , and so the vote adjudged [him]4608-the same god hercules innocent . By that most fortunate aid of [Hercules]857-hercules [he]4608-the same god hercules was exempted from [the country]4513-the country 's law . “ [Myscelus]1253-myscelus , breathing thanks to [Hercules]857-hercules , with favoring wind sailed on [the Ionian sea]8542-the ionian sea , past [Sallentine Neretum]400-sallentine neretum , [Sybaris]401-sybaris , [Spartan Tarentum]402-spartan tarentum , and [the Sirine Bay]8543-the sirine bay , [Crimisa]403-crimisa , and on beyond [the Iapygian fields]8544-the iapygian fields . Then , skirting shores which face [these lands]8545-these lands , [he]4608-the same god hercules found [the place foretold [the river]6228-the river [Aesar]399-distant aesar 's mouth]8546-the place foretold the river aesar 's mouth , and found not far away [a burial mound which covered with [its]8548-a burial mound which covered with its soil the hallowed bones of croton soil the hallowed bones of [Croton]1256-croton]8548-a burial mound which covered with its soil the hallowed bones of croton . — There , upon [the appointed land]8549-the appointed land , [he]4608-the same god hercules built up walls — and [he]4608-the same god hercules conferred the name of [Croton]1256-croton , who was there entombed , on [[his]4608-the same god hercules new city]8550-his new city , which has ever since been called [Crotona]404-crotona . ”[857-hercules] By tradition it is known such strange deeds caused [that city]5869-that city to be built , by [men of [Greece]117-greece upon [the Italian coast]4618-the italian coast]4617-men of greece upon the italian coast . Here lived [a man]5610-a man , by birth [a Samian]4620-a samian . [He]5610-a man had fled from [Samos]245-samos and [the ruling class]4621-the ruling class , a voluntary exile , for [his]5610-a man hate against all tyranny . [He]5610-a man had the gift of holding mental converse with the gods , who live far distant in [the highth of heaven]4622-the highth of heaven ; and all that Nature has denied to [man]1330-man and human vision , [he]5610-a man reviewed with eyes of [his]5610-a man enlightened soul . And , when [he]5610-a man had examined all things in [his]5610-a man careful mind with watchful study , [he]5610-a man released [his]5610-a man thoughts to knowledge of [the public]4624-the public . [He]5610-a man would speak to crowds of [people]4382-people , silent and amazed , while [he]5610-a man revealed to [them]4626-them the origin of [this vast universe]4627-this vast universe , the cause of things , what is nature , what [a god]4898-a god , whence came the snow , the cause of lightning — was it Jupiter or did the winds , that thundered when the cloud was rent asunder , cause the lightning flash ? What shook [the earth]1289-the earth , what laws controlled the stars as they were moved — and every hidden thing [he]5610-a man was [the first man]4630-the first man to forbid the use of any animal 's flesh as human food , [he]5610-a man was the first to speak with learned lips , though not believed in this , exhorting [them]4626-them . — “ No , [mortals]4908-mortals , ”[5610-a man] [he]5610-a man would say , “ Do not permit pollution of [your]4908-mortals bodies with such food , for there are grain and good fruits which bear down the branches by their weight , and ripened grapes upon the vines , and herbs — those sweet by nature and those which will grow tender and mellow with a fire , and flowing milk is not denied , nor honey , redolent of blossoming thyme . “[5610-a man] [The lavish Earth]4631-the lavish earth yields rich and healthful food affording dainties without slaughter , death , and bloodshed . [Dull beasts]4632-dull beasts delight to satisfy [their]4632-dull beasts hunger with torn flesh ; and yet not all : horses and sheep and cattle live on grass . But all the savage animals — the fierce Armenian tigers and ferocious lions , and bears , together with the roving wolves — delight in viands reeking with warm blood . “ Oh , ponder a moment such a monstrous crime — vitals in vitals gorged , one greedy body fattening with plunder of another 's flesh , a living being fed on another 's life ! In that abundance , which [[our]8552-our Earth]2499-our earth , the best of [mothers]5775-mothers , will afford have [you]4908-mortals no joy , unless [your]4908-mortals savage teeth can gnaw the piteous flesh of some flayed animal to reenact the Cyclopean crime ? And can [you]4908-mortals not appease the hungry void — the perverted craving of a stomach 's greed , unless [you]4908-mortals first destroy another life ? “[4635-the sow] That age of old time which is given the name of ‘ Golden , ’ was so blest in fruit of trees , and in the good herbs which [the earth]1289-the earth produced that it never would pollute the mouth with blood . The birds then safely moved their wings in air , the timid hares would wander in [the fields]5475-the fields with no fear , and [their]4632-dull beasts own credulity had not suspended fishes from the hook . All life was safe from treacherous wiles , fearing no injury , a peaceful world . “ After that time [some one of ill advice]8555-some one of ill advice ( it does not matter who it might have been ) envied the ways of lions and gulped into [his]8555-some one of ill advice greedy paunch stuff from a carcass vile . [He]8555-some one of ill advice opened the foul paths of wickedness . It may be that in killing [beasts of prey]8556-beasts of prey [our]8552-our steel was for the first time warmed with blood . And that could be defended , for [I]4638-a victim free of blemish and most beautiful in form ( perfection brings destruction hold that [predatory creatures which attempt destruction of mankind]8557-predatory creatures which attempt destruction of mankind , are put to death without evasion of the sacred laws : but , though with justice [they]8557-predatory creatures which attempt destruction of mankind are put to death , that can not be a cause for eating [them]8557-predatory creatures which attempt destruction of mankind . “[4638-a victim free of blemish and most beautiful in form ( perfection brings destruction] This wickedness went further ; and [the sow]4635-the sow was thought to have deserved death as the first of [victims]4636-victims , for with [her]4635-the sow long turned - up snout [she]4635-the sow spoiled the good hope of a harvest year . The ravenous goat , that gnawed a sprouting vine , was led for slaughter to the altar fires of angry Bacchus . It was [their]4637-their own fault that surely caused the ruin of those two . “ But why have sheep deserved sad destiny , harmless and useful for the good of [man with nectar in full udders]8558-man with nectar in full udders ? [Their]4637-their soft wool affords the warmest coverings for [our]8552-our use , [their]4637-their life and not [their]4637-their death would help [us]8552-our more . Why have [the oxen of the field]8559-the oxen of the field deserved a sad end — innocent , without deceit , and harmless , without guile , born to endure hard labor ? Without gratitude is [he]8555-some one of ill advice , unworthy of the gift of harvest fields , who , after [he]8555-some one of ill advice relieved [[his]8555-some one of ill advice worker]8560-his worker from weight of the curving plow could butcher [him]8555-some one of ill advice , could sever with an axe that toil worn neck , by which so often with hard work the ground had been turned up , so many harvests reared . For some , even crimes like these are not enough , [they]4637-their have imputed to the gods [themselves]4637-their abomination — [they]4637-their believe [a god in [heaven above]8562-heaven above]8561-a god in heaven above , rejoices at the death of [a laborious ox]8563-a laborious ox . “[4643-you] [A victim free of blemish and most beautiful in form ( perfection brings destruction]4638-a victim free of blemish and most beautiful in form ( perfection brings destruction ) is adorned with garlands and with gilded horns before the altar . In [his]4639-he ignorance [he]4639-he hears [one praying]4640-one praying , and [he]4639-he sees the very grain [he]4639-he labored to produce , fixed on [his]4639-he head between the horns , and felled , [he]4639-he stains with blood the knife which just before [he]4639-he may have seen reflected in clear water . Instantly [they]4641-they snatch out entrails from [his]4639-he throbbing form , and seek in them intentions of [the gods]1395-the gods . Then , in [your]4643-you lust for a forbidden food [you]4643-you will presume to batten on [his]4639-he flesh , [O race of mortals]4644-o race of mortals ! Do not eat such food ! Give [your]4643-you attention to [my]0-i serious words ; and , when [you]4643-you next present the slaughtered flesh of oxen to [your]4643-you palates , know and feel that [you]4643-you gnaw [your]4643-you fellow tillers of [the soil]4995-the soil . “ And , since [a god]4898-a god impels [me]4647-souls to speak out , [I]4647-souls will obey [the god who urges [me]4647-souls , and will disclose to [you]4643-you [the heavens above]8566-the heavens above]8565-the god who urges me , and will disclose to you the heavens above , and [I]4647-souls will even reveal the oracles of the Divine Will . [I]4647-souls will sing to [you]4643-you of things most wonderful , which never were investigated by the intellects of ancient times and things which have been long concealed from [man]1330-man . In fancy [I]4647-souls delight to float among the stars or take [my]4647-souls stand on mighty [Atlas]529-atlas ' shoulders , and to look afar down on [men wandering here and there]8568-men wandering here and there — afraid in life yet dreading unknown death , and in these words exhort [them]8568-men wandering here and there and reveal the sequence of events ordained by fate ! “[4647-souls] O sad humanity ! Why do [you]4643-you fear alarms of icy death , afraid of [Styx]278-the styx , fearful of moving shadows and empty names — of [subjects harped on by the poets]4646-subjects harped on by the poets ' tales , the fabled perils of a fancied life ? Whether the funeral pile consumes [your]4643-you flesh with hot flames , or old age dissolves it with a gradual wasting power , be well assured the body can not meet with further ill . And [souls]4647-souls are all exempt from power of death . When [they]4647-souls have left [[their]4647-souls first corporeal home]4648-their first corporeal home , [they]4647-souls always find and live in [newer homes]4649-newer homes . “ [I]4654-i can declare , for [I]4654-i remember well , that in the days of the great Trojan War , [I]4654-i was [Euphorbus]1257-euphorbus , [son of Panthous]8569-son of panthous . In [my]4654-i opposing breast was planted then the heavy spear - point of [the younger son of [Atreus]729-atreus]8570-the younger son of atreus . Not long past [I]4654-i recognised the shield , once burden of [my]4654-i left arm , where it hung in [[Juno]488-juno 's temple]8571-juno 's temple at [ancient Argos]60-argos , [the realm of [Abas]672-abas]8572-the realm of abas . Everything must change : but nothing perishes . [The moving soul]8573-the moving soul may wander , coming from [that spot]4445-that spot to this , from this to that — in changed possession live in any limbs whatever . It may pass from beasts to [human bodies]8575-human bodies , and again to those of beasts . [The soul]8576-the soul will never die , in the long lapse of time . As pliant wax is moulded to new forms and does not stay as it has been nor keep the self same form yet is the selfsame wax , be well assured the soul is always the same spirit , though it passes into different forms . Therefore , that natural love may not be vanquished by unnatural craving of the appetite , [I]4654-i warn [you]8577-you , stop expelling [kindred souls]8578-kindred souls by deeds abhorrent as cold murder . — Let not blood be nourished with its kindred blood ! “[4654-i] Since [I]0-i am launched into [the open sea]5904-the open sea and [I]0-i have given [my]0-i full sails to the wind , nothing in all [the world]1360-the world remains unchanged . All things are in a state of flux , all shapes receive a changing nature . Time itself glides on with constant motion , ever as a flowing river . Neither river nor the fleeting hour can stop its constant course . But , as each wave drives on a wave , as each is pressed by that which follows , and must press on that before it , so the moments fly , and [others]4906-others follow , so they are renewed . The moment which moved on before is past , and that which was not , now exists in Time , and [every one]4653-every one comes , goes , and is replaced . “ [You]8577-you see how night glides by and then proceeds on to the dawn , then brilliant light of day succeeds the dark night . There is not the same appearance in the heavens , : when all things for weariness are resting in vast night , as when [bright Lucifer]513-lucifer rides [his]513-lucifer white steed . And only think of that most glorious change , when loved [Aurora]512-aurora , [[Pallas]694-pallas ' daughter]8579-pallas ' daughter , comes before the day and tints [the world]1360-the world , almost delivered to [bright Phoebus]549-phoebus . Even the disk of [that god]8581-that god , rising from beneath [the earth]1289-the earth , is of a ruddy color in the dawn and ruddy when concealed beneath [the world]1360-the world . When highest , it is a most brilliant white , for there the ether is quite purified , and far away avoids infection from impurities of earth . [Diana]484-diana 's form at night remains not equal nor the same ! ' Tis less today than it will be tomorrow , if [she]484-diana is waxing ; greater , if [she]484-diana wanes . “[4658-we] Yes , do [you]4654-i not see how the year moves through four seasons , imitating human life : in early Spring it has a nursling 's ways resembling infancy , for at that time the blade is shooting and devoid of strength . Its flaccid substance swelling gives delight , to [every watching husbandman]4655-every watching husbandman , alive in expectation . Then all things are rich in blossom , and [the genial meadow]4656-the genial meadow smiles with tints of blooming flowers ; but not as yet is there a sign of vigor in the leaves . “ The year now waxing stronger , after Spring it passes into Summer , and [its]4657-his youth becomes robust . Indeed of all the year the Summer is most vigorous and most abounds with glowing and life - giving warmth . “[4658-we] Autumn then follows , and , the vim of life removed , that ripe and mellow time succeeds between youth and old age , and a few white hairs are sprinkled here and there upon [his]4657-his brow . “ Then aged Winter with [his]4657-his tremulous step follows , repulsive , strips of graceful locks or white with those [he]4657-his has retained so long . “[570-nature] [Our]4658-we bodies also , always change unceasingly : [we]4658-we are not now what [we]4658-we were yesterday or [we]4658-we shall be tomorrow . And there was a time when [we]4658-we were only seeds of [man]1330-man , mere hopes that lived within [a mother]5325-a mother 's womb . But [Nature]570-nature changed [us]4658-we with [her]570-nature skilfull touch , determined that [our]4658-we bodies should not be held in [such narrow room]4661-such narrow room , below the entrails in [[our]4658-we distended parent]4662-our distended parent ; and in time [she]570-nature brought [us]4658-we forth into the vacant air . “ Brought into light , [the helpless infant]8584-the helpless infant lies . Then on all fours [he]4663-he lifts [his]4663-he body up , feeling [his]4663-he way , like any young wild beast , and then by slow degrees [he]4663-he stands upright , weak - kneed and trembling , steadied by support of some convenient prop . And soon more strong and swift [he]4663-he passes through the hours of youth , and , when the years of middle age are past , slides down the steep path of declining age . “[4666-you] This undermines [him]4663-he and destroys the strength of former years : and [Milon]1258-milon , now grown old , weeps , when [he]1258-milon sees [his]1258-milon arms , which once were firm with muscles big as those of [Hercules]857-hercules , hang flabby at [his]1258-milon side : and [Helen]1042-helen weeps , when in the glass [she]1042-helen sees [her]1042-helen wrinkled face , and wonders why [two heroes]4664-two heroes fell in love and carried [her]1042-helen away . — O Time , [devourer of all things]4665-devourer of all things , and envious Age , together [you]4666-you destroy all that exists and , slowly gnawing , bring on lingering death . “ Yes , even things which [we]8585-we call elements , do not endure . Now listen well to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i will show the ways in which [they]4667-they change . “[0-i] The everlasting universe contains four elemental parts . And two of these are heavy — earth and water — and are borne downwards by weight . The other two devoid of weight , are air and — even lighter — fire : and , if these two are not constrained , [they]4667-they seek [the higher regions]4668-the higher regions . These four elements , though far apart in space , are all derived from one another . [Earth]22-earth dissolves as flowing water ! Water , thinned still more , departs as wind and air ; and the light air , still losing weight , sparkles on high as fire . But [they]4667-they return , along [their]4667-they former way : the fire , assuming weight , is changed to air ; and then , more dense , that air is changed again to water ; and that water , still more dense , compacts itself again as primal earth . “ Nothing retains the form that seems its own , and Nature , [the renewer of all things]8586-the renewer of all things , continually changes every form into some other shape . Believe [my]4680-my word , in all this universe of vast extent , not one thing ever perished . All have changed appearance . [Men]1399-men say a certain thing is born , if it takes a different form from what it had ; and yet [they]1399-men say , that certain thing has died , if it no longer keeps the self same shape . Though distant things move near , and near things far , always the sum of all things is unchanged . “[4680-my] For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i can not believe a thing remains long under the same form unchanged . Look at the change of times from gold to iron , : look at the change in places . [I]0-i have seen what had been solid earth become salt waves , and [I]0-i have seen [dry land]4216-dry land made from [the deep]1961-the deep ; and , far away from [ocean]2889-ocean , sea - shells strewn , and on the mountain - tops old anchors found . Water has made that which was once [a plain]6962-a plain into [a valley]6121-a valley , and [the mountain]4203-the mountain has been levelled by the floods down to [a plain]6962-a plain . [A former marshland]4676-a former marshland is now parched dry sand , and places which endured severest drought are wet with standing pools . [Here Nature]4677-here nature has opened fresh springs , but there has shut them up ; rivers aroused by ancient earthquakes have rushed out or vanished , as they lost their depth . “ So , when the Lycus has been swallowed by a chasm in [the earth]1289-the earth , it rushes forth at a distance and is reborn [a different stream]8589-a different stream . [The Erasinus]407-the erasinus now flows down into a cave , now runs beneath the ground a darkened course , then rises lordly in [the Argolic fields]8590-the argolic fields . [They]8591-they say [the Mysus , wearied of [[his]407-the erasinus spring]8593-his spring and of [[his]407-the erasinus former banks]8594-his former banks]8592-the mysus , wearied of his spring and of his former banks , appears elsewhere and takes another name , [the Caicus]408-the caicus . “[1117-centaurs] The Amenanus in Sicilian sands now smoothly rolling , at another time is quenched , because [its]4678-its fountain springs are dry . [The water of [the Anigros]409-the anigros]4679-the water of the anigros formerly was used for drinking , but it pours out now foul water which [you]4680-my would decline to touch , because ( unless all credit is denied to [poets]4681-poets ) long ago [the Centaurs]1117-centaurs , [those strange mortals]4682-those strange mortals double - limbed , bathed in the stream wounds which club - bearing [Hercules]857-hercules had made with [his]857-hercules strong bow . — Yes , does not Hypanis descending fresh from [mountains of [Sarmatia]410-sarmatia]4683-mountains of sarmatia , become embittered with the taste of salt ? “ [Antissa]411-antissa , [Pharos]1259-pharos , and [Phoenician Tyre]412-phoenician tyre , were once surrounded by [the wavy sea]8595-the wavy sea : [they]8595-the wavy sea are not [islands]8596-islands now . Long years ago [Leucas]413-leucas was mainland , if [we]8597-we can believe what [the old timers there]8598-the old timers there will tell , but now the waves sweep round [it]413-leucas . [Zancle]351-zancle was [a part of [Italy]414-italy]8599-a part of italy , until [the sea]1298-the sea cut off [the neighboring land]8601-the neighboring land with strong waves in between . Should [you]8602-you seek [Helice]415-helice and [Buris]416-buris , [those two cities of Achaea]8603-those two cities of achaea , [you]8602-you will find them underneath [the waves]2151-the waves , where sailors point to sloping roofs and [streets in the clear deep]8605-streets in the clear deep . “[4692-the lakes of aethiopia] Near [Pittheaan Troezen]417-pittheaan troezen [a steep , high hill , quite bare of trees]4684-a steep , high hill , quite bare of trees , was once [a level plain]2260-a level plain , but now is [a hill]4686-a hill , for ( dreadful even to tell ) the raging power of winds , long pent in [deep , dark caverns]4687-deep , dark caverns , tried to find a proper vent , long struggling to attain free sky . Finding no opening from [the prison - caves]4688-the prison - caves , imperious to [their]4688-the prison - caves force , [they]4688-the prison - caves raised [the earth]1289-the earth , exactly as pent air breathed from the mouth inflates a bladder , or the bottle - hides stripped off the two - horned goats . The swollen earth remained on [that spot]4445-that spot and has ever since appearance of [a high hill hardened by the flight of time]4691-a high hill hardened by the flight of time . “ Of many strange events that [I]4703-i have heard and known , [I]4703-i will add a few . Why , does not water give and take strange forms ? [Your]8602-you wave , O horned [Ammon]681-ammon , will turn cold at mid - day , but is always mild and warm at sun - rise and at sun - set . [I]4703-i have heard that [Athamanians]418-athamanians kindle wood , if [they]418-athamanians pour water on it , when the waning moon has shrunk away into [her]8606-her smallest orb . [The people of [Ciconia]419-ciconia]8607-the people of ciconia have a stream which turns [the drinker]8608-the drinker 's entrails into stone , which changes into marble all it raves . The [Achaean Crathis]420-achaean crathis and the Sybaris , which flow not far from here , will turn the hair to something like clear amber or bright gold . “[4703-i] What is more wonderful , there are some waters which change not only bodies but the minds : who has no knowledge of [the Salmacis]649-salmacis and of its ill famed waves ? Who has not heard of [the lakes of [Aethiopia]422-aethiopia]4692-the lakes of aethiopia : how those who drink of [them]4692-the lakes of aethiopia go raving mad or fall in a deep sleep , most wonderful in heaviness . Whoever quenches thirst from [the Clitorian spring]4693-the clitorian spring will hate all wine , and soberly secure great pleasure from pure water . Either that spring has a power the opposite of wine - heat , or perhaps as [natives]4694-natives tell [us]4695-us , after [the famed son of [Amythaon]1260-amythaon]4696-the famed son of amythaon by [his]4696-the famed son of amythaon charms and herbs , delivered from [their]4694-natives base insanity [the stricken Proetides]423-the stricken proetides , [he]4696-the famed son of amythaon threw the rest of [his]4696-the famed son of amythaon mind healing herbs into [the spring]4697-the spring , where hatred of all wine has since remained . Unlike in nature flows [another stream of [the country]4513-the country]4698-another stream of the country , called [Lyncestius]424-lyncestius : [everyone who drinks of it , even with most temperate care]4700-everyone who drinks of it , even with most temperate care , will reel , as if [he]4700-everyone who drinks of it , even with most temperate care had drunk unmixed wine . In [Arcadia]249-arcadia is [a place , called [Pheneos]425-pheneos by [men of old]4702-men of old , which is mistrusted for the twofold nature of [its]4701-a place , called pheneos by men of old , which is mistrusted for the twofold nature of its waters waters]4701-a place , called pheneos by men of old , which is mistrusted for the twofold nature of its waters . Stand in dread of them at night ; if drunk at night , [they]4703-i harm [you]4704-you , but in daytime [they]4703-i will do no harm at all . So [lakes]1310-lakes and [rivers]4706-rivers have now this , now that effect . “ [Ortygia]160-ortygia once moved like [a ship]5175-a ship that drifts among the waves . Now it is fixed . The Argo was in dread of [the Symplegades]426-the symplegades , which moved apart with waves in - rushing . Now immovable [they]426-the symplegades stand , resisting the attack of winds . “[4709-hyperboreans of pallene] Aetna , which burns with sulphur furnaces , will not be always concentrated fire , nor was it always fiery . If the earth is like an animal and is alive and breathes out flame at many openings , then it can change these many passages used for its breathing and , when it is moved , may close these caverns as it opens up some others . Or if rushing winds are penned in [deepest caverns]2177-deepest caverns , and they drive great stones against the rock , and substances which have the properties of flame and fire are made by those concussions ; when the winds are calmed [the caverns]4708-the caverns will , of course , be cool again . “ Or if some black bitumen catches fire or yellow sulphur burns with little smoke , then surely , when the ground no longer gives such food and oily nutriment for flames and [they]426-the symplegades in time have ravined all [their]426-the symplegades store , [their]426-the symplegades greedy nature soon will pine with death — it will not bear such famine but depart and , when deserted , will desert [the place]1926-the place . “[4710-scythian women] ' Tis said that [Hyperboreans of [Pallene]427-pallene]4709-hyperboreans of pallene can cover all [their]4709-hyperboreans of pallene bodies with light plumes by plunging nine times in [Minerva 's marsh]543-minerva . But [I]0-i can not believe another tale : that [Scythian women]4710-scythian women get a like result by having poison sprinkled on [their]4710-scythian women limbs . “ If [we]8611-we give any credit to the things proved by experience , [we]8611-we can surely know whatever bodies are decayed by time or by dissolving heat are by such means changed into tiny animals — Come now , bury choice bullocks killed for sacrifice , and it is well known by experience that the flower - gathering bees are so produced , miraculous , from entrails putrefied . These , like the faithful animals from which [they]426-the symplegades were produced , inhabit [the green fields]6925-the green fields , delight in toil , and labor for reward . “[4713-the offspring of the honey bees] The warlike steed , when buried in the ground , is a known source of hornets . If [you]4711-you cut the bending claws off from the sea - shore crab and bury the remainder in [the earth]1289-the earth , a scorpion will come forth from the dead crab buried there , threatening with its crooked tail . “ The worms which cover leaves with their white threads , a thing observable by [husbandmen]8613-husbandmen , will change [themselves]8613-husbandmen to funeral butterflies . Mud holds the seeds that generate green frogs , at first producing tadpoles with no feet , and soon it gives [them]8613-husbandmen legs adapted for [their]8613-husbandmen swimming , and , so [they]8613-husbandmen may be as well adapted to good leaping , [their]8613-husbandmen hind legs are longer than the fore - legs . [The mother bear]8614-the mother bear does not bring forth a cub but a limp mass of flesh that hardly can be called alive . By licking it [the mother]5344-the mother forms the limbs , and brings it to a shape just like [her]5344-the mother own . “[4718-i] Do not [the offspring of the honey bees]4713-the offspring of the honey bees , concealed in cells hexagonal , at first get life with no limbs , and assume in time both feet and wings ? Unless the fact were known , could [anyone]2378-anyone suppose it possible that [Juno]488-juno 's bird , whose tail is bright with stars ; the eagle , [armor - bearer of high Jove]4715-armor - bearer of high jove ; the doves of [Cytherea]384-cytherea ; and all birds emerge from the middle part of eggs ? And some believe [the human marrow]4716-the human marrow turns into a serpent when the spine at length has putrefied in the closed sepulchre . “ Now these [I]4718-i named derive their origin from other living forms . There is one bird which reproduces and renews itself : [the Assyrians]1261-the assyrians gave this bird [his]4717-he name — the Phoenix . [He]4717-he does not live either on grain or herbs , but only on small drops of frankincense and juices of amomum . When this bird completes a full five centuries of life straightway with talons and with shining beak [he]4717-he builds a nest among palm branches , where they join to form the palm tree 's waving top . “[4718-i] As soon as [he]4717-he has strewn in this new nest the cassia bark and ears of sweet spikenard , and some bruised cinnamon with yellow myrrh , [he]4717-he lies down on it and refuses life among those dreamful odors . — And [they]4718-i say that from the body of the dying bird is reproduced a little Phoenix which is destined to live just as many years . “ When time has given to [him]4717-he sufficient strength and [he]4717-he is able to sustain the weight , [he]4717-he lifts the nest up from the lofty tree and dutifully carries from [that place]5935-that place [his]4717-he cradle and [the parent]4055-the parent 's sepulchre . As soon as [he]4717-he has reached through yielding air [the city of [Hyperion]121-hyperion]8618-the city of hyperion , [he]4717-he will lay the burden just before the sacred doors within [the temple of Hyperion]8619-the temple of hyperion . “[549-phoebus] But , if [we]4719-we wonder at strange things like these , [we]4719-we ought to wonder also , when [we]4719-we learn that [a hyena]4720-a hyena has a change of sex : [the female]4721-the female , quitting [[her]4721-the female embracing male]4722-her embracing male , [herself]4721-the female becomes [a male]1699-a male . — That animal which feeds upon the winds and air , at once assumes with contact any color touched . “ Conquered [India]118-india gave to the vine crowned Bacchus lynxes , whose urine turns , [they]8620-they say to stones , hardening in air . So coral , too , as soon as it has risen above [the sea]1298-the sea , turns hard . Below the waves it was a tender plant . “[4732-they] The day will fail [me]0-i ; [Phoebus]549-phoebus will have bathed [his]549-phoebus panting horses in the deep sea waves , before [I]0-i can include in [my]0-i discourse the myriad things transforming to new shapes . In lapse of time [we]4719-we see [the nations]4724-the nations change ; [some]4905-some grow in power , some wane . [Troy]1143-aeneas was once great in riches and in [men]1399-men — so great [she]4727-she could for ten unequalled years afford much blood ; now [she]4727-she lies low and offers to [our]4719-we gaze but ancient ruins and , instead of wealth , [ancestral tombs]4728-ancestral tombs . [Sparta]185-sparta was famous once and great [Mycenae]186-mycenae was most flourishing . And [[Cecrops]559-cecrops ' citadel]4729-cecrops ' citadel and [Amphion]808-amphion 's shone in ancient power . [Sparta]185-sparta is nothing now save [barren ground]4730-barren ground , [the proud Mycenae]4731-the proud mycenae fell , what is the Thebes of [storied Oedipus]875-oedipus except a name ? And of [Pandion]816-pandion 's Athens what now remains beyond the name ? “ Reports come to [me]3929-son of a goddess that [Dardanian Rome]430-dardanian rome is rising , and beside [the Tiber]528-the tiber 's waves , whose springs are high in [the Apennines]57-the cloud - topped apennines , is laying [her]430-dardanian rome deep foundations . So in [her]430-dardanian rome growth [her]430-dardanian rome form is changing , and one day [she]430-dardanian rome will be [the sole mistress of [the boundless world]8623-the boundless world]8622-the sole mistress of the boundless world . “[3929-son of a goddess] [They]4732-they say that [soothsayers]4733-soothsayers and [that oracles]4734-that oracles , revealers of [our]4735-our destiny , declare this fate , and , if [I]0-i recollect it right , [Helenus]1138-helenus , [son of [Priam]1143-aeneas , prophesied unto [Aeneas]1143-aeneas , when [he]1143-aeneas was in doubt of safety and lamenting for the state of [Troy]250-troy]1143-aeneas , about to fall , ‘ O , [son of [a goddess]5320-a goddess]3929-son of a goddess , if [you]3929-son of a goddess [yourself]3929-son of a goddess , will fully understand this prophecy now surging in [my]0-i mind [Troy]1143-aeneas shall not , while [you]3929-son of a goddess are preserved to life fall utterly . Flames and the sword shall give [you]3929-son of a goddess passage . [You]3929-son of a goddess shall go and bear away [Pergama]311-pergama , ruined ; till [a foreign soil , more friendly to [you]3929-son of a goddess]4738-a foreign soil , more friendly to you than [[your]3929-son of a goddess native land]4739-your native land , shall be [the lot of [Troy]250-troy]4740-the lot of troy and of [yourself]3929-son of a goddess . “ Even now [I]460-boreas know it is decreed by [Fate]959-fate that [[our]8624-our posterity]8625-our posterity , born far from [Troy]250-troy , will build [a city greater than exists , or ever will exist , or ever has been seen in former times]8626-a city greater than exists , or ever will exist , or ever has been seen in former times . Through a long lapse of ages [other noted men]8627-other noted men shall make it strong , but [one of [the race of Iulus]8629-the race of iulus]8628-one of the race of iulus ; shall make it [the great mistress of [the world]1360-the world]8630-the great mistress of the world . After [the earth]1289-the earth has thoroughly enjoyed [his]1289-the earth glorious life , aetherial abodes shall gain [him]1289-the earth , and [immortal heaven]8633-immortal heaven shall be [his]1289-the earth destiny . ’ Such was the prophesy of [Helenus]1138-helenus , when great [Aeneas]1143-aeneas took away [his]1143-aeneas guardian deities , and [I]460-boreas rejoice to see [my]460-boreas kindred walls rise high and realize how much [the Trojans]3716-the trojans won by that resounding victory of [the Greeks]2456-the greeks ! “[460-boreas] But , that [we]4741-we may not range afar with steeds forgetful of the goal , [the heavens]5973-the heavens and all beneath [them]5973-the heavens and [the earth]1289-the earth and everything upon it change in form . [We]4741-we likewise change , who are a portion of [the universe]1323-the universe , and , since [we]4741-we are not only things of flesh but winged souls as well , [we]4741-we may be doomed to enter into beasts as [our]4741-we abode ; and even to be hidden in the breasts of cattle . Therefore , should [we]4741-we not allow these bodies to be safe which may contain the souls of [parents]7519-parents , [brothers]1378-brothers , or of those allied to [us]4741-we by kinship or of [men]1399-men at least , who should be saved from every harm ? Let [us]4741-we not gorge down a Thyestean feast ! “ How greatly does [a man]5610-a man disgrace [himself]5610-a man , how impiously does [he]5610-a man prepare [himself]5610-a man for shedding human blood , who with u knife cuts the calf 's throat and offers a deaf ear to its death - longings ! who can kill [the kid]8637-the kid while it is sending forth heart rending cries like those of [a dear child]8638-a dear child ; or who can feed upon the bird which [he]4748-he has given food . How little do such deeds as these fall short of actual murder ? Yes , where will they lead ? “[4751-they] Let the ox plough , or let [him]4748-he owe [his]4748-he death to weight of years ; and let the sheep give [us]4741-we defence against the cold of [Boreas]460-boreas ; and let [the well - fed she - goats]4749-the well - fed she - goats give to [man]1330-man [their]4749-the well - fed she - goats udders for the pressure of kind hands . “ Away with cruel nets and springs and snares and fraudulent contrivances : deceive not birds with bird - limed twigs : do not deceive the trusting deer with dreaded feather foils : do not conceal barbed hooks with treacherous bait : if any beast is harmful , take [his]1252-numa life , but , even so , let killing be enough . Taste not [his]1252-numa flesh , but look for harmless food ! ”[4767-the son of theseus] [They]4751-they say that [Numa]1252-numa with a mind well taught by these and other precepts traveled back to [[his]1252-numa own land]4752-his own land and , being urged again , assumed the guidance of [the Latin state]4498-the latin state . [Blest]1167-blest with [a nymph]2869-a nymph as [consort]4755-consort , blest also with [the Muses]750-muses for [[his]1252-numa guides]4756-his guides , [he]1252-numa taught the rites of sacrifice and trained in arts of peace [a race accustomed long to savage war]4757-a race accustomed long to savage war . When , ripe in years , [he]1252-numa ended reign and life , [the Latin matrons]4758-the latin matrons , [the fathers of the state]4759-the fathers of the state , and all [the people]1439-the people wept for [Numa]1252-numa 's death . For [the nymph]5012-the nymph , [[his]1252-numa widow]4762-his widow , had withdrawn from [Rome]433-rome , concealed within [the thick groves of [the vale Aricia]4764-the vale aricia]4763-the thick groves of the vale aricia , where with groans and wailing [she]5012-the nymph disturbed the holy rites of [Cynthia]1263-cynthia , established by [Orestes]1264-orestes . Ah ! how often nymphs of [the grove]5487-the grove and [lake]4766-lake entreated [her]5012-the nymph to cease and offered [her]5012-the nymph consoling words . How often [the son of Theseus]4767-the son of theseus said to [her]5012-the nymph “ Control [your]5012-the nymph sorrow ; surely [your]5012-the nymph sad lot is not the only one ; consider now the like calamities by others borne , and [you]5012-the nymph can bear [your]5012-the nymph sorrow . To [my]4771-the daughter of pasiphae grief [my]4771-the daughter of pasiphae own disaster was far worse than [yours]4768-yours . At least it can afford [you]5012-the nymph comfort now . “[4771-the daughter of pasiphae] Is it not true , discourse has reached [yours]4768-yours ears that one [Hippolytus]1265-hippolytus met with [his]1265-hippolytus death through the credulity of [[his]1265-hippolytus loved sire]4769-his loved sire , deceived by [a stepmother]4770-a stepmother 's wicked art ? It will amaze [you]4768-yours much , and [I]0-i may fail to prove what [I]0-i declare , but [I]0-i am [he]4769-his loved sire ! Long since [the daughter of [Pasiphae]880-pasiphae]4771-the daughter of pasiphae tempted [me]0-i to defile [[my]0-i father]1438-my father 's bed and , failing , feigned that [I]0-i had wished to do what [she]4771-the daughter of pasiphae [herself]4771-the daughter of pasiphae had wished . Perverting truth — either through fear of some discovery or else through spite at [her]4771-the daughter of pasiphae deserved repulse — [she]4771-the daughter of pasiphae charged [me]0-i with attempting the foul crime . “ Though [I]0-i was guiltless of all wrong , [[my]0-i father]1438-my father banished [me]0-i and , while [I]0-i was departing , laid on [me]0-i a mortal curse . Towards [Pittheus]925-pittheus and [Troezen]190-troezen [I]0-i fled aghast , guiding [the swift chariot]8640-the swift chariot near [the shore of [the Corinthian Gulf]434-the corinthian gulf]8641-the shore of the corinthian gulf , when all at once [the sea]1298-the sea rose up and seemed to arch itself and lift high as [a white topped mountain height , make bellowings , and open at the crest]8643-a white topped mountain height , make bellowings , and open at the crest . Then through the parting waves a horned bull emerged with head and breast into the wind , spouting white foam from [his]0-i nostrils and [his]0-i mouth . “[0-i] The hearts of [[my]0-i attendants]4773-my attendants quailed with fear , yet [I]0-i unfrightened thought but of [my]0-i exile . Then [my]0-i fierce horses turned [their]4774-they necks to face [the waters]5216-the waters , and with ears erect [they]4774-they quaked before the monster shape , [they]4774-they dashed in flight along [the rock strewn ground below [the cliff]2546-the cliff]4776-the rock strewn ground below the cliff . [I]0-i struggled , but with unavailing hand , to use the reins now covered with white foam ; and throwing [myself]0-i back , pulled on the thongs with weight and strength . Such effort might have checked the madness of [my]0-i steeds , had not a wheel , striking the hub on a projecting stump , been shattered and hurled in fragments from the axle . “ [I]1263-cynthia was thrown forward from [[my]1263-cynthia chariot]2527-my chariot and with the reins entwined about [my]1263-cynthia legs . [My]1263-cynthia palpitating entrails could be seen dragged on , [my]1263-cynthia sinews fastened on a stump . [My]1263-cynthia torn legs followed , but a part remained behind [me]1263-cynthia , caught by various snags . The breaking bones gave out a crackling noise , [my]1263-cynthia tortured spirit soon had fled away , no part of the torn body could be known — all that was left was only one crushed wound — how can , how dare [you]8645-you , [nymph]8646-nymph , compare [your]8645-you ills to [my]1263-cynthia disaster ? “[1263-cynthia] [I]0-i saw the Lower World deprived of light : and [I]0-i have bathed [my]0-i flesh , so tortured , in the waves of Phlegethon . Life could not have been given again to [me]0-i , but through the remedies [[Apollo]549-phoebus 's son]4778-apollo 's son applied to [me]0-i . After [my]0-i life returned — by potent herbs and the Paeonian aid , despite the will of [Pluto]664-pluto — [Cynthia]1263-cynthia then threw heavy clouds around that [I]0-i might not be seen and cause [men]1399-men envy by new life : and that [she]1263-cynthia might be sure [my]0-i life was safe [she]1263-cynthia made [me]0-i seem [an old man]7853-an old man ; and [she]1263-cynthia changed [me]0-i so that [I]0-i could not be recognized . “ A long time [she]1263-cynthia debated whether [she]1263-cynthia would give [me]1270-cippus [Crete]100-crete or [Delos]111-delos for [[my]1270-cippus home]5740-my home . [Delos]111-delos and [Crete]100-crete abandoned , [she]1263-cynthia then brought [me]1270-cippus [here]2893-here , and at the same time ordered [me]1270-cippus to lay aside [my]1270-cippus former name — one which when mentioned would remind [me]1270-cippus of [my]1270-cippus steeds . [She]1263-cynthia said to [me]1270-cippus , ‘ [You]1270-cippus were [Hippolytus]1265-hippolytus , but now instead [you]1270-cippus shall be [Virbius]1266-virbius . ’ And from that time [I]1270-cippus have inhabited [this grove]5483-this grove ; and , as one of [the lesser gods]8650-the lesser gods , [I]1270-cippus live concealed and numbered in [[her]1263-cynthia train]8651-her train . ”[1270-cippus] The grief of [others]4906-others could not ease the woe of [sad Egeria]1267-sad egeria , and [she]1267-sad egeria laid [herself]1267-sad egeria down at [a mountain]5634-a mountain 's foot , dissolved in tears , till moved by pity for [her]1267-sad egeria faithful sorrow , [Diana]484-diana changed [her]1267-sad egeria body to a spring , [her]1267-sad egeria limbs into a clear continual stream . This wonderful event surprised [the nymphs]5672-the nymphs , and filled [Hippolytus]1265-hippolytus with wonder , just as great as when [the Etrurian ploughman]4784-the etrurian ploughman saw a fate - revealing clod move of its own accord among the fields , while not a hand was touching it , till finally it took a human form , without the quality of clodded earth , and opened its new mouth and spoke , revealing future destinies . [The natives]3275-the natives called [him]1265-hippolytus [Tages]1268-tages . [He]1265-hippolytus was the first who taught [Etrurians]1269-etrurians to foretell events . [They]3275-the natives were astonished even as [Romulus]1248-romulus , when [he]1248-romulus observed the spear , which once had grown high on [the Palatine]387-the palatine , put out new leaves and stand with roots — not with the iron point which [he]1248-romulus had driven in . Not as a spear it then stood there , but as a rooted tree with limber twigs for many to admire while resting under that surprising shade . Or , as when [Cippus]1270-cippus first observed [his]1270-cippus horns in [the clear stream]4786-the clear stream ( [he]1270-cippus truly saw them there ) . Believing [he]1270-cippus had seen a falsity , [he]1270-cippus often touched [his]1270-cippus forehead with [his]1270-cippus hand and , so returning , touched the thing [he]1270-cippus saw . Assured at last that [he]1270-cippus could trust [his]1270-cippus eyes , [he]1270-cippus stood entranced , as if [he]1270-cippus had returned victorious from the conquest of [[his]1270-cippus foes]6120-his foes : and , raising eyes and hands toward heaven , [he]1270-cippus cried , “ [[You]8652-you gods]8653-you gods above ! Whatever is foretold by [this great prodigy]8654-this great prodigy , if it means good , then let it be auspicious to [[my]4788-an etruscan seer land]6840-my land and to [the inhabitants of [Quirinus]1250-quirinus]8656-the inhabitants of quirinus , — if ill , let that misfortune fall on [me]4788-an etruscan seer . ”[4788-an etruscan seer] [He]1270-cippus made an offering at new altars , built of grassy thick green turf , with fragrant fires , presenting wine in bowls . And [he]1270-cippus took note of panting entrails from new - slaughtered sheep , to learn the meaning of the event for [him]1270-cippus . When [an Etruscan seer]4788-an etruscan seer examined them , [he]4788-an etruscan seer found the evidence of great events , as yet obscure , and , when [he]4788-an etruscan seer raised keen eyes up from the entrails to the horns of [Cippus]1270-cippus , “ [O king]8657-o king , all hail ! ”[4788-an etruscan seer] [he]4788-an etruscan seer cried , “ For in future time [this country]8658-this country and [the Latin towers]8659-the latin towers will live in homage to [you]8657-o king , [Cippus]1270-cippus , and [your]8657-o king horns . But [you]8657-o king must promptly put aside delay ; hasten to enter the wide open gates — [the fates]8298-the fates command [you]8657-o king . Once received within [the city]5520-the city , [you]8657-o king shall be [its chosen king]8662-its chosen king and safely shall enjoy a lasting reign . ”[1270-cippus] [Cippus]1270-cippus retreated , and [he]1270-cippus turned [his]1270-cippus grave eyes from [the city]5520-the city 's walls and said , “ O far , O far away , [the righteous gods]8663-the righteous gods should drive such omens from [me]1270-cippus ! Better it would be that [I]1270-cippus should pass [my]1270-cippus life in exile than be seen [a king throned in the capitol]8664-a king throned in the capitol . ”[1270-cippus] Such words [he]1270-cippus spoke and forthwith [he]1270-cippus convoked [the people]1439-the people and the grave and honored [Senate]1271-senate . But first [he]1270-cippus veiled [his]1270-cippus horns with laurel , which betokens peace . Then , standing on a mound raised by [the valiant troops]4791-the valiant troops , [he]1270-cippus made a prayer after the ancient mode , and then [he]1270-cippus said , “ There is one here who will be [king]6901-king , if [you]8666-you do not expel [him]8667-him from [[your]8666-you city]6691-your city — [I]4792-he will show [him]8667-him to [you]8666-you surely by a sign ; although [I]4792-he will not tell [his]8667-him name . [He]8667-him wears horns on [his]8667-him head . The augur prophecies that , if [he]4792-he enters [this]8669-this [[your]4793-they city]6691-your city , [he]4792-he will give [you]8666-you laws as if [you]8666-you were [[his]4792-he slaves]7127-his slaves . “[4792-he] [He]4792-he might have forced [his]4792-he way within [your]4793-they gates , for they stand open , but [I]0-i have hindered [him]4792-he , although [nobody]2409-nobody is to [him]4792-he so close as [I]0-i [myself]0-i . [Good Romans]1272-good romans , then , forbid [[your]4793-they city]6691-your city to [this man]3867-this man ; or , if [you]4793-they find that [he]4792-he deserves still worse , then bind [him]4792-he fast with heavy fetters ; or else end [your]4793-they fears by knowledge of [the destined tyrant]4797-the destined tyrant 's death . ” As murmurs which arise among the groves of pine trees thick above [us]8672-us , when the fierce east wind is whistling in them , or as sound produced by breaking waves , when it is heard afar off , such the noise made by [the crowd]8673-the crowd . But in that angry stirring of [the throng]8674-the throng one cry could be distinguished , “[4792-he] Which is [he]4792-he ? ” And [they]4793-they examined foreheads , and [they]4793-they sought predicted horns . [Cippus]1270-cippus then spoke again : “[4798-the man whom you demand] [The man whom [you]4793-they demand]4798-the man whom you demand , ” [he]1270-cippus said , “[4798-the man whom you demand] is here ! ” And , [fearless of [the people]1439-the people]8675-fearless of the people , [he]1270-cippus threw back the chaplet from [his]1270-cippus forehead , so that [all]5537-all could see [his]1270-cippus temples plainly , wonderful for [their]4793-they two horns . [All]5537-all then turned down [their]5537-all eyes and uttered groans and ( was it possible ? ) [they]4793-they looked unwillingly upon that head famed for its merit . [They]4793-they could not permit [him]1270-cippus to remain there long , deprived of honors , and [they]4793-they placed upon [his]1270-cippus head the festive chaplet . And [the Senate]8679-the senate gave [you]8680-you , [Cippus]1270-cippus , since [you]8680-you nevermore must come within the walls , a proof of [their]4793-they esteem — so much land as [[your]8680-you oxen]8681-your oxen and [their]4793-they plow could circle round from dawn to setting sun . Moreover [they]4793-they engraved the shapely horns on the bronze pillars of the city gate , which for long ages kept [his]1270-cippus name revered . Relate , O Muses , [guardian deities of [poets]4681-poets]8682-guardian deities of poets ( for [you]8680-you know , and the remote antiquity conceals it not from [you]8680-you ) , the reason why [an island]8684-an island , which [the deep stream of Tiber]8685-the deep stream of tiber closed about , has introduced [[Coronis]541-coronis ' child]8686-coronis ' child among [the deities guarding [the city of [famed Romulus]1248-romulus]8688-the city of famed romulus]8687-the deities guarding the city of famed romulus . A dire contagion had infested long the Latin air , and [men]1399-men 's pale bodies were deformed by a consumption that dried up the blood . When , frightened by so many deaths , [they]4793-they found all mortal efforts could avail [them]4793-they nothing , and [physicians]8690-physicians ' skill had no effect , [they]4793-they sought the aid of heaven . [They]4793-they sent [envoys]8691-envoys to [[Delphi]262-delphi center of [the world]1360-the world]7468-delphi center of the world , and [they]4793-they entreated [Phoebus]549-phoebus to give aid in [their]4793-they distress , and by response renew [their]4793-they wasting lives and end [a city]6165-a city 's woe . While ground , and laurels and the quivers which [the god hung there]8695-the god hung there all shook , [the tripod]8696-the tripod gave this answer from the deep recesses hid within the shrine , and stirred with trembling [their]4793-they astonished hearts — “[4802-your] What [you]4799-you are seeking here , [O Romans]4800-o romans , [you]4799-you should seek for nearer [you]4799-you . Then seek it nearer , for [you]4799-you do not need [Apollo]549-phoebus to relieve [your]4799-you wasting plague , [you]4799-you need [[Apollo]549-phoebus 's son]4778-apollo 's son . Go then to [him]4778-apollo 's son with a good omen and invite [his]4778-apollo 's son aid . ” After [the prudent Senate]8697-the prudent senate had received [Phoebus Apollo]549-phoebus 's words , [they]8697-the prudent senate took much pains to learn what town [the son of [Phoebus]549-phoebus]8698-the son of phoebus might inhabit . [They]8697-the prudent senate despatched [ambassadors]8699-ambassadors under full sail to [the coast of [Epidaurus]436-epidaurus]8700-the coast of epidaurus . When [the curved ships]8701-the curved ships had touched [the shore]5443-the shore , [these men]6740-these men in haste went to [the Grecian elders there]8704-the grecian elders there and prayed that [Rome]433-rome might have [the deity whose presence would drive out [the mortal ill]8706-the mortal ill from [[their]6740-these men Ausonian nation]8707-their ausonian nation]8705-the deity whose presence would drive out the mortal ill from their ausonian nation ; for [they]6740-these men knew response unerring had directed [them]6740-these men . [The councillors]8708-the councillors dismayed , could not agree on [their]8708-the councillors reply : some thought that aid ought not to be refused , but [many more]5656-many more held back , declaring it was wise to keep [the god]5013-the god for [their]8708-the councillors own safety and not give away [a guardian deity]8711-a guardian deity . And , while [they]8708-the councillors talked , discussing it , the twilight had expelled the waning day , and darkness on [the earth]1289-the earth spread a thick mantle over [the wide world]5803-the wide world . Then in [your]8714-your sleep , [the healing deity]8715-the healing deity appeared , [O Roman leader]8716-o roman leader , by [[your]8714-your couch]8717-your couch , as in [[his]0-i temple]4079-his temple [he]0-i is used to stand , holding in [his]0-i left hand a rustic staff . Stroking [his]0-i long beard with [his]0-i right , [he]0-i seemed to utter from [his]0-i kindly breast these words : “[5013-the god] Forget [your]4802-your fears ; for [I]0-i will come to [you]4802-your , and leave [my]0-i altar . But now look well at the serpent with its binding folds entwined around this staff , and accurately mark it with [your]4802-your eyes that [you]4802-your may recognize it . [I]0-i will transform [myself]0-i into this shape but of a greater size , [I]0-i will appear enlarged and of a magnitude to which [a heavenly being]4803-a heavenly being ought to be transformed . ” [The god]5013-the god departed , when [he]5013-the god said those words ; and sleep went , when [the god]5013-the god and words were gone ; and genial light came , when the sleep had left . The morning then dispersed fire - given stars . [The envoys]8721-the envoys met together in much doubt within [the temple of [the long sought god]8723-the long sought god]8722-the temple of the long sought god . [They]8721-the envoys prayed [the god]5013-the god to indicate for [them]8721-the envoys , by clear celestial tokens , in what spot [he]5013-the god wished to dwell . Scarce had [they]8721-the envoys ceased the prayer for guidance , when [the god all glittering with gold and as a serpent , crest erect]8725-the god all glittering with gold and as a serpent , crest erect , sent forth a hissing as to notify a quick approach — and in [his]5013-the god coming shook [his]5013-the god statue and the altars and the doors , the marble pavement and the gilded roof . Then up to [his]5013-the god breast the serpent stood erect within [the temple]4988-the temple . [He]5013-the god gazed on [all]5537-all with eyes that sparkled fire . [The waiting multitude]8728-the waiting multitude was frightened ; but [the priest]5774-the priest , [his]5774-the priest chaste hair bound with a white fillet , knew [the deity]5849-the deity . “[5013-the god] Behold [the god]5013-the god ! ” [he]5774-the priest cried , “[5013-the god] It is [the god]5013-the god . Think holy thoughts and walk in reverent silence , [all who are present]4806-all who are present . Oh , most Beautiful , let [us]4807-us behold [you]4808-you to [our]4807-us benefit , and give aid to [this people that performs [your]4808-you sacred rites]4809-this people that performs your sacred rites . ” [All present]8731-all present then adored [the deity]5849-the deity as bidden by [the priest]5774-the priest . [The multitude]6124-the multitude repeated [his]5013-the god good words , and [the descendants of [Aeneas]1143-aeneas]8735-the descendants of aeneas gave good omen , with [their]8735-the descendants of aeneas feelings and [their]8735-the descendants of aeneas speech . [Nodding]1273-nodding well pleased and moving [his]5013-the god great crest , [the god]5013-the god at once assured [them]8735-the descendants of aeneas of [his]5013-the god favor and hissed repeatedly with darting tongue . And then [he]5013-the god glided down the polished steps ; turned back [his]5013-the god head ; and , ready to depart , gazed on the altars [he]5013-the god had known for so long — a last salute to [the temple of [his]5013-the god love]8737-the temple of his love . While [all the people]2550-all the people strewed [his]5013-the god way with flowers , the great snake wound in sinuous course along and , passing through the middle of [[their]2550-all the people town]8739-their town , came to [the harbor]3497-the harbor and [its]3497-the harbor curving wall . [He]5013-the god stopped there , and it seemed that [he]5013-the god dismissed [[his]5013-the god train and dutiful attendant crowd]8741-his train and dutiful attendant crowd , and with a placid countenance [he]5013-the god placed [his]5013-the god mighty body in [the Ausonian ship , which plainly showed the great weight of [the god]5013-the god]8742-the ausonian ship , which plainly showed the great weight of the god . [The glad descendants of [Aeneas]1143-aeneas]8744-the glad descendants of aeneas all rejoiced , and [they]8744-the glad descendants of aeneas sacrificed a bull beside [the harbor]3497-the harbor , wreathed [the ship]5746-the ship with flowers , and loosed the twisted hawsers from [the shore]5443-the shore . As a soft breeze impelled [the ship]5746-the ship , within [her]5746-the ship curving stern [the god]5013-the god reclined , [his]5013-the god coils uprising high , and gazed down on the blue Ionian waves . So wafted by the favoring winds , [they]8744-the glad descendants of aeneas came in six days to [the shores of [Italy]414-italy]8750-the shores of italy . There [he]5013-the god was borne past [the Lacinian Cape]8751-the lacinian cape , ennobled by [the goddess [[Juno]488-juno 's shrine]8753-juno 's shrine]8752-the goddess juno 's shrine , and [Scylacean coasts]8754-scylacean coasts . [He]5013-the god left behind [Iapygia]437-iapygia ; then [he]5013-the god shunned Amphrysian rocks upon the left and on the other side escaped Cocinthian crags . [He]5013-the god passed , near by , [Romechium]438-romechium and Caulon and [Naricia]439-naricia ; crossed [the Sicilian sea]8755-the sicilian sea ; went through [the strait]8163-the strait ; sailed by [Pelorus]440-pelorus and [the island home of [Aeolus]665-aeolus]8757-the island home of aeolus and by [the copper mines of [Temesa]840-temesa]8758-the copper mines of temesa . [He]5013-the god turned then toward [Leucosia]443-leucosia and toward [mild Paestum]444-mild paestum , famous for the rose .
